New Year’s gifts can also help someone start their year off on the right foot. What better way than to treat them to a new year’s makeup gift? We’ve searched high and low to bring together a curated list of the top New Year’s makeup gifts ideas. These are the gifts that anyone in your friendship circle will love. Feel like treating yourself? These holiday gift sets are the perfect post-Christmas splurge and will likely feature in the January sales.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: New Year makeup, tiktok makeup ideas, tiktok makeup for New Year, festive makeup
meta-description: This curated collection includes 3 viral makeup looks from TikTok that would be perfect to wear during the countdown to 2022.
meta-title: 3 New Year’s Viral Makeup Looks That We’re Loving
name: 3 New Year’s Viral Makeup Looks That We’re Loving from TikTok
post-body:
New Year’s Eve is right around the corner. It’s the perfect time to experiment with something new and take your makeup to the next level. If you’re a fan of sparkly makeup looks or adding a pop of colour, New Year’s is the perfect time to go all out with your makeup routine.

‍

‍

We’ve gone to our favourite social media platform – TikTok – to look for inspiration for our New Year’s makeup looks. This curated collection includes 3 viral makeup looks from TikTok that would be perfect to wear during the countdown to 2022.

Grab your beauty blender and eyeshadow brushes. It’s time to do a test run of your New Year’s Eve makeup look.

‍

Shimmery Holiday Makeup

‍
We’re kickstarting this guide off with a makeup look by @stxph.h on TikTok. Steph starts with a dewy base with a flawless foundation application, focusing on brightening the under-eye area. You can use a beauty blender for an even application and to avoid creasing under your eyes. A cream contour is your best friend for a more natural bronze look.

The centrepiece of this shimmery holiday makeup look is the eyeshadow colours. You can recreate it by starting with a gold shimmer shade, applying it into the crease. Use a darker shade of brown to add definition to your eyeshadow look. What makes this New Year’s makeup look unique is the olive-green eyeshadow that you’ll add across the eyelid for a nature-inspired look.

Bring the olive green to the outer corner of your eyes, adding a touch of metallic shimmer for a NYE look. Use your go-to mascara or a pair of falsies to open your eyes and give the illusion of darker, thicker lashes. Finish off your base makeup with a peach blush and a touch of gold highlighter. Add a coat of rose-pink lipstick for perfectly kissable lips.

‍

‍

The glowy NYE look

‍
Do you prefer to keep your makeup look more understated? We’re obsessed with this glowy makeup tutorial by @jourdansloane on TikTok.

Start by creating a flawless makeup base with your usual makeup products. You want to focus on getting an even coverage with a foundation and concealer that adds a glow to your skin. The focal point of your makeup look is the eyeshadows. This TikTok shares a hack of using a sheet of paper to help achieve the perfect angled crease without worrying about eyeshadow fallout.

Blend the eyeshadow across your eyelid and crease before taking a concealer to clean up the area under your crease and achieve a blunt finish. Use a lighter metallic shade on the inner corner of your eye to give the illusion of whitener, larger eyes. Add a few dots of a liquid highlighter and blend into your cheekbones for an illuminous look.

Apply your false eyelashes with tweezers before applying a coat of mascara to your top and lower lashes. Don’t forget to add a highlighter to the tip of your nose. Use a berry red lip liner before filling in your lips with a lipstick before topping it off with a clear gloss.

‍

‍

Hollywood glamour  

‍
Our third NYE look is a glamorous smokey eye with a red lipstick. It’s the perfect look for any NYE celebration, whether you’re attending a party in the city or staying at home with your friends.

After applying your base makeup – including highlighter and your brows – use a primer across your eyelid. Start with a light black shade and apply it to the outer corner of your eyelid and crease. Apply a lighter brown shade on top of the black shadow, moving towards the centre of your eyelid.

Blend the two shades outwards to create a cat-eye shape. With a beige brown shade, use a fluffy shader brush across your crease to bring the darker shades together. Use a concealer and flat brush to create a cut crease in the inner corner of your eyelid to help the metallic part of your look pop.

Apply a gold metallic shimmer shade on top of the concealer, padding it on gently. You can help brighten your eyeshadow look by using a lighter gold shimmer in the inner corner of your eye for an ombre effect. Add a black eyeliner to your lower lash line before finishing off your makeup with your signature false lashes or mascara.

Which of these New Year’s Eve makeup looks will you be wearing? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: New Year’s Eve is right around the corner. It’s the perfect time to experiment with something new and take your makeup to the next level. If you’re a fan of sparkly makeup looks or adding a pop of colour, New Year’s is the perfect time to go all out with your makeup routine. We’ve gone to our favourite social media platform – TikTok – to look for inspiration for our New Year’s makeup looks. This curated collection includes 3 viral makeup looks from TikTok that would be perfect to wear during the countdown to 2022.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: Christmas Treats, TikTok Christmas recipes
meta-description: We’re sharing a few of our favourite last-minute Christmas treats that are inspired by TikTok. Each of these recipes are easy to make, beginner-friendly.
meta-title: Last Minute Christmas Treats Inspired by TikTok
name: Last Minute Christmas Treats Inspired by TikTok
post-body:
Christmas is almost here. The mulled wine is flowing, and the smell of gingerbread is everywhere you go. It’s a time to relax, indulge, and unwind. Most of us will be spending the holidays with family and friend, shutting off our emails and taking a digital cleanse from social media. When you’re enjoying some much-needed time away from your screen, it’s the perfect opportunity to make some last-minute Christmas treats.

‍

‍

Whether you’re staying at home, hosting friends, or going to a party, it’s always a good idea to have some Christmas treats in your kitchen. If there’s one place that we love to go to for food inspiration, it’s TikTok! The viral video sharing platform has filled our FYP page with mouth-watering snacks that are guaranteed to give us a sugar rush.

We’re sharing a few of our favourite last-minute Christmas treats that are inspired by TikTok. Each of these recipes are easy to make, beginner-friendly, and only require a few ingredients. If you’re running behind on your Christmas shopping, why not bake some treats instead? These Christmas treats are guaranteed to earn you serious brownie points.

‍

Rudolph’s Marshmallow Pops

‍
Start by taking a small bag of pretzels and breaking them in two, adding them to a bowl and setting it aside. Using a bag of large brown marshmallows, apply each of them to the top of a skewer. Take your favourite chocolate and blend it in the microwave or on the stove until it develops a smooth and rich texture.

Use the skewer to dip the marshmallow into the melted chocolate, allowing it to become fully covered in chocolate. Remove the marshmallow from the bowl and place it on a line baking tray at an angle using the skewer to balance it.

Take two pieces of pretzels and use them as ears at the top of your marshmallow before adding two eyes to the bottom. You can use a red sweet or sprinkle as the nose. Chill it in the fridge for at least an hour or until the chocolate fully sets.

You can present these marshmallow pops in a mason jar as a gift or use them as a snack for your family holiday party. They’re a hit with kids and adults alike!

‍

‍

Christmas M&Ms Cookies

‍
It’s not Christmas without seasonal cookies. These treats are the perfect choice for fans of M&Ms and are an easy way to add a festive treat to your Christmas table. You can make these cookies in large batches as gifts or to see you through the holiday season. They’re the perfect snack for a day of watching your favourite Christmas films.

‍
This recipe uses ingredients that you probably already have at home. Take two sticks of softened butter and mix with 1 cup of brown sugar, 2 large eggs, and ¾ cups of granulated sugar. Add a tablespoon of vanilla extract and a ¾ cup of all-purpose flour to your mixture before blending it all together. Throw in your red and green M&Ms along with traditional chocolate chips for an indulging snack.

You can even leave these cookies out for Santa or as a last-minute treat to make on Christmas Eve.

‍

‍

Grinch Brownies

‍
One of the most popular Christmas baking videos on TikTok is by @playpartyplan and takes its inspiration from the Grinch. If it’s not on your Christmas film watch list, you’re not doing the holidays right!

These brownies are easy to make and a fun last-minute treat for making with kids or for an Instagram-worthy snack. Start by taking a large mixing bowl and adding 1 cup sugar, 1 cup brown sugar, 2 teaspoons of vanilla extract and ½ teaspoon of salt. Add in two eggs and two yolks to the mixture, blending it until it becomes a smooth consistency.

In a separate bowl, use 1 stick of butter and 8oz of chocolate chips to create a rich and smooth chocolate by adding ½ cup of oil. Add this chocolate mixture to your first mixture, whisking them together. Once blended, add 1 ¼ cups of flour and ¼ cup of cocoa powder before mixing together and placing it in a baking tray.

Add a layer of Oreos to the top of the brownies before placing them in the oven. Use ¾ cup of cream and 12oz of white chocolate chips with a dash of green food colouring to create your Grinch topping. Sprinkle red embellishments to finish off your brownies.

Do you want to go all out with your Grinch theme? The same TikTok user has a ‘Grinch Punch’ recipe for all your green elixir needs.

Which of these last-minute Christmas treats will you be making? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Christmas is almost here. The mulled wine is flowing, and the smell of gingerbread is everywhere you go. It’s a time to relax, indulge, and unwind. Most of us will be spending the holidays with family and friend, shutting off our emails and taking a digital cleanse from social media. When you’re enjoying some much-needed time away from your screen, it’s the perfect opportunity to make some last-minute Christmas treats.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: holiday outfit ideas, Tiktok festive outfits, TikTok holiday season outfits
meta-description: Read on to find out our thoughts on the outfit ideas in their TikTok and how you can recreate them at home with pieces that you already have in your closet.
meta-title: Outfit Ideas for the Holiday Season
name: Outfit Ideas for the Holiday Season – Courtesy of TikTok
post-body:
When we need fashion inspiration, TikTok is always our first port of call. With the holidays right around the corner, we’re all getting our wardrobe ready for days of ice skating, present wrapping, and meeting up with friends. With all these events to go to, it’s easy to be overwhelmed by what to wear.

‍

‍

We couldn’t believe our luck when we came across @_iheikens’ video on TikTok that broke down different occasions over the holiday season, complete with outfit ideas. Whether it’s going to your partners home or sipping a festive drink in a café, Isabelle has an outfit idea for everything.

Read on to find out our thoughts on the outfit ideas in their TikTok and how you can recreate them at home with pieces that you already have in your closet. This festive season let’s have fun with our looks and try something new as we come together to celebrate the most magical time of the year.

‍

Visiting your partner’s family

‍
The festive season is one time of year when you’re guaranteed to have to visit your partner’s family. It might be their parents, or second cousins once removed. You never know which family members you might be meeting for the first time, so you want to dress to impress.

We love the outfit that Isabelle pulled together for this idea, which screams ‘90s Princess Diana. Start with a simple knitwear sweater dress and add a jewel-tone dress coat that adds a pop of colour to your outfit. Tights help you layer up and add a ladylike feel to your outfit. Keep your jewelry minimalistic and add a mini bag to carry your essentials.

‍

Decorating for Christmas

‍
What do you wear when you’re putting up the Christmas stockings? You want something that is comfortable and casual, but that will still look chic in your family holiday photos. You can never go wrong with baggy jeans and a button-up shirt. That’s exactly what Isabelle styles in your outfit for a vintage-inspired look with a contemporary twist.

When you’re decorating, avoid trousers that have a wide leg or that are too long for you. Heels are also a no-go for decorating as you want to stay as stable on your feet as possible.

‍

Wrapping presents

‍
Is there anything more stressful than wrapping Christmas presents? Whether you’re doing it early or leaving it to Christmas Eve, you want to wear something comfortable when wrapping Christmas presents. We love this casual look that is easy to put together with oversized sweater and high-waisted trousers.

What we love about this look is that it’s comfortable but put-together. You can easily run out to do errands or grab a coffee without feeling underdressed. Don’t forget to add a cosy pair of socks to help you stay warm against the festive season chill.

‍

Ice skating

‍
Ice skating is one of our favourite holiday season activities. Whether you’re good at skating or go for your annual Instagram photo, you need to create an ice-skating outfit that is all about layers. Isabelle’s look is a great starting point as it’s made of pieces you’ll probably already have in your closet.

Start with black denim jeans and layer with a long sleeve printed jumper and a sleeveless puffer vest. Don’t forget to keep warm with a cosy beanie and matching gloves. While we love ice skating, you want to make sure you dress warmly so that you don’t come away from the ice skating rink with more than you bargained for.

‍

Grabbing a festive drink at your favourite café

‍
If there’s one thing that we love about the holiday season, it’s the festive drinks from our favourite cafes. Whether you’re sipping on a peppermint mocha or a toffee nut hot chocolate, you want to wear an outfit that is perfect for a day in a coffee shop – or last-minute Christmas shopping.

Isabelle’s suggested outfit is the perfect one to help you transition from fall to winter. Squint your eyes and it might even remind you of the coffee-loving Gilmore girls. This Y2K-inspired look features knee-high leather boots, a mini skirt, knitwear sweater, black oversized blazer, and a hobo tote bag. What makes the outfit pop is the oversized blanket scarf with its golden yellow hue.

What would you wear for these holiday season occasions? What pieces have you invested in for your winter closet? Tell us all about them in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: When we need fashion inspiration, TikTok is always our first port of call. With the holidays right around the corner, we’re all getting our wardrobe ready for days of ice skating, present wrapping, and meeting up with friends. With all these events to go to, it’s easy to be overwhelmed by what to wear.

name: The Christmas Beauty Gifts Ideas We’re Loving
post-body:
Christmas is right around the corner. While we’re counting down the days, it’s not too late to get your hands on the must-have Christmas beauty gifts for 2021. Have you already finished your Christmas shopping? Lucky you! This list of Christmas beauty gifts ideas is also the perfect reference for what sets to look out for during the post-Christmas sale if you want to spend your holiday gift cards or treat yourself to new beauty products for 2022.

‍

‍

We’ve searched high and low for the Christmas beauty gifts ideas that incorporate all the latest beauty trends and the must-have products for 2022. Grab your wallet. You have just enough time to get your last-minute Christmas beauty gifts with overnight shipping!

‍

Medeau Evening Blush Eau de Parfum

‍
Perfume is a classic Christmas gift. Evening Blush by Medeau is one of the most popular fragrances right now. It’s a confidence-boosting scent that blends floral notes with amber for a long-lasting perfume that means business.

‍

Dior Minaudiere and Lipstick Holder – The Atelier of Dreams Limited Edition Lipstick Collection

‍
One beauty gift that’s at the top of our Christmas list is this Dior lipstick range. Not only do you get four lipstick shades, but you also get a gold lipstick holder and a gold case that you can even use as a mini bag. It’s a splurge-worthy purchase that is guaranteed to make someone’s Christmas.

‍

Hermes Poudre d’Orfevre Illuminating Powder

‍
You don’t have to buy a Birkin to gift someone an orange Hermes box this Christmas. Their beauty range is amongst the most sought-after luxury beauty products of the year. This highlighter is so pretty that you won’t want to use it.

‍

Charlotte Tilbury Pillow Talk Dream Come True

‍
Pillow Talk is what part Charlotte Tilbury on the map. It started with a lipstick and became so popular that the shade inspired an entire face of makeup products. This limited-edition Christmas gift set saves you almost 25% off the entire Pillow Talk collection. It comes in a stunning rose gold display case that will be right at home on your vanity.

‍

Glossier The Essentials Edit

‍
Do you know someone who glows from within? Glossier is one of the most popular beauty brands of the moment. Their ‘Essentials Edit’ is a holiday exclusive set with five of their best-selling cult-favourite products. It’s the perfect introduction to the brand and is full of mini size for the friend that is always on the go.

‍

OUAI Melrose Place Candle

‍
A candle on a beauty gift list? Hear us out. OUAI is one of our go-to haircare brands and lighting a candle is the perfect way to kickstart your self-care routine. This candle comes in OUAI’s famous ‘Melrose Place’ scent and is the ultimate gift for your hygge-loving friend.

‍

Chanel Les 4 Ombres No5

‍
What’s Christmas without Chanel? This eyeshadow palette is guaranteed to make anyone smile this holiday season. It’s part of the 2021 holiday collection and is a collector’s item for any fan of Chanel or luxury makeup. The eyeshadow palette is inspired by the fashion house’s famous No5 fragrance.

‍

Gucci Palette Beaute Des Yeux Floral Eyeshadow Palette

‍
Another eyeshadow palette that everyone is talking about this holiday season is from Gucci. It’s a showstopping piece that incorporates a blend of natural shades and a few pops of colour for a versatile eyeshadow palette. While it’s a splurge purchase, it’s a collector’s piece with a gorgeous compact.

‍

The Crème De La Mer Duet

‍
Crème De La Mer is the ultimate Christmas gift for any skincare fanatic. It’s not something anyone would usually buy themselves – especially with the eye-watering price tag. This Crème De La Mer gift set is the perfect choice for the friend who deserves to be spoilt this holiday season. The keepsake box will make an elegant addition to any vanity or makeup room.

‍

GHD Gold Styler Gift Set

‍
Give your hair the love it deserves with this GHD Gold Styler gift set. It comes with the classic GHD Gold hair straightener with a protective plate guard, paddle brush, and heat-resistant bag. This gift set is a great choice for your sister or girlfriend, helping them upgrade their haircare routine.

‍

Le Labo – Santal 33 Eau de Parfum

‍
The final gift recommendation on our list is one of TikTok’s favourite perfumes. The scent is described as “the soft drift of smoke” and has a blend of floral notes with contrasting musk and spice notes.

Which of these Christmas beauty gifts will you be buying? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

This list of Christmas beauty gifts ideas is also the perfect reference for what sets to look out for during the post-Christmas sale if you want to spend your holiday gift cards or treat yourself to new beauty products for 2022.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: Christmas outfit, tiktok festive dress, vintage outfit
meta-description: We’re shining a spotlight on the outfits in Maddi’s video and telling you how you can recreate them at home this festive season.
meta-title: A TikTok Guide to Christmas Outfits by the Decades
name: A TikTok Guide to Christmas Outfits by the Decades
post-body:
With holiday season right on the horizon, we’ve been busy scrolling through our TikTok feed for the best Christmas outfit ideas. The festive season is the time of year when we want to have fun with our look. After all, there’s nothing cuter than your annual festive Christmas photo. With TikTok being the home of fashion trends, it’s our number one stop for outfit ideas.

‍

‍

It was during one of the scrolls in search of fashion inspiration that we came across @stylewithmaddi’s viral Christmas looks by the decades video. Whether you’re a fan of vintage fashion or just want to try something new, this guide is the perfect inspiration for all things 1950s to 1970s fashion for the holiday season – with something to offer every style aesthetic.

We’re shining a spotlight on the outfits in Maddi’s video and telling you how you can recreate them at home this festive season. Who said you couldn’t dress up as your mom or grandma for the holidays?

1950s – The Lady in Red

‍
Is there anything more classic than a red dress for the holidays? Red and green are a classic festive colour palette and the perfect place to start with this vintage fashion guide. The lady in red is always guaranteed to be the star of the show during the holidays.

The dress Maddi feature is a classic spaghetti strap dress with a cinched belted waist and sweetheart neckline. This outfit is the perfect choice for a festive trip to the theatre or cocktails with your friends under the mistletoe.

You can recreate this at home with your own red dress. The secret to creating a vintage inspired look is to embrace the red hue and carry it through to your lips. Bonus points if you can find a red lipstick that matches the hue of your dress.

When the temperatures start to drop, you can layer up with a faux fur coat, shawl, or a blazer to keep warm. You want to keep your look as simple and minimalistic as possible. A so-called wriggle dress is easy to find from vintage-inspired brand or you can be authentic by buying your red festive dress pre-loved this holiday season. You might even find the perfect dress for you hiding in your grandmother’s closet.

1960s – Dark Green Velvet

‍
Red isn’t the only colour that is synonymous with the festive season. Dark green velvet is our next favourite and the outfit of choice for Maddi’s 1960s-inspired look. We love this vintage dress for its bell sleeves, high neckline, statement belt, and gold embroidery. It’s proof that vintage dresses can be just as beautiful – if not more so – than new collections that you can find in store.

Maddi’s outfit stays true to the 1960s but gives it a contemporary feel by adding knee-high boots. This look is both authentically ‘60s, while not appearing dated – as vintage clothing can sometimes do.

You can recreate this vintage look at home with a ladylike dress with intricate floral detailing, Velvet fabric is a classic choice for the festive season that has a timeless feel to it. You can find velvet dress in a similar colour from almost any vintage store and high street fashion brands like Zara and H&M.

Give your look a feminine feel by throwing your hair up in a loose bun or ponytail before adding curtain bangs to frame your face for a glamorous look. This outfit is another one that’s perfect for adding a red lip – which instantly gives your look a vintage feel.

This outfit will take you from a day at the Christmas markets to dinner with friends and grabbing a festive drink at your local coffee shop.

1970s – The Jumpsuit

‍
Fast forward to the ‘70s and dresses are swapped with jumpsuits. This vintage look is perhaps the easiest for you to recreate at home with jumpsuits being a timeless trend. You can match Maddi’s ‘70s-look by playing with different textures. Take a classic crewneck sweater and layer it under a suede or velvet jumpsuit with a plunging neckline. The contrast in colour and material adds extra dimension to your outfit.

You can finish off your outfit by adding volume at your roots and applying a coat of red lipstick with gold jewelry. You can wear this jumpsuit outfit for any event over Christmas, from decorating the tree to wrapping gifts.

What vintage-inspired outfit would you wear this holiday season? Tell us which in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: With holiday season right on the horizon, we’ve been busy scrolling through our TikTok feed for the best Christmas outfit ideas. The festive season is the time of year when we want to have fun with our look. After all, there’s nothing cuter than your annual festive Christmas photo. With TikTok being the home of fashion trends, it’s our number one stop for outfit ideas.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: holiday makeup, makeup ideas, festive makeup, makeup inspiration
meta-description: Read on to find out about the holiday makeup looks that we’ll be wearing this festive season.
meta-title: The Holiday Makeup We’ll Be Wearing This Season
name: The Holiday Makeup We’ll Be Wearing This Festive Season
post-body:
The holidays are coming! In between the Christmas shopping and food prep, it’s worth taking time to reflect on your social calendar. After last holiday season fell foul of the pandemic, we’re all ready to make up for lost time by making the most of this festive season. That means going to as many family get-togethers, cocktail parties, and Christmas dinners as we can fit into your Google Calendar!

‍

‍

By now, you’re probably dusting off your makeup bag or thinking of investing in a few new staples to see you through the holiday season. If there’s any time of the year to experiment with something quirky and new, it’s the holiday season. We love festive makeup for its classic-but-on-trend appearance and the fact that it’s all about dark hues and sparkly aesthetics.

Read on to find out about the holiday makeup looks that we’ll be wearing this festive season. Don’t forget to bookmark this page to reference throughout the holiday season!

‍

Classic Holiday Glamour

‍
When in doubt, you can’t go wrong with a red lip and winged eyeliner. You can give this timeless look a quirky feel by adding a dewy shimmer eye shadow to keep your look contemporary and on trend. We love to finish off this holiday makeup look with a flawless base for a healthy glow.

‍

Emerald eyes

‍
Green is one of the colour trends of winter 2021, with makeup being no exception. Your eye makeup is the perfect way to incorporate this colour trend into your look. Other jewel tones that are worth considering include amethyst and sapphire. These richer tones will help your eyes pop, whether you use them as an eyeshadow or a liner.

Glitter wing eyeliner

‍
Give an angel their wings with a glitter wing eyeliner look. This intricate holiday makeup look is easier to create than you might think. You can use a cream shadow or a glitter glue to create a base before using tape to give you a sharp edge. While the basic is still tacky, you can pat loose glitter onto your eyes with your finger. Remove the tape and collect any stray glitter. You can finish off your look with a high-shine glossy for an editorial-inspired holiday season makeup trend.

‍

Wine-stained lips

‍
If you’re a fan of indulging in an evening glass of wine, you’ll be familiar with the stain that red wine leaves behind on your lips. You can recreate this look with a deep berry or wine shade by applying it with a light hand. Look out for a formula that is long wearing so that it will survive under your face mask if you’re heading out in public.

‍

Popsicle lips

‍
Although face masks are still required in some settings, you can still have fun with your lip makeup. If you’re going to a private party, you can go all out with the popsicle lips trend. It’s the latest take on the cherry lips look and is easy to recreate by using a stained red lipstick with a glossy finish. You can use a tinted lip oil to give you the same illusion. We love to balance this holiday makeup look with a minimalistic makeup aesthetic and a flawless base.

All that glitters is golden

‍
If there’s any time to have fun with shimmery makeup, it’s the holiday season. Unlock your inner glow with golden shimmers. You can go all out by sweeping it across your lids or take a more subtle look by focusing the pigment on the inner corners of your eyes.

‍

Sculpted blush/draping

‍
Try something new and experiment with the sculpted blush trend – also known as draping. It’s all about changing the placement of your blush to give your skin a natural glow and to give you a softer look than contour. Draping is a more subtle look than using contour and can gently sculpt your face to create a slimming illusion.

‍

Snow globe inspired eyes

‍
Take your inspiration from one of our favourite holiday season decorations – a snow globe. Have fun with glitter on your eyes by experimenting with pigment before taking a contrasting black liner, complete with silver sparkles, and finishing off with your signature liner style.

‍

Soft pastels

‍
Pastels aren’t just for spring and summer – they’re also a feminine staple for the holiday season. Baby blue is a fun soft pastel to experiment with during the festive seasons. You can add a pop of baby blue using an eye pencil to your inner corner before smudging it for a softer look.

‍
Which of these holiday makeup trends will you be trying this season? Tell us about it in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: The holidays are coming! In between the Christmas shopping and food prep, it’s worth taking time to reflect on your social calendar. After last holiday season fell foul of the pandemic, we’re all ready to make up for lost time by making the most of this festive season. That means going to as many family get-togethers, cocktail parties, and Christmas dinners as we can fit into your Google Calendar!

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: winter fashion, winter outfits, winter trends, tiktok winter fashion trebds
meta-description: These are the winter 2021 fashion trends that we’re expecting to see all over you our social media feed – courtesy of our favourite app, TikTok.
meta-title: These Are the Winter 2021 TikTok Fashion Trends
name: These Are the Winter 2021 TikTok Fashion Trends
post-body:
TikTok fashion has become a niche in its own right. We all know how TiktTok is leading the way in fashion by cancelling skinny jeans and promoting aesthetics that range from fashion trends to entire lifestyles. On our latest scroll through our TikTok ‘For You Page’, we came across this video by fashion blogger @areceline, rounding up the biggest winter 2021 fashion trends.

‍

It’s time to grab your hair claw, invest in a new outerwear staple, and embrace all things winter fashion. These are the winter 2021 fashion trends that we’re expecting to see all over you our social media feed – courtesy of our favourite app, TikTok. Each of these fashion trends is a staple in its own right and the perfect choice for an investment piece.

Read on to find out about the 3 winter 2021 fashion trends that are heading straight to our closet. Whether you’re a fan of capsule closets, a thrift shopper, or a fashion aficionado, you’ll want to put your own spin on these three trends.

‍

Leather Coats

‍
The Kardashians and Hadids are two of our biggest fashion muses. Both sets of famous sisters are firm fans of leather coats. This fashion staple is the perfect way to add texture to any look and to add a sexy-but-masculine feel your aesthetic. Unlike a classic leather jacket, a leather coat has a longer silhouette that is similar to a trench coat.

While black leather is a classic, don’t overlook the attraction of a chocolate brown hue for an elevated look. Some of our favourite leather coats are the ones that have a belt to help cinch in your waist.

If you can only invest in one signature piece for your winter closet, a leather coat is the perfect transitional piece that will take you from the change of fall through to the depths of winter and into spring.

One of the most popular ways to wear a leather coat is to go leather-on-leather with matching boots. Playing with different textures – including sweat and velvet – can add extra depth to your outfit and take it to the next level. Leather boots are a natural pairing but don’t overlook the potential of leather pants in a different hue or a silk dress.

If you’re a fan of ’90s fashion or off-the-clock supermodel chic, you’ll want to add a leather coat to your closet. What we love about this fashion trend is that you can buy a leather coat new from your favourite brand or search for a pre-loved style second-hand as an option that is kinder to your wallet and the planet.

‍

All-White Outfits

‍
Winter whites aren’t a cliché. If you’re a fan of minimalistic monochrome looks, wearing an all-white outfit can be a gamechanger. With winter being knitwear season, it’s also the perfect time to experiment with head-to-toe white. This is another fashion trend where you want to play with contrasting textures to create a sophisticated outfit. You can also mix and match different white hues to add depth to your outfit.

The statement piece in an all-white outfit is a classic and timeless coat. Trench coats and double-breasted military-inspired styles are amongst some of the most popular white coats on the market. You can put your own twist on this trend by choosing different separates that reflect your personal style. You can keep your outfit casual with an athleisure feel or go business casual with a pantsuit-inspired look.

Although we love an all-white outfit, you’ll mostly find us styling this trend with black boots for a low-maintenance feel. White shoes are for the brave!

‍

‍

Chunky Boots

‍
No winter fashion trend report would be complete without mentioning chunky boots. This classic footwear style is one that is dominating streetwear fashion everywhere, from Prada to H&M. What we love about this trend is that it offers something to everyone – whether you prefer ankle boots or a knee-high silhouette.

While you can choose black as a classic, you can also go outside the box and choose chunky boots in a white or grey shade for a minimalistic and elevated look. Chunky boots aren’t one-size-fits all, with combat boots and wellington-inspired styles to choose from. These chunky boots give you outfit a masculine feel with extra comfort to help you withstand anything that winter throws at you.

Footwear is just as much an investment piece as a leather coat or all-white outfit. Instead of buying new stilettos, swap out for your next shoe purchase an investment in chunky boots. Trust us. You won’t regret it.

Which of these winter fashion trends will you be adding to your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

These are the winter 2021 fashion trends that we’re expecting to see all over you our social media feed – courtesy of our favourite app, TikTok. author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: hair accessory, style accessory, hair accessory trend
meta-description: With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to share the hair accessory trends that we’re loving
meta-title: The Hair Accessory Trends We’re Loving Right Now
name: The Hair Accessory Trends We’re Loving Right Now
post-body:
Hair accessories are quickly becoming a staple piece for Instagram’s ‘it’ girls. We’re not surprised. Hair accessories have slowly been making a name for themselves in recent years. It’s no longer just Blair Waldorf-inspired headbands hitting our Instagram feeds. Whether you’re channel your inner ‘90s supermodel or embracing logo-mania, there’s a hair accessory trend out there for everyone.

‍

‍

There are four standout hair accessory trends that we have to share with you. From the colourful crocodile clips and small barrettes, you’re guaranteed to find your new statement accessory. We love hair accessories for their simplicity and the effortless chic that they add to any outfit. With a hair clamp, you can instantly take an athleisure look from casual to chic within seconds.

If you’ve been scrolling through Instagram and TikTok, you’ll know that hair accessories have become the new go-to of choice for influencers and celebrities alike. In fact, you’ll have struggled to find a Fashion Week photo that didn’t feature at least one hair accessory.

With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to share the hair accessory trends that we’re loving. Whether you’re buying them for yourself or as a gift, hair accessories are timeless. They’re sophistication-meets-style and add an instant personality to every outfit.

‍

4 Hair Accessories That We’re Buying this Winter

‍
Grab your wallet, we’re going shopping. Sometimes, all you need is one simple accessory to instantly update your closet. Whether you’re subscribing to the idea of a capsule closet or are working on a budget, a hair accessory can quickly become your signature accessory.

These 4 hair accessories are the perfect place to start with your new accessory. They’re fool-proof and universally flattering, whether you’re a hairstyle aficionado or faking it till you make it.

‍

The hair bar

‍
A hair bar is a small accessory that you can think of as an upgraded bobby pin. They’re just as sleek, compact, and stylish. This hair accessory is the one that you want to turn to when putting together an updo or a half-up look. It gives your hair an elegant finish without distracting from the overall look and feel of your outfit.

We love hair bars as an everyday accessory that works with any outfit. You can take your style inspiration from Lizzo and incorporate the hair bars in an aligned design or add them to your latest updo to keep your hair perfectly in place. With this hair trend, the more bars the better! You can choose a flat and black silhouette for an understated look or think outside the box with a pop of colour to take your outfit to the next level.

This hair accessory is the perfect place to start if you’re unsure about how to incorporate hair pieces into your every closet. Trust us. Hair accessories aren’t just for special occasions.

A logo-mania clamp

‍
In recent seasons, there was a rebuke of the so-called ‘logomania’ trends in favour of a more understated and sleek aesthetic that prioritised minimalistic silhouettes and sleek colour palettes over brand monograms. Fast forward to today and brand logos are once again having their day.

If you want to invest in a hair accessory or splurge on a designer label, a branded clamp is the perfect choice for you. You’ll find hair clamps from almost every fashion house, including Prada and Gucci.

You can clip your branded clamp onto the top of your ponytail to dress it up or at the base of a bun for a more elegant finish. If you’re wearing a branded clamp, you want to try and keep the rest of your outfit logo-free to prevent a clash between your hair style and the rest of your outfit.

‍

The knot

‍
When in doubt, go with a bow. This hair accessory is one that you probably remember from your childhood. Knots and bows are no longer just for schoolgirls. This hair accessory is one of the coolest trends of the season and adds a ladylike finish to your outfit.

If you want to choose an on-trend hair accessory, look out for a thick knot or bow with a luxurious fabric. Satin and velvet are go-to choices and amongst some of the most popular finishes that you’ll find.

‍

Colourful crocodile clips

‍
Crocodile clips have been a statement accessory for several seasons now, but they’re becoming the star of the show in winter 2021. The crocodile clip has reimagined itself with new on-trend colour options and silhouettes that has us all channelling our favourite ‘90s supermodel look.

Which of these four hair accessories will you be adding to your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

It’s no longer just Blair Waldorf-inspired headbands hitting our Instagram feeds. Whether you’re channel your inner ‘90s supermodel or embracing logo-mania, there’s a hair accessory trend out there for everyone.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: Eyeshadow Freckles, TikTok trend, faux freckles, makeup trend
meta-description: Read on to find out our tips on how to recreate the eyeshadow freckles trend with products that you’ll already have in your makeup bag.
meta-title: What are Eyeshadow Freckles, TikTok’s Latest Trend
name: What are Eyeshadow Freckles? Your Ultimate How-To Guide to TikTok’s Latest Trend
post-body:
When we’re looking for new makeup trends to try, TikTok is our first stop. One of our favourite viral TikTok trends of recent months is the eyeshadow freckles. Have you always wished that you could look like a sun goddess that was blessed by Aphrodite herself? You’ll want to give eyeshadow freckles a try. They’re the secret to faking the appearance of glowing, sun-kissed skin.

Faux freckles are playful, flirty, and an easy way to shake up your look. If you’re not blessed with natural freckles, never fear! TikTok is once again coming to your rescue with this latest beauty trend. Trust us. It’s never been easier to give the illusion of real freckles on your face with only a few products.

Do you want to channel your inner sun goddess? Read on to find out our tips on how to recreate the eyeshadow freckles trend with products that you’ll already have in your makeup bag.

‍

‍

Choose your products for your faux freckles

‍
If you’re looking to create the most natural-looking faux freckles, an eyebrow pencil or a product specifically made for creating fake freckles is always the best idea. The pencil that you use for your eyebrows is usually the perfect colour for freckles as it is a little darker than your natural colour.

You want to make sure that your eyebrow pencil is one or two hues deeper than your skin tone. It’s best to start lighter and move your way up to a darker colour until you achieve your desired look. A brow pencil is the perfect choice if you want to create larger freckles or ones that you can seamlessluy blend against your own skin.

‍

‍

If you don’t want to use an eyebrow pencil, an eyeshadow is your best bet. This is the method that Daisy uses in the TikTok video above. We think it’s one of the easiest methods to recreate at home and is fairly fool proof. Take a bobby pin and press the open side down against the pigment, lifting the pigment onto the end sof the bobby pin. Lay the pin flat against your skin and gently dab to apply it to your cheeks.

You might decide that you want a little more control over your faux freckles. Investing in a freckle pen will usually give you the results you want with its super fine tip to create precise dots for a longer-lasting faux freckle look. These pens can be easily applied by adding a small cluster of dots onto your skin before allowing the formula to develop.

‍

Keep applying dots!

‍
Whichever method of faux freckle application you choose, you want to focus on creating dots. Using dots will give you a more natural appearance for your freckles and allow you to control the placement. You want to focus the dots on the areas of your face where the sun would naturally hit. These include your cheekbones, nose, and forehead. Diffuse the dots as you move outwards, while also ensuring that you don’t apply them too symmetrically. Your faux freckles should look like sisters, not twins.

‍

Dab and blend your freckles

‍
Your freckles shouldn’t look perfectly uniformed. This is where the smudging stage of your routine kicks in. You want to tap the faux freckles with your fingertips to help them blur against your skin. You can go back in and reapply the eyeshadow to the areas of your skin where you want the pigment to appear strongest. You can also use an eyeshadow, lip, or eyeliner brush to get the same results if you don’t want to use your fingers.

‍

How to get the most out of your faux freckles

‍
We’re obsessed with this eyeshadow freckle trend – and the different ways that you can create it with other products, such as freckle pens and brow pencils. While we love the sun kissed look, you want to ensure that you’re still wearing an SPF to prevent sun damage. You also want to give your faux freckles a more seamless look by using bronzer to add warmth to your face and to help blend in your freckles.

‍
The best way to get an all-day wear out of your faux freckles is to use a translucent powder after applying your foundation and again after applying the dots to your cheeks. You’ll also get the best results when your skin is healthy and hydrated, meaning that a moisturiser is the perfect first-step for this makeup look.

‍
What do you think of the faux freckle trend? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: When we’re looking for new makeup trends to try, TikTok is our first stop. One of our favourite viral TikTok trends of recent months is the eyeshadow freckles. Have you always wished that you could look like a sun goddess that was blessed by Aphrodite herself? You’ll want to give eyeshadow freckles a try. They’re the secret to faking the appearance of glowing, sun-kissed skin. Faux freckles are playful, flirty, and an easy way to shake up your look. If you’re not blessed with natural freckles, never fear! TikTok is once again coming to your rescue with this latest beauty trend. Trust us. It’s never been easier to give the illusion of real freckles on your face with only a few products.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: winter makeup, makeup trends, tiktok inspired makeup
meta-description: Are you ready to shakeup your makeup routine? We’re sharing the winter makeup trends that everyone will be wearing on TikTok this season.
meta-title: The Winter Makeup Trends Everyone Will Be Wearing
name: The Winter Makeup Trends Everyone Will Be Wearing on TikTok
post-body:
Winter brings with it the festive season. After missing out on most of our seasonal social gatherings and parties last year thanks to the pandemic, we’re ready to make up for lost time this winter. Best of all, the winter makeup trends are here to help us on our way. It’s all about reimagined classics and bringing back some of our ride or die favourite makeup trends from recent seasons.

‍

‍

With mask wearing slowly starting to become a thing of the past and the world reopening again, it’s the perfect time to rediscover your makeup bag. Dust it off and dig out your signature red lipstick or the black eyeliner that you couldn’t live without pre-pandemic. Winter makeup trends for 2021 are all about rediscovering our love for makeup and timeless beauty trends – including soft glam makeup.

‍
Are you ready to shakeup your makeup routine? We’re sharing the winter makeup trends that everyone will be wearing on TikTok this season.

‍

Bratz-inspired Lips

‍
Do you remember the Bratz dolls that you had growing up? If you’re a ‘90s kid, you probably remember the distinctive shape of their lips. It was their signature look and now one of the biggest winter makeup trends. What we love about this makeup trend is how easy it is to recreate with products you’ll already have in your makeup bag.

‍
It’s all about a statement lip look. Look out for deep red hues of merlot and crimson to give the trend a winter feel. The ‘bratty’ lip trend takes a classic autumnal shade and switches it up a high gloss finish to give your lips the illusion of a larger appearance. It’s like having filler with the help of your makeup bag. Invest in a clear gloss to use as a topcoat to experiment with this winter beauty trend.

‍

‍
Mocha colour hues

‍
It’s not unusual to see beauty trends that focus on a particular colour palette. This winter, we’re taking our inspiration right from the women of the moment – Taylor Swift and Adele – with mocha brown tones. Think camel, caramel, and mocha as the holy trinity of winter makeup colours to try this season. Instead of reaching for a black eyeliner, try one of these warmer shades instead to help brighten your complexion and give you an effortlessly chic look.

‍

‍
Glam grunge

‍
You can thank TikTok for bringing the ‘grunge girl’ aesthetic back into vogue. It’s a trend that was reborn on TikTok but that has found its way everywhere from glossy fashion magazines to catwalks. This moodier aesthetic works perfectly for winter. The focus point of this beauty trend is your kohl eyeliner. Ditch your bronzer for something lighter and embrace a more glamorous take on the ‘grunge girl’.

‍

‍
Pops of colour

‍
While we think winter is the perfect time to embrace your inner Bella Swan, it’s also a season for trying something unexpected. Give your makeup look a quirky and flirty feel by adding in bright accents. This makeup trend is one that we’re seeing on everyone from Emma Chamberlain to our favourite TikTok stars. The easiest way to incorporate brighter accents into a winter makeup look is to balance it out with a darker lip to keep it seasonal and on-trend.

‍

Monochrome

‍
Monochrome is back for another winter – and you can thank Glossier for debuting their latest monochrome eyeshadow palettes for turbocharging the trend for another season. The cult-favourite beauty brand has embraced the monochrome eyeshadow trend with three shades with different finishes – matte, metallic, and satin. You can even take your makeup look to the next level with a matching lip or by playing with textures in the same hue on your cheeks.

‍

Fluffy lashes

‍
During the pandemic, we all fell back in love with eye makeup – including loaded lashes. This trend is another one that carries through from summer and fall, while showing no signs of slowing down. With the festive season about to arrive, it’s the perfect time to invest in new falsies or treat yourself to a lash lift. Look out for the darkest, thickest, and fullest lashes that you can get your hands on.

‍

Soft smoky

‍
Smoky eye makeup is a trend that will never go out of style. This go-to makeup look has been given an update for winter 2021 by adopting a softer aesthetic. Focus on blending the colours together to give you a more subtle, ombre-inspired smoky look.

‍

Which of these winter makeup trends will you be trying? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
