After missing out on most of our seasonal social gatherings and parties last year thanks to the pandemic, we’re ready to make up for lost time this winter. Best of all, the winter makeup trends are here to help us on our way. It’s all about reimagined classics and bringing back some of our ride or die favourite makeup trends from recent seasons.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: goddess locs, hair locs, hair style, brushing, hair trend
meta-description: We’re sharing everything that you need to know about how the Goddess loc trend came into style and how you can give it a try.
meta-title: Say Hello to ‘Goddess Locs’
name: Say Hello to ‘Goddess Locs’
post-body:
We’re no stranger to jumping on the latest hair trends. Whether it’s the looks taking TikTok by storm or an Ariana Grande inspired ponytail, we like to have our finger on the pulse for the must-try hair trends. Enter the ‘Goddess Locs’ hairstyle – the one that everyone is talking about. This hairstyle was inspired by Lisa Bonet and born from a partnership between stylist Dr. Kari Williams and the actress Meagan God.

‍

‍

Goddess locs stand apart from the traditional loc extensions because of their curled ends and freeform look. What we love about this trend is that it gives you the look of locs without having to make a long-term commitment.

‍
Do you want to find out more about the Goddess locs trend? We’re sharing everything that you need to know about how the Goddess loc trend came into style and how you can give it a try.

‍

The origins of the Goddess Locs

‍
The ‘Goddess Locs’ look began to take shape in 2015 when Meagan Good approached Williams to ask about creating a loc extension hairstyle that would recreate the natural locs of Lisa Bonet. The goal was to create extensions that could look as much like natural locs as possible.

‍
It took years of work and Williams’ extensive experience within the industry to create the extensions that have been quickly nicknamed the ‘Goddess Locs’ after originally being called the ‘Meagan Good Locs’.

‍
Though it was not easy, she was able to use her years of experience to create a style that would later become known as goddess locs. The style was dubbed “Meagan Good locs” for a while before Williams coined the new name.

‍

How much do Goddess Locs cost?

‍
The cost of your Goddess Locs will largely depend on whether you’re installing them yourself or visiting a hair salon. We recommend going to a professional who is trained in this technique to ensure that your Goddess Locs are installed correctly and safely. You can expect to pay a hefty price – anywhere up to $1,000 – for this kind of installation due to the time commitment.

‍
While you may find a stylist who will charge a lesser fee, they’re usually not offering the same quality of work and your hair may end up paying the price in the long run.

‍

How long does the Goddess Locs style last?

‍
While this look was designed to not require a long-term commitment, you can still expect to get three to four months of wear from this hairstyle. It’s more limited than traditional locs extensions as your hair will gradually start to enter a locking process. It’ll be easier to remove the extensions and prevent damage if you remove them within this time frame. Application is also one of the most important steps for non-synthetic hair extensions when creating the Goddess Locs look.

‍

‍
How to care for your Goddess Locs hairstyle

‍
Goddess Locs are a hairstyle that requires more than a little TLC. You’ll want to ensure that your hair is getting enough moisture to prevent your natural hair from starting to break. You want to ensure that you’re carrying for your natural hair while wearing your new hairstyle. It’s worth investing in a hydrating spray that you can quickly apply to your hair every day to keep it hydrated and healthy.

‍

‍
How to remove Goddess Locs

‍
If your Goddess Locs were installed correctly, you shouldn’t have any issues with removing them. It’s best to have a detangler cream on hand to help soften your hair and give it a boost of hydration when you are removing the loc. You’ll also want to use a product to help remove the build-up of oil in your hair after wearing your Goddess Locs. If your Goddess Locs are removed correctly, you shouldn’t experience any hair loss or breakage.

Will Goddess Locs work for me?

‍
Goddess Locs aren’t a hairstyle for everyone. The main complaint that most people have about this hairstyle is the weight of the extensions and the tension that you might experience for the first two weeks after your installation. Before you invest in the Goddess Locs, you can start out by trying twists or braids before gradually progressing to the Goddess Locs look.

‍
What we love about the Goddess Locs extension is how versatile they are as a protective hairstyle. They’re unlike any other style of locs on the market and are perfect for styling – just like your normal hair. You can do anything from a bun to braid or a ponytail with your Goddess Locs.

‍
What do you think of the Goddess Locs hair trend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: We’re no stranger to jumping on the latest hair trends. Whether it’s the looks taking TikTok by storm or an Ariana Grande inspired ponytail, we like to have our finger on the pulse for the must-try hair trends. Enter the ‘Goddess Locs’ hairstyle – the one that everyone is talking about. This hairstyle was inspired by Lisa Bonet and born from a partnership between stylist Dr. Kari Williams and the actress Meagan God.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: sustainability in fashion , ‘De-Growth’ in fashion industry, green , eco, eco responsible
meta-description: We’ve all taken commitments to lower our own fashion carbon footprint – whether it’s buying less or choosing higher quality garments.
meta-title: ‘De-Growth’ and Sustainability in Fashion Industry
name: Everything You Need to Know about ‘De-Growth’ and Sustainability in the Fashion Industry
post-body:
Sustainability is one of the major buzzwords in the fashion industry right now. With COP26 having just ended, all eyes are on the fashion industry to do more to cutdown its carbon footprint. While we all know about how the fashion industry is working to reduce its use of plastics, there’s still more that can be done.

‍

‍

The sustainability debate within the fashion world has continued to evolve in the face of the climate crisis. The ‘de-growth’ movement is one of the most radical suggestions yet for stopping the damage that the fashion industry is causing to the planet. We’re all aware of the role that fast fashion plays with the growing issue of climate change, but is de-growth the answer?

‍
We’ve all taken commitments to lower our own fashion carbon footprint – whether it’s buying less or choosing higher quality garments – but is de-growth the answer that the fashion industry has been waiting on?

‍

‍
What is de-growth within the fashion industry?

‍
Degrowth.info describes de-growth as “an idea that critiques the global capitalist system which pursues growth at all cost, causing human exploration and environmental destruction”.
Let’s break that down.

‍
There’s no denying that as society evolves, every generation has used their economic and personal wealth to further expand and grow every industry. We’ve come to perceive the idea of having more as being ‘better off’. It may have been the years of seeing celebrity closets and ‘how the other half live’, but overconsumption is one of the biggest issues in the fashion industry.

‍
De-growth, in the simplest terms, is the opposite of the ‘I want it now’ mentality that fuels fast fashion.

‍

‍‍
What negative impact does fashion have on the planet?

‍
Fashion has a negative impact both on individuals and the plane itself. With the demands for fast fashion rising every day, brands are searching for ways to lower their production costs and maximise their profits as much as possible. This might sound like a clever way of doing business – but it’s dangerous for our planet.

‍
The majority of the pollution produced by the fashion industry comes from textile manufacturing, fuelled by the overproduction of garments that will inevitably end up in landfill or incinerated. Fashion brands are overproducing at such a volume that they are destroying millions of dollars’ worth of unsold clothing and accessories every year – while still seeing year on year improvements on their profit margins.

‍
Overproduction is a necessary evil in the fashion industry. Brands have no idea what products are going to become best-sellers or a hit with their customers. With bulk orders being cheaper, most brands choose to produce their clothing in a larger volume to take advantage of a better scale of economics.

‍
It’s the view of the de-growth movement that less production and cutting overconsumption is the solution to the fashion industry’s climate problem.

‍

‍
How can fashion brands become part of the de-growth movement?

‍
The simple answer is for fashion brands to stop producing so much. In fact, it’s an ethos that is already being adopted within the fashion industry. The British Fashion Council has said that one of their long-term objectives is to reduce the volume of new physical clothing by promoting smaller and slower brands.

‍
But the fashion industry is a two-way street. Consumers are just as bad as the fashion brands that are overproducing. Overproduction feeds off overconsumption. We’re shopping at a higher volume than ever before but wearing our clothes less. How ofen do you look in your closet and think ‘I don’t have anything to wear?’ when there are racks of clothing in front of you?

‍
If consumers change their behaviour, brands will quickly follow.

‍
How can consumers support the de-growth movement?

‍
As a consumer, you have an active role to play in supporting the de-growth movement. One of the easiest ways to support the de-growth revolution is to jump on the thrifting bandwagon. The next time you need to buy something, why not try buying it second hand first? Not only will you be saving money, you’ll also be helping to protect the planet.

‍
It’s also time to look at what clothes you already have in your closet. Set a goal to wear everything in your closet at least 30 times – and not the average of 3 or 4. Give your clothes the TLC they deserve and repair them instead of throwing them out.

‍
Do you think that de-growth is the answer to the fashion industry’s climate problems? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Sustainability is one of the major buzzwords in the fashion industry right now. With COP26 having just ended, all eyes are on the fashion industry to do more to cutdown its carbon footprint. While we all know about how the fashion industry is working to reduce its use of plastics, there’s still more that can be done.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: eyes makeup, makeup hacks, eyeliner, eyeliner hack
meta-description: Whether you’re a makeup beginner or a seasoned professional, anyone can recreate this makeup hack at home with products you’ll already have in your makeup bag
meta-title: TikTok Hacks: Illusion of Small or Big Eyes
name: TikTok Hacks 101: How to Create the Illusion of Small or Big Eyes
post-body:
Do you ever wish that you could charge your eyes? Maybe you think they’re too big. Perhaps you wish you could have larger eyes that stood out against the rest of your features. We all know the power of eyeliner to transform your makeup, but did you know it can do more than that?

‍

‍

With the right products and placement, you can drastically change the shape of your eyes within just a few strokes. This makeup hack is one that we found courtesy of TikTok and that we’ve been experimenting with over the last few weeks. We can confirm it really does work – and it’s a gamechanger for your everyday makeup routine.

Whether you’re a makeup beginner or a seasoned professional, anyone can recreate this makeup hack at home with products you’ll already have in your makeup bag. Are you ready to transform your makeup look? Grab an eyeliner and follow along below!

‍

How to make your eyes appear larger

‍
When we’re talking about eye makeup, it’s worth remembering that it accounts for all the makeup in your eye area, including your brows. The first step to making your eyes appear larger is to lift your eyebrows by applying concealer along the brow bone to give the appearance of a natural highlighter.

Instead of reaching for your tried and tested black eyeliner first, ditch it in favour of a white eyeliner. A white liner is the secret to opening your eyes and making them appear wider. You want to start by applying the white liner to the inner corner of your eye before carrying it down along your lower lash line to the corner of your eye.

Take a transition shade – such as a caramel hue – and gently blend it into your crease. You want to make sure that you’re working in upward motions to help lift your eyes and give the illusion of them being larger in size.

Now you can take your favourite liquid eyeliner and create a cat eye. You want to aim to create as smooth a line as possible, working from the inner corner and outwards on a curve. The line should gradually become thicker as you move away from the inner corner and towards the flick. You want to avoid making the flick too thick as this can make your eyes appear smaller. The flick should be proportional with your eyes.

Take your eyeliner and carry it down through the outer corner of your eye, stopping before you hit the iris. Take your liquid eyeliner and use it to apply small lash-like strokes onto your skin. They should look like eyelashes and start from the line you just made.

Grab a pair of false eyelashes and apply them directly above your natural lashes. You can use an eyelash curler for a more natural finish and to help blend your natural and false lashes together. If you want a little extra volume, use a coat of mascara to blend everything together.

‍

‍

How to make your eyes appear smaller

‍
If you’re looking to make your eyes smaller, you’ll essentially be doing the opposite of everything in the list above. Start by taking a black kohl liner and applying it to your lower lash line.

Take a dark neutral shade and apply it all over your eyelid using a shader brush, blending the colour into your crease. Using your liquid eyeliner, apply a medium-size line from the inner corner to the end of your eye.

Unlike the makeup look below, you want to end your eyeliner when you reach the corner of your eye. You don’t want to add a flick to the end. Instead, take your liquid eyeliner and carry the line down through the outer corner of your eye, stopping before your hit the iris.

You can decide to skip on eyeliner if you want a more natural and smaller looking eyes. Unlike the look above, you won’t be using false eyelashes. You can always apply a coat of mascara to lengthen your eyelashes.

We love using these makeup hacks to make our eyes appear larger or smaller. If you’re going for a natural look, we think the hack for larger eyes is the perfect way to show off your liquid eyeliner and to help make your lipstick pop. If you want a more lowkey look, the smaller eye look is ideal for every day use.

What is your must-try TikTok makeup hack? Leave us a link and tell us about it in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Do you ever wish that you could charge your eyes? Maybe you think they’re too big. Perhaps you wish you could have larger eyes that stood out against the rest of your features. We all know the power of eyeliner to transform your makeup, but did you know it can do more than that? With the right products and placement, you can drastically change the shape of your eyes within just a few strokes. This makeup hack is one that we found courtesy of TikTok and that we’ve been experimenting with over the last few weeks. We can confirm it really does work – and it’s a gamechanger for your everyday makeup routine. Whether you’re a makeup beginner or a seasoned professional, anyone can recreate this makeup hack at home with products you’ll already have in your makeup bag. Are you ready to transform your makeup look? Grab an eyeliner and follow along below!

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: beauty trends, winter trends, make up trends
meta-description: We’re rounding up 10 of the winter beauty trends that we’ll be investing in this season. They’re the staple makeup looks
meta-title: The Winter Beauty Trends to Invest this Season
name: The Winter Beauty Trends We’re Investing In This Season
post-body:
Winter is coming. In fact, it’s already here. It’s the time of year to experiment and try something new with beauty trends. We love winter for its unique beauty trends. It’s a time when everyone tries something new for the festive season, putting their best foot forward for cocktail parties and family get-togethers. If you’ve been looking for an excuse to update your beauty routine, this is it!

‍

‍

The winter beauty trends for 2021 are all about reimagined classics. There’s something for everyone from bold lips and blush-focused looks, even a traditional sparkly smokey eye to help you ring in the New Year. One trend that we’ve noticed within the beauty industry for winter 2021 is that ‘90s and Y2K aesthetics are still going strong. You’ll see touches of their looks throughout some of the biggest winter beauty trends of the season.

‍

Draped blush

‍
Draping is one of the biggest technique trends in the beauty industry. It’s all about changing the areas where you apply your blush to give your skin a natural, healthy glow that brightens your complexion. You can expect to see draping take on a second life during winter 2021 as we all try to add a little colour to our cheek. While draping has been taking the editorial beauty world by storm, it’s slowly making its presence known within mainstream, beauty.

‍

‍

Metallic eyeshadows

‍
During the pandemic, our eye makeup became the focal point of our beauty routine. You can expect this trend to continue through to winter and into spring. For winter, we’re bringing back metallic eyeshadows and intricate shimmer hues for an icy look that will make you the star of every holiday party. Add a metallic wash of colour over your lids with an added touch of shimmer for a Christmas-ready look.

‍

Wine-stained lips

‍
If you drink wine, you’ll know the distinctive stain that it leaves behind on your lips. It’s one of the biggest beauty trends for winter and is perfect for those who like a more subtle look. You can recreate this look with a burgundy lipstick and by lightly applying it to your lips to give the illusion of a stained finish. ‘Noir Modern’ by Chanel is the perfect shade for creating this look.

‍

Embellished eye makeup

‍
The festive season is the perfect time to add a little embellishment to your makeup bag. Take your eye makeup to the next level with the help of stick on pearls and crystals. You can even throw in a little glitter shadow or eyeliner to go all out for your makeup look. The perfect way to carry this beauty trend is by balancing it with a flawless base to help make your eyes pop even more.

‍

‍

Icy-inspired shadows

‍
The 2000s called, they want their frosty blue eyeshadow back. If you don’t have this colour in your makeup bag, it’s time to make another investment. You can expect to see all the classic 2000s eyeshadow shades to make a major comeback in the winter beauty trends.

‍

Matte lips

‍
It’s not all eye trends for winter 2021. If you’re not a fan of gloss, now is your time to shine. The classic ‘90s matte lips trend is back and having a major moment. You can give the trend a contemporary feel by using a satin-matte lipstick in a plum or cranberry hue for a seasonal feel.

‍

‍

A heavy-handed eyeliner

‍
The ‘grunge girl’ aesthetic is having a comeback thanks to TikTok. If you want to add a touch of this aesthetic to your makeup look, take a heavier hand with your eyeliner and embrace your inner rock-star. This makeup trend is another one where you want to balance an intense eye look against a flawless base.

‍

Fluffy brows

‍
We’re still obsessing over fluffy brows – they’re a modern classic and quickly entering ‘timeless’ territory. If you’re still wearing a face mask, your brows are just as important for your makeup looks. For winter 2021, it’s all about creating natural looking brows and arches. You want to avoid overdrawn brows and instead focus on a full and fluffy look. A new brow gel and pencil will be your BFF for winter makeup looks.

What winter beauty trends will you be investing in this season? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Winter is coming. In fact, it’s already here. It’s the time of year to experiment and try something new with beauty trends. We love winter for its unique beauty trends. It’s a time when everyone tries something new for the festive season, putting their best foot forward for cocktail parties and family get-togethers. If you’ve been looking for an excuse to update your beauty routine, this is it!

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: tiktok makeup hacks, makeup hacks, TikTok makeup tips, foundation applying
meta-description: We’re rounding up the tips in Natseleen’s video and giving you our expert’s opinion and how they’ll help improve your makeup routine and what results you can ex
meta-title: Our Favourite TikTok Makeup Hacks – Skin Edition
name: Our Favourite TikTok Makeup Hacks – Skin Edition
post-body:
When we’re in need of makeup advice, TikTok is our go-to destination. It’s what YouTube was during the mid-2010s and it’s the home of all the latest trends, reviews, and makeup hacks. Whether you’re a beginner or a season pro, you’re guaranteed to learn something new by spending a day on TikTok.

‍

‍

On our latest scroll through TikTok, we came across the viral video of @natseleen_, a makeup influencer who shares tips and hacks for beginners on her TikTok feed. In the video entitled ‘Tips I wish I knew sooner’, Natseleen shares some tried and tested advice that could be a gamechanger for your makeup routine.

‍

‍

We’re rounding up the tips in Natseleen’s video and giving you our expert’s opinion and how they’ll help improve your makeup routine and what results you can expect to see by using them. Are you ready to revolutionise your makeup routine? Keep reading!

‍

Set your makeup with a powder puff, not with a brush

‍
It’s time to ditch your oversized powder brush when using a setting powder. A powder puff has always been our ride or die makeup tool. If you want a natural look, a powder puff is your secret weapon. It helps to decrease shine and gives your skin a more natural look.

‍

‍

We recommend investing in a high-quality powder puff and keeping one in your makeup bag to use. A powder puff can also be used with cream powders to help you get an even application. Not only is a powder puff great for setting products, it’s also ideal to use with more pigmented products to help keep the colour in the right place.

Gently press the powder puff into your skin to apply the product to help maintain its application and pigment. It’s worth adding a back-up powder puff into your on-the-go makeup bag for easy touch ups when you’re out and about.

‍

Use a fan brush to give you the best natural contours

‍
A fan brush is one of the most underutilized brushes in any makeup kit. We’re all guilty of forgetting about it and it’s one of the brushes that inevitably ends up going to the back of our vanity. A fan brush is an all-round multitasker that you can use to apply everything from setting powder to blush and powder foundation.

‍

‍

We agree with Natseleen’s recommendation to use a fan brush instead of a traditional powder brush for contouring. The smaller brush puts you in control and makes it easier to apply the right amount of powder to your face. If you struggle with a heavy hand and find that you easily over-do your contour, a fan brush can be a gamechanger.

The dome shape of a fan brush makes it ideal for contouring everywhere on your face, including your forehead and jawline. If you want to create a natural, glowing makeup look, a fan brush is an essential part of your makeup kit. Once you’ve used it once, you won’t be able to go back to using a denser makeup brush.

‍

‍

Put setting spray onto a sponge and tap on your skin to relieve dry under eyes

‍
If you want makeup that isn’t going to budge – or relieve dry under eyes – you need to start applying your setting spray with a sponge. Setting spray is a product that most of us use every day to set our makeup and keep it in place all day long. A setting spray is also an easy way to give your skin an extra boost of hydration throughout the day.

Most of us are guilty of just spraying the setting spray over our face and calling it a day. If you want to get the most out of your setting spray, you need to be using a sponge to lock everything into place.

We love to use this makeup hack to create a budge-proof makeup look, especially for face makeup. If you don’t want to use the sponge all over your face, you can focus it on the areas of your face where your foundation is more likely to smudge or separate. Focus it on your under eyes, around your nose and in your t-zone.

Once you start trying out this makeup hack, you’ll not be able to go back. It’s an extra step that you can incorporate into your routine that will boost the longevity of your makeup and give you a flawless finish.

What is your favourite makeup hack that you’ve learnt from TikTok? Tell us about it in the comments below!

‍
post-summary:
When we’re in need of makeup advice, TikTok is our go-to destination. It’s what YouTube was during the mid-2010s and it’s the home of all the latest trends, reviews, and makeup hacks. Whether you’re a beginner or a season pro, you’re guaranteed to learn something new by spending a day on TikTok.
We’re rounding up the tips in Natseleen’s video and giving you our expert’s opinion and how they’ll help improve your makeup routine and what results you can expect to see by using them. Are you ready to revolutionise your makeup routine? Keep reading!

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: jeans, baggy jeans, baggy jeans trend, fashionable jeans, how to wear baggy jeans
meta-description: We’re covering everything that you need to know about baggy jeans, including the best ways to style them with pieces you’ll already have in your closet.
meta-title: Skinny Jeans are Out. Baggy Jeans are In
name: Skinny Jeans are Out. Baggy Jeans are In. Here’s How to Wear Them.
post-body:
It’s official. Skinny jeans have been officially cancelled. It’s time to wave them goodbye and go out in search of baggy jeans. The slouchy silhouette and oversized shape are taking over our TikTok ‘FYP’ page and is becoming synonymous with the Y2K revival. If you’re a fan of denim, you have to get your hands on baggy jeans for an on-trend streetwear look.

‍

‍

It seems that every time we open our Instagram feed, other celebrity of fashion influencer is embracing the joy of baggy jeans. If you’ve ever experienced the pain of wearing skinny jeans, you’ll welcome the transition as well. What we love about baggy jeans isn’t just their oversized silhouette, but their universally flattering high rise waist that helps to accentuate your curves and pull in your waist for an effortlessly snatched look.

Before you run out and get your hands on a pair of baggy jeans for winter, you need to read this guide. We’re covering everything that you need to know about baggy jeans, including the best ways to style them with pieces you’ll already have in your closet.

‍

‍

How have baggy jeans become so popular?

‍
Baggy jeans have always been there – even when they’ve been hiding in plain sight. The resurgence of baggy jeans has been something of a perfect storm. They’re a style that is synonymous with Princess Diana’s streetwear style in the ‘90s and comes at a time when fashion is becoming more comfort-driven. You can also thank TikTok and Gen Z for cancelling skinny jeans in favour of their more size-inclusive baggy jean equivalent.

We’ve seen baggy jeans appearing everywhere from Celine to Chanel and Hedi Slimane. Virtually every celebrity and influencer has been stepping out in baggy jeans. This is your sign that it times for you to say goodbye to your skinny jeans and embrace the comfort that is baggy jeans.

It’s not just the runway that is embracing the baggy jean silhouette. Every streetwear look that we saw from Paris Fashion Week featured at least one person in baggy jeans. The beauty of this new-found closet staple is its versatility. When you find the right one for you, there’s no going back.

Pro-tip: It’s all about getting your proportions right.

‍

How to Style Baggy Jeans

‍
Baggy jeans are the new casual staple for your closet. Our number one styling tip is to consider your proportions when putting an outfit together with baggy jeans. Instead of grabbing an oversized hoodie to wear with your baggy jeans, choose a top with a tighter silhouette. You can embrace a Bella Hadid look with a cropped cardigan or jumper. Bomber jackets are another outerwear staple that we love to pair with baggy jeans.

‍

‍

You want to think of your top and bottom half as two separate parts of your outfit that have to complement each other. Sneakers and ankle boots are out go-to choice of footwear when wearing baggy jeans as heels can be problematic if your jeans have a flared hem or a wide leg. The last thing you want to do is trip on your own jeans. Loafers with a chunky sole are the perfect alternative to traditional stilettos and give your jeans an effortlessly chic look.

Baggy jeans aren’t just for a casual weekend. All you need is a structured blazer to take your denim jeans and bring them from a casual look to a business chic outfit. Once you leave the office, switch your blouse out for a cropped top or bodysuit for a night on the town. If you decide to wear a longer top to help layer up with your baggy jeans, tuck the top into your waist to give your figure more definition.

‍

Our top tips for wearing baggy jeans

‍
While there is no such thing as the fashion bible – or fashion rules – there are a few things that you want to keep in mind when wearing baggy jeans.

• Keep the waistband of your jeans high. Low-rise and baggy jeans don’t go together. You’re more likely to look like you’re from an old Avril Lavigne music video.

‍
• Focus on the shape of your outfit. If you decide that you’re going to wear looser layers on top, add a belt to help juxtapose and balance the oversized silhouette of your jeans. You can still go for an all-over oversized look, but baggy jeans require a little more thought than their denim counterpart.

‍
What do you think of baggy jeans? Are they your new ride or die? Tell us your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: It’s official. Skinny jeans have been officially cancelled. It’s time to wave them goodbye and go out in search of baggy jeans. The slouchy silhouette and oversized shape are taking over our TikTok ‘FYP’ page and is becoming synonymous with the Y2K revival. If you’re a fan of denim, you have to get your hands on baggy jeans for an on-trend streetwear look.

meta-title: The Green Nails That Everybody is Wearing
name: The Green Nails That Everybody is Wearing
post-body:
There’s no denying that autumn and winter nail trends are some of our favourites. Out of all the 2021 nail trends that you need to know, green nails have become our new go-to. In fact, we’re betting that they’re the nail color everyone is going to be wearing this winter. There’s something whimsical about forest green that has us becoming the ‘main character’ on our morning Starbucks run.

‍

‍

If you want to know what nail polish to invest in for your makeup bag for fall/winter 2021, it’s dark green. Pinterest – our go-to for all beauty trend predictions – saw a 75% increase in users looking for ‘dark green nails’ and a 55% surge in searches for ‘acrylic nails green’. Like always, Pinterest users are on the ball with their latest beauty trend.

When we took a scroll through our favourite nail Instagram accounts, we weren’t surprised to see those tiny squares full of images of neatly manicured green nails. After all, it’s one of the ‘it’ colours in the fashion industry for the season – making it a natural choice for nail trends.

‍

Why are green nails trending?

‍
It’s because they’re an unexpected neutral. Green nails are effortlessly chic and perfectly seasonal for the colder months of the year. There’s something about green nails that scream changing leaves and pumpkin spice lattes. It’s time to ditch your classic ballerina pink or wave goodbye to the black nail polish that you’ve been wearing since high school. Green is one nail polish hue that everyone should be wearing.

‍

‍

What are the most popular green nail varnish colours?

Are you not sure which green nail polishes to add to your vanity for fall and winter? Never fear! We’ve rounded up the nail polish shades that are all over our Instagram feeds. These are the nail colours that everyone from celebrity manicurists to influencers and a-listers are wearing this season.

These nail polish colours are an instant ‘add to cart’ and the perfect way to experiment with something new for fall. Sometimes, it’s the smallest changes that can have the biggest impact to your look.

‍

‍

Aura Vinylux Polish by CND

‍
Are you looking for an easy DIY at-home manicure shade? We’re loving the shade Aura by CND from their Vinlux Polish range. This is the nail polish shade we’ll be reaching for over the holiday season to style with oversized knitwear and a festive drink.

‍

‍

Pine-ing For You by Orly

‍
If we didn’t love this nail varnish shade, we would buy it just for the festive name. Orly is one of the most popular nail varnish brands and this green shade is the perfect way to get yourself in the mood for the holiday season.

‍

‍

Precious Cargo Go by Essie

‍
Forest green isn’t the only hue that we’re hyping up this season. Olive green is another shade that’s been having a serious moment in recent seasons. If you want a nail varnish that you can take with you on the go for quick touch ups, we recommend ‘Precious Cargo Go’ by Essie. Their quick drying Expressie formula is the perfect choice for touching up your nails between festival cocktail parties.

‍

‍

Teal We Meet Again by Nailberry

‍
Add a dark teal green to your makeup bag for the ultimate nail art look, whether you wear it solo over a clear polish or as a contrasting hue with other green shades. This Nailberry shade is top of our shopping list for our autumn and winter makeup bag. The glossy finish gives your nails an elevated and effortlessly chic look.

Are you looking for budget friendly green nail varnishes that you can use to create contrasting two-tone nail art? We’re loving the Gelly Hi-Shine Nail Polish in Pistachio by Barry M with Nail Inc’s ‘Want Not Need’ dark green hue.

Another colour that we’ll be adding to our makeup bag is a classic racing car green hue. You don’t have to be a fan of formula one or vintage cars to appreciate this huge. We’re living for the Jelly Belly Insta-Dri nail polish in Green Apple by Sally Hansen.

Which of these green nail varnishes will you be wearing this winter? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: There’s no denying that autumn and winter nail trends are some of our favourites. Out of all the 2021 nail trends that you need to know, green nails have become our new go-to. In fact, we’re betting that they’re the nail color everyone is going to be wearing this winter. There’s something whimsical about forest green that has us becoming the ‘main character’ on our morning Starbucks run.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: biggest hair trends, winter hair trends, hair style
meta-description: We’re sharing the biggest trends in the hair industry right now, including the seasonal hair colors that everyone is talking about.
meta-title: The Biggest Hair Trends for Winter 2021
name: The Biggest Hair Trends for Winter 2021
post-body:
As the seasons change, so do our hairstyles. ‘Change the hair. Change the woman’ is an ethos that we live by. When the temperatures start to drop, hair shades become darker and warmer. While we love a lighter look during the autumn, winter is a time to experiment with darker shades and warm tones for a seasonally appropriate look. If you’ve been thinking of changing up your look, autumn and winter is the perfect time to experiment with something new.

‍

‍

We’re sharing the biggest trends in the hair industry right now, including the seasonal hair colors that everyone is talking about. What we love about these hair trends is that you don’t have to drastically change your hair color. It’s all about playing with warm undertones and shades to create a transitional look to see you through the colder months.

This article is your ultimate guide to the biggest hair trends for winter 2021, focusing on the hair colors that everyone is talking about. If you’re thinking of trying something new with your hair, this is your sign.

‍

Honey blonde locks

‍
Nicknamed ‘honey blonde’, this winter hair color is perfect for party season and one that you can rock all-year round. It’s effortlessly chic and gives your hair a look of understated elegance. When you add creamy blonde hues to your hair, it instantly becomes more luminous and brightens your complexion.  If you’re a natural blonde, update your locks for autumn with a full head of warm highlights to lift your original colour and bring it back to its natural shine.

Before you pull the trigger on this hair trend, it’s worth considering the maintenance that comes with a light blonde shade like this. You’ll want to book in for regular treatment to maintain the colour. You’ll also need to give your hair the TLC it needs with hydrating and bond-strengthening products that will protect and repair your hair.

‍

The ‘Bronde’ hybrid

‍
Can’t decide between blonde and brunette? Get the best of both worlds with the ‘Bronde’ trend. It’s one of the biggest hair trends in the beauty industry right now and a favorite of celebrities like Jessica Alba. You can achieve this golden brunette look by incorporating a balyage into your existing hair colour. The secret to the ‘bronde’ hydbrid is to avoid letting the blonde become brassy and to keep it bright for a seamless look.

You want to keep looking after the brunette base of your hair, making sure to keep it healthy and shiny for a polished finish. This is the perfect hairstyle for anyone who religiously curls their hair and wants to show off the multi-dimensional look of the hair colour.

The ‘bronde’ hair trend is universally flattering and keeps having a comeback thanks to 2000s nostalgia. It was originally popularised by Gisele Bundchen in the mid-2000s when she was at the height of her international supermodel career.  

‍

The Espresso Brunette

‍
Do brunettes have more fun? If you’re a brunette, you can still add warmth to your hair colour to give it a transitional look. The iconic ‘espresso brunette’ shade is one that adds warmth and chocolate hues to warm up your brunette locks. Just like your morning coffee, espresso brunette takes a mixture of black and brown hues to create a seamless and natural look.

If you want to go to the dark side this autumn, espresso brunette is a seasonal color that is easy to maintain and fairly low maintenance. While you’ll need an occasional touch-up, you can look after your new hair color at home by using heat protector and products formulated for color treated hair. You’ll want to upgrade your haircare routine at the same time as you swap out your hair colour! It’s the secret to maintaining that natural look and keeping your hair healthy and radiant.

‍

Intense copper hues

‍
As autumn turns to winter, embrace the colder months with intense copper hues. An auburn-copper hybrid is a popular choice this season and allows you to keep your hair shade light, while incorporating bolder undertones. One of the biggest trends for autumn 2021 is intense copper shades with a high shine finish. They’re effortlessly chic and create the fire-kissed look that is perfect for autumn and winter.

We like to think of intense copper hues as being the ‘pumpkin spice latte’ of autumnal hair styles. Copper is also a fun option for brunettes who want a softer look or blondes who want a full transformation.

Which of these autumn 2021 hair color trends will you be trying? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: As the seasons change, so do our hairstyles. ‘Change the hair. Change the woman’ is an ethos that we live by. When the temperatures start to drop, hair shades become darker and warmer. While we love a lighter look during the autumn, winter is a time to experiment with darker shades and warm tones for a seasonally appropriate look. If you’ve been thinking of changing up your look, autumn and winter is the perfect time to experiment with something new.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: TikTokers, makeup muse, TIkTok makeup inspiration
meta-description: We’re taking a look at the most influential makeup TikTokers to let you know which ones are worth following.
meta-title: Meet the Makeup TikTokers
name: Meet the Makeup TikTokers Who Will Be Your New Beauty Muse
post-body:
TikTok is our go-to source for inspiration, especially when it comes to makeup. While we love to sit back and watch a full-length YouTube video, TikTok is a different experience. You come across products that you never knew you needed, with quickfire tutorials and hauls showing you the latest beauty releases.

Just like Instagram, TikTok is no strange to beauty influencers. In fact, it’s given us a new generation of makeup influencers who have grown their online following solely off the video sharing app. We’re taking a look at the most influential makeup TikTokers to let you know which ones are worth following. These are the creatives that are leading the way and changing the beauty industry every day.

‍

Abby Roberts – 17.1million followers

‍
If you’ve ever been on TikTok, then the chances are that you’ve seen Abby Roberts. This British makeup artist is one of the most famous users on the platform. She credits her success with makeup on watching YouTube influencers like Jaclyn Hill and NikkieTutorials to teach her the basics.

Abby is known for her dramatic makeup looks, everchanging hair colour, and brand collaborations. Her videos regularly get over one views, often showing her creating some of the app’s most popular makeup trends.

‍

Mari Maria –18.1 million followers

‍
This Brazilian beauty influencer is famous for her transformation tutorials, in amongst sharing content of her husband and son. She has 18.1 million followers and over 300 million likes on her TikTok page. Her makeup tutorials are filmed in ways that incorporate the latest filming trends on the app, keeping her content fresh and original. Mari is the perfect TikToker to follow if you love a wearable makeup look that you can style for day or night.

‍

Glamzilla – 1.1million followers

‍
One of our favourite beauty influencers on TikTok is @glamzilla. She’s always sharing the latest product launches and beauty hacks, making her a must-follow if you want to stay ahead of the beauty news. Stephanie Valentine is an Ontario-based professional makeup artist known for her bold and fearless body positivity.

‍

Mikayla Nogueira – 8.2 million followers

‍
Mikayla is the sweetheart of the TikTok beauty community and an influencer who has grown with the platform. The 23-year-old is known for trying the latest beauty releases and makeup hacks. She offers flawless makeup tutorials, alongside candid reviews, and personal videos. Mikayla started on TikTok in March 2020 after she lost her job at Ulta due to the pandemic. Her first video blew up and the rest is history.

‍

Danielle Marcan – 1.7 million followers

‍
Danielle is a so-called “makeup guru wannabe” with over 1.7 million followers. She’s always ahead of the trends with her beauty tutorials, offering a mixture of wearable looks with statement styles. You’ll find a mixture of beauty and skincare content, alongside dramatic ‘TikTok’ makeup. We’re obsessed with her recent Black Swan series for Halloween 2021.

‍

Michelle Phan – 402.8K followers

‍
Michelle Phan was one of the original beauty influencers on YouTube. The influencer was one of the first to experience commercial success and took a break from YouTube before returning to social media, including TikTok. She primarily uses the platform to promote her EM Cosmetics beauty brand, with her signature calm and tranquillity.  

TikTok is our favourite place to go when we’re in need of beauty inspiration. With its short videos, TikTok offers everything that you need – from tutorials to product reviews and hacks. These are just eight of our favourite beauty TikTokers, but the list could be endless.

‍

Skincarebyhyram – 6.6 million followers

‍
Although Hyram focuses primarily on skincare, his TikTok account is a must-have for any beauty enthusiast. He’s one of the leading skincare influencers on the internet and is praised for educating a generation of beauty followers on how to understand skincare and the importance of specific ingredients. Your beauty routine starts with your skincare, meaning that you need to up your skincare game to the same level as your makeup routine.

‍

Eden Harvz – 2.7 million followers

‍
Eden is the unofficial big sister of TikTok. Her videos include a mixture of beauty content, on-trend sounds, and self-help videos where her goal is simply to make you break a smile. She’s an influencer you want to follow if you want a balance between real life and beauty content. She’s real, genuine, and offers killer makeup looks.

‍
post-summary: TikTok is our go-to source for inspiration, especially when it comes to makeup. While we love to sit back and watch a full-length YouTube video, TikTok is a different experience. You come across products that you never knew you needed, with quickfire tutorials and hauls showing you the latest beauty releases. Just like Instagram, TikTok is no strange to beauty influencers. In fact, it’s given us a new generation of makeup influencers who have grown their online following solely off the video sharing app. We’re taking a look at the most influential makeup TikTokers to let you know which ones are worth following. These are the creatives that are leading the way and changing the beauty industry every day.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: beauty products, Christmas list, season beauty products, cosmétique, holidays beauty list
meta-description: This guide takes you through some of the most exciting new season beauty products that you need to try. Trust us. They’re worth the hype.
meta-title: New Season Beauty Products That You Need to Try
name: The New Season Beauty Products That You Need to Try
post-body:
With the festive season just around the corner, it’s the perfect time to treat yourself to new beauty products. Autumn is when beauty brands get ready for the holidays by releasing their newest collections, including their Christmas gift sets. With so many new releases, it’s easy to be overwhelmed and confused about which beauty products to add to your online shopping cart.

‍

‍

From supercharged serums to glowing face products and holiday eyeshadow palettes, there’s new releases across the board for this season. This guide takes you through some of the most exciting new season beauty products that you need to try. Trust us. They’re worth the hype.

‍

Byredo Young Rose

‍
Are you in the market for a new perfume? ‘Young Rose’ by Byredo is the brand’s latest release. It takes the feminine floral scent and gives it a musky base with a twist of pepper notes and a fruity mid-section. It’s a youthful take on classic rose fragrances and it’s one that you’ll fall in love with if you’re an old soul. This perfume is a great splurge purchase or an item to add to your Christmas list.

‍

Elizabeth Arden Retinol Ceramide Line Erasing Eye Cream

‍
Retinol is one skincare ingredient that everyone raves about. If you’re a fan of eye creams, it’s time to try Elizabeth Arden’s newest release. The formula contains a blend of ceramides, peptides, niacinamide, and retinol. We love how hydrating this eye cream is, without it being too heavy. It works to brighten your complexion and smooth the texture of your undereye area.

‍

Glossier The Eyeshadow Palette Trio

‍
After what feels like a lifetime, cult brand Glossier has released their first-ever eyeshadow palette. It’s an eco-friendly design with a refillable compact that is fully recyclable. You have a range of 10 eyeshadow combinations to choose from, with each set containing a mixture of matte and metallic shades. These on-the-go palettes work for any occasion and are a must-have for any minimalist beauty fan. We’ll be expecting a few of these palettes under our Christmas tree.

‍

Hermes Les Mains

‍
Speaking of Christmas gifts, meet the luxury nail polish that you never knew you needed. Since the launch of their beauty brand, you can get your hands on a Hermes orange box without breaking the bank. The French brand has recently expanded their beauty range to include nail polishes. They come in a heavy glass bottle featuring a minimalistic white and gold design, with each nail polish having a glossy and highly pigmented formula.

‍

Huda Beauty Life Liner

‍
Huda Beauty has finally released their new duo eyeliner. The influencer-founded brand has created a two-in-one eyeliner, offering a duo wand to give you both a pencil and liquid option. This long-lasting formula is designed for 48-hour wear – come rain or shine. It glides on your eyelid like a dream to give you perfect coverage in just one swipe.

‍

‍Victoria Beckham Beauty Posh Gloss Ice

‍
When we think of ‘90s beauty, clear lip gloss is one of the first things that come to mind. With the ‘90s having a resurgence, it’s only right for Posh Spice to come out with her own clear lip gloss. This lip gloss is guaranteed to be a best-seller for the celebrity beauty brand with its ultra-hydrating and non-stick formula. It contains nourishing ingredients such as vitamin E and aloe butter that leave your lips plump and shiny.

‍

Elemis Pro-Collagen Renewal Serum

‍
Are you on the hunt for the ultimate serum to rejuvenate, repair, and protect your skin? This pro-collagen renewal serum by Elemis features retinol. It works to even your skin tone, minimize the appearance of enlarged pores, and boosts the elasticity and collagen in your skin. This serum is ideal for anyone starting to incorporate anti-ageing products into their skincare routine.

This Works Sleep Plus Massage Relief

‍
Upgrade your self-care routine with this rollerball that is a bedside staple. It helps to deliver targeted relief and contains 5% CBD and magnesium. As a massager rollerball, it helps to relax your muscles and soothe tension, while relieving stress. You can target it anywhere that you’re experiencing tension.

L’Oreal Paris True Match Nude Plumping Tinted Serum

‍
Meet the latest skincare infused foundation. It contains 1% pure hyaluronic acid and is the foundation that feels most like a serum-inspired skin tint. While it doesn’t offer too much coverage, it’s ideal for days when you want a dewy glow and a healthy complexion.

Which of these products will be hitting ‘add to cart’ on? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: With the festive season just around the corner, it’s the perfect time to treat yourself to new beauty products. Autumn is when beauty brands get ready for the holidays by releasing their newest collections, including their Christmas gift sets. With so many new releases, it’s easy to be overwhelmed and confused about which beauty products to add to your online shopping cart.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: @justinelamppe , TikTok , @justinelamppe hack, lifting technique, viral hack on TikTok
meta-description: we’re covering the steps used in this video – along with everything you need to know about the ‘face-lift’ makeup trend.
meta-title: Makeup Technique by @justinelamppe on TikTok
name: Makeup Lifting Technique by @justinelamppe That Went Viral on TikTok – Explained
post-body:
TikTok is quickly becoming our go-to destination for makeup hacks and tutorials. If you’ve always struggled with contouring, you’re in luck with the latest viral makeup trend from TikTok. The ‘face-lift’ hack is at the centre of the soft glam makeup look. The beauty of this makeup trend is that anyone can give it a go with products that they’ll already have in their makeup bag.

‍

‍

Instead of relying solely on contour, this makeup lifting technique instead stacks the different parts of your makeup together for a more seamless look. One of the most viral videos on this lifting technique is by @justinelamppe on TikTok. The content creator followed up her viral video with an in-depth tutorial showing how she creates a subtle lifting technique.

While there are several different approaches that you can use for the makeup lifting technique, we’re covering the steps used in this video – along with everything you need to know about the ‘face-lift’ makeup trend.

‍

Meet the viral TikTok trend

‍
What we love about Justine’s video is that it’s super simple and uses a concealer, white liner, and contour to create her distinctive sculpted look. This lifting technique is ideal if you don’t want to play with blush or if you want a subtle and natural finish for your lift.

Justine starts by applying concealer under the eyes, moving in an upwards diagonal direction. You can follow the same line that you would use to create a cat-eye liner look. Follow up by patting the concealer along the side of your nose, including just below the inner corner of your eye. Add concealer in a diagonal line directly under where your contour while be applied, as well as below the curve of your lips. You can use a large powder blush to blend the concealer for a flawless finish.

Take the white line and trace over the areas that you applied the original concealer, along with your brow bone. You can blend the pigment with your fingers for a seamless look. Once you’ve completed these steps, you can apply your contouring as normal.

‍

What is the face-lift hack?

‍
The face-lift hack (also known as ‘blush sandwich’) revolves around using a concealer and other products to give the illusion of a lifting effect to your skin. While this TikTok video used a white liner and contour, you can also use a highlighter and blush for the same effect. The beauty of this makeup technique is that it is flexible and puts you in control of how you want to lift your skin.

The premise of this makeup technique is that you’re essential stacking your makeup products and nailing the placement at the same time. You’ll notice that everyone doing this trend is placing their blush higher than most of us would do on a daily basis. Instead of applying the blush on the apples of your cheek, your contour goes on the hallows of your cheeks with your blush on top of it. In this sense, the technique is comparable to the ‘draping’ technique that was all over Instagram in spring and summer.

Concealer is the difference between the face-lift and draping techniques. You apply the concealer by blending it up and out from your eyes to create the illusion of a natural-looking highlighter. You blend each product up towards your temples to give you a lifted look.

‍

Does this makeup hack live up to the hype?

‍
Don’t knock it till you try it! We love this makeup trend as it’s an innovative way to give the illusion of a slimmer face without packing on contour. What makes this technique special is how it changes the placement of your products. By moving where you place your blush, you’re able to face your face shape and give the illusion of higher cheekbones for a slimmer face. By applying your blush higher, you’re also able to make your cheeks appear more lifted.

The one thing to consider about this makeup technique is how it looks in real life. While you might look amazing face-on, this technique can easily be overdone and give your face a fake look from the side if you take the pigments too high up your temple.

When you’re starting with this makeup technique, we recommend beginning by applying each step separately – like how Justine did in her TikTok video. While the stacking concept is innovative in and of itself, doing each step individually gives you more control and ensures that you’re applying everything correctly.

What is your favourite makeup technique that has gone viral on TikTok? Tell us about it in the comments!

‍
post-summary: TikTok is quickly becoming our go-to destination for makeup hacks and tutorials. If you’ve always struggled with contouring, you’re in luck with the latest viral makeup trend from TikTok. The ‘face-lift’ hack is at the centre of the soft glam makeup look. The beauty of this makeup trend is that anyone can give it a go with products that they’ll already have in their makeup bag.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: outfit ideas, trends, autumn outfits, what to wear
meta-description: Whether you’re a fan of capsule closets or want to get the most out of your autumn wardrobe, we’re sharing the outfit ideas that you’ll be wearing all autumn.
meta-title: Outfit Ideas That You’ll Be Wearing on Repeat
name: Outfit Ideas That You’ll Be Wearing on Repeat This Autumn and Early Winter
post-body:
In the words of Kate Sanders, “Lizzie McGuire, you are an outfit repeater!”. This autumn, we’ve decided that the term ‘outfit repeater’ is a badge of honour. When you fall in love with an outfit, why not wear it on repeat? With sustainability being one of the biggest conversations in the fashion industry right now, it’s time that we look at how often we wear out clothes. Your clothes are designed to be worn, not sitting on a shelf gathering dust.

Whether you’re a fan of capsule closets or want to get the most out of your autumn wardrobe, we’re sharing the outfit ideas that you’ll be wearing all autumn long. Most of these closet staples you’ll already own or be able to pick up pre-loved or from your favourite store. Read on to find out what outfits you’ll be reaching for all season long.

‍

An all-black moment

‍
Channel your inner Wednesday Addams with this all-black minimalist look, complete with a pop of neutrals. Black is a colour you can wear all-year round, but it’s a staple for autumn. We love the simplicity of a black head-to-toe outfit. It’s effortlessly chic and works for any occasion, while being able to take you seamlessly from day to night. The secret to this look is to play with textures. The leather boots and trousers contrast with the knitwear to add dimension to the look.

‍

A statement ivory coat and black outfit

‍
One of our top picks for your fall wardrobe is an ivory coat. It’s universally flattering an instantly elevates any outfit. We’ll be wearing this outfit on repeat, styling black shorts and a matching top with lace tights and knee-high boots. This outfit screams autumn and is perfect for an elevated date night look or if you want to fun outfit for Fridays at the office. Don’t forget to finish your outfit off with a black mini bag that is just big enough to hold your essentials.

‍

An oversized leather jacket, basic t-shirt, and jeans

‍
It’s not autumn without a leather jacket. We love this outfit for its simplicity. It’ll look like you’ve walked straight out of the ‘90s. This outfit is the perfect opportunity to experiment with some of your closet staples. We think this outfit is one that you’ll reach for if you’re a spending a day studying, doing errands, or relaxing with your friends. You can swap out the boots for sneakers for a streetwear ready look or alternate for stilettoes if you’re planning on hitting your favourite bar.

‍

50 shades of green

‍
If there’s one standout colour of the season, it’s green. We’re seeing different hues of green everywhere we look. It was the Pantone for London Fashion Week and has been riding high ever since. When Glossier gave its iconic monogram hoodie a sage green makeover, the internet fell in love. The beauty of this shade is that it’s easy to incorporate into your closet and it reflects the changes in nature as the season blend together. Whether you prefer sage, neon, olive, or mint, there is a green shade out there for everyone.

‍

‍

Plaid skirt and knitwear vest

‍
Are you lucky enough to live somewhere that enjoys year-round sunshine? This autumn look is warm weather appropriate and encapsulates Parisian chic. We all have a plaid mini skirt hanging in our closet that is dying to come out for autumn. The knitwear vest contrasts against the plaid to create the perfect autumnal look. You can wear this outfit with Chelsea boots for a laidback feel or switch out to kitten heels if you’re going out with friends or need a business casual look. We know we’ll be repeating this outfit all autumn long and through to winter as well.

What we love about these five outfits is their versatility. With the right shoes and accessories, they can take you from a day at the office to drinks with your friends. The pieces in these outfits are closet staples that everyone should own, whether it’s leather trousers or a classic knitted dress. With these five outfits, we’ll proudly be outfit repeaters this autumn – and winter as well!

Which of these autumn fashion trends will you be wearing this month? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: In the words of Kate Sanders, “Lizzie McGuire, you are an outfit repeater!”. This autumn and early winter, we’ve decided that the term ‘outfit repeater’ is a badge of honour. When you fall in love with an outfit, why not wear it on repeat? With sustainability being one of the biggest conversations in the fashion industry right now, it’s time that we look at how often we wear out clothes. Your clothes are designed to be worn, not sitting on a shelf gathering dust.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: bright lipstick, lipstick application, lipstick make up, lipstick colors
meta-description: Do you notice how many different types of lipsticks? Read on to find out more about how to choose the right bright lipstick colour for your skin tone.
meta-title: How to Choose the Right Bright Lipstick Colour
name: How to Choose the Right Bright Lipstick Colour for You
post-body:
Do you notice how many different types of lipsticks there are in department stores? There are hundreds of different lipstick shades for you to choose from with different hues and finishes. There’s a signature lipstick shade out there for every woman. Although most lipstick shades are universally flattering, there will always be certain shades that flatter your skin tone best.

The secret is to work with your skin’s undertones to help you determine which bright lipstick colour is right for you. Read on to find out more about how to choose the right bright lipstick colour for your skin tone.

‍

Determining your skin’s undertone

‍
The first step to choosing the right lipstick colour for you is to correctly identify your skin’s undertones. There are three categories that undertones fall into – cool, neutral, and warm – with each category having its own sub-categories. Generally, you’ll just need to know the top undertone in your skin.

• Cool undertone is pink, blush, and red.
• Neutral is a mixture of cool and warm.
• Warm is yellow, peachy, and golden hues.

Still not sure which undertone you have? Here is a little more detail on each type of skin undertone.

‍

‍
You have cool undertones to your skin if:

‍
• Your natural tan develops more rosy than golden
• You have light to medium skin that tans to a deep cinnamon shade
• You have a deeper skin tone that develops a reddish tan

You have neutral undertones to your skin if:

‍
• Your skin has no predominant shade to it.
• Your skin burns or tan when you’re in the sun.

You have warm undertones to your skin if:

‍
• Your light skin becomes more peach when you tan
• Your light to medium skin develops a golden hue when tanned
• Your deeper and richer skin becomes more caramel when you tan.

‍

Choosing the right lipstick for your undertones

‍
Although there’s no set rules for choosing the right bright lipstick shade for you, it’s always a good idea to let your undertones guide the way. If you can, swatch the lipstick shade that you’re considering on the inside of your arm to directly compare it to your skin’s undertones.

Here is some general guidance about lipstick colours and skin undertones:

‍

‍
• Warm undertones: If you have olive skin, yellow or warm undertones, you want to choose a lipstick shade that has warmth to it. Look out for terra-cotta, orangey-reds, and classic brick red hues.

‍

‍
• Pink or blue undertones: You want to match your cool skin tones with a lipstick that also has cool undertones. Shades with a blue or purple hue are your best bet. Look out for a bright cherry red that has a blue undertone instead of orange. Cranberry and deep plum berry shades are the perfect signature colour for you.

‍

‍
• Neutral undertones: If you have neutral undertones, you can choose virtually any shade that you want. If you have fair skin, pink lipsticks are your best friend. Mauve works for medium skin tones, while berry shades work beautifully for darker skin.

‍

Choosing a bright lipstick

‍
Bright lipsticks – such as red- orange, and pink shades – are easier to choose for your undertone than a nude lipstick. However, it’s still easy to be overwhelmed by the different choices that you have. Here are some of our tips on how to find the best bright lipstick shade for you:

• Consider the finish of your lipstick as this will change the overall look of the colour. Matte lipsticks have a stronger hue and a modern look, while sheet formulas give you a fresher look. A satin or cream finish is a classic that you want to have in your collection.
• If you have cooler undertones, choose a brighter shade. If you have warmer tones, look out for softer hues to work with your skin.
• One of our biggest tips is to choose a sheerer lip colour if you’re not sure if it’ll work for you. If the shade ends up being too bright, you can easily work with it and use a lip balm to tone it down.

‍

Choosing a nude lipstick

‍
Like we’ve mentioned, nude lipsticks can be some of the trickiest to choose. You have to consider your undertones and your natural lip colour to avoid choosing a lipstick that drowns you rout or makes you appear sick. When we think of ‘nude’, it’s easy to assume that it means your skin tone.

In reality, you want a nude lipstick that is a ‘your lips but better’ colour. Start by using your natural lip colour as a starting point, going one shade brighter or darker. Tinted balms and glosses are the perfect place to start.

What colours are your signature lipstick shades? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Do you notice how many different types of lipsticks there are in department stores? There are hundreds of different lipstick shades for you to choose from with different hues and finishes. There’s a signature lipstick shade out there for every woman. Although most lipstick shades are universally flattering, there will always be certain shades that flatter your skin tone best. The secret is to work with your skin’s undertones to help you determine which bright lipstick colour is right for you. Read on to find out more about how to choose the right bright lipstick colour for your skin tone.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: TikTokers, TikTok influencers, fashion TikTok
meta-description: We’re sharing the 10 fashion TikTokers that you need to be following. They’re always one step ahead of the curve and defining trends.
meta-title: Fashion TikTokers That You Need to Be Following
name: The 10 Fashion TikTokers That You Need to Be Following
post-body:
First it was blogs. Then Youtube came around. Instagram has had its day. Now, it’s TikTok’s time to shine. While it took us a little while to warm up to the app, it’s now our ride or die. The app has a growing international audience and is quickly becoming the most popular social media app in the world. Every fashion influencer and celebrity are finding their way to the viral video-sharing app.

‍

Whether it’s posting their latest handbag unboxing, behind the scenes at Fashion Week, or a classic #OOTD, the fashion community on TikTok is thriving. While we love TikTok, it can be difficult to navigate and find specific accounts. We mainly rely on the algorithm to give us the content that we want to see.

We’re sharing the 10 fashion TikTokers that you need to be following. They’re always one step ahead of the curve, defining trends, and making us fall head over heels for their latest outfits. Whether you’re a fashion veteran or a newbie to TikTok, you’re guaranteed to find someone new on our list.

‍

Young Emperors

‍
Meet French couple Isabella Chaput and Nelson Tiberghien – otherwise known as ‘Young Emperors’. The multi-talented couple are creative directors and performing artists. Officially repped by The Society Management, the couple is known for their matching outfits.

‍

Ellen V Lora

‍
With almost 500k followers on Instagram, Ellen V Lora is building her following on TikTok. Ellen – also known as EVL – is a vlogger based in Los Angeles. Her distinctive style aesthetic is dark edge meets feminine dressing.

‍

Nava Rose

‍
Known on TikTok as @the.navarose, Nava is one of the most popular streetwear fashion accounts on TikTok. She’s known for her grassroots streetwear and has amassed a following of over 5.5 million on the video-sharing app. Her bio describes her as a “girl with too many clothes”. Nava stands out for her quirky videos, featuring everything from Harry Potter-inspired fashion to looks that take their inspiration from BTS and even emojis

Janice Glimmer

‍
Pop culture fashion is getting bigger than ever. We’re always seeing trends inspirated by TV shows and films, whether it’s Bridgerton dresses or Black Widow earrings. Janice is a must-follow for fans of pop culture or those want to keep their finger on the fashion pulse.

She’s a TikTok influencer who takes her inspiration from the world of fictional characters, whether it’s The Queen’s Gambit or Disney princesses. If you want fun and quirky fashion, Janice is a must-follow.  She was described by Harper’s Bazaar as one of the ‘it girls of TikTok’ and often features her mum in her videos.

‍

Keri Fay

‍
Do you remember the days when everyone posted their #OOTD? Keri Fey reminds us of the good old days with her fashion TikTok account. Based in New York, she encapsulates the casual New York chic. Amongst her fashion and beauty videos, you’ll find celebrity-inspired tutorials and educational videos on how to style the latest must-have pieces. Keri is known for her extensive shoe collection and minimalistic fashion.

‍

Brittany Xavier

‍
We love following Brittany for her luxury fashion content and family-focused videos. Amongst her TikToks of attending fashion week shows, you’ll see videos of her with her two daughters and husband. She’s known for her matching outfits with her teenage daughters and always on-trend videos. With 4.3 million followers on TikTok, Brittany is one of the leading fashion influencers on the platform.

‍

Denise Mercedes

‍
Denise is the founder of the #stylenotsize movement on TikTok, promoting body positivity. Her content focuses on showing videos of two women wearing the same outfit with different body types. We love to follow her for countless outfit inspiration with ideas that work for every body type. If you need body positivity on your feed, Denise is a must-follow TikToker. Denise has 3.5 million followers on TikTok and has us all wanting to match our outfits with our BFFs.

‍

Deanna Giulietti

‍
Deanna is the big sister of TikTok. She’s famous for her #OOTD posts – otherwise known as her “ootadah”. Her speeches sound like an inner monologue that is guaranteed to make you feel confident the next time you’re in front of the mirror. Deanna is the hype woman of fashion TikTok and will always have you leaving her videos with a simple on your face.

She’s one of the few fashion TikTokers who isn’t obsessed about perfection. She once famously wore a dress the ‘wrong’ way and owned up to it, before uploading another video showing how the dress was meant to be worn.

Who is your favourite fashion TikToker to follow? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: First it was blogs. Then Youtube came around. Instagram has had its day. Now, it’s TikTok’s time to shine. While it took us a little while to warm up to the app, it’s now our ride or die. The app has a growing international audience and is quickly becoming the most popular social media app in the world. Every fashion influencer and celebrity are finding their way to the viral video-sharing app. Whether it’s posting their latest handbag unboxing, behind the scenes at Fashion Week, or a classic #OOTD, the fashion community on TikTok is thriving. While we love TikTok, it can be difficult to navigate and find specific accounts. We mainly rely on the algorithm to give us the content that we want to see.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: french braids, hair style, brushing, TikTok hair trend
meta-description: We’re telling you everything that you need to know about french braid hack and how you can recreate it for an effortlessly chic look.
meta-title: The Easy French Braid Hack Taking Over TikTok
name: The Easy French Braid Hack Taking Over TikTok
post-body:
TikTok is our number one source of beauty inspiration. It’s where we go when we’re on the hunt for the best hair hacks. When we first came across this French braid hack, designed to hide greasy roots, we instantly fell head over heels.

TikTok has been the home of some of the biggest hair trends of 2021, including heatless curls and ‘90s-inspired buns. The short video format of TikTok means that it’s easy to follow hair tutorials without having to watch an entire YouTube video.

‍

‍
This French braid hack is one of the easiest to follow and the ideal look for days when you don’t have time to wash your hair. We’re telling you everything that you need to know about this hair hack and how you can recreate it for an effortlessly chic look.

‍
Greasy hair is a part of life. Unless you’re blessed with a healthy scalp, your hair might get greasy the day after shampooing. No one wants to overwash their hair and strip it of its natural oils, but what can you do to hide greasy hair? Enter the French braid hack. It’s the perfect alternative to excessively using dry shampoo or trying to hide your hair with heat styling.  

‍
This easy hair tutorial teaches you everything that you need to know to conceal your greasy roots and give it a new lease of life. Wave goodbye to trying to hide your hair under a baseball cap or layers of dry shampoo. What we love about this hair hack is how easy it is to recreate at home. You don’t need to worry about complicated braiding that will leave you feel like you’ve just done an arm workout.

‍

‍
Unlike French plaits, this braid is easy to do and beginner friendly. You can use it after going to the gym or if you oversleep and miss your alarm.

‍
This hair hack trend was started by the TikTok user @sar___h1 who talked her 26,000 followers through an easy-to-follow hack to hide greasy roots with a chic faux-French braid that anyone can do. Sarah promoted the video as solving the problem of “greasy hair? Can’t do French plaits?”.

‍

‍

You can watch Sarah’s easy-to-follow TikTok tutorial above or follow our write up below, if you prefer to take it a little slower. The original video now has over 184k likes and has been shared over 4000 times. Sarah’s account is full of effortlessly chic hair tutorials if you want to build your skills and say goodbye to a ponytail.

‍
The easiest way to start this hair hack is to put your hair down, letting it frame your face. For an elevated look, you want to part your hair in the middle, taking two small sections of your hair. While Sarah left a smaller section of your hair out from the look, you might decide to use all your hair if it’s very greasy.

‍

‍
While your head is down, start by plating the first small section into a slim braid. Carry on braiding the hair until you reach the back of the crown of your hair. For a seamless look, skip using a hair bauble and choose an elastic instead that matches the colour of your hair. Use a few hair pins to attach the braid in place at the back of your hair.

‍
Once you have the first braid in place, repeat the previous step for the other section of hair. You want to try and keep the two braids as even as possible, unless you prefer a messy and more natural look. It’s up to you to decide how sleek you want the finish to be.

‍
Here is where the magic starts to happen. You want to use your fingertips to start loosening the braids slightly, making them appear like Dutch braids. Once they’ve loosened, you can ruffle them to make them look closer to a traditional French braid.

‍
It’s as easy as that. With over two million views, it’s clear we’re not the only ones who have fallen in love with this hair style. Sarah’s comment section is full of praise for her easy hair hack, with her one of followers saying that it was the “best thing I’ve ever seen”.

‍
The next time you have greasy hair or want to skip a wash, give this hair hack a try. It’s perfect for autumn and winter to keep your hair hydrated by letting you go longer without having to wash your hair.

‍
What’s your favourite TikTok hair hack? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: TikTok is our number one source of beauty inspiration. It’s where we go when we’re on the hunt for the best hair hacks. When we first came across this French braid hack, designed to hide greasy roots, we instantly fell head over heels. TikTok has been the home of some of the biggest hair trends of 2021, including heatless curls and ‘90s-inspired buns. The short video format of TikTok means that it’s easy to follow hair tutorials without having to watch an entire YouTube video.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: beauty trends, makeup trends, hair trends, trends 2021
meta-description: The ‘60s and ‘70s are still holding their grip on the beauty industry, no doubt thanks to TikTok’s love of vintage fashion and style inspiration. Read more
meta-title: Meet the Biggest Beauty Trends of the Season
name: Meet the Biggest Beauty Trends of the Season
post-body:
If you ever want to get ahead of the beauty trends, all you have to do is look at the runway. With collections being shown seasons in advance, it gives us our first taste of what makeup artists think are going to be the next ‘it’ trends. We’re turning to Paris, Milan, London, and New York for our beauty inspiration for autumn and winter 2021. With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to experiment with the latest beauty trends.

At Paris Fashion Week, makeup artists and hair stylists took their inspiration from muted pastel shades to encapsulate the idea of escapism. Whether it was a sequinned lip or coral hair, Fashion Week has showed us that the beauty world is still enjoying a quirky moment.

One themed you’ll see in most of these beauty trends is that nostalgia is everywhere you look.
