Milan Fashion Week made us feel like we were stepping back into the ;90s, from sleek straight hair to bandanas and face gems. It’s not just the ‘90s that are being remembered. The ‘60s and ‘70s are still holding their grip on the beauty industry, no doubt thanks to TikTok’s love of vintage fashion and style inspiration.

Read on to find out more about the biggest beauty trends of the season that we're all over the catwalk at fashion week.

‍

‘90s hair

‍
It’s time to bring your backcombing brush out of storage. One of our favourite hair looks from fashion week was Collina Strada bringing back-combing back to life, along with bright mullets and rattails. If you’re a fan of ‘80s and ‘90s fashion, then it’s time to embrace your love for the era.

‍

Maximalist hair accessories

‍
Another hair trend that was all over the runway was stacked hair accessories. Gone are the days of wearing just one statement hair clip. While some aspects of fashion are going all minimalistic, it’s time to say hello to maximalism.

Everyone from Simone Rocha to Tom Ford and Alice & Olivia had their models wearing stacked hair clips and accessories. Stacked accessories are perfect to style with a messy undone bun for a textured look.

‍

Dramatic smoky eyes

‍
After a year of minimalistic and understated eyeshadow trends, smoky eyes are back again. It’s not your classic dark smokey eye with hues of brown and taupe. With this trend, the bolder the colour palette, the better.

It’s all about adding flashes of colour to your look, whether it’s a pastel pink or your favourite aqua blue hue. For this trend, keep the rest of your makeup natural for a flawless finish and to let your eyes pop. This beauty trend is a must-try for the holiday season.

‍

Short, chopped bob

‍
Change the hair. Change the woman. It’s a moto that we live by. If you feel like you want to make a drastic change to your hair, it’s time to experiment with the biggest hair trend of the season. Autumn/winter 2021 is all about the bob haircut, which is going to carry through to Spring 2022. At Loewe, we saw pastel bowl-cut hair, while Chanel opted for the classic French-girl chic bob.

‍

Head scarves

‍
Another accessory about to make a return to the beauty scene is headscarves – imagine what you would wear to a music festival in the early ‘80s. The brighter and bolder the scarf, the better. You can match your bright vintage headscarf to your makeup or let your accessory do the talking.

‍

Holographic chic

‍
This beauty trend takes its inspiration right from Euphoria with holographic pastel detailing. We spotted this trend everywhere from Tom Ford to Anna Sui and KNWLS. Think wet looks with natural shades, complete with a shiny metallic finish. It’s futuristic chic with an understated elegance.

‍

Glam grunge

‍
Are you not a fan of pastels? Glam grunge is a edgier look that is both glamorous and contemporary. The focal point of this look is a deep stain-glass lip with fresh skin and minimalistic eye makeup. You can take your inspiration for this beauty trend from the feminine grunge movement of the 1990s. You’ll want to fill your makeup bag with deep purple and wine-toned lipsticks. You can rock this beauty trend all year round for a glamorous rock chic look.

Which of these beauty trends will you be experimenting with? Are there other trends that you’re excited to try this season? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: If you ever want to get ahead of the beauty trends, all you have to do is look at the runway. With collections being shown seasons in advance, it gives us our first taste of what makeup artists think are going to be the next ‘it’ trends. We’re turning to Paris, Milan, London, and New York for our beauty inspiration for autumn and winter 2021. With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to experiment with the latest beauty trends. At Paris Fashion Week, makeup artists and hair stylists took their inspiration from muted pastel shades to encapsulate the idea of escapism. Whether it was a sequinned lip or coral hair, Fashion Week has showed us that the beauty world is still enjoying a quirky moment.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: ponytails, ponytail ideas, hairstyles, hair
meta-description: Here we share Our favourite ponytail hairstyles ideas. If you have a look on TikTok , you can see how influencers alike have been experimenting with the trend
meta-title: 6 Ponytail Hairstyles Ideas
name: 6 different Ponytails Hairstyles
post-body:
Our favourite tips and tricks for an XXL ponytail

‍
What we love about this trend is how easy it is to put your own spin on it. An XXL ponytail is easy to create, giving you the creative freedom to make it your own. If you have a look on TikTok and Instagram, you can see how celebrities and influencers alike have been experimenting with the trend.

‍
It might take some trial and error for you to find exactly what you’re looking for, but it’s worth experimenting with before the holiday season. We’re sharing our top tips and tricks on how you can take your XXL ponytail to the next level and add a touch of your personality to the trend.

‍

Knotted and sleek

‍
Sometimes, the best looks are the most simplistic. If you’re in a rush or a fan of minimalism, you can keep your XXL ponytail laidback and elevated with a sleek look. Our favourite way of adding an effortless chic twist to our ponytail is by knotting some of our hair around the hair tie. This trick adds an instantly bohemian feel to your look.

‍
If you want to make it even sleeker, run your straighteners through your hair and add a little hair oil to get rid of any flyways and frizz. You can keep your XXL ponytail high or wear it a little lower for a more laidback off-the-clock look.

‍

Middle-parting

‍
Ariana Grande and the Kardashian sisters are the ultimate style muses for this trend. Another styling tip that we’ve taken from these celebrities is their love for a middle-parting. With so much attention on your ponytail, it’s easy to forget about your roots. Adding a middle parting can give you a sleek and super-model worthy look.

‍
It helps to add a little hair oil to your roots to help smooth your hair and create an even, obvious parting at the crown of your hair. You’ll want to do this middle parting before putting your ponytail together to prevent any bumps.

‍
We love to wear this style of XXL ponytail at the bottom to our head for a feminine look that works for any occasion, whether you’re grabbing coffee or going on vacation.

‍

Braided

‍
Are braids your signature? Don’t worry, you don’t need to say goodbye to them just yet. What we love about the XXL ponytail trend is how inclusive it is as a style. If you’re someone who usually wears their hair in braids, you can use the XXL ponytail to give them a new look.

‍
The easiest way to re-create this look is to style your hair as normal in braids, paying extra attention to make sure that there’s no bumps or unevenness around your scalp.

‍
Once your braids are done, flip your head upside down and gather your braids at the part of your head where you want to secure your ponytail. Braids work perfectly for a high-top XXL look, as the braids add extra texture to your hair, taking the look to the next level.

Rapunzel-inspired hair

‍
While waist-length hair isn’t an essential for this trend, it gives it a whole new look. If you’ve always wanted to style yourself like a goddess or a movie star, endless hair is a staple. Don’t worry. There’s no need to wait for years for your hair to grow. None of us are that patient.
‍

Invest in the longest hair extensions that you’re comfortable wearing, keeping in mind that you’ll be installing them to a ponytail. If you have real human hair in your wig, it’s worth straightening or styling your wig beforehand to help it seamlessly blend with your natural hair.

‍

Voluminous waves

‍
Sleek hair isn’t for everyone. If you’ve fallen head over heels for the cottagecore aesthetic or prefer a more traditional feminine look, you can jump on the XXL ponytail trend as well. A wavy ponytail can work for any occasion, whether you’re heading to a wedding or going out with friends. It’s the perfect way to show off thick, healthy hair and have fun with your ponytail.

‍
The easiest way to do this trick is to add waves to your hair before putting your ponytail together. Avoid curling the top of your hair, as you want to keep it sleek and smooth. Work on adding curls and waves to the hair from the base of your ear down. You can add volumizing products to give the illusion of thicker hair and to add another dimension to your look.

‍
We love to finish this trick off with an oversized hair scrunchie or one with chain detaining to give the look an elevated feel. This hairstyle is another one that’s perfect for using your hair extensions for to give you extra volume to work with.

‍

Mermaid-inspired ponytail

‍
Molly Mae is one of our biggest style inspirations – and she’s also a fan of the XXL ponytail look. You can recreate Molly’s mermaid-inspired ponytail by adding short and loose curls to your hair to create a crimpled look. We love that Molly has also added a middle parting to her look, with the smoothness of your roots contrasting against the waves of her ponytail. Don’t forget to add a glossy finish to your hair with a natural hair oil.

‍
What do you think of the XXL ponytail trend – is it one that you’re going to try? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: What we love about this trend is how easy it is to put your own spin on it. An XXL ponytail is easy to create, giving you the creative freedom to make it your own. If you have a look on TikTok and Instagram, you can see how celebrities and influencers alike have been experimenting with the trend.‍It might take some trial and error for you to find exactly what you’re looking for, but it’s worth experimenting with before the holiday season.We’re sharing our top tips and tricks on how you can take your XXL ponytail to the next level and add a touch of your personality to the trend.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: skin care, microdosing trend, skin microdosing trend
meta-description: We’re taking a look at what microdosing is and everything you need to know to be able to incorporate them into your routine.
meta-title: Everything You Need to Know About the Microdosing
name: Everything You Need to Know About the Microdosing Trend
post-body:
Don’t worry. Microdosing isn’t as scary as it sounds. In fact, it can give your skin a healthy kick and turbo-charge your skin’s recovery. Grab a pen and take some notes, we’re giving you a full rundown of this new skincare trend that everyone is talking about.

‍
If you’re someone who has a consistent skincare routine, the chances are that you are familiar with active ingredients. In fact, it’s likely that you’ve overdone it at least once. It’s easy to get carried away with your active ingredients. Like most things in life, it’s possible to have too much of a good thing. Most of us simply want to achieve healthy, glowing skin and assume that using more active ingredients is the easiest way of getting there.

‍

‍

Like another popular philosophy, good things come to those who wait. Patience is key to getting results from your skincare routine. You can’t simply layer dozens of active ingredients in the hopes of speeding up the process. Everyone has to wait. In fact, using too many active ingredients can do more harm than good. Certain active ingredients don’t mix well together and can lead to acne, dryness, redness, and irritation, amongst dozens of other side effects.

‍

‍
It’s this tendency to overcomplicate skincare and active ingredients in particular that has led to the “microdosing” trend becoming one of the biggest buzzwords in the industry right now. If skinimalism has taught us anything, it’s that adopting a simpler approach can transform your skin and give you the results that you want.

‍
The popularity of microdosing comes from its ability to give you both short and long-term results that make a visible difference to the condition of your skin. We’re taking a look at what microdosing is and everything you need to know to be able to incorporate them into your routine. It’s a unique innovation that offers something for every skincare user.

‍

What is microdosing?

While microdosing is becoming a growing trend within the industry, it’s not a new phenomenon. When you hear the word ‘microdosing’, chances are you’re thinking of psychedelic drugs like LSD. What microdosing does is use smaller micrograms of the substance, giving the user the focus and mental health benefits without the ‘high’ side effects that come with a larger amount of the substance being used. The concept of microdosing has been around in the healthcare sphere for decades but has finally made its way into the beauty and skincare industry.

‍
The concept of microdosing with skincare ingredients is to avoid using high concentrations that can cause irritation. Microdosing is using a lower percentage, usually around one-tenth of the concentration, and applying it regularly. Using a microdosing amount means that your skin can grow its tolerance and maintain its protective barrier, while getting the benefits of the ingredients to create a healthy, dewy glow. With microdosing, you can use active ingredients daily instead of every few days. You get all the benefits with the ease of using a lower concentration. If you have sensitive skin, microdosing might be the answer to all your problems.

‍

‍
The beauty industry is looking at microdosing as a therapeutic way of helping you incorporate valuable but easy-to-oversee ingredients. These types of active ingredients include vitamin C, exfoliating acids, and retinoids. These active ingredients can be a game changer for your routine but it’s easy to go overboard and have an adverse reaction to them. They’re also notorious for being difficult to layer with other active ingredients.

‍
By microdosing instead of jumping off at the deep end, you can avoid the adverse side effects of using active ingredients, such as redness, irritation, and flaking. Microdosing allows you to slowly build up your skin’s tolerance to the active ingredient to prevent side effects and irritation.

‍
While you might start slowly with a normal product, it’s easy to become overly zealous and go overboard with a high-strength concentration that ends in chaos for your skin. Your skin can only take a certain level and concentration of an active ingredient before it starts to become inflamed in response. This response is the opposite of what you want from your active ingredients.

‍

‍
You want to see your skincare routine as something that develops slowly over time. Slow and steady wins the race. If you want long-lasting results and a visible improvement in your skin, you need to be committed and consistent with your routine.

‍
If you speak to any dermatologist or skincare expert, they’ll all tell you the same thing. You’ll get the best results when you’re consistent with your skincare routine. The issue comes with active ingredients that you’re not using every day. It’s easy to forget about the retinoid that you’re meant to be applying twice a week. It means you end up forgetting to use it and your skin doesn’t build up the tolerance it needs.
‍

Instead, if you use a lower strength of the active ingredient every day, it’s easier for you to create a regular and consistent routine. You can’t keep stopping and starting with an active ingredient, as it won’t give you the results you want. If you’re not consistent and keep trying to re-start with the active ingredient, your skin can end up in a worse state than when you started using the ingredient.

‍

Incorporating microdosing into your beauty routine

‍
Never fear. You don’t need to go and see a dermatologist or pay a top tier price to try microdosing. Like anything, beauty brands are evolving to meet the growing demand for microdosing, making it more accessible and easier to use.

‍
The brand Skin + Me offers a skincare subscription service that links you to dermatologist, giving you a tailored service that allows a specialist to prescribe you with the most suitable active ingredients for your skin type at a lower percentage. Boosters are another similar product to micro-dosing and are designed to be used alone or added to your moisturizer as a low-percentage way of getting active ingredients into your routine.

‍

‍
Another brand that has come out with a microdosing product is ‘Spectacle Skincare’. Their newly released Performance Crème works with a microdose of vitamin C, encapsulated retinaldehyde, and poly hydroxy acids all rolled into one formula. It also gives your skin a consistent dose of vitamin A, allowing your skin to get the most out of anti-inflammatory antioxidants and ingredients that help to stimulate your collagen and elastin production. If you’re a fan of skinimalism or want an easy to use skincare routine, this style of microdosing product is for you.

‍
Every skin type could do with incorporating microdosing into their skincare routine. If you have sensitive skin or one that’s prone to irritation and reactions, you want to pay extra attention to the benefits of micro-dosing. It can be the best – and in some cases, only – way of getting certain active ingredients into your skin.

‍
You don’t need to go overkill with high doses of active ingredients like retinol to see their benefits. Microdosing gives you the same benefits, without irritating your skin or causes more problems than you already have.

‍
One of the main selling points of microdosing is that it offers something for everyone. Are you new to the world of active ingredients? Start with microdosing. Do you have sensitive skin? Try microdosing. Are you trying to find out what works for your skin? Bingo. It’s microdosing.

‍
One thing you want to consider is that not every ingredient is suitable as a microdose. While we can expect the industry to jump on the microdosing trend and try to incorporate it into every product, there’s some that you can’t just microdose. SPF is the perfect example of this. Your skin needs at least SPF30 protection every day with a teaspoon-sized amount of sunscreen on your face.

‍
Make a list of the active ingredients that you want to add to your routine, then set off in search of the microdose version of it. These microdosing products can be incorporated into your routine after cleansing and toning, before finishing off with a moisturizer to lock in the active ingredients and offer all-day hydration.

‍
It’s that easy. With microdosing, active ingredients are more accessible and easier to use than ever before.

‍
What do you think of the microdosing trend? Is it something you would consider adding to your routine? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary:
Don’t worry. Microdosing isn’t as scary as it sounds. In fact, it can give your skin a healthy kick and turbo-charge your skin’s recovery. Grab a pen and take some notes, we’re giving you a full rundown of this new skincare trend that everyone is talking about.
If you’re someone who has a consistent skincare routine, the chances are that you are familiar with active ingredients. In fact, it’s likely that you’ve overdone it at least once. It’s easy to get carried away with your active ingredients. Like most things in life, it’s possible to have too much of a good thing. Most of us simply want to achieve healthy, glowing skin and assume that using more active ingredients is the easiest way of getting there.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: TikTok fashion trends, tiktok trends, closet, fall outfit
meta-description: At the beginning, TikTok was famous for its OTT and loud fashion trends that not everyone would want to wear.
meta-title: 3 Trends Fashionistas Are Wearing on TikTok
name: 3 Trends Fashionistas Are Wearing on TikTok
post-body:
What we love about these TikTok outfit ideas is that they incorporate some of the most on-trend pieces that you’ll already on your radar. You can even find some pre-loved through third stores on apps like Depop if you want to be more sustainable with your shopping habits.
‍

As the world starts to reopen after the pandemic and as we welcome winter , it’s the perfect time to have some fun with TikTok fashion trends and try something new. This article is your ultimate guide on everything that you need to know about TikTok fashion trends. If your closet is in need of some inspiration, we’re rounding up 3 fashion trends that everyone is wearing on TikTok, including how you can incorporate them into your outfits for the perfect fall 2021 look.

‍

‍
At the beginning, TikTok was famous for its OTT and loud fashion trends that not everyone would want to wear. During the pandemic, fashion trends have changed to adopt a more laidback and casual look, focusing on classic staples.

‍
You can expect to see everything from coloured button-down shirts to Y2K inspired outfits, you’ll get a bit of everything with this TikTok fashion guide. Make sure to bookmark this page so that you can use it as your shopping lift for your next closet haul.

‍

Polarised cycling sunglasses

‍
This TikTok fashion trend has divided the community on the app, with some people loving them while others are…less than amused by them. We didn’t want these to become a trend until we saw how good people looked in them on TikTok. We’d like to personally thank all the Olympians who filmed their TikToks while wearing these polarised cycling sunglasses.

‍
So how do you wear these oversized and somewhat awkward sunglasses? After all, they’re designed to be worn on a bike and not for everyday use. The secret is once again in the styling. TikTok fashionistas tend to balance the sporty look of the cycling sunglasses with a sleek and streetwear-ready outfit. Picture dark denim jeans with a vintage blazer or leather jacket. These sunglasses add an instant level of coolness to your look.

‍
Oversized sunglasses have been a trend for years – inspired by celebrities hiding from the press. These sporty cycling sunglasses take the aesthetic to the next level, with an on-trend athleisure twist that is sure to catch everyone’s attention.

‍

Carpenter pants

‍
Okay, hear us out.

‍
Carpenter pants are another example of a fashion item that we didn’t think was stylish until we saw it all over your TikTok feed. If you scroll through a few OOTDs and ‘get ready with me’ videos, you’ll notice that these carpenter pants are everywhere you look. They’re a utility style that gives your outfit an effortlessly chic feel.

‍

‍
If you want to get the authentic and TikTok-approved look, keep an eye out for pre-loved carpenter pants in vintage stores, thrift stores, and on second-hand shopping apps. Trust us. You’ll be trying to track a pair of these down by the end of the day.

‍

Throwback graphic t-shirts

‍
If there’s one thing that TikToker fashionistas love, it’s a graphic t-shirt with a throwback ‘90s or early 2000s’ inspired look. This trend is an opportunity for you to add your personality to your look. You can choose a graphic t-shirt with your favourite band or old-time film. Graphic t-shirts add an instantly cool feel to your outfit. You can style them with a blazer and bicycle shorts or keep it simple with denim jeans.

‍

‍
Which of these TikTok fashion trends will you be trying during fall 2021? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: This article is your ultimate guide on everything that you need to know about TikTok fashion trends. If your closet is in need of some inspiration, we’re rounding up 3 fashion trends that everyone is wearing on TikTok, including how you can incorporate them into your outfits for the perfect fall 2021 look.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: TikTok, Sea Salt water trend, clean acne, dermatologiste
meta-description: We’ve been waiting for a TikTok skincare trend to come around that is too-good-to-be-true. Enter the seas saltwater treatments.
meta-title: TikTok is Using Sea Salt Water to Clear Acne.
name: TikTok is Using Sea Salt Water to Clear Acne: What’s the Verdict?
post-body:
Sometimes, we come across a trend that seems like it’s too good to be true. Most of the time these trends are on TikTok. We’ve all seen the videos that have made us do a double take and ask, ‘that can’t be real?’, before scrolling through the comments to see what everyone else is saying. That’s how we feel about sea saltwater treatments. They’re trend that is all over TikTok, with users claiming that it will clear their acne.

‍

‍

While TikTok is known for its skincare hacks, not every one of them is worth following. In fact, some of them are more likely to harm your skin than solve anything. We’ve been waiting for a TikTok skincare trend to come around that is too-good-to-be-true. Enter the seas saltwater treatments.

‍

How the saltwater treatment trend started

One TikTok claiming that the treatment can remove acne has several million views and 1.5 million likes. With that many views, you’d expect the treatment to work, right?

The video shows TikTok user @aubyrnjadeart explain how she had used a sea saltwater treatment to cure her acne and transform her complexion to achieve clear skin.

She claims that her acne was cured using a mixture of water and sea salt which was applied to her face twice every day. Aubyrn claims that she had tried everything to get rid of her adult acne until she came across a video by a fellow TikToker, @leacryclics. She shared how she had started using the sea saltwater treatment after claiming that her skin looked better after swimming in the ocean. Both TikTok users say that the treatment helped improve their skin by killing bacteria and balancing their skin’s pH levels.

If there’s one thing that we’ve learnt, it’s that you should always take a viral beauty hack with a grain of salt. Before you go out and try any beauty trend on your skin, you should always look out for the opinion of a professional. The last thing you want to do is damage your skin because you trusted the advice of a stranger on the internet.

‍

Does the saltwater treatment work?

So, what’s the judgement from dermatologists?

While this treatment may work in theory, it’s not going to permanently remove acne, scars, or pimples. Most dermatologists would agree that looking at the sun or sea for skincare inspiration is rarely the best place to start. The reason? It’s difficult to recreate an ocean in a bottle.

Real ocean water, particularly that which is magnesium-based, can feel like it’s a miracle from your skin. There’s lots of evidence of sea salt water in the ocean effectively exfoliating your skin to cleanse the pores, removing impurities and oils from your skin.

The issue is that while this might work in the office, it won’t work in your bathroom at home. It’s impossible to recreate the exact circumstances of the ocean and the benefit of ocean water to your skin.

‍

The danger of DIY TikTok skincare trends

‍
Don’t get us wrong. We love a good TikTok beauty trend as much as the next person. That doesn’t mean that we ignore the danger that some of them pose. It’s worth remembering that most DIY skincare solutions either don’t work or can damage your skin. For example, while this sea salt water treatment will work on the surface of your skin, it won’t be able to target the dermis layer of your skin for long-term results.

Salt water does have its benefit. It can soothe mild skin inflammation, including redness and hyperpigmentation. Although it can do this, it’s not considered an appropriate treatment for acne. The real danger posed by this DIY skincare trend is that it will delay people from seeing their dermatologist or result in scarring and hyperpigmentation by using the wrong products for their skin.

One thing that we can disprove is the claim in this trend that ocean water balances your skin’s pH level and removes bacteria. Sea water has an alkaline pH of 8 which is similar to that of acne-prone skin. If you wanted to balance acne-prone skin, you would need to use an acidic pH instead, such as salicylic acid or glycolic acid.

While people might be claiming to get visible results from this treatment, it’s not all its made out to be. At its heart, it’s a mild exfoliation and anti-inflammation treatment. This is one TikTok beauty trend that we won’t be trying.

What do you think about TikTok skincare trends? Do you do your research before trying a DIY trend yourself? Let us knowin the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Sometimes, we come across a trend that seems like it’s too good to be true. Most of the time these trends are on TikTok. We’ve all seen the videos that have made us do a double take and ask, ‘that can’t be real?’, before scrolling through the comments to see what everyone else is saying. That’s how we feel about sea saltwater treatments. They’re trend that is all over TikTok, with users claiming that it will clear their acne.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: beauty trends, future trends, makeup trends, sustainability, cosmétique
meta-description: We’re looking at five trends that are the future of the beauty industry. You can expect to see these popping up in new collections
meta-title: Meet the Beauty Trends of the Future
name: Meet the Beauty Trends of the Future
post-body:
Make dates back as far as 5,000 years to the Sumerians. It’s evolved somewhat over time – developing from the way ancient civilizations used to the more practical styles that we use today. It wasn’t until the Romans that makeup became a tool for enhancing your beauty and natural features. Ever since, beauty products have been a part of our daily ritual and routine.

‍
Since then – for hundreds of years – beauty and makeup products have evolved to meet the needs of society. Interestingly, looking at the beauty industry can give you insights into what society is thinking. During World War 1, women wore makeup as they started going out into the workforce. During the pandemic, we lightened our makeup to reflect the reality of working from home.

‍

‍
Societal influences are everywhere you look with the beauty industry. As we come through the other side of the pandemic, it’s not difficult to see the impact of the last 18 months on the beauty industry. From low-maintenance products to inclusive makeup lines and a simpler approach to beauty, the industry is continuing to evolve.

‍
Looking at today’s trends, we can see where the beauty industry is heading to in the future. The trends of today determine the products of tomorrow. We’re looking at five trends that are the future of the beauty industry. You can expect to see these popping up in new collections and to be the focal point of your makeup bag in the months and years to come.

‍

‍

Skinimalism as the new ‘it’ look

‍
Thanks to the rise of social media, there were several years where everyone was wearing dramatic makeup looks that had an editorial style and looked more suited to a costume party than everyday life. Think heavily-contoured cheeks and dramatic eye makeup that would remind you of a reality TV star.

‍
After living through a global pandemic, working from home, and the reality of mask wearing, heavy makeup looks have become a thing of the past. People want a more streamline and easy to use makeup routine that has a simpler approach. ‘Skinamlism’ focuses on embracing your natural beauty, focusing on evening your texture and creating a glowing radiance.

‍
This trend is characterised by a ‘less is more’ approach, with fewer products and a focus on natural ingredients and so-called clean formulas. It’s all about giving your skin a healthy, dewy glow.

‍

‍
You can see the skinimalism trend in wider society through the rise of minimalism. Whether it’s Marie Kondo-ing your life or adopting lifestyle aesthetics like cottagecore, people want to look their best while embracing their natural skin.

‍
The popularity of skinimalism is clear to see from Pinterest Predicts reports. The social media platform is the go-to choice for people looking for inspiration for changing their look or who wants to create a vision or mood board. The report saw a noticeable increase in the number of searches for natural skincare.

‍
Users were searching for phrases like “natural everyday makeup”, which saw an increase of 180% in search volume. Another popular search term was “how to get glowing skin naturally”.

‍
As part of the skinimalism trend, there’s been a shift in consumer behaviour away from makeup products and onto skincare. The NPD group reported makeup sales were down 34% in 2020, not surprising when you consider the circumstances.

‍

‍
The minimalistic approach and skinimalism has been on the rise in recent years, but it was turbo-charged by the pandemic. The industry has shifted its focus from makeup to skincare as people go back to basics and pay attention to their self-care routine through using skincare products.

‍
You can see the ‘less is more’ approach of skinimalism everywhere that you look in the beauty routine right now. Even as life returns to normal and the impact of the pandemic starts to ease, most of us are choosing to keep our simplified beauty routines and stay on top of our skin’s health.

‍

It’s all about the eyes

‍
One trend that came out of the pandemic was the focus on eye makeup. While the pandemic turbocharged the already-growing trend of skinimalism, it brought back bold eye looks for the first time in years. It’s no surprise that with most of our face covered, we chose to pay more attention to our eyes.

‍
Notable trends include reverse cat eye, bold eyeliner shades, pastel eyeshadows, and coloured mascaras. If it goes on your eyes and you can make it a colour, it’ll be part of this trend.

‍

‍
As part of the eye makeup trend, there’s been a heightened interest in semi-permanent makeup that can give you long-term benefits for your lashes. A lash lift is the perfect example of this, as it’s less stressful than extensions and works by using your natural lashes – essentially giving them a perm. Lash lifts work by curling and lifting your lashes from the base to create a more professional look.

‍
While you’ll always want to go to a professional for a lash lift, the main attraction to the treatment is that it does away with the need for mascara. Other treatments such as brow lamination have risen in popularity as well as they help play-up your features and draw attention to your eyes, while also streamlining your makeup routine.

‍

Celebrity makeup lines becoming more competitive

‍
First it was perfumes, then it was celebrity makeup lines. We all know that celebrities can attach their name to just about everything and it’ll sell. For a few years, it seemed like everyone was coming out with a celebrity makeup line – none of which grabbed our attention or was worth our money.

‍
Then Fenty happened – and everything changed.

‍

‍
Rihanna’s makeup brand served as a watershed movement for the beauty industry, showing that celebrities can have a makeup brand and compete with the most established names in the industry. Fenty Beauty offers a mouth-water 40 foundation shades and the brand was even named one of the ‘Best Inventions of the Year for 2017’ by Time magazine.

‍
In 2020, Selena Gomez joined the club with her own makeup line ‘Rare Beauty’. Instead of contributing to unrealistic beauty trends, this brand focused instead on helping customers embrace their inner beauty and find acceptance in their makeup routine. This message has been at the heart of the brand since it launched.

‍
It might be time that we give celebrity makeup brands a second chance. Celebrity perfumes came to dominate the industry in the early-to-mid 2000s, and the same might just happen in the makeup industry.

‍

The Zoom Effect

‍
Have we ever spent so long looking at our own reflection? Thanks to the pandemic, we’ve spent more time in front of a camera than ever before. The so-called ‘Zoom Effect’ refers to the growth of dermatologist visits from consumers who have noticed imperfections in their skin after spending all day looking at their reflection.

‍
The American Society of Plastic Surgeons found that 64% of plastic surgeons had an increase in virtual consultations since the start of the pandemic. Most of these consultations were for treatments associated with issues you could see on camera – such as a double chin, wrinkles, and texture issues.

‍
While the pandemic increased the skinimalism movement, it also made us more aware of our imperfections by forcing us to look at them every day.

‍

Sustainability

‍
The beauty industry – like almost every niche in society – is being impacted by the effects of climate change. There’s no denying that the industry has played more than its fair share in causing climate change. You only have to look at the unnecessary water and plastic usage by brands.

‍
As consumers demand new sustainable formulas and packaging, brands are scrambling to get ahead of the curve with new alternatives and sustainable solutions to meet new consumer habits and preferences.

‍

‍
73% of consumers have said that they would change their consumption habits to lower their environmental impact. 41% of those interviewed by Nielsen said that they would be ‘highly willing’ to spend more on products that have a natural or organic formula.
For most beauty brands, this forms the foundation of their sustainability mission – looking for ways to make their formulas more organic, while changing their packaging. It’s worth remembering that consumers are becoming more educated than ever before, meaning they’re covered about the overall environmental impact and carbon footprint of their beauty products.

‍
Some beauty brands have reacted quickly to growing consumer demands for sustainability. L’Occitane has developed their refill program across 25 product ranges, which require up to 90% less packaging, while offering consumers a better price for the product. They’ve said that the initiative have saved around 200 tons of plastic going to landfill every year. Unilever – one of the biggest beauty conglomerates - have committed to making their packaging recyclable, reusable, or compostable by 2025.

‍
What do you think the future of the beauty industry will look like? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Looking at today’s trends, we can see where the beauty industry is heading to in the future. The trends of today determine the products of tomorrow. We’re looking at five trends that are the future of the beauty industry. You can expect to see these popping up in new collections and to be the focal point of your makeup bag in the months and years to come.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: shacket, TikTok Must-Have, fall / winter, shacket style
meta-description: The #shacket on TikTok has over 28 million views and climbing, showing the popularity of this TikTok fashion trend.
meta-title: Why ‘Shacket’ is a TikTok Must-Have
name: What is the ‘Shacket’ and Why It’s a TikTok Must-Have
post-body:
These are essentials that make it easy to layer with other staples to keep you warm as autumn turns to winter. The so-called ‘shacket’ is a stand-out essential and one that TikTok has fallen head over heels with.

The shacket is a hybrid of a jacket and button-up shirt. It’s not as heavy as a jacket, nor as light as a shirt. The beauty of a shacket is that you can wear it with almost any outfit, whether it’s a pencil skirt, denim jeans, or maxi dress. You have limitless styling options when it comes to the shacket.

‍

‍

The #shacket on TikTok has over 28 million views and climbing, showing the popularity of this TikTok fashion trend. What we love about the trend is that you can choose to buy a new style or dig out an old vintage favourite. If you want an affordable way to update your closet for fall, look no further than this TikTok must have.

‍

What is a shacket?

‍
A shacket is a quintessential layering essential that everyone needs in their closet. Just like all good things, you can find shackets in every shape and size. There’s one for every occasion and style aesthetic – the shacket works with anything in your closet. It’s the transitional essential to take you effortlessly from the warmer weather to the first days of winter.

‍

‍

Plaid shackets are the perfect autumnal aesthetic, especially if you plan on curling up with a pumpkin spice latte. A plaid shacket is an easy way to incorporate this classic print into your autumn closet. You have dozens of plaid patterns to choose from, whether you’re a fan of classic tartan or elevated houndstooth. If you live in a colder climate, look out for shackets with a Sherpa-lined collar.

Another popular option is an oversized shacket, perfect for days when you want to be comfortable and curl up with a book and your favourite movie. They can help dress down a tailored look or give you extra room to layer up against the cold. Some of our favourite autumn shackets are ones that you can effortlessly style with cable-knit sweaters, miniskirts, and your favourite knee-high boots.

‍

‍

Why it’s a TikTok must-have

‍
The shacket is having a moment on TikTok because it’s the perfect essential for days when you don’t know what the weather will be like. Autumn is the most unpredictable time of the year. It goes from sunshine to rain to touches of snow. If you’re not ready to commit to bringing out your winter jacket, it’s time to invest in a shacket.

‍

‍

Another reason why the shacket is trending on TikTok is because of how easy it is to style. Whether you’re someone who lives in leggings all autumn long or prefer dresses, you’re guaranteed to find a shacket that works with your aesthetic.
With ‘hygge’ and comfort-driven fashion being two of the biggest trends of 2021, it’s no surprise that TikTok has fallen in love with this cosy, often oversized, button-up shirt jacket.

‍

How to style your shacket

‍
A shacket is effortlessly chic and an essential that you can wear with almost anything. A slim-fit t-shirt is perfect for layering under your shacket, tucked into denim jeans or a high-waisted skirt. When you’re styling your shacket, you can think of it as a classic button-up shirt.

You can wear virtually anything under your shacket. You can add a feminine feel to your look with a dress or layer up with jeans, an oversized sweatshirt, and Chelsea boots. Nothing is off limits when you’re styling a shacket – you can wear a jumpsuit, wide-leg trousers, or a bodycon dress.

‍

‍

One of our favourite ways to style a shacket is to mix and match elevated basics, including turtlenecks, minimalistic hoodies, and classic t-shirts. You can get the most out of your shacket by choosing a minimalistic style in a neutral colour.

Don’t be afraid to style a button-up shirt with your shacket, especially if it’s a dress. We think nothing screams autumn more than a shacket, plaid dress, and knee-high boots. It’s a look we’ll be wearing all autumn long.

What do you think of a shacket? Is it a must-have for your autumn closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: The shacket is a hybrid of a jacket and button-up shirt. It’s not as heavy as a jacket, nor as light as a shirt. The beauty of a shacket is that you can wear it with almost any outfit, whether it’s a pencil skirt, denim jeans, or maxi dress. You have limitless styling options when it comes to the shacket.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: beauty trends, social media trends 2021, hair
meta-description: We’re looking at the biggest beauty trends that have dominating social media in 2021. This article shares how you can re-create them at home
meta-title: 3 Beauty Trends We Have Spotted on Social Media
name: 3 Beauty Trends We Have Spotted on Social Media
post-body:
The beauty of social media is that beauty trends can come out of nowhere, changing and adapting to our needs. This idea was never truer than when the pandemic hit, and beauty trends shifted from a full-face of makeup or a skincare-focused routine.

‍
With most of us spending time indoors, it inspired beauty trends to focus on creating a healthy, dewy glow by looking after our skin. Skinimalism came to dominate trends, just as we swapped workwear for activewear. But it’s also been an opportunity to be creative and try something new as trends like cottagecore become lifestyle aesthetics.

‍
We’re looking at the biggest beauty trends that have dominating social media in 2021. This article shares how you can re-create them at home, incorporating products that you already have in your makeup bag and vanity.
You’ll want to make sure to bookmark this guide to keep it on your radar for the next time you want to try something new.

‍

The ‘80s aesthetic

‍
Trends work on a 20-year cycle. While we spend most of our time looking at – and thinking about – Y2K trends, it’s worth considering the trends that are officially turning 40-years old.

‍
80s trends are back again to add colour and curls back into our lives. Millenials and Gen Z are discovering the trends of their parents’ generations, whether they’re raiding their closets or going through old photos. It even inspired a viral video on TikTok where on user tried to recreate her mum’s 80s high school picture.

‍
Whatever your makeup preference is, you can jump on the ‘80s bandwagon. It’s all about bold colours and daring hues, whether it’s a blue eyeshadow or a neon pink lipstick. You can even shake it up and wear both at the one time. No rules apply when you’re talking about ‘80s beauty.

‍

‍
You can keep your makeup look subtle or go over the top, the choice is up to you. Put on some Madonna and embrace the error with vibrant eyeshadow, voluminous hair, and curls for day. The ‘80s trends are all about going big or going home. It’s time to show what you “got from my mama”.

‍

‍

Independent and small beauty brands

‍
If you follow any beauty accounts on social media, you’ll know that there are thousands (if not millions) of small beauty brands out there. During the pandemic, we all started to pay more focus on small and independent brands that don’t have the same support as big-name players.

‍

‍
We all started to vote with our wallet, swapping mainstream brands for independent alternatives. The power of social media has taken small beauty brands and grown them overnight thanks to viral videos or an influencer mention. Whether it’s an influencer brand or one from Etsy, there’s no shortage of brands for you to support.
‍

What we love about small beauty brands is the feel good factor. You get a new beauty product to experiment with, while knowing that your order will have made someone’s day. It’s a win-win (and the perfect excuse to spend some money!).

‍

Have fun with wigs

‍
2020 was the year that no one had their hair done. It felt like a breakup from our hair stylist. As a result, minimalistic hair trends that were easy to maintain and style started to appear across social media. There’s nothing easier than throwing on a wig to take your look from 0 to 10.

‍

‍
You can take a leaf from the Kardashian styling book and borrow their favourite accessory. You don’t have to worry about fighting off your friends for a salon appointment and it’s easy to maintain. If you’ve always wanted to experiment with a cut or colour but haven’t wanted to commit - wigs are the answer to all your problems.
With a wig, you don’t have to worry about stocking up on dry shampoo or spending hours trying to curl your hair. You can choose a wig that comes pre-style to make the look even more low-maintenance. Way goodbye to daily styling and constant salon appointments.

‍

‍
There’s no shortage of wig styles for you to choose from, whether you want to invest in a virgin remy wig or keep it simple with a budget-friendly synthetic wig. The popularity of wigs means that you can even find them in clothing stores. Instagram and TikTok are full of thousands of tutorials and videos sharing tips on how to look after and maintain your wigs to keep them in tip-top shape.

‍
Change the hair. Change the woman. This 2021 trend shows no sign of stopping.

Which of the 2021 beauty trends have you been experimenting with? What unexpected trends do you think will pop up in the final months of 2021? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: The beauty of social media is that beauty trends can come out of nowhere, changing and adapting to our needs. This idea was never truer than when the pandemic hit, and beauty trends shifted from a full-face of makeup or a skincare-focused routine.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: TikTok fall trends, TikTok fashion, fall trends
meta-description: We’ve recently came across a few videos on TikTok. Here are a few of our favourite easy fall fashion trends that are minimalistic, versatile, and timeless.
meta-title: Fall Fashion TikTok Trends to Add to Your Closet
name: Easy Fall Fashion TikTok Trends to Add to Your Closet
post-body:
TikTok fashion trends can change in the blink of an eye. If you spend a week away from the app, you could come back to a totally different fashion scene. It’s easy to think that TikTok fashion is all about having a personality change every season. Trust us, it would be impossible to jump on every TikTok fashion trend. There’s a new trend every day that influencers are trying us we can’t afford to miss out on.

Not everyone wants to endorse fast fashion. Staying on top of all the trends can quickly break the bank. Whether it’s for personal or financial reasons, some of us like to keep our seasonal closet updates simple and minimalistic. It’s all about adding a few must-have essentials to your closet that will see you through the season, while still being perfectly on trend.

‍

‍

We’ve recently came across a few videos on TikTok about easy ways to add TikTok fashion to your closet. It’s inspiration behind this article and a way of showing you that you don’t need to spend a fortune to stay stylish and on trend with the TikTok crowd.

Here are a few of our favourite easy fall fashion trends that are minimalistic, versatile, and timeless. Most of these you can pick up second hand from a vintage store or Depop. They’re also ideal for investment pieces to elevate your closet or try something new. These TikTok trends won’t take you too far out of your comfort zone and are easy to integrate into your closet.

Grab your credit card. These trends are an instant ‘add to cart’.

‍

Deep green

‍
The ‘it’ colour of the season for TikTok fashion is deep green. Think Slytherin or forest green. It’s the colour that everyone will be wearing and it’s universally flattering. For us, it screams autumn and is a transitional style to see you through to winter and spring.

When you’re shopping for a deep green staple, we recommend looking out for a zip-up hoodie, oversized jumper, or sweatshirt. This shade of green is easy to mix and match with everyday neutrals, adding a pop of autumn to your look. If you’re a vintage fan, deep green is a shade that we always see in vintage stores and on the pre-loved market.

‍

Leather jacket

‍
Nothing screams autumn more than a leather jacket. It’s a staple that blends masculinity with modern femininity. If you want to embrace your inner off-duty supermodel, a leather jacket is the perfect way to elevate your style. You can throw it over jeans and a t-shirt or a jumper and maxi skirt for a more feminine look. It adds a vintage twist to any outfit.

The beauty of a leather jacket is that it gets better with age as the leather starts to wear in and develop its own personality. You can stick to a classic black shade or experiment with a deeper hue of red or grey.

‍

Knee high boots

‍
Once the temperatures start to drop, it’s time to leave your sandals at the back of your closet until next summer. Knee high boots are both functional and stylish. They’ll keep you warm against the cold, while adding a sexy feel to any outfit. You can wear them for a night on the town with a mini dress or be a tourist in the city with a button-up dress or knitwear moment.

Suede is a classic option, but you might prefer to stick to leather or a faux reptile texture if you live in a wet or snowy climate. These shoes are a must-have investment in your autumn closet.

‍

Ivory coat

‍
Speaking of investment pieces, nothing is a better purchase than an ivory coat. You can choose a style that matches your personality, whether it’s a teddy coat, trench coat, or woollen style. An ivory coat is a chance to bring a touch of minimalistic chic into your closet. White is effortlessly sophisticated and has a regal aesthetic, whether you want to channel your inner Meghan Markle or Kate Middleton.

White is universally flattering and perfect for a snow day. When you’re searching for an ivory coat, look out for a material that is easy to wash or dry clean. You can expect to spill at least one thing on the front of your coat or get caught in the rain.

Which of these fall staples will you be adding to your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: TikTok fashion trends can change in the blink of an eye. If you spend a week away from the app, you could come back to a totally different fashion scene. It’s easy to think that TikTok fashion is all about having a personality change every season. Trust us, it would be impossible to jump on every TikTok fashion trend. There’s a new trend every day that influencers are trying us we can’t afford to miss out on.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: brow, makeup, brow products, eyebrow products , eyebrow
meta-description: Your eyebrows are the curtains of your face. We’re sharing the cult-favourite eyebrow products that will take you give you an instantly elevated look.
meta-title: Products You Need for The Ultimate Brow Look
name: The Cult-Favourite Products You Need for The Ultimate Brow Look
post-body:
Your eyebrows are the curtains of your face. All it takes is a flick of your brow pencil to transform your look. Whether you’re a fan of gels, pencils, or powders, we all have our favourite way to do our brows. You can thicken your brows up, fill them in, or seal them in place with the right products. Don't forget to find tour perfect eyebrow colour.

With thousands of brow products to choose from, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed when you’re shopping through the eyebrow section of your favourite beauty store. With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to get your brow game on fleek. We’re sharing the cult-favourite eyebrow products that will take you give you an instantly elevated look.

‍

‍

You’ll find everything from splurge worthy luxury brow products to affordable drugstore alternatives that put you in control of your eyebrows for a supermodel-worthy look.

‍

Maybelline New York – Brow Fast Sculpt Brow Mascara

‍
This budget-friendly brow mascara has a dual-sided brush that gives you extra control for perfectly groomed brows. It’s ideal for beginners who are just experimenting with their brow routine. This product is best for darker brows and can help thicken and fill in your brows with one product. We love to use it to touch up our brows before a night out or between brow appointments.

‍

Benefit Gimme Brow Plus Volumizing Eyebrow Gel

‍
Benefit is famous for their brow products. They win awards every single year for their brow products which have a cult-following amongst beauty influencers, celebrities, and editors alike.

The ‘Gimme Brow Plus Volumizing Eyebrow Gel’ is worth the splurge purchase and helps you create a seamless look as the gel mimics the appearance of real hair. Available in 10 shades, this eyebrow gel is ideal for those with sparse brows or who want to keep a natural look.

‍

Hourglass Arch Brow Sculpting Pencil

‍
Are you looking to make a splurge purchase? The Hourglass ‘Arch Brow Sculpting Pencil’ is one of the best-sellers in the world of luxury beauty. It gives you the best of all worlds as a pencil meets powder, meets wax.

The double-ended tip puts you in ultimate control, effortlessly creating the illusion of fuller brows. You can fill in sparse brows or concealed overplucked areas to create a defined look. We’ll be adding this brow pencil to the top of our Christmas list.

‍

Maybelline New York Tattoo Studio Brow Gel

‍
When it comes to affordable brow products, Maybelline reigns supreme. This long-lasting brow gel gives you a 48-hour hold, even after cleansing. It’s perfect for weekend looks or when you want to streamline your beauty routine. This brow gel uses the same technology as waterproof mascara to give you extra longevity with a gel that won’t budge an inch.

‍

Anastasia Beverly Hills Brow Definer

‍
No list of eyebrow products is complete without mentioning Anastasia Beverly Hills. The brand is synonymous with their eyebrow products, with the Brow Definer being one of their best-selling products. It’s effortless to use, easy to sharpen, and a must-have for doing your makeup on the go. This eyebrow product is one that you’ll find in almost every influencer’s makeup bag.

‍

Sigma Beauty Color Shape Brow Powder Duo

‍
While we love a brow gel or liner, Sigma’s powder duo puts you in control of your brow colour. You get two shades to choose from, letting you mix them together to create a shade that matches your natural brow hairs. Powder is perfect for using with sparse or overplucked eyebrows

‍

Uoma Beauty Brow-Fro Fro to Go

‍
Are you someone who is already doing their makeup on the go? Whether you’re fixing your brows on your commute to work or a frequent traveller, this Uoma Beauty products is the ultimate two-in-one.

You get a triangle-shaped pencil on one end for filling in the sparse sections of brow hair. What makes this product unique is that it comes with an added powder highlighter shade inside a sponge-tip applicator for a defined and groomed look.

‍

Hard Candy Brows Now! Precision Tip Brow Ink

‍
Another affordable brow staple is the Hard Candy Precision Tip Brow Ink. If you’re heavy-handed with your brow pencils and worry about overapplying colour, this brow ink is designed to give you an effortlessly realistic look. It’s perfect for beginners and ideal for using between professional eyebrow touch ups.

What is your ride or die brow product? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Your eyebrows are the curtains of your face. All it takes is a flick of your brow pencil to transform your look. Whether you’re a fan of gels, pencils, or powders, we all have our favourite way to do our brows. You can thicken your brows up, fill them in, or seal them in place with the right products. With thousands of brow products to choose from, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed when you’re shopping through the eyebrow section of your favourite beauty store. With the holiday season right around the corner, it’s the perfect time to get your brow game on fleek. We’re sharing the cult-favourite eyebrow products that will take you give you an instantly elevated look.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: capsule closet, style, winter wardrobe, fashion
meta-description: Capsule closets are all about finding your ‘ride or die’ pieces. Here are the staples that you need to create the ultimate capsule closet for 2021:
meta-title: How to Create the Ultimate Capsule Closet for 2021
name: How to Create the Ultimate Capsule Closet for 2021
post-body:
Capsule closets are all about finding your ‘ride or die’ pieces. The ultimate capsule closet is one that is full of essentials, go-tos, and versatile styles that work for any occasion. They’re a sustainable alternative to fast fashion and ideal for anyone who wants to make a long-term investment into their closet.

‍

‍

The idea of downsizing your wardrobe and creating a capsule closet can be overwhelming. It’s all about understanding what pieces you need to be able to create a myriad of looks. You could have 15 pieces in your capsule closet, yet you could create up to 100 different looks with those pieces. It’s all about finding effortlessly chic essentials that work for any occasion and are comfortable without compromising on style.

Here are the staples that you need to create the ultimate capsule closet for 2021:

‍

Penny loafers

‍
If there’s one pair of shoes your capsule closet needs, it’s penny loafers. They’re a shoe style that has lasted a lifetime. Although originally designed for men, penny loafers have become a staple for women. They’re an easy way to add an elevated masculine twist to any outfit to give it a contemporary yet classic feel. It’s traditional meets preppy meets off-duty chic.

‍

The timeless long coat

‍
Every woman needs an investment coat. If you’re only able to splurge on one closet essential, let it be your coat. The right long coat can stay in your closet for years to come. It might even become your signature piece. Perhaps the most iconic coat is the trench. While Burberry is synonymous with the style, every designer has put their own twist on the silhouette.

If you live in a colder climate, swap out the trench coat for a woollen design that you can wear as the temperatures start to drop. For the most versatility, choose your investment coat in a neutral shade.

‍

Seasonless blazer

‍
Blazers are the ultimate power piece. They effortlessly blur the line between business casual and off-the-clock chic. Your capsule closet needs a corporate-appropriate blazer that works for any occasion. You can choose a boxy and oversized silhouette for a contemporary feel or choose a preppy-inspired look for a sophisticated feel. A blazer can be paired with everything from a pencil dress to jeans and a t-shirt.

‍

The Y2K shoulder bag

‍
Although this trend is often labelled as ‘Y2K’, it also has a feel of the ‘90s to it. Shoulder bags are a staple that work with every outfit. You want a size that you can tuck under your arm, while still being able to carry all your essentials. Bottega Veneta has made us all fall back in love with a sculptural shoulder bag. Some of our favourite styles from the ‘90s and early 2000s are making a comeback. You can choose a muted shade for everyday wear or add a pop of colour with a pastel hue.

‍

A knit dress

‍
A modern icon is the knit dress. Do you love a cozy jumper? You can carry that love through to a knitted dress. What we love about this silhouette is that it sculpts your body and hugs your curves, while being as comfortable as your favourite winter sweater. It’s effortlessly chic and works for a day at the office or your next city break. You can think of a knit dress as the new little black dress.

‍

Minimalistic sneakers

‍
We’ve made it through the ‘ugly sneakers’ trend in one piece. Instead of falling for momentary trends, give your capsule closet the perfect base with a minimalistic white sneaker. Veja is one of the most popular sneaker brands of the moment, while you can invest in a designer pair from brands like Alexander McQueen or Gucci.

Your minimalistic sneakers are staples to take with you wherever you go. Look for a style that is low-maintenance and easy to care for. No one wants to be replacing their white sneakers every six months.

‍

An investment watch

‍
Along with a coat, another investment you need for your capsule closet is a timepiece. Instead of looking at it through the eyes of the latest trends, think of your timepiece as an heirloom. You don’t need to splash out on a Cartier or Omega piece but choose a style that will stand the test of time. A leather strap or stainless-steel face can be mixed and matched with any outfit in your capsule closet.

Are you a fan of capsule closets? Which of these essentials will you be investing in? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Capsule closets are all about finding your ‘ride or die’ pieces. The ultimate capsule closet is one that is full of essentials, go-tos, and versatile styles that work for any occasion. They’re a sustainable alternative to fast fashion and ideal for anyone who wants to make a long-term investment into their closet.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: Fashion looks, fashion outfits, TikTok fashion influencers, TikTik pfw
meta-description: We’re sharing what some of TikTok’s biggest fashion influencers have worn to recent fashion weeks.
meta-title: What TikTok Influencers Wore to Fashion Week
name: What TikTok Influencers Wore to Fashion Week
post-body:
A decade ago, bloggers were making their first appearance on the front rows of fashion week. Now, it’s the turn of the TikTokers to grace Fashion Week with their presence. As global celebrities, these influencers have a marketing power that can rival most celebrities.  It’s not usual to see influencers wearing entire outfits gifted by the brand whose show they are attending.

‍

‍

We’re sharing what some of TikTok’s biggest fashion influencers have worn to recent fashion weeks. It gives you an idea of their personal style and the brands that they work with. During Fashion Week, influencers want to grab the attention of the camera and boost their profile online and across the fashion industry.

Not only do these Fashion Week #OOTD give us a unique view into the world of influencers, but they also show us what trends are just around the corner. No one wants to rock up to Fashion Week wearing last season’s ‘it’ bag. Read on to get a peek into the world of Fashion Week.

‍

Leonie Hanne

‍
As one of the biggest fashion influencers on TikTok, Leonie is no strange to Fashion Week. She often appears at the shows of major luxury designers, including Louis Vuitton and Dior. This reel gives you a recap of her front row fashion week outfits. As expected, the influencer was dressed head-to-toe in clothes from each brand.

Her Fashion Week outfits included an oversized Christian Dior poncho dress, complete with mesh tote bag and white compact boots. At Prada, Leonie appeared in a strapless black top and green midi skirt with black combat boots and a bubblegum pink Prada nylon bag. She finished the Prada look off with one of the brand’s padded headbands.

‍

‍

At Balmain, Leonie opted for a minimalistic outfit focused on different beige hues, complete with a white top-handled Balmain bag. At Miu Miu, Leonie’s look was sleeker with head-to-toe black, blending masculinity with touches of femineity, including a statement black and silver buckle belt.

‍

Victoria @InTheFrow

‍
Not all Fashion Week looks are OTT and things you wouldn’t wear in everyday life. Victoria @InTheFrow shared one of her London Fashion Weeks looks on TikTok. She paired a colour blocked oversized jumper with black flared jeans and matching open-toe heels in a lime green to make the jumper pop. To bring in the pink of the jumper, Victoria carried one of her signature top handle Louis Vuitton bags, before finishing the look off with a tucked-in hairstyle and gold jewellery.

This Fashion Week look shows the power of streetwear looks and that sometimes the most wearable and everyday styles are the best.

‍

Tamara Kalinic

‍
If you want to get an insight into what Fashion Week is like from the point of view of an a-list influencer, check out Tamara Kalinic’s Paris Fashion Week recap video. She appears in an endless number of outfits, showing off a mixture of streetwear with minimalistic pantsuits and exciting cocktail dresses – complete with diamonds.

This video gives an interesting insight into how influencers alter their outfits for almost every show that they attend, often changing in their car on route to the next show. Influencers want to reflect the brand that they’re often representing by attending front row at fashion week.

‍

‍

A few of the must-have trends that you’ll spot in this video include Kamara’s plaid ‘clueless’ inspired two-piece skirt set, knee high boots, bold green heels, and a reimagined little black dress.

You can get another look at some of Tamara’s favourite Paris Fashion Week looks in this video. It shows her outfits for Louis Vuitton, Valentino, Acne, and Isabel Marnet. Each outfit reflects the current ethos and aesthetic of the brand. For most of these Fashion Week shows, Tamara is wearing head-to-toe looks by the brand.

What did fashion influencers wear to Fashion Week? For most of them, they’ll have been wearing outfits planned for them by the brand’s whose shows they were attending. These looks give us an interesting insight into what it’s like to attend Fashion Week as an influencer, as well as what trends to look out for.

Noah Beck

‍
Noah Beck is an unlikely TikTok star to have at Fashion Week. Noah first became famous on TikTok with his shirtless videos before becoming the darling of Paris Fashion Week. Attending Balmain’s Spring/Summer 2022 show, Beck wore a black shirt with white stripes, complete with tailored trousers and minimalistic black sneakers. He accessories his Balmain show look with a choker necklace, square framed sunglasses, and a black nylon tote bag.

Which of these influencer outfits was your favourite? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: We’re sharing what some of TikTok’s biggest fashion influencers have worn to recent fashion weeks. It gives you an idea of their personal style and the brands that they work with. During Fashion Week, influencers want to grab the attention of the camera and boost their profile online and across the fashion industry.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: indigo denim, indigo jeans, style, fashion
meta-description: For autumn/winter 2021, it’s all about darker denim. In fact, it’s everywhere you look.
meta-title: Indigo Denim Is Having a Comeback Moment
name: Indigo Denim Is Having a Comeback Moment
post-body:
If Bella Hadid is rocking it, you know it’s a trend. It’s time to go to the dark side and experiment with indigo denim. If you’ve been loyal to your whitewash jeans or classic blue denim, you might want to look away. For autumn/winter 2021, it’s all about darker denim. In fact, it’s everywhere you look.

‍
It’s not very often that the catwalks and high street stores are in unison on a trend. Usually, you’ll see the trend hit the runway months before it starts to pop up in stores. That’s where indigo denim is different. Almost every designer who does denim, along with high street and contemporary brands, are switching to indigo denim as their staple. The reign of whitewash and classic denim might be coming to an end.

‍

‍

The denim trend making a return to the catwalk

‍
One of the biggest philosophies of the fashion industry is that – eventually – everything comes back in style. Usually, it’s on a twenty-year cycle as the next generation discovers the trends that their parents enjoyed. It’s why ‘70s fashion is always making a comeback. Now, it’s the turn of Y2K fashion and blue indigo denim to have its moment.
‍

There’s no way of overestimating the power of the Y2K trend and how Gen Z are driving fashion trends on platforms like Instagram and TikTok. We can hardly go a week without a former Y2K trend making a comeback. After Gen Z cancelled skinny jeans and yoga pants, we’ve been waiting for them to make a ruling on the world of denim shades.
It’s finally here.

‍
Lightweight denim is out. Indigo denim is in.

‍

‍

How indigo became the biggest denim trend of 2021

‍
The attraction of indigo denim comes from its elevated aesthetic. It has a crisp and clean look, usually incorporating a proper hemline. You’ll rarely find indigo jeans with rips or holes. These are the jeans you would wear for a college lecture and then for drinks out with friends. If you’re a minimalistic or have a capsule closet, blue indigo will get you more bang for your buck than any other type of denim.

‍
It’s business casual with the right styling or your off-the-clock weekend look when you throw on a hoodie. You can style your blue indigo up for a special occasion or wear it to the office. No other denim has the versatility of blue indigo – that’s why we’re seeing it all over our Instagram feeds and the catwalk.

‍

‍
We got our first signs that indigo denim was making a comeback in the Autumn/Winter 2021 catwalk shows for Dior and Hermes. Molly Goddard even went on stepped further and added a knee-length turn-up for a ‘70s-inspired look.
‍

While we’ve been waiting for blue indigo denim to have its moment, we can finally look back on Destiny’s Child and Paris Hilton for our style inspiration. The most versatile styles are ones that incorporate a high waisted silhouette and a flared leg. While you can find dozens of styles on the high street, you can easily pick up a vintage pair of indigo jeans on Depop or eBay.

‍

What to look for when buying indigo denim

‍
After over 18 months of living in our activewear, we’re excited to finally be shopping for denim again. After so long, it’s good to have a refresher on what to look out for when buying indigo denim.

‍
When you’re buying new jeans, keep in mind that a more distressed denim means that it has gone through additional processing. It’s worth remembering that your denim will naturally fade and soften over time, especially if you buy an investment pair to wear for years. If you’re concerned about sustainability, it might be worth skipping on overly processed denim in favour for a more minimalistic style.

‍

‍
One benefit of indigo denim is that it’s more sustainable by its nature. Unlike light wash denim, indigo doesn’t undergo the same repeated washing and bleaching than paler colours do.  You can also look out for denim made with recycled or sustainable denim. After all, denim is one of the most damaging garments to the environment due to its high water use and carbon emissions.

‍
When it comes to updating your closet for autumn/winter 2021, don’t overlook the power of indigo denim. These jeans will see you through the season and beyond, whatever is on your social calendar. They’re the ultimate investment choice and the best way to get back into denim after living in athleisure.

‍
What do you think about indigo denim? Is it a hit or a miss? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: If Bella Hadid is rocking it, you know it’s a trend. It’s time to go to the dark side and experiment with indigo denim. If you’ve been loyal to your whitewash jeans or classic blue denim, you might want to look away. For autumn/winter 2021, it’s all about darker denim. In fact, it’s everywhere you look.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: Halloween Costume Ideas, TikTok halloween ideas, Halloween TikTok trends
meta-description: We’re rounding up our favourite TikTok Halloween costume ideas that everyone is talking about.
meta-title: The Ultimate Guide for TikTok Halloween Costume
name: The Ultimate Guide for TikTok Halloween Costume Ideas
post-body:
Welcome to spooky season! It’s the time of year when our favourite influencers are all over TikTok sharing their Halloween costume ideas. You don’t need to dress up as a sexy witch or spooky ghost when you have thousands of ideas to check out on TikTok. The #halloweencostume already has over 2 billion views and climbing on TikTok as the app comes together to celebrate the spookiest time of the year.

‍

‍

It’s not too late to get your hands on a must-have Halloween costume, make one of your own, or improvise with pieces that are already in your closet. After spending last Halloween indoors, we’re all ready to go out and party the night away on All Hollow’s Eve. Not sure what you’re wearing? We’re rounding up our favourite TikTok Halloween costume ideas that everyone is talking about.

‍

The Shining

‍
Are you looking for a group costume idea? Why not bring back one of the most popular Halloween films of all time with a Shining inspired group look? Ellie Addis has shared a series of looks inspired by the film’s main characters. You can recreate most of these looks with pieces you’ll already have in your closet or that you can borrow from a friend.

‍

Squid Game

‍
Not only is ‘Squid Game’ the most talked about Netflix shows of all time, but it’s also one of the easiest Halloween costumes. This tutorial shows you how to create a Squid Game inspired costume in just a few steps. It’s an easy and effortless DIY that is cheap, affordable, and instantly recognisable.

‍

Care Bears

‍
Throw it back to the ‘90s with your favourite Care Bear character. This Halloween costume idea is another one that you can recreate with staples that you already have in your closet. You’ll want to dig out your childhood Care Bear or pick up a new one to carry around so that everyone knows who you’re dressed as.

‍

Tinkerbell

‍
Halloween is the perfect time to bring back everyone’s favourite fairy. Tinkerbell is the ultimate Halloween look for anyone on the shorter side. All you need is a green dress, fairy wings, and a blonde wig that’s finished in a top knot. It’s effortlessly chic and instantly recognisable.
 

Zootopia Nick and Judy

‍
Couple costumes are some of the highlights of Halloween. They go viral every year and have us wishing we had thought of it earlier.  We love that this TikTok by @danielysse22 breaks down everything you’ll need to recreate the look, right now to the accessories and shoes. This is another look you can create almost entirely out of clothes you already own. Want something a little sexier? Check out this Mr & Mrs Smith look instead.

‍

The Power Trio Looks

‍
Girls over bros. If you don’t have a significant other to do a couples look, grab your two best friends instead. TikTok user @Ka$hi has put together the ultimate list of trio looks that every ‘90s kid would love. Whether you want keep it classic with PowerPuff Girls or go spooky with the Dimitrescu Sisters, trio looks always go down a treat.

‍

Space Cowboy

‍
If Kendall Jenner does it, you know it’s an iconic Halloween costume. The ‘space cowgirl’ is one of Kendall’s most recognisable Halloween looks of all time. It’s perfect for the girl who loves country music and wants a quirky and flirty look for spooky season. You can put your own twist on the look by changing up the accessories or re-create Kendall’s look from head to toe.

‍

The Lizzie McGuire Movie

‍
Another duo Halloween look that’s gone viral on TikTok takes its inspiration from the hit 2000s film, The Lizzie McGuire Movie. This look makes a reappearance almost every Halloween and it’s a firm favourite any ‘90s kid.  Don’t forget to finish off your look with a Britney style microphone.

‍

Lady Gagag in American Horror Story

‍
Lady Gaga is the Queen of glamorous Halloween looks. This TikTok takes its inspiration from Gaga’s time on American Horror Story. It’s elevated, sophisticated, and perfect for an upmarket Halloween party. All you need is a sleek blonde wing, faux fur scarf, and black opera gloves – complete with a statement ring. You can finish it off with a blood red lipstick and soft pencil winged eyeliner.

Which of these TikTok-favourite Halloween costumes will you be recreating this year? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: It’s not too late to get your hands on a must-have Halloween costume, make one of your own, or improvise with pieces that are already in your closet. After spending last Halloween indoors, we’re all ready to go out and party the night away on All Hollow’s Eve. Not sure what you’re wearing? We’re rounding up our favourite TikTok Halloween costume ideas that everyone is talking about.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: halloween makeup trends, halloween tiktok trends, tiktok makeup ides, tiktok makeup
meta-description: These are our favourite Halloween makeup trends courtesy of TikTok.
meta-title: The TikTok Halloween Makeup Trends
name: The TikTok Halloween Makeup Trends You Need to Know
