post-body:
When it comes to makeup inspiration, TikTok is in a league of its own. If you want daring makeup that will make you stand out from the crowd, TikTok is the place to go. All-year round the best of TikTok’s makeup artists and beauty influencers share their dramatic full-face looks. It’s like Halloween all year long. So once scary season came around, we knew TikTok was going to deliver with the ultimate Halloween makeup trends.

‍

‍

If you’re heading out to a nightclub or a friend’s Halloween party, these are the makeup looks that everyone will be talking about. Forget ‘hot girl summer’. It’s ‘hot girl Halloween’. If there’s any time of the year that you can go all-out with your makeup, it’s Halloween. These are our favourite Halloween makeup trends courtesy of TikTok.

‍

Simple Spiderweb Liner

‍
The #halloweenmakeup has over 3.6 billion views and climbing. Some of the most trending looks are also the most daring. They’re the ones that would require a full day sitting in front of your vanity. Not everyone has that time or wants to do a full face of makeup. Enter the simple spiderweb liner.

All you need is your favourite liquid eyeliner and a small eyeliner brush. This look is perfect with a pair of false lashes and works for any Halloween event.

‍

It’s Cruella

‍
We love Halloween makeup looks that jump on some of the biggest film releases of the year. Disney’s live action version of ‘Cruella’ with Emma Stone had us all wanting to dye our hair black and white. This Cruella-inspired makeup look is closer to the original film but with the glamour of this year’s release. It’s an ideal option for anyone who wants a full-face look without spending hours on their look.

‍

Haunting Butterflies

‍
Olivia Rodrigo has been the star of 2021. This Halloween makeup trends takes “she probably gives you butterflies” to a whole new level. Imagine a fairy Barbie meets Halloween chic. It’s the ultimate feminine look for a nightclub event if you’ve got your heart set on winning ‘best costume’ of the year. Don’t forget the opaque contacts and dramatic crown for a haunted look.

‍

Corpse Bride

‍
One of the most famous Halloween films is Corpse Bride, meaning we’re guaranteed to get Halloween looks inspired by the trend every year. This ‘Emily’ inspired look will get you serious points with the judges and let you put a Halloween twist on bridal chic. The butterflies are the standout piece in this makeup look, which is beginner friendly with elevated accessories taking it to the next level. Grab yourself a Victor to win the best Halloween couple of the year.

‍

Skeleton Queen

‍
Do you have a spare 10 hours? This iconic makeup look by @illumin_arty takes the cake for one of the best Halloween looks we’ve seen on TikTok. The elaborate head dress and realistic skull makeup give us Hollywood blockbuster vibes.

‍

Who is it?

‍
Not sure who you’re going to dress up as for Halloween? This makeup trend will have everyone asking you “who are you?”. It’s a clever tongue-in-cheek style that blends an intense smoky eye with sparkle, complete with question marks and intense icy blue highlighter. Add a tiara or kitten ears to show off your fun side.

‍

Cleo de Nile

‍
It’s not Halloween without a Cleopatra inspired makeup trend. This Halloween makeup look by @siananscrivner takes its inspiration from Monster’s High, giving us modern cartoon Cleopatra chic. You can recreate this makeup look with most of the products you’ll already have in your makeup bag – don’t forget the oversized gold jewellery and a long wig.

‍

Wednesday Addams

‍
When in doubt, go with Wednesday Addams. This makeup trend reminds us how much of an icon Wednesday Addams is. It’s one of the easiest Halloween makeup trends to recreate, complete with a costume that’s as simple as a little black dress, white collar, and a long black wig. This makeup look is beginner friendly and perfect for a last-minute Halloween look.

‍

Tears of blood

‍
Our final Halloween makeup trend is another eyeliner moment. While this TiktTok features several eyeliner options, we love the ‘tears of blood’ inspired look. It’s simple to recreate with a red liquid lipstick and your trusty liquid eyeliner. You don’t need to break the bank (or your makeup bag) to create a stunning Halloween look.

Which of these TikTok makeup trends will you be recreating for Halloween? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: If you’re heading out to a nightclub or a friend’s Halloween party, these are the makeup looks that everyone will be talking about. Forget ‘hot girl summer’. It’s ‘hot girl Halloween’. If there’s any time of the year that you can go all-out with your makeup, it’s Halloween. These are our favourite Halloween makeup trends courtesy of TikTok.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: nails, halloween nails, halloween beauty , Halloween nail ideas
meta-description: We’re rounding up the biggest Halloween nail trends that we’re seeing professional nail artists, celebrities, and influencers talking about.
meta-title: Say ‘Boo’ To the Halloween Nails
name: Say ‘Boo’ To the Halloween Nails Everyone Is Talking About
post-body:
October is here and it’s time to say ‘hello’ to spooky season. We like to think of as the start of the festive period. After all, as soon as Halloween is over, it’s all about Christmas. Halloween marks the start of party season and it’s a time to get creative with your beauty routine – including your nail art. Not everyone is a fan of getting dressed up and going for an adult version of trick and treating.

‍

‍
If you want a subtle way to celebrate the spooky season, we’ve got just the thing. Enter Halloween nail art. It might be the spookiest time of the year, but it’s also the time when nail artists let their creativity run wild. It’s all about impossibly long nails with blood red lacquer and shorter sets, complete with intricate detailing.

‍
Halloween is your chance to have fun with your nails, whether you’re doing them at home or treating yourself to a salon appointment. We’re rounding up the biggest Halloween nail trends that we’re seeing professional nail artists, celebrities, and influencers talking about. We’re also sharing out tips on how to maintain and get the most out of your Halloween manicure.

‍

The classic Halloween motifs

‍
When it comes to Halloween nails, there are some trends that never die. You’ll always see people asking for blood dripped cuticles, spide web accents, and the occasional fang-inspired look. The one thing that no one can doubt is that the two biggest nail shape trends are pointy and round, giving the illusion of longer nails.

‍
Blood drips have long been one of the most request styles for professional nail artists. If you want something Cardi B-inspired or a little more sparkly, ask about a Swarovski spider. If your nail artist offers embellishments, a crystal spider can help you steal the show at your Halloween party.

‍


Not sure where to start, go for blood—on your nails that is. “When it comes to my most highly requested design for Halloween, it’s definitely blood drips,” says California-based nail artist Laysa Cazares.  “I would say the top three that I get requests for are blood drips, spider webs, and Swarovski spiders. Black stilettos are definitely really in for Halloween as well but with the square shape becoming super popular I’ve had a lot more clients want square nails instead.”

‍

‍
Eye-catching designs are the biggest trend for Halloween every year. The more eye-catching, the better. You can stick with a classic theme of pumpkins or eyeballs, but you want to consider whether you’ll want to wear that style in the days after Halloween.

‍
Pumpkin is a more generic autumnal motif, but one that perfectly ties into the Halloween season. Don’t overlook the simplicity of pumpkin orange. It’s a shade that’s becoming even more popular for autumnal nails and it’s a great choice if you need a more professional and minimalistic look.

‍

‍

The simplicity of ombre nails

‍
Whether you want to keep your nails simple or go over the top, look out for deeper shades with a metallic finish. You want to choose a luxurious autumnal hue that you can wear after October 31st. If you’re planning on keeping your nails after Halloween, a dark ombre look is perfect for the season and works as a transitional style into the holiday season.

‍

‍
Creating an ombre nail is easier than you think. You can create the look at home using a makeup sponge. Start by applying color at the top of the sponge and layer it on a clear nail, working downwards until you create a gradient effect. It’s as easy as that!

‍
Another simple look that you can try is to play with negative space and turn classic styles on its head. Instead of a French manicure, swap out the white tip for a black hue instead. You’ll still get the elegant look, but with a spooky twist. If you’re a fan of black nail polish, you can all out with a minimalistic black manicure and a coffin nail shape.

‍

‍

The most popular Halloween nail shapes

‍
If you want to channel your inner witch or spooky Queen, it’s a good idea to opt for a stiletto shape manicure. Long nails are a must-have for Halloween. They’re glamorous, but also offer you more space for nail art and designs.  However, square space shapes are becoming more popular as people opt for a more minimalistic and fuss-free nail style.


What trends are you jumping on for your Halloween manicure? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Halloween is your chance to have fun with your nails, whether you’re doing them at home or treating yourself to a salon appointment. We’re rounding up the biggest Halloween nail trends that we’re seeing professional nail artists, celebrities, and influencers talking about. We’re also sharing out tips on how to maintain and get the most out of your Halloween manicure.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: sustainability in beauty industry, changes in beauty industry, eco-friendly, eco. green
meta-description: It’s obvious that we need to do more to tackle the plastic in our oceans. So, what are the main issues and how do we address them?
meta-title: How the Beauty Industry is Tackling the Plastic
name: Here’s How the Beauty Industry is Tackling the Plastic Problem for Our Oceans
post-body:
Plastic is a problem that we’re all aware of. Everyone is taking strives towards reducing their use of single use plastic. When was the last time you went into a coffee shop and got a plastic straw? Most of us carry around metal water bottles and have ditched plastic containers for glass alternatives.

When we think of products in our everyday life that rely on plastic, we often overlook the heavy reliance of the beauty industry on plastic. It’s the go-to material that they use for packaging, making the beauty industry a major contributor to the world’s plastic problems. It’s believed that 120 billion units of plastic packaging are made every year for the cosmetic industry internationally. Most of this is used to make multi-layered boxes and lids. The vast majority of this plastic is non-recyclable and ends up in landfills and our oceans.

‍

‍

Did you know that every year, around 11 million tonnes of plastics end up in our oceans? If we keep going on this trend, the world will end up with more plastic in our oceans than fish by the end of 2050. This stark warning from the United Nations should shock us all into action. Although people are becoming more conscious of their plastic usage and the impacts of using plastic, we’re not doing anywhere near enough to deal with the problem.

Unless we take sharp action and create a plan for sustained action, we can expect the number of plastic entering our ocean to nearly triple within the next 20 years. If this number is allowed to hit 29 million metric tons every year, there will be no going back.

We also can’t forget how much plastic is already in our oceans. It’s bad enough that you can see it from space. The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration have found that there are parts of our oceans where there are seven times more plastic in the water than fish. That 2050 statistic by the United Nations starts to look even more likely when you consider this.

‍

‍

While we were starting to make progress with single used plastic, the pandemic changed everything and threw us off course. Just imagine the impact of single-use PPE masks, the plastic used to make vaccines, and the reliance on online retailers that are notorious for their use of plastic packaging.

The ARC Centre of Excellence for Coral Reef Studies have found that corals which are effect by plastic are 90% more likely to be killed by a disease. Shockingly, plastic is having a knock-on effect on the male fish population. In an odd twist, it’s been found that plastic in our rivers have even been changing the gender of fish, causing some male fish to show feminine traits, including a reduction in their sperm quality.

While you might think this is a fun little fact for your next pop quiz, it has a knock-on effect for the food chain. Anchovies have been seen to be consuming microplastics – unable to tell the difference been plastic and food – before they’re eaten by bigger fish, which we then eat. Not only is the plastic ending up in our oceans, it’s finding its way back into our systems when we eat fish.

It’s obvious that we need to do more to tackle the plastic in our oceans. So, what are the main issues and how do we address them?

‍

The major issues with plastic in the beauty industry

‍
While your mind will instantly think of plastic packaging, some of the worst offenders are wet wipes and cotton buds – two products that almost everyone uses. Water UK have found that wet wipes, such as baby and makeup wipes, contain a plastic known as polypropylene. The issue with this material is that it doesn’t decompose. As a result, it’s around 90% of the material that is causing sewer blockages across the UK. Part of the issue is that people don’t know how to dispose of these wet wipes, even flushing them down the toilet.

Top of the agenda is to find a more sustainable and eco-friendlier product that we can use to clean our faces and remove makeup or dirt.

It’s worth reflecting on where we are and the changes that we’re already making. The so-called ‘Attenborough Affect’ has led to an impressive 53% decrease in consumer use of single-use plastic. 82% of these consumers are now more likely to purchase products with sustainable packaging.

The change that needs to happen in the beauty industry

‍

The first thing that we need to do is turn our thoughts into actions. Even though we’re becoming more aware of the consequences of using plastic, we’re not doing enough in our daily life to reduce plastic use. Saving our oceans will take small and proactive steps happening every day. You need to make smart choices that cumulate to make a difference to your routine. Something as simple as putting a recycling bin into your bathroom can be transformational step forward.

Political action is also important. Governments across the world are taking action to reduce the use of plastics, including banning microbeads and cotton buds. The issue with these specific items is that we only use them for a few minutes, before they end up in landfill and take hundreds of years to decompose. If you want to see change, lobby your local politicians to implement more guidance to regulate the use of plastic within the beauty industry.

It’s not just us who has to make changes – corporations have a role to play to. So far, there has been positive signs. The beauty industry was amongst the first to respond to the backlash over microbeads, with many choosing to cut it out of their formulas before the ban came into force.

The industry must use the same force that they used to tackle the microbead issue to reduce their plastic use with refillable and reusable alternatives. A number of products – such as soaps – can even go ‘naked’ without any unnecessary packaging. Recycling isn’t enough. We need to be cutting down our plastic use entirely.

‍
post-summary: Plastic is a problem that we’re all aware of. Everyone is taking strives towards reducing their use of single use plastic. When was the last time you went into a coffee shop and got a plastic straw? Most of us carry around metal water bottles and have ditched plastic containers for glass alternatives.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: nude lipsticks, nude lips, nude, makeup
meta-description: Are you looking for inspiration on which nude lipsticks are worth the money? There are some shades that are as famous as the brands that have made them.
meta-title: The best-selling nude lipsticks
name: The best-selling nude lipsticks
post-body:
Are you looking for inspiration on which nude lipsticks are worth the money? There are some shades that are as famous as the brands that have made them. MAC Cosmetics’ ‘Velvet Teddy’ lipstick was the one that every Youtuber and influencer was wearing in the early days of social media. It’s popularity means its still one of the most famous nude lipstick shades of all time.

‍

‍

A relative newcomer to the world of nude lipstick is Charlotte Tilbury’s signature ‘Pillow Talk’ lipstick. The shade is so popular that it’s even inspired an entirely collection of lipstick products, blush, and eyeshadows to complement it. It’s a supermodel-approved lipstick shade with a light pink hue and a classic matte formula.

‍

‍

Are you looking for a more neutral nude lipstick that isn’t pink? Check out the ‘Artist Rouge Lipstick’ range by Make Up For Ever. It has a hazel beige shade that offers a creamy consistency for a high impact finish. You can use the precision bullet for an easier application to prevent overlining.

‍

‍

One of our favourite nude lipsticks is the ‘Lip Chic’ by Chantecaille. It has a comfortable formula that is easy to apply, adding an even shine to your lips without leaving any sticky residue behind. This lipstick helps give the illusion of fuller and more youthful lips. It’s made in Italy using a nourishing formula that won’t irritate your lips. You get the shine of a gloss with the coverage of a lipstick.

‍

‍

La Bouche Rouge’s ‘Nude Brown’ lipstick is perfect for those looking for a darker nude. 97% of the ingredients are natural, with a serum formula that works to protect your lips for premature aging, using seaweed that is harvested by hand in France. One of our favourite things about this lipstick is that it comes with a refillable case, with the lipstick sold as a separate eco-refill when you’re finish with the bullet. The began formula is made without beeswax and is cruelty-free. This cold brown nude gives you a satin finish for an elevated look.

‍

If you’re looking for a nude shade to work with a darker skin tone, check out the ‘Deborah’ lipstick by Nars. It has a muted chestnut look with warm undertones. You get full-coverage for all-day wear and a hydrating formula with shea butter for extra moisture.

Huda Beauty is famous for their nude lipstick shades that give you an ultimate colour payoff without being uncomfortable. Their ‘Power Bullet Matte Lipstick’ range has several nude tones for you to choose from. These lipsticks are famous for their pigmentation and matte finish that incorporates almond oil to prevent drying.

‍

‍

Feel like being boujee? Check out the Gucci ‘Rouge a Levres’ satin lipsticks. Their ‘Painted Veil’ shade is one of the most perfect nudes that we’ve seen in a long time. It offers a comfortable feel with a lightweight consistency and long-lasting coverage.  It’s gold tube adds an extra layer of luxury for any makeup aficionado.

‍

Speaking of luxury. Nothing can beat the feeling of a Tom Ford lipstick. They’re saturated, long-lasting, and creamy. It’s everything you need in a nude lipstick and more. Their ‘Indian Rose’ shade works for almost every skin tone.

Another lipstick worth considering is the newest collection by Bare Minerals. They’ve taken the fan-favourite lipstick and the first mineral-infused vegan formula to hit the market. It’s just what you need to add positive energy and affirmations into your makeup routine.

Are you someone who wants precision with their lipstick? Why not try a crayon instead of a lipstick? The Bite Beauty creamy matte lip crayon is an all-in-one liner and lipstick that gives you a nude lip in just one swipe. The formula contains hydrating ingredients like wild African mango and pomegranate oil for all-day wear.

When in doubt, go with a classic. Estee Lauder is one of the most recognisable beauty brands in the world and is still in a league of its own. Their ‘Intense Nude’ shade is one of their best-selling lipsticks and work to enhance the natural colour of your lips while offering shape and definition.

What is your favourite nude lipstick? We would love to hear about them in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Are you looking for inspiration on which nude lipsticks are worth the money? There are some shades that are as famous as the brands that have made them. MAC Cosmetics’ ‘Velvet Teddy’ lipstick was the one that every Youtuber and influencer was wearing in the early days of social media. It’s popularity means its still one of the most famous nude lipstick shades of all time.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: soft glam makeup, makeup trend, soft makeup
meta-description: We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves.
meta-title: How to Do Soft Glam Makeup
name: How to Do Soft Glam Makeup
post-body:
We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves. If you’re thinking of experimenting with the trend, make sure to bookmark this page to use as your tutorial for the next time you’re doing your makeup.

‍

Prep your skin for a healthy glow

‍
If there’s one thing that all trends have in common right now, it’s focusing on prepping your skin before applying makeup. Soft glam is all about radiant skin, meaning you want to take the time to give your skin the TLC that it deserves. Having good skin is half the battle to create a soft glam look.

‍
Make sure that you’ve cleansed, toned, and moisturised your face before you start applying your makeup routine. You want to ensure your skin is clean and hydrated so that it can absorb the makeup products into your skin and keep an even texture and smooth skin tone.

‍

‍
You might decide to use a primer to diminish the appearance of your pores for a more polished look and to help your base products last all day long. If you have skin that’s oily or prone to irritation, adding a primer can be a gamechanger for your routine. It’ll form a layer between your skin and makeup products, preventing it from sinking into your pores and causing breakouts and worse, if you start to sweat the makeup away.

‍
If you’re doing a soft glam look for a special occasion, you’ll want to take the time to invest in using a primer to keep your makeup in place all day long.

‍

Use the right makeup tools

‍
You don’t need to break the bank with designer makeup to create a soft glam look. What you do want to invest in is your tools and makeup brushes. It might be tempting to buy low-quality brushes, but they’re often impossible to blend with and leave your makeup looking streaky.

‍
It’s time to do an audit of your makeup tools and make sure that you have everything you need to create the soft glam look. One tool you’ll need is a sponge or beauty blender to help apply your liquid or cream products. It’s a must-have for applying concealer to give you a natural finish, while covering blemishes and dark circles. A beauty sponge can be used on the more delicate areas of your skin, including under your eyes for treating dark circles.

‍
When in doubt, try using your fingers to blend out the product for a seamless finish. The heat of your fingers can often do the trick to help the pigment blend together.

‍

Make sure to set your face after each step

‍
You want to make sure that you’re setting you’re your makeup as you go along. If you have naturally oily skin, this can cause your ‘radiant’ glow to end up looking more like a glitter ball. You want to make sure that you set your makeup as you go along without losing the radiance and shine in your skin.

‍
The easiest way of setting your makeup is by using a translucent powder and gently dusting it over the targeted areas of your skin – such as your t-zone – using a large fluffy brush.

‍

Choose soft colours

‍
As the name suggests, ‘soft glam’ is all about using soft and feminine colours that help add a glow to your skin. The beauty of soft glam is in its simplicity and the hues that help to make your face glow. You want to stay firmly away from bright colours or anything too dark. You also want to avoid a darker or harsh contour. You can even use a foundation one or two shades darker than your everyday colour to get a more natural look that is softer when blended.

‍
If you want to add a pop of colour to your makeup look, focus it either on your eyes or lips – without overpowering your makeup.

‍

Setting spray

‍
If there’s one tip that you take way from this article, let it be this one. You want to make sure you’re using a setting spray to help finish off your soft glam look and hold it in place. A good setting spray will help merge the layers of your makeup and seal in the finish product to stop it sweating or melting off your skin throughout the day.

‍

Be patient

‍
Like we said before, doing soft glam can be difficult. It’s all about mastering the techniques and using a precise hand and a lightweight application to target the right products to your features. You might find that you’re spending more time blending or doing your makeup in general. With practice and patience, you’ll be able to do soft glam makeup with your eyes closed.

‍
What do you think of soft glam makeup? Is it a trend that you want to try? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves. If you’re thinking of experimenting with the trend, make sure to bookmark this page to use as your tutorial for the next time you’re doing your makeup.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: navy blue eyeliner, blue makeup, navy makeup trend, makeup trend
meta-description: We’re taking a look at the navy blue eyeliner trend to help you determine if it’s the right one for you.
meta-title: Classic Black VS Navy Blue Eyeliner
name: The Makeup Battle Between Classic Black and Navy Blue Eyeliner
post-body:
Are you getting tired of your makeup routine and want to try something new? Most of us fall into the routine of applying the same makeup products every single day. You probably don’t want to go too far out of your comfort zone, but still want to make a change. If that sounds like you, we may have just the trick!

‍
Navy blue is the new black.

‍
Okay, it’s a statement we hear a lot. First it was ‘pink is the new black’ then ‘orange is the new black’ and now this. It’s time to swap your classic black eyeline for a navy blue shade.

‍

‍

While it might seem unconventional at first, we promise there is a method behind our madness. Just think of your closet. You’ll have a little black dress hanging next to a pair of navy blue jeans. Both are just as classic and versatile as each other. When you think of timelessness and sophistication – black and navy blue are on equal footing.

‍
This navy blue eyeliner trend hasn’t come out of nowhere. Thanks to the pandemic, we’re all shifting our focus to our eye makeup routine, looking for ways to inject a subtle amount of colour and change up our look without going too wild. Wearing a face mask means that our eye makeup is even more important than ever before.

‍
We’re taking a look at the navy blue eyeliner trend to help you determine if it’s the right one for you. Spoiler alert: It’s universally flattering, easy to use, and will help your eyes pop.

‍

‍

Navy blue eyeliner on the runway

‍
We’re used to looking at the runways for the latest fashion trends, but have you ever thought of looking there for the up and coming beauty trends? Designers put just as much thought into the makeup their models wear as their set presentation. We saw the phenomena of navy blue eyeliner at several runway collections for luxury designer brands.

‍
It’s interesting that both the brands we’re about to mention have their own luxury makeup lines, which they promote during their runway shows. If you need a sign that navy eyeliner is the next big thing – this is it.

‍
Chanel sent its models down the catwalk wearing black winged eyeliner that had an unexpected twist with a low flick of navy blue shadow. While it’s not exactly an everyday navy blue eyeliner look, you can see the influencer of the trend. The navy blue added a lighter hue of colour that wasn’t as harsh against the skin.
If Chanel is doing it, you know it’s a trend.

‍

‍
Over at Dior, the resident makeup artist Peter Philips was using a different twist on the navy blue and black colour combination. He accentuated the model’s gaze by using lines of cool midnight blue that added both softness and density to the look. This idea perfectly encapsulates why we like navy blue. It’s equal part soft and daring. There’s no denying that black eyeliner shades can often be too harsh, with navy blue representing a softer alternative that gives you a similar aesthetic but with a softer tone.

‍
Do you want to steal the Dior look and channel your inner Cara Delevingne? Pick up the  ‘5 Couleurs Couture Eyeshadow Palette’ by Dior in the name ‘Denim’. While the five colours are inspired by the shades and textures of blue jeans, it’s the dark indigo shadow that you want to use for this look.

‍

Wearing blue navy eyeliner in everyday life

‍
Okay, raise your hands if you’ve created a ‘zoom makeup’ routine. So, all of us then? Black eyeliner can give you the illusion of panda eyes if you apply it with a heavy hand. Using a blue navy shade instead will give you the same defined look without risking a bad lighting situation making it look like you’ve been crying.

‍
Celebrity makeup artist Tasha Reiko Brown, who works with the likes of Alicia Keys, sweats by using a smudged navy blue eyeliner to create a Zoom makeup look. The makeup artist uses Chanel’s ‘Marine’ stylo yeux pencil to create the subtle but distinctive definition. Wearing navy blue instead of black gives your makeup look a modern twist and a subtle pop of colour that isn’t overwhelming. If you want to keep your look clean and sophisticated, but with a ‘cool’ factor to it – just swap out black for navy blue.

‍
What we love about this beauty trend is that it doesn’t involve changing how you apply your eyeliner. Not everyone wants to get as adventurous as a reverse cat eyeliner look. All you have to do is switch out to the navy blue shade of your favourite eyeliner. Most brands will offer it as an alternative shade to classic black, especially as more pastel and bold shades becoming popular amongst beauty influencers.

Finding the right shade of navy blue for your makeup

‍
The only challenge you’ll face with this trend is finding the right navy blue shade for you. The good news is that almost every hue is universally flattering, so it’s a case of choosing a shade that works for your mood and personality. Navy blue is a more common eyeliner shade than you might expect, meaning that you have plenty of options to choose from when it comes to the finish and hue of your navy blue eyeliner.

‍
If you want something bolder and daring, look for a navy blue eyeliner that is bolder in its hue with a metallic finish. This style of eyeliner can help elevate your eye look without going too far out of your comfort zone. It’s also an easy way to carry the trend through to the holiday season or to wear it for a special occasion.

‍
If you want something that is both classic and contemporary, keep an eye out for a deeper and richer shade of navy blue.

‍

‍
Whatever shade of navy blue you choose, you want to use it with lighter eyeshadow shades that help the richer tone of your navy to stand out and be the star of the show. If you’re wearing navy blue eyeliner, you want everyone to know you’re wearing it. Why be different if you don’t stand out?

‍
One of our favourite ways to wear navy blue eyeliner is with a natural makeup look, nude lipstick, and a light pink bush to let the eyeliner do all the talking.

‍
Navy blue eyeliner adds an instant layer of chic to your look. It’s what Blair Waldorf would wear if she was a beauty influencer. We think this shade is also the perfect transitional hue if you’ve been wearing pastel eyeliner through the summer. There are dozens of navy blue eyeliners available, whether you’ve got the budget for Chanel or NYX.

‍
What do you think of the navy blue eyeliner trend? Wil you be swapping out your black eyeliner for it? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary:
Are you getting tired of your makeup routine and want to try something new? Most of us fall into the routine of applying the same makeup products every single day. You probably don’t want to go too far out of your comfort zone, but still want to make a change. If that sounds like you, we may have just the trick!
Navy blue is the new black.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: tiktok bronze hack, bronzer, make up, TikTok beauty
meta-description: We’re telling you everything that you need to know about the TikTok beauty hack and the latest contouring and bronzing trends.
meta-title: The Only TikTok Bronze Hack That You Need to Know
name: The Only TikTok Bronze Hack That You Need to Know
post-body:
Does anyone else struggle with their bronzer? Raise your hand!

‍
While we love the sculpted look that it gives us, bronzing and contour are one part of our makeup routine that we’ve come to dread. You want to create a look that is sculpting but natural. It can be a difficult balancing act. Now thanks to TikTok, we’ve finally got the makeup hack that we’ve been waiting for.

‍
This one-step hack is everything we’ve ever needed. Whether you’re a newbie to the beauty scene or want to touch-up on your skills, this bronzing hack is one that you need to know. What did we ever do before TikTok?

‍

‍
We’re telling you everything that you need to know about the TikTok beauty hack and the latest contouring and bronzing trends. Spoiler alert: it’s all about natural-looking contour for a sun-kissed and dewy glow.

‍
Make sure to bookmark this article so that you can come back to it the next time you’re using bronzer!

‍

The art of contouring

‍
It’s no secret that contouring is notoriously one of the hardest makeup skills to perfect. If you take too much powder onto your brush, it can quickly go from a sculpted look to as though you’re wearing too much fake tan. All it takes is a split second on your brush to mess up your look.

‍
It’s why we’ve long thought of contouring as an art form. Celebrities like Kim Kardashian were pivotal at bringing around the revolution of contouring. Do you remember before the pandemic when chiselled contouring was a must-have part of your look? We all made mistakes along the way, whether it was not blending properly or using a bronzer that was a shade too dark.

‍

‍
Like most beauty trends, the pandemic has seen us all tone down our contouring. Instead of the chiselled look of the past, trends are pointing towards a more natural look. You don’t want your contour to dominate your face or make it appear as though you’ve gone to down with your powder. Instead, your contour should accentuate your natural features and help lift and sculpt your face.

‍
Bronzer is about creating the illusion of a slimmer face with a healthy glow and definition. We can’t deny that we’re glad to see this trend change. If you remember the old days of contouring, you’ll know how many hours were spent in front of a mirror trying to perfect the art of the Kardashian contour.

‍
You can be forgiven for thinking that only a professional could get you that seamless look. Contouring isn’t easy but this more natural contouring trend can be achieved in just one swipe.

‍

The essentials of contouring that everyone needs to know

‍
As much as we want to look like a chiselled goddess every day, contouring takes time. As skinimalism comes to dominate beauty trends, contouring has been the latest makeup step to be pulled back to the bare necessities.


Before we can talk about this TikTok hack, it’s worth pointing out the basics about contouring that have never changed. Just like your blush, the placement of your bronzer is the most important step. If you put your bronzer in the wrong place, it can change the shape and appearance of your face. You also want to make sure you blend your bronzer to get rid of any muddy streaks or obvious lines that ruin the illusion of naturally sculpted cheeks.

‍
It’s worth going back to basics and thinking about these two things before jumping into the TikTok hack. You’ll want to consider them regardless of what style of contouring or makeup hack you’re using.

‍

The TikTok contouring hack that you need to know

‍
Thanks to TikTok user @glamzilla, we have a newer and quicker way of contouring. It’s a gamechanger that your makeup routine will love. Nicknamed the ‘one fluid motion bronzer’, this hack focuses around applying your bronzer in just one brush stroke to give you a contoured look in seconds.

‍
All you need for this makeup hack is a cream contour or bronzer (avoid powder as it won’t blend as easily) and a medium-sized makeup brush for your face. These are staples that you likely already have in your makeup bag or vanity. If you don’t, they’re the perfect investment pieces and a must-have for anyone who does their makeup regularly.

‍
During the makeup hack, the TikTok user talks about how she loves to find easy makeup hacks that allow you to create a look with just one fluid motion of your hand.

‍

‍
To create the one motion look, you need to load your medium-size face brush up with cream bronzer. Place the brush at the outside corner of your eye, travelling along your brow bone, before going down one side of your nose, quickly followed by going up the other side. Carry on applying your bronzer in one fluid motion over your other brow bone, travelling down your cheek, along your jaw, up your opposite cheek, before crossing your forehead and finishing at your temples.

‍
While that might sound complicated, it’s essentially taking the classic ‘3’ shape trick that most people use and re-creates it on both sides of your face in one fluid motion. It’s the perfect makeup hack to use when you’re on the go or in a rush out the door. Trust us. It’s not as complicated as it sounds.

‍
You might think that this makeup hack would only give you a subtle contouring look. In reality, you get an impressive bronze glow and sculpted look in just one brush motion. It’s one of the most satisfying makeup hacks that we’ve found in years and so easy to do. Whether you’re a beginner or a professional makeup artist, this TikTok beauty hack can be a gamechanger for your routine.

‍

Other things to consider with this TikTok beauty hack

‍
One thing to consider when trying this TikTok beauty hack is whether you want to apply it under or above your foundation. You can experiment with one of the other major TikTok beauty trends by trying ‘reverse’ makeup. It involves applying your contour, highlighter, and blush first before adding a liquid foundation and blending everything together. As this trend calls for a cream bronzer, you can try both at once!

‍
If you want the most natural and seamless look possible, it’s worth investing in a primer and applying it onto your skin first to help your bronzing brush move across your skin for a fluid motion.

‍

‍
You can apply your foundation after doing your cream bronzer, focusing the coverage on the areas inside the line of your bronzer. Don’t forget to blend everything together to give you the most natural look possible. Blending is essential to prevent any streaks or smudges getting left behind on your skin.

‍
As the beauty industry looks for ways to cut down on the number of products we’re using and how long we spend in front of a mirror, this trend looks like it’s here to stay. It’s the latest in easy-contouring trends that focus on giving you the illusion of a healthy glow without caking your face with powder.

‍
We think this TikTok hack is one that everyone should try and experiment with. It’s a time-saver that’s just made our everyday makeup routine even easier.

‍
What do you think about this TikTok makeup hack? Will you be a gamechanger for your everyday makeup routine? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Does anyone else struggle with their bronzer? Raise your hand! While we love the sculpted look that it gives us, bronzing and contour are one part of our makeup routine that we’ve come to dread. You want to create a look that is sculpting but natural. It can be a difficult balancing act. Now thanks to TikTok, we’ve finally got the makeup hack that we’ve been waiting for.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: cooper hair colore, hair colore ,red hair, hair trend
meta-description: One reason why we’re loving the copper hair trend is because every celebrity is jumping on it this season.
meta-title: Why copper hair is back as a trend
name: Why copper hair is back as a trend
post-body:
One reason why we’re loving the copper hair trend is because every celebrity is jumping on it this season. Every time we open TikTok or Instagram, it seems like someone else has changed up their look with a vibrant red shade.

Pretty Little Liars’ actress Ashley Benson is one of the latest celebrities to switch her signature blonde hair out for a dazzling copper hue instead. She debuted her new look on Instagram with the help of Anthony Holguin, a celebrity hair stylist. Copper isn’t the first hair trend that Benson has jumped on. The actress has experimented with everything from pink to brunette in the past, always going back to her OG blonde.

‍
Benson captioned her Instagram picture with, “always wanted to be a redhead”.

‍
The feeling’s mutual Ashley!

‍

‍
It’s not just celebrities who are rocking the copper hair trend, we’re seeing it all over the silver screen with fictional characters. Some of the biggest shows of the moment have put copper hair front and centre, giving classic blonde a run for its money.

‍
Bridgerton – arguably the biggest show since Game of Thrones – featured its lead actress, Phoebe Dynevor as Daphne Bridgerton in a signature copper red hair. While the actress went back to her classic blonde hair after filming, she’s once again dyed her hair to the familiar shade of fiery red for season two of the hit Netflix show. You can expect to see plenty of women gong into salons with pictures of Daphne Bridgerton as their hair muse.

‍

‍

‍
Other TV shows that have featured a red head lead include the Marvel TV series ‘WandaVision’. The main character of Wanda Maximoff brought back her glossy red locks for most of the show, with rich hues that make us want to recreate the colour at home.

‍

‍
Another Netflix show with a redhead for the lead was ‘The Queen’s Gambit’. Anya Taylor-Joy swapped her blonde locks for copper hair to reflect Beth Harmon’s fiery personality. Although the character was a brunette in the book version, the production team decided to make her a red head. We think it’s a decision that spearheaded the revival of copper red as a hair trend. Even Gigi Hadid has said it was one of the reasons behind her decision to go red.

‍

Why copper hair is back as a trend

‍
It’s not only nostalgia for ‘90s trends and films that are driving the return to copper as one of the must-have hair colours. Red represents a new beginning and it’s a way of helping you stand out from the crowd. There’s a reason why one of the most popular transitions is from blonde to copper. Around 2% of the population has red hair naturally, making copper hair an instant way to make a statement.

‍

‍
There has always been a romanticism with red hair. In the 19th-century, women were painted with red hair to give the idea of independence, selfhood, and identity. If you heard stories as a child, the chances are that the female heroine had red hair. Just think of Ariel – one of Disney’s most popular characters – and her signature bold red locks

‍

What do know before dying your hair copper

‍
You want to consider the maintenance that comes with a red-toned hair colour. It’s not as fuss-free as you might think. You can expect to go back to your salon every 6-8 weeks for a maintenance appointment to top-up the colour. You’ll need to re-dye your hair around the same time if you’re doing it at-home with a box dye.

‍
Between appointments, you’ll want to be using hydrating conditioners and shampoos to help keep your hair protected and maintain its natural shine. Depending on how picky you are, you may even want to invest in weekly touch-ups at the roots or base of your hair to keep its copper hue.

‍

‍
One thing that’s worth keeping in mind is that copper will fade quicker than other popular and trending hair colours. It’s always best to go to see a professional so that they can help you find a copper pigment that you like and that will last a decent amount of time. You don’t want to be unnecessarily dying your hair. You want to make sure you’re using haircare products that are tailored to coloured hair to prevent damage and keep it protected.

‍
What do you think of the copper hair trend? Are you ready to give the shade a go? Tell us your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: One reason why we’re loving the copper hair trend is because every celebrity is jumping on it this season. Every time we open TikTok or Instagram, it seems like someone else has changed up their look with a vibrant red shade.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: ponytail, hair, brushing, hair trend
meta-description: We’re sharing everything you need to know about the XXL ponytail trend, including how to create it at home for a seamless look.
meta-title: Meet the XXL Ponytail Hair
name: Meet the XXL Ponytail Hair That Will Make You Feel Like Ariana Grande
post-body:
Go big or go home. It’s a motto some people live by. Whether you subscribe the philosophy or not, there’s one area where we can all agree it’s true – your hair. With ‘80s and 2000s trends making a comeback, we’re all ready to add extra volume to our hair. The XXL ponytail look is all over social media, but it’s one that most of us are familiar with.

‍
This super-high ponytail has been the signature look of popstar Arian Grande since she appeared on the music scene. Updos are leading the way in hair trends for their effortless chicness and low-maintenance. All you have to do is secure in place with a few bobby pins and hairspray, then you’re ready to go.

‍

‍
Searches on Google and Pinterest for updos have soared over the fall as everyone’s been looking for easy-to-create hair looks that go seamlessly from day to night. If you’re thinking of experimenting with an updo, go big or go home.

‍
Just like fashion trends, beauty trends are becoming more casual and laidback. Most of the updos we would usually wear are more elevated – like an elegant braid or a complicated chignon. What we love about an XXL ponytail is that it’s both laidback and glamorous. Thanks Ariana!

‍

‍
While this hair trend is everywhere this season, it’s the perfect one to experiment with before the holiday season. It can take you from a day at work or college to an evening out with friends.

‍
We’re sharing everything you need to know about the XXL ponytail trend, including how to create it at home for a seamless look.

‍

‍

Can anyone wear an XXL ponytail?

‍
Don’t worry. You don’t need to have Ariana Grande’s hair to take part in this trend. It’s easy to assume that you need Rapunzel-length hair to be able to create such a high ponytail, but the reality is different. Like most things in life, it’s all an illusion.

‍
You can steal Ariana’s best-kept secret and use two stacked ponytails – a higher and mid-length one – to give the illusion of more length to the ends of your hair. As long as your hair goes beyond your shoulders, you can give this trend a try.

‍

‍
Extensions are another option if you have short hair or want an extravagant XXL ponytail for a special occasion. It’s much quicker than having to wait for your natural hair to grow. The easiest way to incorporate hair extensions is to use Ariana’s trick of two ponytails, adding the extensions to the lower ponytail.

‍
You can hide the top of your extensions by taking a small section of your hair and wrapping it around the base of your ponytail for a seamless look.

‍
Whether it’s with extensions or your natural hair, creating an XXL ponytail is easier than you think.

‍

How to add volume to your XXL ponytail

‍
The number one tip for getting an ultra-high and sleek ponytail is to flip your head upside down. Gather the hair at the top of your head, as high as possible, using one hand to hold your ponytail while the other smooths out any bumps. It’s essential that you get your hair as smooth as possible, otherwise you’ll need to start all over again.

‍
Hold your hair tightly for a snatched look before adding your ponytail, tightening it as you go. You can add extra height to your ponytail by adding a second hair band half an inch above the first one to help add to the height illusion.

‍
post-summary: Go big or go home. It’s a motto some people live by. Whether you subscribe the philosophy or not, there’s one area where we can all agree it’s true – your hair. With ‘80s and 2000s trends making a comeback, we’re all ready to add extra volume to our hair. The XXL ponytail look is all over social media, but it’s one that most of us are familiar with.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: Gen Z, instagram, follow, gen Z inspire, power list
meta-description: They’re the people we follow on social media and whose journeys we’re privileged to be a part of.
meta-title: Gen-Zers who inspire us everyday
name: Gen-Zers who inspire us everyday
post-body:
This guide only highlights 6 of the thousands of Gen-Zers who inspire us everyday. They’re the people we follow on social media and whose journeys we’re privileged to be a part of. These inspiring individuals show that you’re never too young to make a difference and that change more often than not comes from the young.

‍
Read on to find out more about these inspiring individuals and how you can follow their journey on social media. With these Gen-Zers, the future looks bright.

‍

Maya Ghazal

‍
Maya was the first female Syrian refugee to become a pilot. After arriving in the UK in 2015, Maya has been advocating for the rights of refugees and even taught herself English. She’s recently been appointed to the role of Goodwill Ambassador for the UNCHR – focusing on supporting refugees.

‍
You can follow Maya’s journey, her work with the UN, and her life as a pilot and engineer on Instagram.

‍

Kenya Shania

‍
Can we have a moment to appreciate Kenya? They’re a non-binary blogger, writing, and supermodel. We love seeing their beautiful outfits appear on our Instagram feed. Their podcast ‘Level with Shania’ is all about teaching the art of self-awareness and self-acceptance, while tackling societal issues like gender norms.

‍
If you’re looking for a new podcast to binge-listen to, we can’t remember this one highly enough! Follow their Instagram to stay up to date with all things Kenya.

‍

Grete Henriette

‍
When you want to find the change-makers in a generation, look at the fashion industry. Grete is a London-based fashion designer that creates 16th-century inspired outfits that are designed for queer bodies. She skilfully blends the recognisable aesthetic of the era with a futuristic twist, while pushing the fashion industry to become more inclusive.

‍
Most of her designs incorporate upholstery material, while she borrows jewellery from her friends to create regal-worthy looks. Grete’s goal is to tackle the stigma associated with queerness within the fashion industry by creating a safe space for trans and non-binary people.

‍

Honey Ross

‍
You may know her as the daughter of celebrity Jonathan Ross, but Honey has a profile all of her own. As a body positive activist, she’s also a writer and model who uses her social media platform to promote inclusivity and acceptance of all body types. As part of her work, Honey co-founded ‘Pink Protest’ a platform that focuses on campaigning for free period products and ending the practice of FGM. She’s also the co-host of the podcast ‘Body Protest’, examining the relationship we all have with ourselves.

‍
You can follow the adventures of Honey – and her cat Maura – on her Instagram.

‍

Zendaya

‍
No power list is complete without a celebrity mention. Zendaya is one Hollywood star who isn’t afraid to be vocal about her work. While she doesn’t call herself an activist, Zendaya has spoken candidly about issues around colourism and black actors in Hollywood. She’s taken a stood against cultural appropriation and has been known to turn down roles that she believed belong to actors with a darker skin tone.

‍
Whether you’re a fan of her ethos or her movies, Zendaya is one of our favourite celebrities to follow on Instagram.

‍

Yaz Demand

‍
Yaz is an icon within the black trans community, using her platform on TikTok to talk about her experience as a black trans woman. She focuses on “giving trans goddess realness”, while not being afraid to talk about her experience of transitioning. Yaz has covered topics such as dating and calling out transphobic behaviour.

‍
She has almost 290k followers on TikTok with over 11.8 million likes. Yaz deserves a spot on your FYP page or Instagram feed.

‍
Who would you put on your Gen Z power list? Is there anyone we missed? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: This guide only highlights 6 of the thousands of Gen-Zers who inspire us everyday. They’re the people we follow on social media and whose journeys we’re privileged to be a part of. These inspiring individuals show that you’re never too young to make a difference and that change more often than not comes from the young.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: eye make up, reverse cat eye, trend make up
meta-description: We’re taking a look at Cat Eye recent TikTok beauty trend, showing you how to recreate it at home and which products you’ll need to use.
meta-title: Meet the Reverse Cat Eye Trend
name: Meet the Reverse Cat Eye Trend That Will Upgrade Your Eyeliner Game
post-body:
Changing up your makeup routine doesn’t mean that you have to go outside your comfort zone. Some of the best makeup trends are the ones that do things in reverse. We’re already seeing this style of trend all over social media, including putting your base products on in reverse order. What we love about reverse beauty trends is that they’re not crazy but make a subtle change that can transform your look and give it a chic finish.

Meet the reverse cat eye.

‍

‍

It’s the latest in unexpected but simple beauty trends that are taking social media by storm. If you can apply a traditional eyeliner look, you can do a reverse cat eye shape. You get the appearance of a regular winged eyeliner look, simply inverting it to make your lower lash line the centre of attention instead of the corner of your eye.

This eyeliner trend is the perfect way to add an instantly sultry twist to your look with a seductive feline shape that is universally flattering. If you’re a fan of smoky eyeshadow looks, this trend is for you.

‍

‍

Out of all the recent TikTok trends, none of them have gained as much attention or hype as the reverse cat eye look. It’s worth noting that this trend isn’t entirely new. It’s one that TikTok users have rediscovered and turned viral with heir creative content. If you’re a Kardashian fan, you’ll remember Kim Kardashian-West wearing the makeup look during a red carpet event in 2019. Kirsten Stewart is the celebrity most associated with the trend, wearing it numerous times on the red carpet.

The trend didn’t enter the mainstream and we thought it was doomed to sit in the ‘rejected’ box forever.

Then TikTok came to save the day.

‍

‍

With mask wearing still being the norm, we’ve shifted our focus to creating intricate eye makeup looks that put the attention firmly on the windows of our soul. The bolder and more dramatic – yet simplistic – the look, the better.

We’re taking a look at this recent TikTok beauty trend, showing you how to recreate it at home and which products you’ll need to use to help it last all day long. While this look is cute for a night-time look, it’s difficult to get it to see you through a full day of wear.

‍

What is the reverse cat eye makeup trend?

‍
We all know what a cat eye is. It’s one of the most popular beauty trends and something that every makeup aficionado has tried at least once. If you’ve got a TikTok account, the chances are that you’ve seen at least one tutorial on the reverse cat eye makeup trend on your For You Page.

What makes the reverse cat eye different from the traditional style is that the line starts underneath the lower lash line, instead of on the upper lash line. If you’re someone who has been in the habit of wearing a cat eye makeup look everything, this reverse trend can help freshen up your look and let you try something new.

As part of this TikTok makeup trend, liquid eyeliner has been ditched for kohl pencils and gel eyeliner. These tools are a better choice for doing the reverse eyeliner trend as you have more control over the colour as you’re applying it under your lower lash line. The easiest way to do this look is to add a dash of liner underneath your lash line, before using an angled brush to wing out the pigment at the corner of your eye, connecting it to your upper eyelid’s wing.

‍

‍

What makes this eyeshadow look more seductive is when you use a fluffy brush to blend the liner under your lash line for a smoky look. If you want a more defined look, add your favourite liquid liner to the inner corner of your eyes, before applying mascara to your top and bottom lashes for a fluffy look. With the addition of liquid eyeliner and mascara, you can make your reverse eyeliner look more dramatic and striking for a bold appearance.

If you want to make a statement and aren’t afraid to try something new, then reverse cat eye liner is for you.

‍

How do you create the reverse cat eye makeup look?

‍
What we love about the reverse cat eye makeup trend is that it’s beginner friendly and easy to recreate with products you’ll already have in your makeup bag or vanity.

You want to start by taking an eyeliner pencil, working from the centre of your eye, creating a line that goes towards the outer corner. Once you’ve got your line, take a flat brush and work on blending the end of the line to give the appearance of a smoky wing. You want to avoid using an eyeliner that is too rough as this can cause the pigment to ball up as you blend it.

Stick to a gel formula for ease of use as it will glide onto your skin and stay up for hours. You can also use a denser angle brush to help add a shape to your wing for a more distinctive look. Your line should join up with the wing on your upper eyelid. You can add extra layers of pencil to help thicken up the line and help define your wing more.

If you’re going for a vixen look, you want to stick to a smoky aesthetic by blending the eyeliner pencil with your fluffy brush. If you want to elevate the look, all you need is a liquid eyeliner and an extra touch of pencil at the waterline to bring it to the next level.

You can go all out by finishing off your look with false eyelashes or keep it simple with a few coats of mascara on the top and bottom lashes.

‍
post-summary: Changing up your makeup routine doesn’t mean that you have to go outside your comfort zone. Some of the best makeup trends are the ones that do things in reverse. We’re already seeing this style of trend all over social media, including putting your base products on in reverse order. What we love about reverse beauty trends is that they’re not crazy but make a subtle change that can transform your look and give it a chic finish.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: soft glam, soft makeup looks, soft makeup look, make up trend
meta-description: We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves.
meta-title: How To Create A Soft Glam Makeup Look
name: How To Create A Soft Glam Makeup Look
post-body:
Are you a fan of the barely-there makeup trend? Are you ready to take it to the next level? ‘Soft glam’ is one of the biggest trends right now and takes the dewy, healthy glow from the barely-there look and elevates it with a radiant shine and airbrush finish.

‍

We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves. If you’re thinking of experimenting with the trend, make sure to bookmark this page to use as your tutorial for the next time you’re doing your makeup.

‍

Prep your skin for a healthy glow

‍
If there’s one thing that all trends have in common right now, it’s focusing on prepping your skin before applying makeup. Soft glam is all about radiant skin, meaning you want to take the time to give your skin the TLC that it deserves. Having good skin is half the battle to create a soft glam look.

‍
Make sure that you’ve cleansed, toned, and moisturised your face before you start applying your makeup routine. You want to ensure your skin is clean and hydrated so that it can absorb the makeup products into your skin and keep an even texture and smooth skin tone.

‍

‍
You might decide to use a primer to diminish the appearance of your pores for a more polished look and to help your base products last all day long. If you have skin that’s oily or prone to irritation, adding a primer can be a gamechanger for your routine. It’ll form a layer between your skin and makeup products, preventing it from sinking into your pores and causing breakouts and worse, if you start to sweat the makeup away.

‍
If you’re doing a soft glam look for a special occasion, you’ll want to take the time to invest in using a primer to keep your makeup in place all day long.

‍

Use the right makeup tools

‍
You don’t need to break the bank with designer makeup to create a soft glam look. What you do want to invest in is your tools and makeup brushes. It might be tempting to buy low-quality brushes, but they’re often impossible to blend with and leave your makeup looking streaky.

‍
It’s time to do an audit of your makeup tools and make sure that you have everything you need to create the soft glam look. One tool you’ll need is a sponge or beauty blender to help apply your liquid or cream products. It’s a must-have for applying concealer to give you a natural finish, while covering blemishes and dark circles. A beauty sponge can be used on the more delicate areas of your skin, including under your eyes for treating dark circles.

‍
When in doubt, try using your fingers to blend out the product for a seamless finish. The heat of your fingers can often do the trick to help the pigment blend together.

‍

Make sure to set your face after each step

‍
You want to make sure that you’re setting you’re your makeup as you go along. If you have naturally oily skin, this can cause your ‘radiant’ glow to end up looking more like a glitter ball. You want to make sure that you set your makeup as you go along without losing the radiance and shine in your skin.

‍
The easiest way of setting your makeup is by using a translucent powder and gently dusting it over the targeted areas of your skin – such as your t-zone – using a large fluffy brush.

‍

Choose soft colours

‍
As the name suggests, ‘soft glam’ is all about using soft and feminine colours that help add a glow to your skin. The beauty of soft glam is in its simplicity and the hues that help to make your face glow. You want to stay firmly away from bright colours or anything too dark. You also want to avoid a darker or harsh contour. You can even use a foundation one or two shades darker than your everyday colour to get a more natural look that is softer when blended.

‍
If you want to add a pop of colour to your makeup look, focus it either on your eyes or lips – without overpowering your makeup.

‍

Setting spray

‍
If there’s one tip that you take way from this article, let it be this one. You want to make sure you’re using a setting spray to help finish off your soft glam look and hold it in place. A good setting spray will help merge the layers of your makeup and seal in the finish product to stop it sweating or melting off your skin throughout the day.

‍

Be patient

‍
Like we said before, doing soft glam can be difficult. It’s all about mastering the techniques and using a precise hand and a lightweight application to target the right products to your features. You might find that you’re spending more time blending or doing your makeup in general. With practice and patience, you’ll be able to do soft glam makeup with your eyes closed.

‍
What do you think of soft glam makeup? Is it a trend that you want to try? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: We’ve broken down the steps to create the perfect beginner-friendly soft glam routine to show you what this makeup looks involves. If you’re thinking of experimenting with the trend, make sure to bookmark this page to use as your tutorial for the next time you’re doing your makeup.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: whipped lemonade, drinks on Tiktok, TikTok recipe, whipped lemonade on TikTok
meta-description: We’re taking a look at everything you need to create this mouth-watering lemonade drink that all your friends will be asking for.
meta-title: Whipped Lemonade Everyone Is Making on TikTok
name: The Whipped Lemonade Drink That Everyone Is Making on TikTok
post-body:
What did we ever do before TikTok? If we’re not talking about beauty trends, then we’re talking about a recipe or song that’s gone viral on the platform. One of the latest trends to go viral on TikTok is a whipped lemonade drink that will help you transition from summer to autumn.

‍
Last year, we were all raving about whipped coffee and cloud bread. TikTok was the driving force behind this food trend as well. We all learned the art of whipping coffee from the app, which brought the trend into the mainstream.

‍
Whipped drinks have now moved from coffee to lemonade, once again thanks to the viral video-sharing app. TikTok has once again hit it out of the park with its latest viral drink. If you’re not a fan of caffeine and prefer something fresher, this is the drink for you.

‍

‍

While lemonade is the perfect summer drink, we love to drink it all year long. Whether it’s an unexpected summer heatwave or if you want an Instagram-ready photo, the whipped lemonade drink is one recipe you want to learn ASAP. It’s an instant crowd-pleaser and one that you and your friends will love.

‍
This TikTok drink gets bonus points for being aesthetically pleasing. It’s the perfect drink for snapping a picture of to put on your Instagram feed and you can even customise it for an exciting floral look. If you want to take your drink to the next level, you can even make an alcoholic version of the drink.

‍
Grab your shopping list. We’re taking a look at everything you need to create this mouth-watering lemonade drink that all your friends will be asking for. You’ll never be able to go back to plain and boring old lemonade ever again. Trust us. Your taste buds and Insta-feed will thank you.

‍

‍

How do you make the TikTok whipped lemonade drink?

‍
What we love about this TikTok recipe is that it’s easy to make with things that you either have at home or can easily pick up from your local supermarket.

‍
The recipe we’re sharing will give you enough to make two servings of the whipped lemonade – enough for you and your BFF.

‍
Start by taking an aesthetically pleasing glass (bonus points if it’s coloured!) and set it aside to put the finish product into.

‍
You want a second glass to do your mixing to create the whipped topping. Add one half water and one half coconut milk to create the whipped topping for your lemonade. Just like with whipped coffee, you want to froth the coconut milk and water mixture to give you the desired whip look that you want.

‍

‍
While you can do it by hand using a whisking spoon, Amazon is full of frothing tools that can get the job done within a few seconds. If you’re a fan of whipped coffee or whipped lemonade, this handy tool is a staple for your kitchen.

‍
Trust us. Your wrists will thank you.

‍
Now that you have your whipped mixture, take your first glass, and fill it with ice-cold lemonade. You can stick to a classic one or get inventive with a pink lemonade or any that tickle your taste buds. You want to make sure that you leave enough space in your glass to accommodate the whipped mixture on top of the lemonade.

‍
Take the whipped mixture and pour it on top of your lemonade to give you the whipped appearance. Add a fun metal straw to make the lemonade easier to drink and garnish the glass with your favourite fruit. Lemon, lime, or grapefruit are a classic choice but feel free to get inventive.

‍

Making your whipped lemonade your own

‍
What we love about TikTok recipes like this one for whipped lemonade is that there’s no hard and fast rules. You can shake up the recipes and make it your own with just a few changes or additions. You can go super fancy with your whipped lemonade or keep it laidback and casual with a minimalistic recipe that is fuss-free.
Don’t be afraid to experiment and have fun with trying to achieve the perfect whip consistency.

‍
It’s worth having a scroll through TikTok to see how other users have shaken up the recipe to make it their own. One of our favourite alterations is to swap out the coconut milk for condensed milk, using it with whipped cream instead of water.

‍
Using these ingredients instead will give you a thicker consistency that is closer to your favourite frappe drink. It also makes the whipped lemonade more indulgent with a richer consistency.

‍
One of our favourite ways to change up the whipped lemonade drink is to add an alcoholic twist. Lemonade is one mixer that works with virtually every type of alcohol – whether you’re a fan of vodka or rum. You can easily convert your whipped lemonade recipe into a new cocktail by adding in your go-to alcohol for a fun twist.
Feel free to experiment and have a fun time with your whipped lemonade. There are no rules that you have to follow, and you can make this drink you own. Just like everyone has their own coffee, you can create a signature whipped lemonade that is uniquely your own.

‍
What we love about whipped lemonade is that it’s a year-round drink that you can sip on at the poolside or during the holiday season. Whether you’re in the mood for alcohol or just want a refreshing drink, you can tailor your whipped lemonade to meet your cravings.

‍
Do you know what makes whipped lemonade even better? An insta-worthy glass to serve it in. Don’t forget to stock up on cocktail glasses and fun seasonal styles ahead of the holiday season. You can even customise your whipped lemonade with a special Halloween or Christmas drink.

‍
Once again, TikTok is out there changing our lives – and our taste buds are loving it.

‍
Have you tried making the infamous whipped lemonade? What special twists do you add to your drink? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: What did we ever do before TikTok? If we’re not talking about beauty trends, then we’re talking about a recipe or song that’s gone viral on the platform. One of the latest trends to go viral on TikTok is a whipped lemonade drink that will help you transition from summer to autumn.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: beauty trends, social media tends, skincare, TikTok beauty trends
meta-description: We’re looking at the biggest beauty trends that have dominating social media in 2022
meta-title: The Biggest Beauty Trends Dominating Social Media
name: The Biggest Beauty Trends Dominating Social Media in 2022
post-body:
We might be two-thirds of the way through 2022, but we’re still seeing new beauty trends popping up on social media every day. With the  new season, it’s the perfect time to have a look at the biggest beauty trends of 2022. Some of these you may have missed, or they might help you shake up your look for the new season.

‍

‍
Social media is the driving force behind every trend in society right now – none more so than beauty trends. This fact isn’t entirely new. Since beauty influencers started taking over YouTube – long before they became known as influencers – social media has been leading the way and creating trends of its own. Gone are the days when beauty editors and celebrities had sole control over dictating trends.

‍

Skinimalism

‍
Have you found that you’re buying more skincare products than makeup products? The chances are that you’ve jumped on the skinimalism trend. It focuses on giving your skin the nourishment it needs, so that you can rely on fewer makeup products to accentuate your features.

‍
Skinimalism is all about creating a dewy, healthy glow in the easiest way possible. Gone are the days of wearing layers upon layers of products with heavy-coverage formulas that sink into our pores. With this trend, the focus shifts from your makeup products to your skincare routine. Putting effort into your skincare routine means you can ditch the cakey foundation formulas and let your skin breathe.

‍
Low-key makeup trends are everywhere we look on TikTok, emphasising the importance of skinimalism as the secret to a flawless base. Part of skinimalism is finding multi-functional products that cut down your routine, making it easier and quicker to get ready to head out the door.

‍
Invest in 2-in-1 formulas like a cream blush that doubles as a lipstick or a tinted moisturizer that hydrates your skin, while adding a soft glow and minimal coverage to top up your concealer.

‍

Pastel liner

‍
If there’s one thing that we’ve learnt in 2022, it’s finding the joy in everyday life. The next time you’re scrolling through your Instagram feed, stop and count how many times you feel your favourite influencers wearing a coloured liner. While black is our daily go-to, a pastel shade can add an instant pop of colour that elevates your look and takes it to the next level.

‍
Before 2022, coloured liner was something that you might wear on a night out or for a special occasion. Thanks to social media, pastel liner has become an everyday staple that we love to wear.

‍
Your eyes are the window to your soul, with pastel liners helping to brighten your eyes and make them appear larger. If you search for pastel liners on Google, you’ll find hundreds of different options available, whether you prefer a pencil liner or a gel formula.

‍
While pastel liner is an easy addition to make to your vanity, you want to make sure you’re loading up on your mascara. Fluffy lashes are the perfect way to finish off your eye makeup look. Bonus points if your liner matches your outfit for the ultimate monochromatic look.

‍

It’s all about the eyes

‍
Thanks to the pandemic, most of us have spent 2022 going out and about wearing face masks. It means that social media influencers have had to shake up their look, ditching bold lips for maximalist eyeshadow looks. This is your sign to perfect the art of eyeliner and invest in some sparkly shadows.

‍
While our outfits are getting more minimalistic, it’s time to have some fun with our eye makeup looks. It’ll help you stand out from the crowd and allows you to have fun with your makeup look, even when wearing a mask.
Easy ways to achieve the maximalist look includes using rainbow hues for eyeshadow, pops of colour, and graphic abstract liner. The more outlandish the better.

‍
This social media trend shows no sign of slowing down and it’s the perfect one to experiment with before the holiday season. Add a touch of metallic glitter to see your maximalist eyes look through to party season.

‍
post-summary: We might be two-thirds of the way through 2022, but we’re still seeing new beauty trends popping up on social media every day. With the seasons new season, it’s the perfect time to have a look at the biggest beauty trends of 2022. Some of these you may have missed, or they might help you shake up your look for the new season.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: skincare, retinol, vitamin C, hyaluronic acid, skincare questions,
meta-description: We’re taking a look at the most popular questions that Gen Z have and what advice a dermatologist would give them on the most common issues.
meta-title: The most popular skincare questions that Gen Z ask
name: The most popular skincare questions that Gen Z have
post-body:
If you’re a Gen Z-er, you’ve likely got a few skincare related questions flying around your head. No worries. We’re here to help. We’re taking a look at the most popular questions that Gen Z have, letting them know which products are worth investing in, and what advice a dermatologist would give them on the most common issues.

‍

‍

Q: What products should I have in my skincare routine?

‍
The first non-negotiable for your skincare routine is a gentle cleanser that will exfoliate your skin and remove dead skin cells. If you’re wearing makeup, don’t forget that you need to remove it as well. You might decide to use a double cleansing method with both a makeup remover and a separate cleansing product.

‍
When your skin is full of impurities and dead skin cells, it starts to become dull and can be troubled with breakouts. Your cleanser will remove these impurities and help brighten your skin’s complexion, while helping your skin absorb the active ingredients in your other skincare products.

‍
Toners are one product that often gets given a bad reputation. Look for one with a water-based formula and incorporate it into your routine to help brighten your face and get rid of any left-over impurities in your skin.
You can add in a serum for a targeted treatment to help address any specific skincare concerns that you have.
Finish off your routine with a hydrating moisture that restore your skin’s pH balance and helps to boost your skin’s protective barrier. Even if you oily skin and are prone to breakouts, you want to be using a moisturizer.

‍

Q: How can I get rid of my acne?

‍
Acne is something that everyone deals with – whether it’s genetic or hormonal. It’s amongst the most common skin problems and one that can be painful to deal with. We’ve deal with confidence issues as a result of acne. One of the best things you can do to tackle your acne is to create a consistent skincare routine that you follow. You won’t see results overnight, but it’s worth sticking to. After 4-6 weeks of consistently following your routine, you can expect to see a noticeable difference in the condition of your skin.

‍
You can also incorporate specific ingredients – like salicylic acid – into your skincare routine to help tackle the root cause of your acne. Make sure that you’re always removing your makeup and cleansing your skin.
