Look out for a glycolic toner and ensure that your skin is getting the hydration and moisture that it needs to help soothe the redness and irritation that acne causes your skin.

‍

‍

Q: What active ingredients should I be using as part of my skincare routine?

‍
This is a million dollar question and one that can’t answer for you. Active ingredients are the powerhouse behind your skincare routine and allow you to tailor your routine to address your specific concerns. Every active ingredient has a purpose behind it – whether it’s plumping your skin, removing dead skin cells, or healing acne scarring. The best thing you can do is research the active ingredients that are best to use for your specific skin type or concerns.

‍
It’s easy to get caught up thinking that you need to use every single active ingredients. Sometimes, less is more. It’s also worth researching which active ingredients can and can’t be used together. Active ingredients are the most powerful part of your skincare products, and some can react badly to each other.

‍

‍
Three of the most popular active ingredients are Hyaluronic Acid, Glycolic, and Vitamin C. These are the most common ones for Gen Z to use and can help you achieve a healthy glow to your skin.

‍
Vitamin C works to brighten your complexion, unlocking your skin’s inner radiance while helping to relieve dull and tired-looking skin. We also love Vitamin C for its antioxidant properties, helping to protect your skin from free radical damage to prevent premature aging and breakouts.

‍
Glycolic is another brightening active ingredient and is ideal for using with your evening skincare routine as a toner or serum.

‍
Hyaluronic acid is a hero ingredient and one that everyone is talking about. It can hold up to thousand times its weight in water and works for every skin type as the ultimate hydrating ingredient. One universal skincare product that everyone should be using is a hyaluronic acid serum.

‍

Q: What percentage should I be using with my Retinol, Vitamin C, and Hyaluronic Acid products?

‍
The golden rule of thumb is to always start on the lower end of the percentage for any product. If you go in at the deep end, your skin might take a reaction and you can end up doing more harm than good. It’s best to start slowly and gradually work your way up, especially if you have sensitive skin.

‍
You want to start by slowly introducing the ingredient to your skincare routine – especially retinol. Start by using a lower percentage of the active ingredient once or twice a week to allow your skin to build up its tolerance before gradually increasing your use.

‍
As your skin becomes more familiar and acclimates to the ingredient, you can gradually raise the percentage until you find one that you’re happy with and that gives you the results you’re looking for.

‍
The above advice is mostly relevant for Retinol and Vitamin C. You’ll want to start as low as possible with retinol, while 10% is usually a good percentage to start with for vitamin C. When it comes to hyaluronic acid, you can use any percentage that you like. If you have sensitive skin, it’s still worth going a little lower to start with.

‍
What is your must-have Gen Z skincare product? We’d love to hear about it in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: If you’re a Gen Z-er, you’ve likely got a few skincare related questions flying around your head. No worries. We’re here to help. We’re taking a look at the most popular questions that Gen Z have, letting them know which products are worth investing in, and what advice a dermatologist would give them on the most common issues.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: tiktok fashion hacks, tiktok trends, fashion tips
meta-description: We’re sharing the best TikTok fashion trends that you want to start incorporating into your closet ASAP. It’s time to say goodbye to visible bra straps and more
meta-title: The TikTok Fashion Hacks
name: The TikTok Fashion Hacks That Will Change Your Closet Forever
post-body:
The fashion community on TikTok is genius. Their hacks are revolutionary and will change how you get dressed every day. They have hacks and solutions to problems you didn’t even realise that you had. Downloading TikTok during the pandemic was probably one of the best things we ever did.

‍
While it’s easy to feel guilty about endlessly scrolling through your TikTok feed or spending too much time on the app, it’s had a positive impact on our lives. No, finding out you to give your white t-shirt a glow up isn’t that lifechanging, but the app has taught us a lot. Whether it’s learning how to make whipped lemonade or about social justice issue, TikTok is a platform that is as much about education as it is entertaining.
Enter the TikTok fashion community.

‍

‍
If anyone can make a dress sell out in minutes or a trend go viral, it’s TikTokers. What we love about the app is that you feel like you’re talking to a best friend through your phone screen, like it’s a weekly FaceTime or Zoom call.

‍
That’s why we have problem taking fashion advice or hacks from our favourite influencers on the app. TikTok is the modern public information service that is changing our lives little by little. What did we ever do without it?
One thing that TikTok has reminded us that you are the person wearing your clothes, your clothes aren’t wearing you.

The best fashion hacks on TikTok right now

‍

‍

We all love strapless dresses or ones that have a thin strap. While this will keep you cool, the chances are that you’ll be struggling to try to hide your bra strap. Never fear. We have a TikTok hack that works for any kind of dress with short straps or a strapless silhouette. It’ll save you investing in a strapless bra and means you don’t have to change your outfit at the last minute.

This hack works better than your normal strapless bra. Start by taking your bra and loosen the straps all the way. Make sure that they are as loose as possible on both sides. Take the straps and move them over your head and shoulder to the opposite side of your body. Tuck the loose parts of your bra under the straps to secure them in place.

‍
With this easy TikTok hack, your normal bra will be able to give you better results than a strapless bra, while giving you extra support.

‍

‍

Crop tops are trending but you don’t need to go out and buy a new one. Take one of your favourite t-shirts and transform them into a Nineties style crop top with just a bangle.

‍
All you need to do is take a classic t-shirt and gather the front of the fabric, pulling it through the bangle, before twisting the excess fabric through the sides of the bangle.  You should be left with the lower half of the bangle exposed, giving you an instant crop top without having to cut your t-shirt.

‍

‍

We all have a button-up shirt that is gathering dust in our closet. With this TikTok hack, you can easily transform a plain button-up shirt into a Jacquemus-inspired top. Don’t have a button-up to use? Pick one up second hand.

‍
Start by putting you button-up shirt on back to front, with the buttons sitting at your back. Put one arm into the shirt, before flipping the rest of the shirt over in on itself to create a ruching detailing before putting your other arm through into the shirt. Once you have it on at the front, button the shirt the whole way down your back.
This fashion hack is perfect for a night out when you have ‘nothing to wear’ and don’t want to buy a fast fashion piece.

‍

‍

Have you bought a tank top with straps that are too loose? You might be tempted to throw it out or get rid of it. Stop. TikTok has a hack to sort your problem. All you have to do is put the straps over your neck to your other shoulder to create a criss-cross look to give the illusion of a halter neck. It’ll instantly elevate your tank top and solve your loose straps problem.

What do you think of these TikTok fashion hacks? Do you think they’ll help you get the most out of your clothes and cut down on waste? Let us know your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: The fashion community on TikTok is genius. Their hacks are revolutionary and will change how you get dressed every day. They have hacks and solutions to problems you didn’t even realise that you had. Downloading TikTok during the pandemic was probably one of the best things we ever did.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: waterless cosmetics, eco friendly cosmetics, changes in cosmetic industry, sustainable cosmetics
meta-description: With the threat of climate change growing every day, we’re all looking for small and proactive steps that we can take to make the world a better place.
meta-title: Welcome to the Era of Waterless Cosmetic
name: Welcome to the Era of Waterless Cosmetic
post-body:
With the threat of climate change growing every day, we’re all looking for small and proactive steps that we can take to make the world a better place. While we’re all aware of issues like fast fashion and controversial ingredients like palm oil, water is one ingredient that you’re probably overlook. Water is something that most of us takes for granted every day. The ability to go into our kitchen and run a tap, receiving instant water, is virtually unheard of in some parts of the world – even in the 21st century.

Water is one ingredient that we often turn to for its hydrating and moisturising properties. You might think of it as an everyday ingredient, but one marketing research firm is calling it the “new luxury” ingredient due to demand outstretching supply. Water is about to become a precious commodity across the world as the demand for it begins to outstretch supply and as climate change takes hold.

‍

‍

All you have to do is look at the intense water consumption of industries like the fast fashion niche to see how this is happening. In countries like India, most of their water is used for textile production, while millions of people are without safe drinking water.

As the population continues to grow, economic development thrives, and consumption increases, the global supply of water is going up with it. Did you know that the average person in the Western world uses 140 litres of water a day, including for washing and household use? Just picture a one litre bottle of water and then times it by one hundred and forty. That’s how much water just you use every day. Now multiple that by how many people live in your house and you’ll quickly see the number start to rise.

‍

‍

There’s also the impact of climate change to consider. Two thirds of the world’s population are already dealing with water scarcity for at least one month of the year as temperatures start to rise and climates become more humid. With climate change raising the earth’s temperature, we can expect this number to rise as well.

Although agriculture is naturally the main consumer of water usage – taking around 70% of the world’s resources – the beauty industry is playing a role in contributing to the problem as well. It’s not just about beauty brands becoming more sustainable or greener, it’s also about making consumers aware of the impact that their products are having.

Just think of how we all ditched single used plastic after seeing the harms it causes to our oceans. As more consumers become aware of the dangers of certain ingredients, they start to put pressure on brands to change their practices and look for more sustainable alternatives. They also work to lobby governments and institutions, often causing a change in regulations and even laws. The banning of micro-beads in the UK is a prime example of this.

‍

Change is already happening within the industry

‍
As the world looks to become more sustainable and eco-friendlier, it’s no surprise that beauty companies are already looking for ways to reduce their water consumption. As consumers become more educated, these brands are seeking to get ahead of the curve and out-perform their competition on the axes of sustainability. Even some of the most popular brands within the industry are taking proactive steps.

L’Oreal has pledged to reduce its water consumption by an eye-water 60% per finished product unit by the end of 2022. When you think of how many products L’Oreal makes, that’s an impressive commitment. Similarly, Unilver have set their own goal of halving the environment impact of the production and usage of their products by 2030. This ambitious goal also includes its water usage.

What you might not know is that water is one of the leading ingredients in most of the skincare and cosmetics products in your vanity. The next time you’re washing your hair, take a look at the ingredients list on your shampoo and condition. You’ll notice that ‘Aqua’ is almost always one of the first ingredients listed. The ingredients list works by starting with the highest concentration before working its way down.

The issue with the beauty industry is that water has been used as a filler ingredient for years to bulk out the product. It’s typically listed as the first ingredient as it forms the base for the product. You might even find that it makes up 70-80% of the product’s formula. One reason why water is chosen as the base is due to its low price point, meaning that it lowers the overall cost of producing the produce, in turn making it more affordable. It’s this view of water as being a ‘cheap’ commodity that leads to people assuming that it’s a limitless resource that will never run out.

‍

‍

Finding an alternative to water-based formulas

‍
The good news is that there are already alternatives to water-based formulas on the market. You can vote with your wallet and make the industry change by opting for more sustainable formulas.

Solid beauty bars are one product that have been on the rise in recent years due to their sustainability and the fact that they use virtually no packaging and leave zero waste. What we love about solid beauty bars is that they come with a more concentrated formula, meaning that you get more for your money with a lower cost per use. As there is little to no water used, you’re getting more active and skin-loving ingredients in your beauty bar. A beauty bar will naturally lather up when you’re using it in the shower, making it a popular format for shampoos.

‍

‍

These beauty bars are more sustainable than you might think, ticking all the boxes for anyone with an eco-friendly conscious. Think of the big containers that house liquid shampoos. They come covered in plastic – and occasionally even an outer layer of plastic. It uses considerably more plastic than a shampoo bar, which can even be packaged in eco-friendly material like beeswax paper or recycled cardboard.

Water-free beauty products can be stored and packaged in compostable materials or even sold naked. If you’ve ever been to stores like Lush, you’ll see that their soaps do not come individually wrapped in plastic, instead stored in their whole form. Without the need for this plastic packaging, your beauty products have a lower carbon footprint, and the lack of water means that it weighs even less. As it weighs less, it has a knock-on effect by lowering the transportation cost of the product.

‍

‍

The rise in powder products as an eco-friendly alternative

‍
You also want to consider swapping out for powder-based products, which are already starting to become a popular niche within the beauty industry.

While most skincare products come in a liquid format, powder versions of products like cleaners, exfoliators, and face masks are becoming more popular. You activate the ingredients in the product and use it by adding a touch of water to turn them to liquid. You get all the skincare benefits, while reducing the weight and waste of your product.

‍

‍

The beauty of using powder-based products is that they can maintain the integrity of your active ingredients. Vitamin C is one active ingredient that can deteriorate overtime if it is pre-mixed with water. If you use vitamin C in its powder form, you can preserve its integrity and purity to make sure that you get the most out of the ingredients when you use them. All it needs is a touch of water to active it.

The other thing to consider is that the powder form of products means that it can be made without needing to use preservatives, which are one of the leading causes of skin irritation. If you want a cleaner product, with more active ingredients and a less irritating formula, it’s time to shift from water-based liquid formulas to powder.

One other bonus of using a beauty bar or powder is that they don’t count towards your liquid allowance while flying. If you’re always on the go, these eco-friendly products can be a lifesaver.

‍

Oil-based alternatives to water formulas

‍
The other product type to consider are oils. Most of us assume that water is instantly a good thing. You’ll often see water justified as being in a formula for its hydrating benefits, when it’s really only there for filler. In reality, the minerals and metals in water can strip your skin if you use them too often.

Too much of a good thing can cause problems – with water being no exception.

‍

‍

If you have sensitive skin or want to cut your water use, swap out for nourishing natural oils instead. You’ll get all the hydrating benefits of the natural ingredients, while the oil will help them absorb seamlessly into your skin. Instead of using water, these oils incorporate things like fruit waters and botanicals to create the same effect without the environmental consequences.

While you might be used to seeing water coming out of your kitchen tap, that’s the exact problem. We’re so used to water that we take it for granted. With new solutions and alternatives coming to the market every year, it might be time to finally cut down our water usage.

How are you making your beauty routine more sustainable? Do you use any water-free products? Tell us about them in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: With the threat of climate change growing every day, we’re all looking for small and proactive steps that we can take to make the world a better place. While we’re all aware of issues like fast fashion and controversial ingredients like palm oil, water is one ingredient that you’re probably overlook. Water is something that most of us takes for granted every day. The ability to go into our kitchen and run a tap, receiving instant water, is virtually unheard of in some parts of the world – even in the 21st century.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: Hair Claw Clip, 90' style, fashion, trend, hair, hair accessoire
meta-description: This article is your sign to ditch your elastic hair ties for a claw clip. Trust us. It’s healthier for your hair, causes less breakage.
meta-title: It’s Time to Bring Back the Classic ‘90s Hair Clip
name: It’s Time to Bring Back the Classic ‘90s Hair Claw Clip
post-body:
The claw clip is finally making a reappearance in fashion trends thanks to Gen Z and millennials. This hair accessory is effortlessly chic and an easy way to pull your hair back when you’re on the go. The messy your hair, the better. Forbes even went as far as to say that the claw clip is the hair accessory of 2021.

‍
This article is your sign to ditch your elastic hair ties for a claw clip. Trust us. It’s healthier for your hair, causes less breakage, and instantly elevates your look. Everyone from Bella Hadid to Hailey Bieber and Kendall Jenner are a fan of the hair accessory. Do you need any more of an endorsement than that?

‍

‍

While a ponytail is an easy style to create on the go, you’ll inevitably end up giving yourself a headache within a few hours of wear. The beauty of the ‘90s hair claw clip is that it’s fuss-free and is kind to your scalp. You can wear it with freshly washed hair to help it dry quicker or use smaller hair claws to pin back specific sections of hair.

‍
We’d like to thank Gen Z and Millennials for bringing the accessory back after classic ‘90s shows like Dawson’s Creek and Moesha were added to Netflix. It’s a nostalgia for the ‘90s and an interest in discovering the trends of the era for the first time that have made the claw clip the ‘it’ hair accessory for 2021.

‍

‍
The humble hair claw has something to offer everyone – making it deserving of the title of ‘it’ hair accessory. It’s a staple that works for any hair type or age, whether you’re heading to school or work and want a low-maintenance hair style.

‍
Last year, headbands were all the rage. The year before that, it was all about the scrunchies. Pearl hair clips made a momentary appearance in between the two trends. Like the sun rising in the east, another year brings with it a new hair accessory trend.

‍
For 2021, it’s all about the claw clip – and we’re not complaining. It’s easy to use, gives your outfit an effortless finish, and holds your hair securely in place for a low-maintenance style.

‍

‍
Best of all – you can find this innovative but simple hair accessory in virtual every colour under the sun. Do you prefer crystals? No problem. Are pearls your signature? You can find those as well. They’re also one of the most affordable and accessible hair trends of the year, making them easy to incorporate into your look without breaking the bank.

‍
We’re taking a look at the reasons behind this trend, whether claw clips live up to the hype (they do!), and how you can use them. Grab your credit card, you’ll want to stock up on these claw clips before they sell out.

‍

The claw clip as a practical alternative

‍
One of the reasons why we love the ‘90s claw clip is that it’s a practical alternative to your everyday hair accessories. A claw clip is a healthier alternative for your hair than using elastics – whether you’ve got wet or dry hair. You don’t have to worry about breakage, and it can help keep your hair up and out of your face.

‍
Just like a traditional hair elastic, you get versatile with a claw clip. You can put it up in a classic twist-up look or take a leaf from Kendal Jenner’s style book and use it for a half-up/half-down look. As hair claws come in different shapes and sizes, you can use a smaller claw to hold back specific pieces of hair to bring definition to your look. Smaller hair claws are perfect for clipping back the sides of your hair to keep it out of your face.

‍

‍
The reason why claw clips are so popular is that they work for virtually every hair length and texture. If you have curly hair, it’s usually a good idea to add a texturizing mouse to help define and shape your curls before pulling them up into your claw clip.

‍
The secret to wearing a claw clip is to not worry about making it look perfect. It’s meant to look messy. It creates a ‘I just rolled out of bed’ look, while still being fashionable and stylish.

‍
post-summary: The claw clip is finally making a reappearance in fashion trends thanks to Gen Z and millennials. This hair accessory is effortlessly chic and an easy way to pull your hair back when you’re on the go. The messy your hair, the better. Forbes even went as far as to say that the claw clip is the hair accessory of 2021.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: tiktok, perfum om tiktok, Amyris, Maison Francis Kurkdjian’s
meta-description: We’re taking a look at the hype behind the Amyris Femme fragrance to help you decide if it’s worth of a spot on your vanity.
meta-title: Meet TikTok’s Most Viral and Favourite Perfume
name: Meet TikTok’s Most Viral and Favourite Perfume of All-Time
post-body:
Perfume is one of the most intimate products that we own. It’s something that only those closet to you get to experience. While a strange can see your lipstick, only those who get up close and personal can experience the allure of your fragrance.

Like most things, TikTok has played a role in bringing back the allure and glamour of fragrances and perfumes. In fact, there’s one that virtually owes its success to the video-sharing platform. #PurfumeTok is one of the most influential niches within the platform, helping to make or break the success of newly released perfumes, while bringing old favourites back as popular must-have scents.

‍

‍

Enter Maison Francis Kurkdjian’s ‘Amyris Femme’. It’s the kind of perfume you would text your ex-girlfriend to ask about so that you can gift it to another woman.

That’s the kind of reaction people have to this perfume. It’s on another level and has developed a cult-following amongst influencers, celebrities, and everyday TikTok users.

Whether you’re a perfume aficionado or looking for a signature scent, Amyris Femme is a scent that everyone needs to experience at least once. It’s a universally appealing scent that brings you in – whether you’re the one wearing it or a mere passer-by.

‍

‍

One TikTok user – whose video has over 2 million views – describes the scent as being what Helen of Troy would wear, that it “smells like unspeakable beauty”. Is this a perfume that could launch a thousand ships? We’ll led you be the judge of that. Another TikTok user went as far as to name Amyris Femme to be amongst their most complimented products. She even added that after wearing it out in public once, she was stopped on the street three times to be asked about her perfume.

‍

If you’re looking to catch your crush’s attention or just get a simple compliment, this is the fragrance for you.

Amyris Femme is a perfume that TikTok will make you buy (just like everything else you’ve bought recently!). But we can guarantee that it won’t end up being a regret – far from it.

We’re taking a look at the hype behind the Amyris Femme fragrance to help you decide if it’s worth of a spot on your vanity. Pro-tip; this perfume is going to be at the top of everyone’s Christmas list for 2021. You better stock up now before it starts selling out before the holiday season.

‍

Should you buy the Amyris Femme?

‍
The simple answer is – absolute.

When something with a high price tag goes viral with nothing but praise, you know it’s something special. If you want to upgrade your routine – or picture yourself as Helen of Troy – this is the fragrance that you need in your life.

It’s no exaggeration to say that this is the perfume that could change your life. Once you get the gold-topped bottle into your hand, there’s no going back. We promise that once you’ve sprayed it against your skin, it’ll become your new go to scent.

‍

The scent of Amyris Femme

‍
It’s one thing to create drama and hype around a perfume, it’s another to consider what it actually smells like. It’s easy to fall for clever marketing techniques and pretty packaging – especially when it’s for something like a fragrance. It’s worth looking at the fragrance itself and what makes it so special.

Amyris Femme lingers on your skin as a lightweight but sensual fragrance. It opens to top notes of Jamaican amyris that mimic the blend of cedar and sandalwood that you’ll find in other luxury fragrances. Amber adds a woody allure to the top notes. You’ll find a more citrus blend of California orange, Florentine iris, lemon blossom, and Haitian vetiver amongst the top notes to balance out the more floral notes.

What we love about this perfume is that you get bang for your money. You can expect one spritz to last you between 8-10 hours of wear. If you’re someone who finds that their perfume disappears almost instantly from their skin, then this fragrance will be lifechanging.

‍

‍

The aromatic fragrance is designed for long-term wear. With a lasting power of up to 10 hours, it’s a perfect all-day scent to see you through the workday or take you seamlessly from day to night. It’s one scent we’ll be wearing for every date night.

This alluring fragrance is equal parts charming and feminine, while having a sexy under-tone. It shows that you mean business but that you’re not trying too hard to get anyone’s attention. It’s the kind of fragrance you can imagine the Queens of Old Hollywood – like Grace Kelly and Audrey Hepburn – wearing at the height of their popularity.

While we’re talking about perfume and its longevity, it’s worth taking a look at the history of perfume and some of the most common questions around wearing fragrances. If Amyris Femme is the first fragrance that you’re buying – or if you want to get your money’s worth out of the bottle – the guide below is a must read.

‍

The history and purpose of perfume

‍
Perfume is one of the oldest traditions in the beauty industry – in history in fact. It’s something that is rich in history, handed down through the generations. Perfume has changed and evolved with time changing its purpose. What makes it significant is that it’s always been there – from the time of Helen of Tory to now.

Smell is one of our primary scents, unlocking memories and stirring emotions deep within us that we never expected. It’s this experience that makes perfume so powerful – and why it’s instantly associated with seduction.

The purpose of perfume has changed throughout history. It was originally to show off your wealth, but it’s often used for seducing people. Today, most of us choose to wear perfume for ourselves.

Most people choose to have a signature scent. It might be a specific note – like lavender or English rose – or even a certain perfume. We all have a friend who has a signature smell, whether it’s Chanel’s No5 or Dior’s Black Opium.

‍
post-summary: Perfume is one of the most intimate products that we own. It’s something that only those closet to you get to experience. While a strange can see your lipstick, only those who get up close and personal can experience the allure of your fragrance. Like most things, TikTok has played a role in bringing back the allure and glamour of fragrances and perfumes. In fact, there’s one that virtually owes its success to the video-sharing platform. #PurfumeTok is one of the most influential niches within the platform, helping to make or break the success of newly released perfumes, while bringing old favourites back as popular must-have scents.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: instagram accounts, beauty accounts, beauty bloggers, beauty on instagram
meta-description: We’re rounding up the 4 beauty accounts that everyone should be following on Instagram. Your makeup routine will thank you for following them.
meta-title: Instagram Accounts for Beauty Inspiration
name: Instagram Accounts to Follow for Beauty Inspiration
post-body:
While YouTube serves its purpose, no one wants to go through 3 hours of footage from beauty vloggers in the hopes of good product recommendations or the latest TikTok makeup hacks. Sometimes, you want to go back to basic with easy to watch content that is short and sweet. While we’ll never let go of our favourite makeup YouTubers – their content isn’t what we need or want on a day-to-day basis.

‍
That’s where your Instagram feed comes in.

‍

‍
When you’re deciding who to follow on Instagram, it’s easy to get all caught up in influencers and celebrities. It’s likely that you’re overlooking the makeup brands and stores that you shop from and whose products you love. Every makeup brand has their own way of producing and posting social media content. Some focus solely on promoting their products, while others incorporate pop cultural references and have more of a narrative to their marketing.

Some will post organic content created by fans and influencers, while others will focus solely on professional makeup looks created by the brand or on photoshoots. What we love about following beauty brands is that they’ll add a mixture of product releases, recommendations, and tutorials to your feed to shake it up.

‍

‍
If you’re looking for engaging and educational makeup content, look no further. These are the 4 beauty Instagram accounts you need to be following ASAP. Quick. Go and grab your phone – you’ll be looking up their profiles and hitting the ‘follow’ button right away. Trust me. Your makeup routine will thank you for following them.

‍

@anastasiabeverlyhills

‍
If you’ve not heard of ABH, who even are you? They have almost 20million followers on social media and are amongst the most popular contemporary beauty brands of all time. If you’re looking to up your brow game, Anastasia Beverly Hills is the perfect place to start.

‍
ABH is the number one brow brand in the United States and uses their social media platform to share product features and tutorials from influencers and professional makeup artists to help you incorporate the ABH product line into your everyday routine.

‍

@nikkietutorials

‍
One of the OG beauty influencers that is still posting tutorial videos is Nikkie. Her micro-tutorials tell you everything you need know to learn the tricks of the trade. Think of applying liquid lipstick, perfecting the art of contouring, and the easiest way to do a winged eyeliner look.

‍
She even worked as a host for Eurovision 2021 and is famous for teaching a whole generation of young people how to do their makeup. Follow Nikkie and bring your makeup game to the next level.

‍

@jaclynhill

‍
Another OG beauty influencer turned brand owner is Jaclyn Hill. From her Morphe palette days to the launch of her own product range, Jaclyn has seen it all. She’s known for adding an elevated edge to everything she does – whether it’s with a bold eyeshadow or a pair of studded Louboutins.

‍
With over 6.6 million followers on Instagram, Jaclyn shares a mixture of luxury fashion with iconic makeup looks that will make you want to try something new.

‍
We hope these ten beauty accounts inspire you to try something new, experiment with trends, and have fun with your makeup. If you’re feeling disheartened, don’t forget that makeup is art. It takes time – and a lot of patience – to master to art of applying makeup.

‍

@patrickstarrr

‍
Okay, so we’re kind of cheating. While Patrick is an influencer, he’s also launched numerous products and collaborations. With over 4.2 million Instagram followers, you’ll be in safe hands with Patrick. He’ll have you reaching for your liquid liner to create a perfectly winged liner look.

‍
Patrick promotes the idea that “makeup is a onesize fits all” mentality. Appropriately, his makeup brand is called ‘onesize’ and available at Sephora and through the brand’s official website.

‍
Best of all – you’ll get random posts of him impersonating Whitney Houston, in between swatches of the latest product releases. We take that as a win-win!

Who are your favourite beauty accounts to follow on Instagram? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: While YouTube serves its purpose, no one wants to go through 3 hours of footage from beauty vloggers in the hopes of good product recommendations or the latest TikTok makeup hacks. Sometimes, you want to go back to basic with easy to watch content that is short and sweet. While we’ll never let go of our favourite makeup YouTubers – their content isn’t what we need or want on a day-to-day basis.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: nude lipsticks, lipstick trend, lips make up, makeup trends
meta-description: We’re rounding up everything you need to know about applying nude lipstick.
meta-title: The Nude Lipsticks That Will Give You Perfect Lips
name: The Nude Lipsticks That Will Give You Perfectly Kissable Lips
post-body:
Not everyone is a bold lipstick person. After all, it takes a lot of confidence to pull off a red lip or a vibrant shade of blue. Most of us like to stay in our comfort zone with a trusty nude lipstick and matching liner. With natural makeup being one of the biggest trends within the beauty industry, it’s no surprise that more of us are choosing to go back to the fuss-free nude lipsticks.

During the mid-to-late 2000s, nude lipstick was everywhere. We loved for its subtle look and easy application. If you overline too much, it wasn’t the end of the world. If you overline with red lipstick, it can be disastrous.

‍

‍

What we love about a nude lipstick is that it can give you the illusion of plumper lips, while being easy to apply and you don’t have to worry about it smudging.

Nude is one of the few lipstick shades that is truly universal. Some of the best selling lipsticks of all time are nude shades, loved by makeup wearers of all complexions. Just think of the popularity of Charlotte Tilbury’s ‘Pillow Talk’ lipstick, which has inspired a full makeup range in its honour. If the pinkish undertones don’t work for you, there’s always MAC Cosmetics’ Velvet Teddy shade.

We promise this isn’t a sales pitch for every single nude lipstick out there – though we are going to sing the praises and benefits of having a good nude shade in your makeup bag. We’re rounding up everything you need to know about applying nude lipstick and the most popular nude lipstick shades that every woman needs to own.

‍

‍

What is nude lipstick?

‍
As you’ll probably guess, nude lipstick is a ‘your lips but better’ colour that is designed to blend with your natural lip shade to make it look as though you’re not wearing any lipstick. It can help enhance the appearance of your lips, while complementing your skin tone. Like any makeup product, there’s a fine line between finding the perfect nude lipstick and one that leaves you looking washed out and unwell.

‍

How do I choose the right nude lipstick for me?

‍
The secret to choosing the best nude lipstick for you is to think about your skin tone. If you have a darker skin tone, you want to look at nude shades that have warm or caramel undertones. Stay firmly away from any with a pastel undertone as they will wash you out. If you have oily skin, look for rosy undertones or a mid-level pink. If you have paler skin, look for a nude shade that has hint of brown with a mauve or pink twist. You’ll be able to get away with wearer a lighter pink colour as a nude lipstick.

‍

‍

The other thing you want to consider is having a lipstick that works with your natural lip colour, adding another dimension to the appear of your lips. Using a lip liner is an easy way to get the most out of your perfect nude lipstick. You can choose one that is in the exact same hue (most brands sell a matching lip liner for their lipsticks) or one that is a few shades on either side of the lipstick.

Using a lip liner will help add depth and dimension to your lips, leaving them perfectly kissable. Another trick worth knowing is how to use a lip brush to apply your lipstick as if helps you from overapplying too much lipstick.

The number one mistake people make when they’re shopping for a new nude lipstick is that they test it on the back of their hand, which usually gets more sun than your face, making it darker. You want to instead compare the bullet of the lipstick directly to your lips if possible.

‍

‍

What is the most popular lipstick shade?

‍
Nude lipstick is one of the few shades that work for every occasion, complementing any outfit you wear – whether it’s casual or formal. What we love about nude lipsticks is that they’re low-maintenance and fuss-free, meaning you don’t need to worry about reapplying them constantly. If the lipstick starts to wear away, it leaves a less obvious trace behind on your lips.

Nude lipstick is also an easy way to give the illusion of plumper lips – even making it look as though you’ve invested in filler. The trick to getting plumper lips with a nude lipstick is to use a warm brown lip liner and gently feather it along the line of your lips, leaving the centre bare for your lipstick.

‍
post-summary: Not everyone is a bold lipstick person. After all, it takes a lot of confidence to pull off a red lip or a vibrant shade of blue. Most of us like to stay in our comfort zone with a trusty nude lipstick and matching liner. With natural makeup being one of the biggest trends within the beauty industry, it’s no surprise that more of us are choosing to go back to the fuss-free nude lipsticks.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: jewellery, fall trends, jewellery trends
meta-description: Keep reading to find out more about fall jewellery trends that you can expect to see popping up on your social media feed.
meta-title: Must-Have Fall Jewellery Trends
name: Must-Have Fall Jewellery Trends
post-body:
Fall is our favourite time of year to start looking at jewellery. It’s still warm enough to wear some of your summer jewellery, but you’ll also want to consider which jewellery to wear for events and special occasions over the up-coming holiday season. Fall is the perfect time to sit down and have an audit of your jewellery box.

‍
When it comes to our jewellery, we usually recommend that you follow you heart and choose pieces that speak to you. Jewellery is an intimate experience – just like your perfume. This statement is even more true if you’re looking to invest in your jewellery for fall 2021 or if you’re looking for signature pieces.

‍

‍
This guide helps you get ahead of the curves by comparing different celebrity-inspired jewellery trends to give you inspiration for which styles you should keep an eye out. We’ll be covering celebrities like Gigi Hadid, Priyanka Chopra, and Rihanna to look at their signature jewellery pieces and what you can learn about how they style it.

‍

‍
This trio of celebrities are the perfect place to start – just like they’re the same people we turn to when looking for the next ‘it’ bag or must-have pair of designer shoes. It’ll come as no surprise that these three celebrities are amongst some of the most famous for their jewellery. Gigi Hadid is wearing her pearl earrings non-stop, while Priyanka Chopra is choosing more subtle jewellery to complement her timeless and classic outfits.

‍
Keep reading to find out more about the fall jewellery trends that you can expect to see popping up on your social media feed and in real life during fall 2021.

‍

‘Dad’ chains

‍
First, we had ‘dad shoes’, now we have ‘dad chains’. You can thank Gigi Hadid for making this jewellery piece a major trend during summer 2021 and one that we’re planning on transitioning through to fall and winter.

‍
The style is all about gold chain link necklaces that are instantly laidback and cool. Think of the gold chains that your dad or uncle would have worn under their shirts. Gigi is a fan of wearing these gold ‘dad’ chains as a part of her off-the-clock look when she’s not on the runway.

‍

‍
One reason why we love dad chains is that they’re easy to style and layer with larger necklaces to create a stack and make a statement. You can easily mix and match different metals, textures, or gemstones to get the look you want with dad chains.

‍
If Gigi’s wearing it, we’re officially calling it a trend.

‍

Body Jewellery

‍
We love Priyanka Chopra’s signature classic style. She isn’t someone who goes too bold with her clothing, keeping everything timeless, and she isn’t a celebrity who is guilty of over-accessorizing. Instead, the actress focuses on subtle pieces that instantly elevated her outfit and are perfectly chic.

‍
One way that Priyanka has been keeping her jewellery contemporary is by using body jewellery.  If you have a similar sophisticated style of dressing and want to keep your jewellery minimalistic, this is the perfect trend to jump on for fall 2021.

‍
Priyanka is known for her love of dainty body chains that peek out under her low necklines and signature wrap dresses. If you want to make an investment, you can look into the ‘permanent’ jewellery chains that are going viral all over social media.

‍

Anklet


Other body jewellery that you can consider is an anklet. Who said an anklet wasn’t a fall jewellery staple? If you’re someone who lives in ballet flats or heels, an anklet is the perfect way to add a hint of seduction to your look while keeping it all sophisticated.

‍
When party season rolls around, you’ll be able to show off your anklet in style with your favourite statement heels.

‍

Barely There Chokers

‍
Another minimalistic jewellery trend that we love from Priyanka Chopra’s jewellery box is her ‘barely there’ chokers. She’s giving the '90s staple jewelry item a new look by stacking barely there chains for a subtle, layered. This understated jewellery styling tip perfectly complements a bold print or outfit, whether you’re heading to a party or making your way into the office.

‍
What are your signature pieces? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: Fall is our favourite time of year to start looking at jewellery. It’s still warm enough to wear some of your summer jewellery, but you’ll also want to consider which jewellery to wear for events and special occasions over the up-coming holiday season. Fall is the perfect time to sit down and have an audit of your jewellery box.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: fall trends, fashion, tiktok fashion, tiktok trends
meta-description: When it comes to fashion and beauty trends, TikTok is kind. The app has inspired everything from beauty trends to fashion aesthetics.
meta-title: The Fall Coolest Trends on TikTok
name: The Fall Trends That All the Coolest Fashionistas Are Wearing on TikTok
post-body:
TikTok is our go-to spot to look for trends and style inspiration. Thanks to the viral video sharing app, it’s never been easier to find the style and aesthetic that works for you. After all, the app is responsible for starting and turbo-charging trends like cottagecore and Y2K. While the debate is still ongoing on Instagram vs TikTok, we find the video sharing app to be our go-to for everyday inspiration.

‍
When it comes to fashion and beauty trends, TikTok is kind. The app has inspired everything from beauty trends to fashion aesthetics and even a craze for whipper coffee at the start of the pandemic. When you’re scrolling through your TikTok FYP, you’ll notice one thing about the people you follow.

‍

‍
They’re all unbelievable stylish and fashionable.

Where can we get their outfits? Where do TikTokers find their clothes? Why is fashion such a big deal on TikTok? We’ve taken a deep dive into the fall trends that the most stylish and coolest fashionistas are wearing on TikTok. With the seasons changing, it’s the perfect time to shake up your closet and try a new TikTok-approved look.

‍

Button-down shirt

‍
One of the most classic staples to come out of the TikTok fashion trends is the button-down shirt. This garment works for any occasion or style aesthetic. Whether you prefer dark academia or like to keep it timeless and vintage-inspired, you’ll want a button-down shirt.

‍
While a white button-down shirt will work for any occasion, don’t be afraid to follow the TikTok trend with a vibrant hue or a bold shade, with pastel and jewel tones being amongst the most popular ones.

‍

‍
We love to style a button-down shirt with a tank top underneath and slim trousers. You can leave your shirt un-buttoned for a more laidback look, or you can button it for a more elevated look.

‍
A button-down shirt is one that you can wear with everything from a skirt to denim jeans. It’s one of the most versatile staples in your closet and a must-have if you’re considering swapping to a capsule closet.

‘60s-inspired two-piece outfit

‍
Are you looking to add a little spice to your fall 2021 fashion? TikTok is the best place to look for fashion trends that are outside the box, especially ones that look to the past for inspiration. TikTok is full of statement-worthy outfits and retro prints that help you stand out from the crowd and pop on your Instagram feed.

‍

‍
One of TikTok’s signature fashion trends is the ‘60s-inspired motifs. Imagine what you might wear if you were in Mamma Mia, and you won’t be far wrong. The ‘60s inspiration is everywhere that you look on TikTok. One of the most popular outfits for this aesthetic is the classic two-piece look.

‍
If you want to go in at the deep end with your ‘60s-inspired look, experiment with a two-piece suit. You can keep it casual with shorts and a blazer or go more elevated with a skirt and jacket combo. A two piece set is easy to find at high street stores or pre-loved if you want a sustainable alternatives.

‍

Western-inspired boots

‍
One of the most important things to have in your fall closet is boots. While we all have ankle boots or even riding style boots, TikTok is hyping up a style that you’ve probably not considered. While it’s hard to call cowboy western boots a ‘trend’, they’re all over TikTok wherever you look.

‍

‍
As per usually with TikTok, it’s Gen Z who are fuelling the obsession with western boots, including styles that change up the silhouette to make them more understated and modern.

‍
If you want a fall 2021 staple that is equal-parts modern and vintage, pick up a pair of western-inspired boots.

‍

Saturated shades

‍
The general fashion content that you’ll find on social media apps like TikTok and Instagram tend to be a sharp break away from what you might be seeing on the runway. It’s important to remember that the runway shows are out of sync, always looking ahead of the season that we’re in now.

‍

‍
One of the few instances where runway and TikTok trends have overlapped is saturated hues. This trend is actually more of a styling tip. While monochromatic looks have had their day in the sun, it’s time to shake it up and start to experiment with saturated shades instead.

‍
Take your inspiration from your favourite TikTok fashion influencers and luxury brands like Versace and Prada to create colour-blocking outfits that make a statement wherever you go. Don’t be afraid to go head-to-toe with saturated bright shades, including mixing and matching complementing hues to take your look to the next level.

‍
post-summary: TikTok is our go-to spot to look for trends and style inspiration. Thanks to the viral video sharing app, it’s never been easier to find the style and aesthetic that works for you. After all, the app is responsible for starting and turbo-charging trends like cottagecore and Y2K. While the debate is still ongoing on Instagram vs TikTok, we find the video sharing app to be our go-to for everyday inspiration.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: soft glam, soft glam makeup, make up trend, soft makeup, natural make up
meta-description: If you’re looking to shake up your makeup look but don’t want to go outside your comfort zone, then soft glam is the perfect trend to experiment with.
meta-title: Welcome to the Era of Soft Glam Makeup
name: Welcome to the Era of Soft Glam Makeup
post-body:
Are you a fan of the barely-there makeup trend? Are you ready to take it to the next level? ‘Soft glam’ is one of the biggest trends right now and takes the dewy, healthy glow from the barely-there look and elevates it with a radiant shine and airbrush finish.

‍
What we love about soft glam is that it’s a sharp break away from the days of sharp eyebrows, heavy contour and full face of makeup. Soft glam focuses on adding definition and structure to your face with minimal product in the most natural way possible. Like most beauty trends right now, your base products are essential for creating a healthy, dew glow that carries the look.

‍

‍
The soft glam beauty trends have something to offer everyone – whether you’re a fan of ‘no makeup’ makeup or want to tone down your every look to bring it in line with beauty trends. Soft glam is a timeless aesthetic that works for any occasion, whether you’re heading into work or attending a wedding.

‍

‍

It’s unapologetically feminine, universally flattering, and easy to create with products that you’ll already have at home in your makeup bag and vanity. If you’re a fan of the ‘hygge’ lifestyle of comfort-driven trends and style choices, soft glam is also for you.

‍
Everyone from celebrity makeup artists to influencers are fans of the soft glam look. It’s an easy way to accentuate your features without hiding it under layers upon layers of makeup. If you subscribe to the philosophy of ‘skinimalism’, then soft glam is the perfect makeup look for you. Part of the focus of soft glam is creating a smooth and radiant base that gives your makeup a flawless look.

‍

‍
We’re sharing everything you need to know about soft glam makeup, including how to recreate it at home with your favourite products. If you’re looking to shake up your makeup look but don’t want to go outside your comfort zone, then soft glam is the perfect trend to experiment with.

What is soft glam?

‍
Soft glam is a beauty trend that focuses on emphasizing your natural features and creating a healthy, dewy glow for your skin. You want to make it look as though your skin has been airbrushed. Unlike other makeup trends, soft glam focuses on a muted colour palette that flatters your natural colour and skin tone. You can imagine shades of flush pink, brown eyeliner, and simple nude lipstick.

‍

‍
With soft glam, the more understated the better. This aesthetic is a step up from the ‘no makeup’ look but carries across some of the same elements – including ditching your heavy-duty foundation for a softer and more buildable concealer and lightweight foundation.

‍
You want to make sure you’re covering your blemishes and accentuating your best features instead of trying to hide away under layers upon layers of makeup. If you’re looking to boost your confidence level, soft glam is a makeup look that will make you fall back in love with your skin.

‍
At the heart of this trend is smooth and radiant-looking skin. Although the colour palette will change from person to person, it’s all about blending the pigment into your skin to create a ‘soft’ look. Wave goodbye to your smoky eye and say hello to a more minimalistic and softer look.

‍

‍
Instead of the chiselled contouring look, soft glam calls for the ‘draping’ style of contouring. You’ll also find that cream and liquid products are the most popular formulas amongst soft glam makeup artists due to their easy blendability.

‍
One common misconception that we want to correct is the idea that you can’t use full coverage makeup for a soft glam look. You absolutely can, but you want to consider the techniques you’re using to apply your products, along with the type of products you’re using. Does your foundation cover all your imperfections but make your skin look cakey? If it does, then it’s time to ditch it.

‍

‍
You want to avoid any harsh lines or contrasts in colour and texture in your makeup look. Everything should look as natural and seamless as possible to give your skin a healthy glow and a radiant finish.

‍
It’s worth pointing out that – like all good things – you’ll need to show a little patience as you practice the soft glam makeup look. Like anything, you’ll need to learn the techniques and different products that are used to create the soft glam look. If you’re someone who usually wears heavier makeup, it might take you a while to wrap your head around the idea of soft glam.

‍

‍
post-summary: Are you a fan of the barely-there makeup trend? Are you ready to take it to the next level? ‘Soft glam’ is one of the biggest trends right now and takes the dewy, healthy glow from the barely-there look and elevates it with a radiant shine and airbrush finish.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: copper hair, hair trend, hair colore, copper trend, trend 2021
meta-description: We’re taking a look at the hottest hair colour trend of 2021 to help you determine whether it’s time to go for a Sansa Stark inspired look.
meta-title: Why Copper is the Hair Trend of 2021
name: Why Copper is the Hair Trend of 2021
post-body:
Change the hair. Change the woman. It’s a mantra that we live by.

‍
Copper hair is one of the most daring but wearable shades that you can choose when you decide to transform your look. One of the most famous copper hair moments came in Luc Besson’s 1997 classic sci-fi film ‘The Fifth Element’, when the movie’s hairstylist managed to convince Milla Jovovich to dye her hair a bright copper shade.

‍
Jovovich dyed her hair copper and as they say…the rest is history.

‍

‍
The beauty of the copper hue made Jovovich’s look timeless. As though she was from ancient Greek, while still looking as though she was from lightyears in the future. There’s something about copper red that is equal parts timeless and unnatural. It’s a shade that belongs to folklore and fairytale.

‍
The red copper hair trend is one of our favourites. Why? It’s one that almost everyone can jump on. Red is a universally flattering shade, meaning that there is a hue out there that will work for you. It’s all about working with your skin’s undertones to find the shade of red that will complement your features and brighten your complexion.

‍

‍
We’re taking a look at the hottest hair colour trend of 2021 to help you determine whether it’s time to go for a Sansa Stark inspired look. Our Instagram feed is full of celebrities who are giving the look a try, making us think that this trend is here for the long-term.

How to find the best copper shade for you

‍
Start by looking at your wrists to determine the undertones of your skin. If you have cool undertones, you’ll see blue and purple veins. If you have neutral undertones, you’ll see green and blue. Green and olive hues are a sign of warm undertones to your skin. If you have warm tones to your skin, you’ll naturally have a golden (or sometimes red) tint to your skin. Cooler tones tend to take on a more blue or violent tint to their skin. If you can’t figure out which you are then the chances are that you’re right in the middle as a neutral hue.

‍

‍
Once you know your undertones, go and meet your stylist to talk about finding the perfect complementary shade. You also don’t want to forget to ask them about the best way to maintain your new copper colour. Your salon will usually have a product line that they can recommend that works with the specific formula and dye that they used to achieve your copper hue.

‍

‍
One of the most popular hues for copper shades is a bright-auburn. Part of the popularity behind these copper shades is that they’re exciting, unexpected, and something different. All you have to do is look at how popular the #copperhair is on TikTok. The app dominates all the trends and usually calls the shots on what’s hot and what’s not. The hashtag has over 25 million views and climbing. We’d call that a trend.

‍

Why has copper hair become a trend

‍
There’s a reason why women often change their hair out of the blue. It’s mainly to be able to gain some sense of control over their life. Do you remember the early weeks and months of the pandemic? How many of your friends and family did you see using box dyes to change their hair? At one stage, box dye was one of the hardest beauty products to track down as we all found ways of trying to survive without our trusty hair stylist.

‍
When we get emotional, our hair is the first thing we reach for to control. It’s why we often say that we feel like “pulling our hair out” when we’re having a bad day. If you’re looking to change your outlook on life and shake up your look, copper hair might be just what you’re looking for.

‍

‍
Plenty of celebrities turned to the trend during the pandemic, including Bella Hadid who saw in 2021 with a Ginger Spice-inspired copper highlight look. Her sister Gigi quickly jumped on the trend, posting a photo with long copper auburn hair after her post-maternity debut back on the runway.

‍
Like the Hadid sisters have shown, you don’t have to jump off on the deep end with the copper trend. If you have brunette hair, you can even experiment with the hue by using balayage to help add a copper undertone to your hair without making too much of a statement.

What do you think of the copper hair trend? Are you ready to give the shade a go? Tell us your thoughts in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Copper hair is one of the most daring but wearable shades that you can choose when you decide to transform your look. One of the most famous copper hair moments came in Luc Besson’s 1997 classic sci-fi film ‘The Fifth Element’, when the movie’s hairstylist managed to convince Milla Jovovich to dye her hair a bright copper shade.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: beauty accounts, instagram, beauty tips, makeup
meta-description: We’re rounding up the 5 beauty accounts that everyone should be following on Instagram.
meta-title: 5 Beauty Instagram Accounts You Need to Follow
name: 5 Beauty Instagram Accounts You Need to Be Following
post-body:
Makeup is a form of living art. Whether it’s attempting to apply false eyelashes or nailing the art of the perfect winged eyeliner, everyone has felt frustrated by makeup at one time or another. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the ever changing trends (thanks TikTok), new techniques and products that seem to be popping up on social media every time we log onto our feed.

‍
That’s before you start to think about how you need to tailor your makeup routine to suit your style and appearance. Not everyone wants to look like Kim Kardashian, some people prefer the Y2K trend while others like a softer cottagecore inspired makeup look. It can be almost impossible to find a makeup guru that captures your attention, reflects your personality, and looks similar to you.

‍
Trust us. We’ve been there.

‍

‍

If you’re someone who wears makeup, the chances are that you’ve looked high and low for your beauty soulmate on social media. In reality, finding an influencer who uses the same types of products and has the same looks as you can be hard to find.

‍
One option you have is to switch up your makeup feed and look at accounts that offer makeup inspiration instead. These accounts can actually be more useful for your makeup journey than following influencers. You’ll get to see a blend of paid marketing, alongside organic content that the brand posts. You can get an insight into their products, learn how the professionals apply makeup, and even get recommendations on which influencers to follow.

‍
We’re rounding up the 5 beauty accounts that everyone should be following on Instagram. Trust us.

These  accounts will help you look at makeup in a whole new way.

‍

@gerardcosmetics‍

‍
Known for their lip products, Gerard Cosmetics’ Instagram page will help you find the perfect lipstick shade that works for your skin tone and complexion. This women-owned beauty brand has almost 2 million followers on Instagram and shares a mixture of tutorials, product posts, and memes that will make you stop scrolling and have a giggle.

‍

@toofaced

‍
Looking for up-close inspiration, makeup tutorials, and plenty of production recommendations? Too Face ticks all the boxes. It describes itself as a “serious makeup brand that knows how to have fun”. They’re famous for being one of the world’s leading cruelty-free beauty brands, incorporating fun and quirky packaging into their products and collections.

‍
One of their best-selling products in their ‘Better than Sex’ mascara – need we say more? If you want to find out more about their products, then the Too Faced Instagram is the perfect place to start.

‍

@nicoleguerriero

‍
With over 1.8 million Instagram followers, Nicole Guerriero is known for her YouTube channel where she posts classic content like vlogs, tutorials, and product hauls. We love that she uses her Instagram feed as a digest for her YouTube channel, making it easy to see what trends she’s experimenting with and products she’s using without having to head to YouTube.

‍

@tartecosmetics

‍
All hail Tarte Cosmetics! They’re the brand behind the infamous shape-tape concealer and a favourite amongst beauty influencers and celebrities. Whether you’re looking for funny memes to get you through your Monday blues or style inspiration, Tarte’s Instagram page has something to offer everyone.

‍
Their ‘high-performance natural beauty’ is a hit online. You’ll find promo codes and even a virtual try-on feature link in their Instagram bio.

‍

@kandeejohnson

‍
If you’ve been around on YouTube since the early days of the online beauty industry, you’ll know Kandee Johnson. She rose to fame with her impressive transformation videos – including turning herself into Barbie in 90 seconds. Her Instagram feed is just as impressive as her YouTube page and just as quirky.

‍
As a self-described “youtube pioneer of beauty and lifestyle”, Kandee has almost 2 million followers on Instagram. As a trained makeup artist, she’s the perfect beauty account to follow for beginners and makeup aficionados alike.

Who are your favourite beauty accounts to follow on Instagram? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Makeup is a form of living art. Whether it’s attempting to apply false eyelashes or nailing the art of the perfect winged eyeliner, everyone has felt frustrated by makeup at one time or another. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the ever changing trends (thanks TikTok), new techniques and products that seem to be popping up on social media every time we log onto our feed.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: Gen Z, activist, climate change activist, human rights, gen z power list
meta-description: We’re rounding up the most influential Gen-Zers who are using their social media platforms to rally us all around their causes.
meta-title: Meet the Future – The Gen-Z Power List
name: Meet the Future – The Gen-Z Power List
post-body:
The future is here. You may have heard of Forbes’ iconic “30 under 30” or “power lists”. We thought it was time to turn our attention to the next-generation of influencers, entrepreneurs, and leaders who are changing the industry from the inside. These Gen-Zers are fighting everything from the patriarchy to climate change and fast fashion.

‍
What makes these Gen-Zers unique is their ability to leverage social media to promote their causes, calling out injustice, and uniting us all behind their campaigns. While Millennials and even baby boomers are familiar with social media, Gen-Z were the first generation to grow up with digital technology in their everyday life.
As Gen-Zers are under 24, most of them don’t get the create that they deserve. Power lists often overlook them, and they don’t get the praise that they should have.

‍

‍
We’re rounding up the most influential Gen-Zers who are using their social media platforms to rally us all around their causes. Each of them is an advocate and visionary in their own right, whether it’s promoting the dangers of climate change or bringing attention to the struggles of the trans community.

‍

Greta Thunberg

‍
Perhaps the most famous member of Gen Z, Greta Thunberg is a climate change activist with Asperger’s that is regularly in the headlines for her revolutionary work. She first hit the news after starting her school climate strike in 2018, inspiring thousands of other children and teenagers to join her every Friday.

‍

‍
Even though she’s only a teenager, Greta has stood up on the world stage, engaged with international leaders, and even been nominated three times for the Nobel Peace Prize. You’ll regularly see Greta on the news as the ‘face’ of the Gen Z climate change coalition, working with organisations such as the United Nations to fuel change.

‍
You can stay up to date with Greta’s work through her Instagram page, where she has over 12 million followers.

‍

Emma Gonzalez

‍

Even if you don’t think you know her, the chances are that you’ve seen Emma on your TV screen. They’re one of the most well-known advocates for gun reform in the United States after surviving the Stoneman Douglas shooting in Florida in 2019. Emma – who uses they/them pronouns - was at the forefront of the ‘March for Our Lives’ movement, speaking in front of millions of people during the march on Washington.

‍

‍
One of their most well-known anti-gun speeches went viral on social media when they said that “we are going to be the kids you read about in textbooks”, promising to advocate for a change in gun regulations to prevent another school shooting.

‍
You can follow Emma on Instagram at @emmawise18.

‍

Georgia Rankin

‍
One of our favourite influencers is Georgia, who has over 700k subscribers on her YouTube page. She’s used her platform as an opportunity to speak out on societal stereotypes around disability, creating content that promotes body confidence. You’ll find the usual influencer content of shopping hauls and skincare routine, offering something for everyone.

‍

‍
Georgia appeared on the British TV show ‘This Morning’ in 2020, opening up about her life in a wheelchair and how it has boosted her confidence.

‍
You can join Georgia’s 200k+ followers by following her on Instagram.

‍

Amika George

‍
If you’re a member of Gen Z or know someone who is, you’ll be familiar with the various campaigns to end period poverty. Amika rose to popularity after launching her campaign to offer free period products for women and girl. After launching her campaign at just 17, Amika has become one of the most well-known figures within the movement to end period poverty.

‍

‍
Her not-for-profit group ‘Free Periods’ was launched in 2017, campaigning for women in need to have access to free period products. 2021 has seen the release of her first book ‘Make It Happen: How to Be an Activist’ that promotes itself as the handbook on activism.

‍
You can follow Amika’s fight to end period poverty through her Twitter page.

‍

Mikaela Loach

‍
Mikaela is a Global Citizen Prize nominee and a climate justice activist, all while being a medical student. She has more than 114k followers on Instagram, using her platform to campaign on issues like migrants rights, climate change, and opposing white supremacy. She recently visited 10 Downing Street to oppose the planned development of ‘Cambo field’ a new oil development.

‍

‍
You can find out more about Mikaela’s activism by following her Instagram page.

‍

Who would you put on your Gen Z power list? Is there anyone we missed? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: The future is here. You may have heard of Forbes’ iconic “30 under 30” or “power lists”. We thought it was time to turn our attention to the next-generation of influencers, entrepreneurs, and leaders who are changing the industry from the inside. These Gen-Zers are fighting everything from the patriarchy to climate change and fast fashion.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: jewellery trends, jewellery fall 2021, celebrity-inspired, jewellery fashion
meta-description: Keep reading to find out more about the celebrity-inspired jewellery trends that you can expect to see popping up on your social media feed.
meta-title: The Celebrity-Inspired Jewellery Trends
name: The Celebrity-Inspired Jewellery Trends That You Need to Know
post-body:
Fall brings with it the perfect opportunity to shake up your closet for the rest of the year. While there are classics that you’ll reach for every year like leather handbags and plaid scarves, there’s on accessory that you might be overlook. Jewellery has the power to elevate your look and take it to the next level within an instant.

‍
It’s time to wave goodbye to the dainty pieces that we wore during lockdown and saw hello to more dramatic, statement-worthy jewellery that will capture everyone’s attention. As you go out into the world, do so boldly with a statement piece of jewellery. Make Elizabeth Taylor proud.

‍

‍

Whether your jewellery is your new luck charm or fills you with nostalgic for a forgotten time, jewellery is an accessory that can quickly become your signature. If you want to wear your heart on your sleeve, then nothing does that better than your jewellery. Every piece tells a story and tells the world something new about you.

Shells and pearls

‍
One of Gigi Hadid’s classic jewellery signatures are shells and pearls. While you might think that this is a summer look, it’s a classic transitional style that you can wear through the first few weeks of fall 2021. Once the weather starts to get colder, ditch the shells and keep the pearls.

‍

‍
We think that shells and pearls are a match made in jewellery heaven. You’ll hardly ever notice the supermodel leave her home without wearing her signature shell necklace and pearl earrings. Don’t worry – these aren’t like the shell necklaces that you would have made as a trend.

‍
We love the shell necklace as it’s a unique and personal way to reconnect with the world around us. While we’re used to more earth-inspired pieces, the shell jewellery will remind you of days spend by the sea and the beauty of the beach and its oceans.

‍

‍
It’s worth pointing out the growing trends – and changes – amongst jewellery trends when it comes to pearls. It’s easy to think that pearls are something that your grandma would have worn – but they’re a timeless jewellery staple that will stand the test of time.

‍
In recent years, pearls have been given a modern upgrade. Tiffany’s are even running a #NotYourMother’sTiffanys campaign to show that classic pieces that pearls aren’t just for the older generation. If you’re looking to make an investment into your fall 2021 jewellery collection, pearls are the perfect splurge purchase.

‍

Bold stones

‍
Rihanna is no stranger to stepping out in bold colours and taking risks with her accessories. After all, she’s a singer-turned-makeup-mogul who is famous for her use of colour in her makeup products. One of the star’s favourite jewellery trends right now is multi-colored stones that are bright, dazzling, and unbelievably eye catching. We love how Rihanna always goes for an oversized jewellery piece when wearing bold stones, but you can easily swap it out for a smaller or more subtle shape if you want to keep your look more understanded.

‍

‍
Bold stones – including gemstones – will add colour to your jewellery box and help you create a myriad of looks.

‍

Dramatic earrings

‍
Whether we’re still wearing face masks in fall 2021 or finally free of them, there’s one jewellery piece we’re excited to start wearing. Dramatic earrings. The bigger, the better. Party season is right around the corner – whether it’s Halloween, Christmas, or even other occasion in between.

‍
Tassel dangle earrings are the perfect ones to wear for any fancy outing, and the good news is that it won't weigh your lobes down. Don’t let the fear of dramatic earrings weighing down on your ears put you off wearing them. Most jewellery designers go out of their way too choose lightweight materials that are easy to wear and versatile.

‍

‍
You can also look out for dramatic earrings that have jacket combos. These are just as fun and a modern take on the design of oversized drop earrings. Trust us, everyone's going to ask where you got your earrings from.
‍

The beauty of wearing dramatic and oversize earrings is that you can play down the rest of your look. You can keep everything from your hair to your makeup and the rest of your jewellery lowkey to let your earrings pop.
‍

Dramatic OTT earrings are always a good idea and the perfect way to finish off any look. Another style of drop earrings to look out for are floral prints. While Miranda Priestly might think florals for spring are ‘groundbreaking’, we think they’re pretty iconic for fall and winter.

Which of these celebrity-inspired jewellery trends will you be trying during fall 2021? What are your signature pieces? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Fall brings with it the perfect opportunity to shake up your closet for the rest of the year. While there are classics that you’ll reach for every year like leather handbags and plaid scarves, there’s on accessory that you might be overlook. Jewellery has the power to elevate your look and take it to the next level within an instant.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: TikTok beauty, tiktok trends, tiktok beauty trends, trends to try
meta-description: It proves that TikTok has the power to make both new and established beauty products go viral when it gives the product a vote of confidence.
meta-title: 3 Biggest TikTok Beauty Trends to Try Right Now
name: 3 Biggest TikTok Beauty Trends to Try Right Now
post-body:
If you grew up with the early YouTube beauty influencers and the makeup tutorials that would have taught you how to do makeup, you’ll be able to notice the special magic behind TikTok and its influencers. The intimacy of the app makes you more likely to take their recommendation, listen to their reviews, and likely to incorporate the trends from the app into real life. Most of the leading influencers on the app are millennials and Gen Z, some of whom are discovering certain trends for the first time.

‍
Whether you spend hours scrolling through your TikTok app or have never opened the platform, this article is for you. It gives you an insight into the trends that are dominating the platform and that you can expect to see more people rocking in real life. Another knock-on effect of TikTok trends is that it impacts which products beauty brands choose to release. If a beauty brand spots a trend about to go viral on TikTok, they’ll rush to get ahead of it.

‍

‍
Read on to find out more about 3 TikTok’s most viral beauty trends and how you can easily incorporate them into your routine with products that you’ll already have in your makeup bag or vanity case. Trust us. TikTok loves nothing more than a beauty hack that makes your life easier – which is exactly what you’ll find here.

‍

Lip contouring

‍
No, we aren’t talking about bringing back Kylie Jenner lips. Instead of doing some of Kylie’s weird and wonderful methods for getting fuller lips – remember the suction cups? – TikTok is on a mission to find new ways of contouring your lips. This TikTok beauty trend focuses on using a brown contour shade to outline your lips before blending it out, along with the rest of your contour. Adding your lips into your contouring routine means that you can make them look more voluminous and add an unmistakable pout to your lips.

‍

Freckles

‍
What makes TikTok different is that most of its trends are influenced by filters on the app instead of real life things. After TikTok launched a freckle filter a few weeks ago, our feed has been full of users sharing their tips and tricks on how to give yourself faux freckles. Don’t worry, you don’t need to invest in a freckle pen if you don’t want to.

‍

‍
All you need is a brow or eyeliner pencil/gel and a precision brush. Dab the pigment across your nose and cheeks, where freckles would naturally be, before pressing down on the pigment with the brush.

‍
Voila! You have freckles.

‍

Blush placement

‍
Did you know that where you place your blush can drastically change the appearance of your face? The right placement can give you face a slimming effect and make it look elongates. Put it a few inches the wrong way and it can make your face look puffy and unattractive. Liquid and cream blush are the go-to products of choice for TikTok users, who typically find that the formulas are easier to blend for a more natural-looking finish.

‍

‍
These videos will show you a side-by-side comparison of how blush placement can change your appearance. Trust us. Once you’ve watched this video above, you’ll never do your makeup the same way again. We’re big fans of the sunkissed look, but there are others you can try as well.

‍
If you thought putting bush across your nose was crazy, just wait until she see other ways you can be placing your blush across your face.

‍

What do you think of these TikTok beauty trends? Which one is your go-to? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

It gives you an insight into the trends that are dominating the platform and that you can expect to see more people rocking in real life. Another knock-on effect of TikTok trends is that it impacts which products beauty brands choose to release. If a beauty brand spots a trend about to go viral on TikTok, they’ll rush to get ahead of it.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
