keywords: fall looks, fall outfits, fashion ideas, outfit ideas
meta-description: This guide shares 6 easy ways for you to add a fashionable twist to any outfit. These 6 tips will be a gamechanger for your closet and outfit ideas.
meta-title: 6 Outfit Ideas to Get Your outfits Ready for Fall
name: 6 Outfit Ideas to Get Your outfits Ready for Fall
post-body:
It’s easy to look at photos of supermodels and influencers during fashion week and think, “I can never look that good”. It might sound cheesy, but the only way you’re going to become fashionable is by changing that mindset and discovering your inner confidence.

‍
Your confidence level is the number one deciding factor on how fashionable your outfit is going to be. A confident person can even make a garbage bag look like haute couture.

‍
Remember, you’re the one wearing the clothes. Not the other way around.

‍

‍
It might be possible that one of the outfits in our list below feels outside of your comfort zone. That’s okay! But it’s good to experiment from time to time – even if it’s a small change to help you figure out if there’s another style out there that you prefer.

‍
The power behind your fashionable outfits come from your attitude and confidence. You want to make sure to incorporate positive affirmations and manifesting into your morning routine to help you head out the door with right mindset. If you want easy and fool-proof tips on how to make any outfit fashionable, then you’re in the right place.

‍
This guide shares 6 easy ways for you to add a fashionable twist to any outfit – whether you’re rocking laidback loungewear and taking centre stage with special occasion wear. Trust us.

‍

Wear layers, layers, and more layers

‍
Layers are for more than just keeping you warm. Layers are an easy way to add texture and colour into your outfit. The beauty of wearing layers is that you don’t have to worry about one piece throwing it all off. You can wear a crisp white shirt under a dress, add a cardigan, and even a jacket to change up the look.

‍
Wearing layers can help you get the most out of your favourite pieces and make them appropriate for every season – taking your summer essentials right through to autumn and winter.

‍

Swap out your footwear

‍
If you want to change up your fashion looks, start with your feet. Trust us. Nothing will make you feel more different than stepping into a new pair of shoes. If you’re loyal to your favourite sneakers, swap them out for ballet shoes or a stiletto heel to give you an entirely new look. It might feel odd at first, but it’s a change that everyone will notice.

‍

Add different proportions to your look

‍
Play with proportions and sizes when choosing layers to add to your look. Think of wearing an oversized shirt with cut-off shorts or a crop top under an oversized jacket. The different proportions and contrasting shapes elevate your look and gives your pieces a whole new appearance. You can also play with proportions by mixing and matching different textiles, silhouettes, materials, and structures.

‍

Let your shirt hang out

‍
Most of us were told growing up that your shirt has to always be tucked in. While you’ll usually need to do this for work, it’s not a rule that has to dominate your life. The next time you’re wearing a shirt or sweater, grab the front of the garment and loosely untuck it from your skirt or trousers.

‍
Part of the secret to creating a fashionable outfit is to make it look as effortless and fuss-free as possible.

‍

Add a hat

‍
Are you having a bad hair day? Forgot your dry shampoo at the office? Hats are one fashion accessory that we often overlook, but they can help to add definition to your outfit as a statement accessory. You can change up your look in an instant just by adding a trusty hat.

‍

Supermodel-worthy sunglasses

‍
When you’re looking at paparazzi photos of influencers and celebrities, you’ll notice that everyone wears sunglasses – even when the sun isn’t out. If there’s something missing from your outfit, try experimenting with a pair of sunglasses. You want to make sure you find a style that works with your eye shape. The golden rule of thumb is to choose a silhouette that is opposite to your eye shape to flatter your features.

‍
Which of these fashion tips will you be trying out? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: This guide shares 13 easy ways for you to add a fashionable twist to any outfit – whether you’re rocking laidback loungewear and taking centre stage with special occasion wear. Trust us. These 13 tips will be a gamechanger for your closet and outfit ideas.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: tiktok, beauty, trends, beauty on tiktok, influencers
meta-description: Read on to find out more about 3 TikTok’s most viral beauty trends and how you can easily incorporate them into your routine.
meta-title: 3 Viral TikTok Beauty Trends That Everyone is stil
name: 3 Viral TikTok Beauty Trends That Everyone is still Talking About
post-body:
TikTok is the king of trends. The viral video-sharing app has become the unlikely home of fashion and beauty trends (along with just about everything else!) online. Do you want to lean how to make whipped lemonade? Go to TikTok. Do you want a review on the latest Kylie Cosmetic collection? It’ll be on TikTok. Do you want to shake up your makeup routine? TikTok is the perfect place to start looking. While Instagram has had its day in the sun, TikTok is able to turn a viral video into a trial quickly than you can say “video sharing”.

‍


While TikTok is famous for its sub-cultures and influencers, the beauty community is one of the most important and powerful on the app. They had the potential to make or break any product with just one video. They’re the next-generation of beauty influencers, using short videos to create everything from tutorials to product haul. The app has a mixture of professional MUAs with those who are passionate about the industry and want to share their tips and tricks with the world.

‍
Although we often get caught up thinking about TikTok’s viral content or that which revolves around astrology signs, the beauty niche on TikTok is the power behind the throne. Almost every product trend that you’re seeing right now has come from the video sharing app. Gone are the days when YouTube and Instagram reigned supreme. When TikTok finds a product that it loves, it sells out for weeks on end. When TikTok finds a trend that it loves, you’ll see it everywhere.

‍

Colourful lashes

‍
Thanks to the pandemic, we’ve shifted the focus of our makeup towards our eyes. Just think of how long you spend wearing a face mask in your day-to-day life. Most of us have ditched liquid lipsticks and a full face of makeup in favour of playing up our eye makeup. If you scroll through Instagram, most of the makeup videos are talking about eye makeup trends or products.

‍
Eyes are the window to your soul – and they’ve never been more important than now. Monochromatic makeup is a trend in its own right on TikTok but it’s one that not everyone wants to recreate. After all, would you wear the same colour on your lids, cheeks, and lips?

‍

‍
This new TikTok trend is about having fun with your eyelashes. Don’t worry. You don’t need to rush out and buy an oddly-shaded mascara. This TikTok DIY hack is easy to do at home, with products you’ll already have.
All you need is false eyelashes, concealer, and loose pigment. What you’re going to go is give your falsies a new lease on life with colour. Take the concealer and place it all over your falsies before letting them dry. Take the pigment and go to down with it as you apply it over the falsies. You can choose any colour that works for you or compliments your skin tone. Jewel tones are among the most popular.

‍
You can create a more seamless look by taking the pigment that you applied onto the falsies and using it to create a dramatic winged eyeliner. You can do this by taking the pigment and adding a few drops of your normal liquid eyeliner to give it the intense colour.

‍
With the holiday season just around the corner, this is one TikTok makeup trend that you want to be experimenting with. With this trend still going viral on TikTok, we wouldn’t be surprised to see models going down the catwalk wearing the dramatic coloured lashes in just a few weeks.

‍

‍

Contour Mapping

‍
TikTok is no stranger to doing things differently. The app is infamous for taking makeup routines and doing them in reverse. One thing that users of the app have been searching for is the perfect way to seamlessly apply foundation and other cream and liquid face products for a Goddess-inspired look.

‍
Here is where contour mapping comes in.

‍

‍
No, it’s not someone wearing a mask – but you can be forgiven for thinking that. Contour mapping involves drawing dozens and dozens of tiny squares on your face, filling them in with the different colors for that specific area. There’s no science behind it, so it’s all about trusting your cut and putting the right colour in each spot.

‍
TikTok is still debating whether it’s pro or anti this trend, given that it’s not the easiest one to recreate when you’re rushing out the door. However, it’s fascinating to watch and shows the artform that is makeup.

But if you want to know HOW TO APPLY BLUSH LIKE A PROFESSIONAL MAKEUP ARTIST click here.

‍

Complexion perfectors

‍
If there’s one type of product that TikTok loves – its any that promises to give them a flawless base with a healthy glow. These so-called ‘complexion perfectors’ are amongst the most popular products to be reviewed on the video-sharing app. In the last few weeks, TikTok reviews have led to rise in sales for products like the KVD Vegan Beauty ‘Good Apple Skin-Perfecting Foundation Balm’ and Charlotte Tilbury’s ‘Hollywood Flawless Filter’.

‍
With TikTok’s obsession for creating ‘soft glam’ and skinimalist makeup looks, it’s no surprise that these kind of products are always going viral on TikTok. Users are looking for base products that will deliver high-quality results without clogging their pores or weighing down their skin. When TikTok finds one of these products, they quickly go viral.

‍

‍
If you’re on the beauty side of TikTok (which you probably are if you’re reading this article), we can guarantee that you’ve seen videos of people comparing these complexion perfecting products. While the KVD foundation balm reviews came out when the product was new, the Charlotte Tilbury product is one of the brand’s oldest and most established items.

‍
It proves that TikTok has the power to make both new and established beauty products go viral when it gives the product a vote of confidence. Beauty brands are more keen than ever to get their products in the hands on TikTok influencers in the hopes of recreating this success for their own brand.

What do you think of these TikTok beauty trends? Which one is your go-to? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: TikTok is the king of trends. The viral video-sharing app has become the unlikely home of fashion and beauty trends (along with just about everything else!) online. Do you want to lean how to make whipped lemonade? Go to TikTok. Do you want a review on the latest Kylie Cosmetic collection? It’ll be on TikTok. Do you want to shake up your makeup routine? TikTok is the perfect place to start looking. While Instagram has had its day in the sun, TikTok is able to turn a viral video into a trial quickly than you can say “video sharing”.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: Sustainability Influencers, eco tips, eco friendly
meta-description: If you’re not sure where to start with sustainability or how to incorporate it into your lifestyle, these influencers are the best place to start.
meta-title: The 10 Sustainability Influencers You Need to Know
name: The 10 Sustainability Influencers You Need to Follow
post-body:
When we’re in need of inspiration, we always turn to our favourite influencers. While you might think of influencers as being people trying to sell you a product, they can also be people who advocate for a type of lifestyle. Meet sustainability influencers.

They’re your online gurus in the art of sustainability, helping you to understand the often complex reality of the lifestyle. If you’re not sure where to start with sustainability or how to incorporate it into your lifestyle, these influencers are the best place to start.

‍

‍

One reason why we turn to influencers is that they can make a topic more personal and relatable. It’s easy to think that becoming sustainable means that you have to miss out on all the best things in life or spend all your time trying to find alternatives to plastic.

Sustainability influencers will teach you tips and tricks on how to easily incorporate more sustainable practices into your daily routine. They’ll also teach you the idea that some of the smallest changes can make the biggest impact.

When their posts come up on your feed, it helps to keep the importance of sustainability at the front of your mind. It also acts as a wake-up call amongst the hundreds of posts telling you that you need a new fast fashion dress or promoting a plastic product that is destined to end up on land-fill.

‍

‍

Whether you want to be educated or entertained, sustainability influencers have something to offer anyone who is interested in adopting a more sustainable lifestyle. Sometimes, you need a little helping hand along the way – which is where influencers come in. You can put your social media to good use by helping these influencers boost and amplify their message of sustainability to a larger audience to help make meaningful change to protect our planet.

Whether you already follow sustainable influencers or want to find out more about the lifestyle, we’re rounding up 10 people that you need to be following. Each of them adds a personal touch to the idea of sustainability, helping to educate you with tips and tricks that will expand your horizons and encourage you to create a more earth-friendly lifestyle.

It’s easy to think that every influencer is obsessed with their follower count, buying designer handbags, or jetting off on luxury holidays. These 10 sustainability influencers are down-to-earth and friendly, opening up the world of sustainability to everyone. Here are the ten sustainable influencers that you need to be following:

‍

Leah Thomas @greengirlleah

‍
Leah Thomas is an environmentalist with a creative flair. She’s a writer and the founder of the @intersectinalenvironmentalist movement on social media. The platform acts as a resource hub for anyone new to the sustainability movement or who wants to find out more about the intersection between social and environmental justice. If you want to learn something new and be educated online through engaging content, Leah is your new Insta bestie.

‍
With over 220k followers, Leah is a self-entitled ‘climate optimist’, who promotes the idea of making progress as being better than perfection. Her sustainable living lessons will help you feel welcomed into the community and allow you to grow and develop on your journey towards an eco-friendlier life.

‍

Immy Lucas - @sustainably_vegan

‍
Immy Lucas is a video creator who describes herself as a ‘seasonal eater’, promoting the idea of sustainability and outdoor adventures on her social media platform. Her feed is about more than just living sustainability and reducing waste. Immy focuses on the art of seasonal eating and saving the planet by eating fruits and vegetables that are in season, instead of importing food.

‍
If you’re looking for mouth-watering food and beautiful outdoor adventures, Immy is the perfect sustainability influencer to follow. Trust us. You’ll be wanting to jet off on an adventure to the mountain with a basic of fresh fruit in no time.

‍

Jasmine Roders – @thatcurlytop

‍
Jasmine has one of the brightest colour palettes you’ll find anywhere on Instagram. She uses her platform to promote sustainable fashion and lifestyle changes. While most fashion influencers focus on fast fashion, Jasmine likes to take it slow with ethical and sustainable fashion brands. If you’re struggling to find eco-friendly fashion, Jasmine is your new personal stylist.

‍
If you’re a fan of the Y2K trend or appreciate year-round pastel shades and bold hues, you’ll feel right at home on Jasmine’s Instagram feed.

‍

Auri Jackson - @aurijackson

‍
Auri is an environmental writer and film director who is committed to being “imperfectly zero waste”. She’s another sustainability influencer who advocates the idea of being imperfect with your sustainability vs. doing nothing at all. Her quirky and wholesome content takes a look at the realistic side of living as sustainable lifestyle.

‍

Monika Poppy - @sustainabilityiscool

When it comes to Instagram handles, this one won us over right away. Sustainability is cool and its more than just a buzzword for the beauty and fashion industry. What we love about Monika’s profile is that it’s not what most people expect from a sustainability social channel. It’s quirky name is juxtaposed by editorial style content that makes it feel like a luxury fashion blog.

Monika uses her platform to promote the idea of progressive alternatives to bring sustainability to your life. Her platform has been featured on websites like Forbes, Glamour, Sky, and Stylist. How much more of an endorsement do you need?

If for nothing else, follow this account just to prove that sustainability is cool.

‍

Kathryn Kellog - @going.zero.waste

Achieving a zero waste lifestyle is something that we all are striving towards. Kathryn takes you on her journey of going zero waste, sharing her experience with over 300k+ followers on Instagram. She’s one of the most recognisable faces within the sustainability movement and uses her platform to spread positivity and love.

Kathryn gives her followers tips on becoming eco-friendly and how to master the art of frugal living. She even has a free crash course in sustainability.

‍

Shelbi - @shelbizlee

What we love about Shelbi’s platform is that she uses it promote an inclusive and body positive message alongside her sustainability content. Her bio carries the quote that, “you cannot do all the good that the world needs, but the world needs all the good that you can do”. The message perfectly encapsulates the importance of the sustainability movement and how it focuses on us all playing our role in making the world a better place.

A self-described “eco-minimalist”, Shelbi takes you behind the scenes of her sustainable life, while sharing engaging graphics to give you tips and tricks on becoming more earth-friendly.

‍

Jessica Clifton - @impactforgood

‍
Another influencer who describes themselves as promoting “imperfect sustainability” is Jessica Clifton. Her platform focuses on making sustainable living easier to achieve, sharing affordable alternatives to the premium eco-friendly brands. She also shares easy tips on how to battle against consumerism and overconsumption to make a sustainable lifestyle work for you.

‍
Jessica has over 105k+ followers on Instagram and donates 3% of her earnings to ocean conservation.

‍

Jhanneu - @jhanneu

‍
Are you looking for a sustainability influencer who makes you feel like you’re following a luxury influencer? You need Jhanneu in your life. Her platform focuses on sharing tips for low-waste living and on making sustainability more inclusive. Jhanneu is a “low waste expert making sustainable living inclusive” and has been featured on platforms like Forbes and Goodful.

‍
Amongst photos of Jhanneu’s global trotting adventures, you’ll get useful tips and tricks on how to create a more sustainable lifestyle.

‍

Bea Johnson - @zerowastehome

‍
Bea was described by CNN as “the mother of the zero waste lifestyle”, having lived trash-free for over 13 years. Bea is a motivational speaker and the author of ‘Zero Waste Home’, which has been re-published in 27 languages. A zero waste home is something that we’re all striving towards – but it’s something that Bea has been rocking for years.

‍
Who is your favourite sustainability influencer to follow? Drop their handle into the comments below!

‍
post-summary: When we’re in need of inspiration, we always turn to our favourite influencers. While you might think of influencers as being people trying to sell you a product, they can also be people who advocate for a type of lifestyle. Meet sustainability influencers.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: nails, autumn manicure, nail trends, nail ideas
meta-description: No outfit is complete without a coat of polish – whether you’re a fan of avant-garde nail art or a classic.Here are 13 nail art ideas to try in autumn 2021:
meta-title: The Nail Trend Ideas to See Through Autumn
name: The Nail Trend Ideas to See Through Autumn to Winter
post-body:
Booking in for a manicure is the ultimate act of self-care. It’s an opportunity to take some time to relax and unwind. Our nail techs are our unofficial therapist, listening to our problems while giving us a new nail look. With summer changing to autumn, it’s the perfect time to book in to see your favourite nail tech and change up your look. You don’t have to say goodbye to pastel and bright shades, but it’s a chance to try out more understated nail art trends.

No outfit is complete without a coat of polish – whether you’re a fan of avant-garde nail art or a classic French manicure with a pastel twist. Whether you’re heading back into the office for the first time in months or preparing for the Halloween season, these are the autumn nail art trends for 2021.

Trust us. Any of these nail trends would look ‘peng’ on your Instagram feed. You want to make sure to bookmark this page or screenshot your favorite nail art to recreate with a DIY manicure at home or to take to your next nail appointment. Here are 13 nail art ideas to try in autumn 2021:

‍

80s-inspired Powerpuff Girls

We love Powerpuff Girls-inspired nail art that screams 80s chic. Is there anything more fun than pastel hearts? Heart beam nails are everywhere we look on Instagram, incorporating ‘80s trends with a cartoon feel. You can keep it classic with bold red and pink hues or mix it up with warmer hues to give the look an autumn feel.

‍

Heads in the clouds

Cloud nails are one of the biggest trends for summer 2021 and the perfect transitional nail art to see you through to autumn. These cartoon-inspired clouds are easy to recreate at home. All you need is an art brush and white polish. You can recreate the sky with a blue polish or go with darker shade to reflect the changing of the season.

‍

‍

Cuticle Accents

Most of us focus our nail art on the top of our nails. For autumn 2021, we’re turning this look on its head and adding the accents at the cuticles. It shows that the simplistic change can transform how your nails look. This half-moon shape is easy to recreate at home or for your nail technician to create for you, using your favourite shades. It’s best to keep your nails uniform with one classic shade and then choose a metallic colour for your accents.

‍
This nail art trend will see you through the holiday and party season, giving you an understated but sophisticated look that works for cocktail parties, work functions, and Halloween events.

‍

‍

Mix and Match Your Nails

Instead of sticking to one nail art for your manicure, why not ask your nail technician to mix and match designs? Why have one look when you can have two?

‍
This ‘60s inspired look nail art is on trend and is perfect for autumn, adding flower power as the seasons start to change. You can make the trend your own by choosing a solid colour for three nails and adding a fun pattern to your index and middle finger.

If you’re feeling adventurous, take it to the next level and wear a different colour on each nail. Your nail technician will suggest a combination of colours that work together or you can choose your favourites!

For autumn, you can focus on warm and earth-tone shades. As Halloween comes around, don’t be afraid to play with hues of orange and black for a pumpkin-inspired look.

‍

‍

Butterflies

Embrace your inner Taylor Swift or Kacey Musgrave with butterfly nail art this autumn. You can DIY them with nail stickers or ask your nail tech to recreate your favourite butterflies, whether you prefer a blue or pink look. You want to keep it classic wand let the butterflies pop with a pale polish as your base and a clear coat to seal it all in.

‍

‍

Somewhere over the rainbow

Autumn is a time of change. You might be starting college, moving abroad, or entering a new stage of life. If you want to experiment with your nail art without going out of your comfort zone, try rainbow French nails. You get the classic look of a French manicure with the modern twist of a rainbow tip. You can even take the illusion of a rainbow and instead incorporate your favourite colour palette for a personalised look.

‍

‍

Classic Red Shades

When in doubt, wear classic red polish. These nails are perfect for special occasions or if you need nail art that works for everything on your social calendar. You can make this look contemporary by adding in different hues of red. This monotone trend is elegant and can be swapped out with other colors like pastels or jewel hues as an accent shade.

‍

Stars and rainbows

‍Y2K trends are everywhere we look, including for nail art. These stars and rainbow nails are customizable, allowing you to choose the color and star style to fit your personality. Choose your favourite color palette and mix and match the rainbow tips with star accent nails. You can use the stars as an accent on your ring finger or rotate between the two styles.

‍

Glitter Everything

Glitter is a season-less nail art trend that we love to rock all-year long. Bring some glitter to your nails for a fun look that you can make your signature nail art. Glitter nails can add something fun to your look or help you celebrate a special occasion, whether it’s a birthday or a wedding.

Don’t want to change up your signature look too much? Take your usual choice of nail art and add a touch of glitter for a fun look.

‍

Abstract Nail Art

One of the biggest trends in nail art right now is abstract shapes. It’s a way of taking a colour palette and making it your own, adding your personality into your nail art. You start with a classic base color and then turn it into a statement with an abstract shapes. You can keep it simple with wave-inspired lines that interlock and mix match with each other.

Your abstract shapes can come in every size and can be placed anywhere on your nails. You might decide to keep them all uniform or change the colour for each of your nail. Your nail tech will help you choose a style that works for you.

‍

Rainbow French Tips

Do you want something but more understated look for autumn? We have just the thing! One trend we’re seeing everywhere on Instagram is coloured French tips. While pastel hues are the most popular, you can change up this trend for autumn by choosing warm shades of yellow and orange. You can choose one colors for each fingernail or keep the colors the same for each hand.

It’s an elegant look that lets you have fun with your nails without being too loud or outlandish with its finish. It’s the perfect nail art for when you’re first experimenting with colour.

‍

The side Frenchie

‍
For most of us, a French manicure is our go-to as an understated nail art style that will never let you down. Do you want to upgrade your classic French tips? We’ve already included a few ideas in this article, but side frenchies are the latest nail art trend to go viral. It’s all about creating a crescent moon shape to your tips, moving it off centre with a side-swoosh, thinning the polish as it travels down your nail.

‍

70s Inspired Look

‍
70s-inspired trends are everywhere you look right now in the beauty world. You can inject a little of the 70s bohemian look into your nail art by choosing a different style for each nail. It’s the perfect way to add personality to your look. Keep the colours palette warm to fit the autumnal season, and add in your favourite symbols, whether it’s pink polka dots or an upbeat smiley face. Flowers are a classic motif for this nail art trend, giving you a chance to add earth-tone shades for autumn into your look.

Which of these nail art trends is your favourite? Do you book yourself in for regular manicures or do you prefer to do it yourself? Let us know about your nail routine in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Booking in for a manicure is the ultimate act of self-care. It’s an opportunity to take some time to relax and unwind. Our nail techs are our unofficial therapist, listening to our problems while giving us a new nail look. With summer changing to autumn, it’s the perfect time to book in to see your favourite nail tech and change up your look. You don’t have to say goodbye to pastel and bright shades, but it’s a chance to try out more understated nail art trends.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: fashion looks, fashion trends, fashionable, easy fashionable steps
meta-description: This guide shares 7 easy ways for you to add a fashionable twist to any outfit. These 7 tips will be a gamechanger for your closet and outfit ideas.
meta-title: How to Look Instantly More Fashionable
name: How to Look Instantly More Fashionable In 7 Easy Steps
post-body:
Trying to become more fashionable doesn’t meant that you have to splurge on a whole new closet. In fact, becoming more fashionable is easier than you think. It’s all about mastering the art of subtle styling tricks and knowing when to wear the right clothing. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed by different trends in the fashion industry. Can we let you in on the secret?

People who are truly fashionable don’t let trends dominate their closet. They’re confident in their style and aren’t obsessed about wearing the latest must-have item from Zara or Bottega Veneta. Instead, they focus on subtle styling features that instantly elevated their outfit – it can be something as simple as adding layers to their outfit or throwing on oversized sunglasses to finish off their look. Here are 4 FASHION TRENDS FOR 2021 YOU ALREADY OWN.

Trust us. It’s the simple things that count.

These 7 tips will be a gamechanger for your closet and outfit ideas.

‍

Colour coordination 101

‍
How often do you stop and plan your outfits around a colour palette? We’ve all woke up and ended up putting on two clashing colours. Instead of choosing your outfit around specific pieces, shift your focus to choosing two or three colours to form the colour palette for your outfit. Once you’ve got your colours, use them to help you pick the right clothes and accessories to create your outfit. You can even incorporate the hues into your makeup routine.

‍
It’s a good idea to choose colours that naturally flatter your complexion and features. You can incorporate signature colours like blue and lavender, or choose a more minimalistic colour palette of neutral and earth-tone shades.

‍

Mixing textures

‍
Get some texture into your look by mixing and matching different fabrics to give you an elevated and effortlessly chic look. You’re guaranteed to have more than one texture in your closet. You can style a ribbed knitted sweater with denim jeans and leather boots or contrast a silk blouse with suede shoes.

‍
Textures help to add definition to your outfit, giving you an instantly elevated look. You can keep your textures all within the same colour family for a subtle look or go all out by incorporating bold colours to emphasise the different textures.

‍

Don’t be afraid of colour

‍
Everyone has a signature colour that reflects their personality. Whether you’re Elle Woods with a hint of pink or prefer to wear emerald green, you can never go wrong by adding a pop of colour to your outfit. People often assume that there are rules for wearing colour. In reality, you can mix and match any hues that catch your eye.

‍
Don’t be afraid to experiment with pastels, neutrals, and neon hues in one outfit to help you stand out from the crowd.

‍

Wear a matching set

‍
Channel your inner Blair Waldorf with a matching set. This outfit screams Parisian chic and is both timeless while feeling contemporary and in-trend all at once. You can invest in a coordinating two-piece from your favourite brand or buy a budget-friendly option from a high-street store. While a skirt suit is the classic option, you can experiment with a pantsuit or a knit set for a fun twist.

‍
Once you have your matching set, choose your accessories and footwear to go with them. You’ll usually want your matching set to take centre stage, incorporating the main colours into your accessories.

‍

Blazer with a graphic tee

‍
In the last 18 months, fashion trends have turned on their head and become more casual and laidback than ever before. If you want to achieve the ‘high low’ look of blending athleisure with workwear, a blazer and graphic tee is the easiest way to re-create the look. It’s both laidback and dressed up at once, meaning it works for anywhere you’re going to.

‍

Stick to monochromes

‍
When in doubt, go monochrome. If you’re looking for an easy fashionable look, choose one hue to create your outfit around and stick to it. You’ll want to avoid choosing a hue that matches your hair, but you want one that does complement your skin tone and complexion.

‍
A monochrome outfit makes getting dressed even easier and helps you to narrow down your outfit choices by keeping your look in one colour from head-to-toe. You can keep your monochrome shade neutral or go for a pop of colour to stand out.

‍

Throw your jacket over your shoulder

‍
Your jacket isn’t a jacket, it’s a cape. If you look back at photos of Old Hollywood stars like Maria Callas, Grace Kelly, and Elizabeth Taylor, you’ll notice one thing in common. They always wore their jackets over their shoulders. It’s an effortlessly chic look that helps to keep you arm while adding an elevated feel to your outfit. It’s perfect for layering over dresses or as a transitional styling tip as the temperatures start to drop.

‍
post-summary: Trying to become more fashionable doesn’t meant that you have to splurge on a whole new closet. In fact, becoming more fashionable is easier than you think. It’s all about mastering the art of subtle styling tricks and knowing when to wear the right clothing. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed by different trends in the fashion industry. Can we let you in on the secret?

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: tikTok beauty, TikTok beauty hacks, TikTok makeup, Gen Z makeup
meta-description: We’re sharing seven Gen Z makeup hacks that are taking over TikTok, helping to shape the beauty trends for autumn and winter 2021.
meta-title: The Gen Z Makeup Hacks Taking Over TikTok
name: The Gen Z Makeup Hacks Taking Over TikTok
post-body:
TikTok is where we all go for the latest trend. The video sharing app experienced a turbo charge of growth during the pandemic, going from a niche platform to the app that is calling the shots for every trend. It’s YouTube for the next-generation of wannabe makeup artists and beauty enthusiasts. Gen Z are everywhere you look on the app, bringing in new trends and genius makeup hacks that we never knew we needed.

‍
After years of watching 20-minute long YouTube tutorials, TikTok videos have a unique appeal as easy-to-watch content that gets right to the point. Gen Z makeup is all about taking risks, trying something new, and finding ways to achieve dewy, flawless skin with a minimalistic routine.

‍

‍
Gone are the days of heavy contouring, replaced with draping and light-handed techniques that focus on giving the appearance of a radiant glow. While you’ll find plenty of examples of ‘social media makeup’ on TikTok, most of the hacks focus on embracing the natural beauty trends that have dominated 2021.

‍
We’re sharing seven Gen Z makeup hacks that are taking over TikTok, helping to shape the beauty trends for autumn and winter 2021. Whether you’re a newbie to the world of beauty or a makeup aficionado, everyone has something to learn from these makeup hacks.
These hacks are a gamechanger for your everyday makeup routine, helping you create a supermodel-worthy look with products you probably already have in your makeup bag. Read on to find out how to incorporate these clever makeup hacks into your routine. Trust us. They’re easier than you think.

‍

The flawless skin makeup hack

‍
With the natural beauty trend, the focus is on creating a flawless base to give your skin a dewy glow. It’s one reason why skincare has come to dominate the beauty industry in recent months. You want to give the illusion of healthy skin that unlocks your natural radiance. As the saying goes, “fake it till you make it”.

‍
Danielle Marcan, a “makeup guru wannabe” on the video-sharing app, shared her easy ‘flawless’ skin makeup hack. It works by reversing your makeup routine to start with your blush, contour, and highlighter before moving onto your foundation. While this might seem like you’re applying your makeup on backwards, it’s not unusual for some of the best hacks to swap up the order of your products.

‍
This hack starts by applying contour to define your face, adding a pop of blush and highlighter for a natural shine and flush. You add on your foundation with a brush for buildable coverage before blending everything together with a beauty blush.

‍
The results? A seamless and flawless base that gives you a goddess-worthy glow.

‍
Pro-tip! This makeup hack is easier to recreate when you use liquid and cream-based products for easy blendability.

‍

‍

How to apply setting spray for all-day wear

‍
Ever since the Urban Decay all-nighter spray came out, we’ve been using setting spray religiously to keep our makeup in place. No one wants to put in the effort of spending time applying your makeup every morning, only for it to melt off your face by lunch. While setting spray can be a miracle worker, you might just be using it wrong.

‍
This makeup hack comes courtesy of @kevikodra, who showed us the best way to get the most out of our setting spray. Instead of applying it directly to your skin, you want to spray it onto a damp beauty blender until it becomes wet. You want to bounce the beauty blend onto the back of your hand to help it absorb into the sponge.

‍
Start by pressing the beauty blender into your skin, working from the areas where you usually apply highlighter. It helps to give your skin a dewy, healthy glow while allowing the setting spray to settle into your skin to prevent any residue.

‍

‍

Where to place your blush

‍
One of the first makeup lessons we ever learned was to apply blush to the apples of your cheek. You have to smile – but not too brightly – to help find the so-called perfect placement. What most of us don’t realise is that the placement of your blush can drastically change the appearance of your face. If it’s too low, it can make your face appear longer and fuller. If you raise your blush a little, you can give the illusion of a natural face lift to slim your face.

‍
This makeup hack by @meganlavallie takes you through how to correctly place your blush, depending on your desired look. If you’re going for a natural contour, Megan shows you how to give your cheeks a slimmer appearance or create the appearance of a sun-kissed glow.
Watch the video and find your perfect blush placement to help you achieve your must-have makeup look.

‍

‍

The Bratz-inspired lip liner hack

‍
For years, we’ve been recreating Kylie Jenner’s signature overlined look for giving our lips the appear of being naturally plumper and larger. As the Y2K trend has taken over TikTok, it’s no surprise that Gen Z are looking to the era for their makeup inspiration.
This lip liner hack takes its inspiration from the Bratz dolls that were popular in the early-to-mid 2000s that most Gen Zs would have grown up playing with as a child.

‍
This makeup hack is also known as ‘lip wings’ as it starts by working from the corner of your lips, winging it outwards, until they join. It might remind you of a cat-wing eyeliner with the definition that it gives to your lips. This hack calls for using a darker shade around your lips before filling in to finish off your look.

‍
You can do this hack either with a traditional lip liner or by using a lip brush with your favourite lipstick for greater control and a creamer consistency.

‍

‍

The filter-worthy faux freckle hack

‍
We’re no strangers to using filters to change our appearance on social media apps. While animal-inspired filters were all the rage just a few years ago, most of the filters on TikTok focus on giving you the illusion of a full-face of makeup. One of the most recent filters to go viral is the faux freckle filter, giving you a soft and whimsical look.

‍
Freckles are an easy way to elevate your natural makeup look to keep it looking fresh, while giving you an envy-worthy glow to your skin. While there are dozens of products on the market tailored to creating faux freckles, this hack uses products you’ll already have.

‍
All you need is a brow pencil or gel, dotting it across your cheeks and nose where natural freckles would sit. You can even use the filter as a reference to help you achieve a natural look. Press down on the pigment with your finger and blend into your skin.

‍

‍

The effortless concealer hack

‍
Do you know that one product you’re probably not applying correctly is concealer? It’s an essential for any makeup look – especially the natural beauty trend – whether or not you want to layer it with a powder or foundation. The placement of your concealer is even more important than your blush placement.

‍
Just like blush, it helps to lift your features and brighten your complexion and make you look wide away by hiding imperfections and blemishes.

‍
This makeup hack focuses on angling your concealer to work it up and away from your eyes and the corner of your mouth. Add a small dot to the inner corner of your mouth, side of your nose, under your cheekbone, and directly under the centre of your eye. Once it’s all in place, blend the concealer into your skin for a seamless look.

‍

Stay all-day lipstick trick

‍
One of the most annoying things about makeup is when your lipstick starts to come off throughout the day. You might notice lipstick residue on the side of your coffee cup or look in the mirror to see bare lips staring back at you. When you spend a pretty penny on a lipstick, you want to get the most out of it.

‍
With face masks still being the norm, it’s never been more important to have a makeup hack that can keep your lipstick in place al-day long.

‍
Apply your lipstick as you usually do, before taking a tissue and peeling off the top layer so that you’re left with only one layer of tissue. Place it gently over your lips before taking a translucent powder with a fluffy brush, applying it over the tissue.

‍
When you life the tissue from your lips, you’ll get a matte finish with all-day wear. It’s our new go-to makeup hack for days out or when we don’t want to worry about reapplying lipstick on a night out.

‍
What do you think of these seven makeup hacks? Which one do you want to try first? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: TikTok is where we all go for the latest trend. The video sharing app experienced a turbo charge of growth during the pandemic, going from a niche platform to the app that is calling the shots for every trend. It’s YouTube for the next-generation of wannabe makeup artists and beauty enthusiasts. Gen Z are everywhere you look on the app, bringing in new trends and genius makeup hacks that we never knew we needed.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: soft sculpting, makeup trends, soft sculpting trend
meta-description: With beauty trends all pointing towards a ‘natural’ look, it’s no surprise that “soft sculpting” is the trend that everyone is talking about.
meta-title: Everything You Need to Know About Soft Sculpting
name: Everything You Need to Know About Soft Sculpting
post-body:
Contouring is one of the biggest trends within the beauty industry. In recent years, we’ve gone from dramatic Kim Kardashian worthy contour to a mora natural look. Even Mario Dedivanovic, the go-to makeup artist for the Kardashians sisters, has switched to a light-handed approach for contouring. With beauty trends all pointing towards a ‘natural’ look, it’s no surprise that “soft sculpting” is the makeup trend that everyone is talking about.

‍

‍

How soft sculpting has become the ‘it’ trend

‍
Where has this trend come from?

‍
It finds its origins in the sudden shift from ‘social media makeup’, the OTT looks that we see on our feeds every day, to a more everyday look. You’ll rarely find the Instagram beauty influencers wearing their dramatic looks in everyday life. Soft and buildable sculpting that focuses on blush, contour, and highlighting, has become the go-to look for influencers and celebrities alike.

‍
Contour used to be a secret of celebrity makeup artists, before social media opened up the industry and everyone could learn how to contour with just one YouTube video. Contouring has gone from being ‘special occasion’ makeup to an everyday look. With the right technic, you can now achieve the sculpted look without having to use a dozen makeup products.

‍

Soft sculpting and skincare

‍
The shift to soft sculpting is to do with more than just the growing admiration for natural looking makeup. Since the pandemic, we’ve all turned out focus to our growing obsession with all things skincare related. With this focus on skincare, people are less reliant on makeup to cover imperfections. A ‘dewy glow’ is the look that everyone is going after.

‍
Millennials and Gen Z are the driving force behind the change to natural makeup, including soft sculpting. It’s a refreshing change from the days of 25-part makeup routines that dominated the industry in the mid-to-late 2010s. If you want to start with applying blush like a professional makeup artist click here.

‍
Here’s our step-by-step guide on how to perfect the soft sculpting look.

‍

Softly on the cheeks

‍
We often think of contouring as focusing on the hollows of our cheeks. While this was the original style of contouring, it leads to a heavier and more unnatural look. For a softer look, apply your bronzer or contour to the area slightly above the hollows of your cheeks. Using a bronzer brush, blend the power upwards through the hollows of your cheek to help lift your skin.

‍
You want to make sure you choose a soft colour that adds a natural warmth to your skin to give you a natural-looking sculpting effect. The secret to achieving this look is to start by applying only a small amount of product. You want to use a bronzer or contour that is buildable, making it easy to stay in control of your look.

‍
For daytime makeup, you want to think about how your makeup will look in the daylight. We often do our makeup under artificial light, making it look different to how it will outside. If you’re sculpting your jaw or nose, this could appear harsher when you’re outside. Instead of focusing on what looks good on your Instagram stories, think about what looks best in the real world.

‍

Shading with foundation

‍
A contour stick is every makeup lover’s best friend, but foundation can give you the same effect. The trick is to find a foundation that is half or a full shade darker than your everyday foundation. You can apply it as a contour using a brush or a beauty blender if you want more contour over your look.

‍
This style of contouring is ideal for sculpting your cheekbones, forehead, nose, and jawline. Using a slightly darker foundation will help to give you a natural look as it mimics the appearance of your real skin.

‍
The next time that you’re buying your go-to foundation, make sure to pick it up in a slightly darker shade to create this look. If you prefer a more natural look or to work with liquid products, choosing this style of sculpting can help you achieve this look.

‍

Experiment with a pop of blush

‍
What makes soft sculpting different from traditional contouring is that it focuses on creating the most natural look possible. It’s not all about contouring – it also focuses on highlighter and blush. The one product we all reach for when we want to give our skin a healthy glow is blush. All you need is a few strokes of blush to give your skin a natural and healthy appearance.

‍
The secret to applying blush is to make sure it lifts your face. You want to avoid applying it too low on your cheeks. The easiest way to place your blush in the correct place is to smile naturally and apply it to the apple of your cheeks. It will help naturally lift your face. If you want a more contemporary look, you can blend a small amount of blush across your chin, forehead, and nose.

‍
The best products to use for a glowing look are blushes with a cream or liquid formula as they mimic your natural-looking skin. If you’re planning on layering your blush with other products, keep your powder light and focus it on your t-zone to keep your skin’s dewy glow.

Use your favourite highlighter

‍
The third component of the soft sculpting look is highlighter. What makes your highlighter different for soft sculpting is that you don’t want it to look obvious. You want to give the appearance of being lit-from-within by avoiding applying your highlighter too heavy or by adding texture to your skin.

‍
Illuminate your skin and add to its natural radiance. You want to avoid the stripe of highlighter along your cheekbones that is overly visible. If your skin is older, there’s a helpful trick to correctly apply your highlighter. Just like when applying blush, you want to smile softly when applying your highlighter. Smiling means that you can avoid applying your highlighter on the fine lines and wrinkles that form around your eyes.

‍
The same rules apply when choosing your highlighter as they do for blush. Avoid powder formulas and instead choose a liquid highlighter to give you a more natural look. Liquid formulas naturally absorb into your skin, giving you that naturally illuminated look.
When you’re aiming for a soft sculpting look, you want to avoid using a powder highlighter. This type of highlighter sits on your skin and gives an artificial look, especially as it sparkles in the sun. These products can give your skin a shiny or greasy texture, instead of the dewy glow that you’re aiming for.

‍
You can place your highlighter near where the blush has already been applied. You want to create a ‘gleam’ on your skin by applying it above your cheekbones, the bridge of your nose, brow bone, your inner eye, and your cupid’s bow. The secret is to focus on the parts of your face where the sun would naturally hit.

‍

Sculpting your face

‍
Makeup is something that is highly personal. No two people apply makeup the same way and everything looks different on different people. A smoky eye might flatter one eye shape and not another. You might find a lipstick that is your perfect match, but that doesn’t compliment the skin tone of your best friend. It’s all about tailoring makeup and trends to suit your face.

‍
If you want to master the art of makeup, you need to get to know your face. It’s not just about recognising your reflection, but instead knowing how your skin works and what flatters your face.

‍
Just like any makeup trend, soft sculpting isn’t a one-size-fits-all type of makeup. It’s not a trend that works for every occasion – or even every face. You want to break the soft sculpting trend down into a step-by-step process, focusing on each step individually.
Start by learning how to apply contour to your face and understand which products to use when. While powder works for more dramatic looks, you want to focus on cream and liquid products for a softer look. Apply your chosen product with a light hand to avoid an unnatural finish. It’s best to start small and build the product until you achieve your desired finish.

‍
When you’re working on your blush, make sure to apply it in a way that lifts your face. Chose a cream or liquid blush and smile so that you can apply it to the apples of your cheeks. The same rules apply for your highlighter. Keep it natural and apply it on the spots of your face where the sun naturally shines.

‍
When you learn how to do these three steps in a way that suits your face, you’ll master the art of soft sculpting. It’s a way of helping you learn the difference between the makeup we see on social media and ‘real life’ makeup.

‍
post-summary: Contouring is one of the biggest trends within the beauty industry. In recent years, we’ve gone from dramatic Kim Kardashian worthy contour to a more natural look. Even Mario Dedivanovic, the go-to makeup artist for the Kardashians sisters, has switched to a light-handed approach for contouring. With beauty trends all pointing towards a ‘natural’ look, it’s no surprise that “soft sculpting” is the trend that everyone is talking about.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: fall 2021 fashion, trends fall 2021, fashion, fall 2021 closet
meta-description: We’re giving you the ultimate guide for the trends of fall 2021 with eleven different trends that designers have incorporated into their collections.
meta-title: The Must-Try Fashion Trends for Fall 2021
name: The Must-Try Fashion Trends for Fall 2021
post-body:
Fall is our favourite season of the year. It’s a time when you can have fun with your closet, as you’re getting ready for the holiday season. Whether there’s an unexpected heatwave in September or the classic autumnal glow, fall is a time to be creative with your closet and try something new.

‍
While we usually go to the likes of TikTok and celebrities for our fall 2021 inspiration and trends, we thought it would be interesting to change it up and look at the trends directly from the runway.

‍
What makes the Fall 2021 collections so unique is that designers were creating them during an odd period of time during the pandemic, when our lives were changing forever. Most of them had to change their show styles, relying heavily on digital presentations or an intimate presentation with only a few models and guest (if any) in attendance.

‍

‍

Even in the face of adversity, these designers took their creativity and made something beauty. Fall 2021 collections captured the idea of embracing outdoor living, while taking inspiration from the era of the Roaring ‘20s, with the presence of the always timeless little black dress. For fall 2021, designers look at putting comfort first with elevated and effortlessly chic knitwear.

‍
We’re giving you the ultimate guide for the trends of fall 2021 with eleven different trends that designers have incorporated into their collections. You don’t need to have a Bottega Veneta budget to be able to experience and experiment with these trends. When you know what you’re looking for, you can find more attainable dupes from your favourite brand.
Here are the eleven different trends that you can expect to see everywhere in fall 2021:

‍

Crop jackets and tops

‍
One unexpected trend for fall 2021 is crop silhouettes. While we usually think of these as being a spring or summer look, they’ve made a comeback for fall 2021. You’ll spot everything from cropped tops to jackets on the runway. They have a more elegant silhouette, while keeping the midriff-baring shape to the top. Chanel took a chic and sophisticated fuchsia pantsuit down the runway, while Emilia Wickstead took a two-piece set and gave it a ladylike feel.

‍

Comfortable and hygge fashion

‍
If there’s one word that we can use to describe fall 2021 trends, it’s ‘cosy’ or ‘hygge’. You need to remember what the world was like when designers were coming up with the concepts for these collections. What is different about the runway is that these are elevated without a single sweatpant in sight.

Fashion designers have gone out of their way to incorporate an extra layer of comfort into their designs, whether it’s with shearling-lined coats at Chloe or fuzzy hoodies from Dior. You’ll notice fabric that is plush and oversized, with silhouettes that are tapered while being universally flattering. Comfortable clothing never looked so good.

‍

Midi dresses and silhouettes

Another trend that has made a reappearance for fall 2021 is midi dresses and skirts. This silhouette has been gaining momentum over recent years as a longer hemline that is more universally flattering. Midi skirts were everywhere we looked during fall 2021 shows, with each designer putting their own twist on the look.

Dior used a box-pleat for their midi skirts, while Erdem opened for a knife pleat, as The Tow went for a classic a-line silhouette, whereas Partow kept their skirts flowy and feminine.

‍

1920s glamour

‍
Embrace the glamour of the 1920s and channel your inner Daisy Buchanan with this trend. It’s all about layers upon layers of sequins. You can think of this trend as 1920s meets the opulence of the 1980s. If you’ve ever wanted to dance the night away at a jazz bar, this trend is for you. What is unique about it is that the silhouettes are modest and covered up, while incorporating glimmering and sparkling textures into the pieces.

‍
Some of the signature pieces for this trend are high neck jumpers, structured jackets, voluminous dresses, and long trousers. We saw this trend across the board with brands like Loewe, Valentino, Dries Van Noten, and Paco Rabanne. These brands each choose to skip the minimalistic aesthetic in favour for a more optimistic and opulent look.
Ladies, the roaring ‘20s are back again. It’s time to get your outfit ready for it.

‍

Saturated colours

‍
One trend that you’ll see everywhere on the runway – and TikTok – is saturated colours. Colours are making a comeback and we couldn’t be more excited. You want to play with colour that is unexpected and off the beating track. Jil Sander experimented with a mustard hue with a lemon twist, while Miu Miu stuck with a feminine colour palette of bubblegum pink with marigold. At Patou, you’ll see rust and lavender hues.

‍
These colours will turn heads and make you the centre of attention for any event.

‍

It’s all about tailoring

‍
Let’s just be blunt. Tailoring is back and you need to get it in your life. Designers are no longer just adding a few tailored elements to their pieces. It’s all about tailoring. On the runway, we saw tailored pieces paired and layered over other tailored pieces. It’s clear that the industry is all for tailoring for fall 2021.

‍
Instead of pairing these tailored outfits with on-trend sneakers or even sophisticated pumps, brands are choosing to wear them with loafers and oxford shoes for a masculine twist. If you’re a fan of layering tailored pieces for a smart look, check out the collections of The Row, Tory Burch, Prada, and Peter Do.

‍

Knitwear

‍
Is it even fall if there isn’t knitwear on the runway? One of the biggest fashion lessons from the pandemic is that people want comfortable clothing – without compromising on style. We saw the rise of luxury loungewear with pieces that are equal-parts comfortable and polish. You can bring the aesthetic through to fall 2021 with elevated luxury knitwear. Look out for cashmere and wool two-piece sets and comfortable silhouettes that you can cuddle up with during cold evenings.

‍
We saw this trend at brands like Altuzarra, Gabriela Hearst, and Prozena Schouler.  If you’re going to invest in anything for fall 2021, let it be luxury knitwear. Trust us. You’ll thank us later.

‍

Apres-Ski Trips

‍
It’s not unusual for fashion brands to look to the world’s most luxurious ski resorts for inspiration for their fall collections. Fall 2021 was no exception with Aspres-Ski inspired pieces appearing across almost every runway show. You want to look out for modern classics like a cropped cardigan in a bright hue or a cosy knitwear set that has a statement colour. You want to close your eyes and imagine that you’re about to go out onto the slopes. That’s the style aesthetic that you’re going for.

‍
Classic brands like Balenciaga, Chanel, Miu Miu, and Junya Watanabe have all put comfortable ski sweaters and loungewear at the heart of their fall 2021 collections.

‍

Puffer coat

‍
The puffer coat is one trend that seems to come back every fall and winter, only gaining more momentum every year. You want to look for a puffer coat in a bold colour – like Dolce & Gabbana’s red leopard – to make a statement with your coat. Most of the puffer coats that you’ll find on the runway are high-fashion pieces that are designed to make a statement, while keeping you warm as the temperatures drop.

‍

Back to Black

‍
No matter what happens in the world, you can always rely on a little black dress appearing on the runway. These dresses will never go out of style, even when we hear things like ‘pink is the new black’. If you’re looking to invest in your fall 2021 closet, look no further than a little black dress.

You’ll often find that the little black dress is given an update and a new look every season. For fall 2021, the little black dress was kept short and fitted with a sultry look. At Dior, they focused on the babydoll look, while Fashion Eat incorporated tuxedo dresses. Whatever LDB you’re wearing, make sure you’re showing off your legs.

Which of these fall 2021 trends will you be recreating? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: Fall is our favourite season of the year. It’s a time when you can have fun with your closet, as you’re getting ready for the holiday season. Whether there’s an unexpected heatwave in September or the classic autumnal glow, fall is a time to be creative with your closet and try something new.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: recyclable beauty, earth-friendly beauty, recycling cosmetic
meta-description: We’re sharing five easy swaps that you can make to turn your beauty routine into a more earth-friendly ritual that is kind to your skin and the planet.
meta-title: How Make Your Beauty Routine More Earth-Friedly
name: 5 Ways to Make Your Beauty Routine More Earth-Friendly and Sustainable
post-body:
Sustainability is one of the hottest topics in the beauty industry right now. While we often look at our beauty routine as a part of our wellness and self-care routine – giving us an instant mood boost – there’s more to it than meets the eye. The only way we can prevent climate change and create a better future for our planet is by changing our daily routine to become more sustainable.

Your bathroom is where you probably go to do your makeup and skincare routine. While it might be your own little paradise, it’s also one of the most polluting spaces in your home. Most of the beauty products you’re using – even those with a natural ingredients – are harming our planet and causing irreversible damage. What might be a pick-me-up for your skin could take hundreds of years to decompose in a landfill or our oceans.

‍

‍

Everything from plastic packaging to chemicals from cosmetics ending up in our oceans and causing chaos for marine life are things we have to consider. If you want to become a more sustainable individual who cares about the planet, you need to take a hard look at your beauty routine and ask where you can make changes to become more earth-friendly.

Sometimes, it’s the smallest things that make the biggest difference. Just think of all the good we did when we ditched plastic straws for eco-friendly alternatives. Rome wasn’t built in a day – and your sustainability journey will take time. Just think of how much of an impact you could make just by getting rid of facial wipes from your routine. Trust us. You could be saving the lives of hundreds of marine life and helping to cut down on landfill.

Although beauty brands are looking to innovate and meet the growing demands for sustainable beauty products, you have a role to play in this change as well. In fact, it can’t happen without you. The choice is yours – do you want to help save the planet?

We’re sharing five easy swaps that you can make to turn your beauty routine into a more earth-friendly ritual that is kind to your skin and the planet we call home.

‍

‍

Swap from liquid to solid shampoo and soaps

‍
Did you know that around 80 billion plastic shampoo and conditioner bottles are through out every year? That’s a lot of plastic – and just from those two products. Thanks to innovation in the beauty industry, there’s no need for you to be using a shampoo or conditioner that comes in a plastic bottle.

Most of the brands who are taking a sustainability pledge had been introducing solid shampoo and soap bars as an alternative to their plastic-packaged liquid formulas.

Just this one change to your routine can make a huge difference – and here’s how:

Using a ‘naked’ or plastic-free product means that you’re cutting down on packaging. If it’s a ‘naked’ soap or shampoo, you’re leaving no waste behind. Any bars that come with packaging typically use eco-friendly material to cut down on their environmental impact.

As your product has come in a solid form, it means that there isn’t unnecessary water being used as a ‘filler’ in the formula. The only water it needs is what you use while washing or showering.

These products also weigh less than plastic bottles, meaning that they cut down on carbon emissions as they take less space during transportation.

Just this one switch can do all this.

‍

‍

Use a hot cloth for your skin instead of face wipes

‍
Let’s get one thing straight. Face wipes are the enemy.

While they might be convenient to use after a night out or when you’re too tired to do your skincare routine, their environment impact would beg to differ. The UK alone uses 11 billion wet wipes every year – with most of them ending up in landfill or flushed down the toilet, meaning that they end up in our oceans.

In the UK, wet wipes account for over 90% of sewer blocks and can even lead to ‘fatbergs’ that build up in rivers, which often include products like sanitary items and facial wipes.

Another thing to consider is that facial wipes aren’t good for your skin. They can often strip your skin of its moisture, while not giving you a deep enough cleanse to remove makeup and impurities. One of the easiest swaps you can make is to ditch your wet wipes for a hot cloth to help cleanse your skin and remove makeup.

Like everything in the beauty industry, the market has evolved to come up with an eco-friendly alternative to wet wipes. Reusable pads – like the Face Halo – only need water to help remove your makeup and can be used in place of up to 500 face wipes. All you have to do is throw them into your washing machine to clean after use to keep them as good as new.

‍

‍

Look for refillable options of your favourite makeup

‍
We all know makeup products can be expensive. Most of what your paying for can often be the packaging – which is usually what draws us to a product in the first place.

We all love to splurge on a beautiful compact or a new foundation bottle that would look perfect on our vanity. But once your product is done, what do you do with the compact or bottle? You don’t want to throw it out, but it’ll go to waste.

This is where refills come in.

They’re a cost-effective way of keeping your makeup budget low, as well as reducing your environmental footprint. Instead of paying full price for a whole new product, you can just purchase a refill to insert into your original packaging. That means there’s less plastic going to landfill and you’re saving a pretty penny at the same time.

‍

‍
One of the most innovative brands is La Bouche Rouge, which creates customisable and reliable cases for their products. The brand’s packaging is free of micro-plastic and uses recycled metal and upcycled leather to make products like their Universal Compact. This one compact works to host all their powder-based products, including their highlighter, eyeshadow, and bronzer.

What we love about La Bouche Rouge is their transparency. They’re a brand who aren’t afraid to wear their heart on their selves and they’re fully committed to limiting their environmental impact. It’s their USP that sits at the heart of their brand story. They make high-quality makeup products that are entirely free of harmful micro-plastics. You won’t find any plastic on their ultra-sleek products either.

Their microplastic-free and recyclable makeup products are environmentally responsible with simple alternatives. You’ll find their mascara in glass bottles and brushes that use castor plant fibres, along with no-plastic refillable lipsticks. Their containers are deliberately unbranded. They use silicone moulds that are discarded after use, while their offices operate with a zero plastic policy.

‍

Choose packaging that is reusable, recycled, or recyclable

‍
One of the easiest things you can do is to stop and look at the packaging that your products are coming in.

Post-consumer recycled plastic is one that is becoming increasingly popular as an alternative to virgin plastic. Beauty brands like REN Skincare are leading the way by putting existing plastic to good use by using it for their packaging instead of having to bring more plastic into the world. Their Ocean Plastic bottles are made using plastic that is collected from beaches, riverbanks, and oceans. The only way you’ll usually notice post-consumer recycled plastic is from the slight grey tint that the plastic can develop.

Almost every beauty brand is looking for ways to incorporated recycled packaging into their products. Dove has been using 100% recycled plastic bottles since 2019, while Aveda’s product range has seen over 85% of items made using 100% post-consumer plastic.

You also want to consider packaging that is easy to recycle. Brands like Maybelline and The Body Shop are working with recycling companies to create drop-off locations in their stores and at local kiosks to encourage you to recycle your empty beauty products. It makes recycling easier than ever. Brands like MAC Cosmetics even incentivise this through their ‘back to MAC’ programme.

Other types of materials to look out for include aluminium, a popular alternative to plastic that can be recycled and reused an infinite number of times. Glass is another alternative and one usually used by luxury brands like La Bouche Rouge as substitute to plastic.

‍

Add a recycling bin to your bathroom

‍
In an ideal world, we would have more recycling bins than normal garbage cans.

You want to be trying to recycle more than what you send to landfill. One of the best ways to reach this target is to make recycling as easy as possible. One way you can do this is by adding a recycling bin in your bathroom, so you have no excuse not to do the right thing.

You can even use a split bin to help save on space or use two bins if you want to make sure you’re splitting up your recycling and general waste.

What steps are you taking to make your beauty routine more sustainable? We would love to hear about them in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Sustainability is one of the hottest topics in the beauty industry right now. While we often look at our beauty routine as a part of our wellness and self-care routine – giving us an instant mood boost – there’s more to it than meets the eye. The only way we can prevent climate change and create a better future for our planet is by changing our daily routine to become more sustainable.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: perfume, wearing perfume, fragrances, Eau de parfum
meta-description: Whether you’re looking to buy your first perfume or are an avid collector, this guide has something for everyone.
meta-title: How to choose and wear Perfume
name: Everything That You Need to Know About Wearing Perfume
post-body:
Perfume is considered to be one of the oldest traditions in the beauty industry. It’s something that is rich in history, culture, and intrigue. Perfume has changed and evolved throughout history, changing its purpose, but it’s always been there. Smell is one of our primary scents and a way that helps us feel the world around us. Smells can unlock memories and stir emotions deep within us that we never expected.

The purpose of perfume has changed throughout history. It was originally a way of showing off your wealth to the world, but it’s often been used (and is still used) as a way of seducing people. Now, most of us choose to wear perfume for ourselves and because of the joy that it brings to us.

Most people have a signature scent – a perfume that their friends and family associate with them. It might be a specific note – like lavender or English rose – or even a certain perfume.

Even those who have a collection of dozens of perfumes often don’t know the backstory and heritage behind perfume. Whether you’re looking to buy your first perfume or are an avid collector, this guide has something for everyone. We’re setting out the different principles behind perfumes to help you get the most out of your investment.

Make sure to bookmark this guide to come back to the next time that you’re buying a perfume. There’s nothing more personal – or intimate – than the perfume that you wear. Whether it’s an everyday scent or for a special occasion, your perfume gives a unique insight into who you are.

The different types of fragrances

One of the first things you need to understand is the differences between the types of fragrances that you’ll find on offer. It’s easy to feel overwhelmed when you come face to face with shelves full of pretty bottles and clever marketing campaigns. Understanding the differences between these fragrance types can help you find the perfect one for you. Whether you want a light scent for everyday or something more potent, there’s a fragrance out there for you.

Parfum is a perfume in its most potent form, giving you the strongest scent possible from the notes inside the bottle. You may find ‘parfum’ being called ‘extrait de parfum’ or ‘pure perfume’, depending on the origin of the brand that you’re looking at. You’ll often find that the parfum version of a scent is also the most expensive as the scent is in its purest form.

‍

‍

One of the most popular parfums is the Maison Francis Kurkdjian Baccarat Rouge 540 Extrait spray – which you’ll find everywhere from TikTok to Instagram. It’ll set you back a pretty penny but is one that has a loyal fan following.

Eau de parfum – also known as EDP – is the second strongest type of fragrance on the market. While it’s less intense than a parfum, it’s stronger than an eau de toilette. An EDP is the perfect alternative if you don’t want to invest in the cost of a potent parfum but still want to enjoy the scent. These scents are made to last on your skin, although their scent is not as intense as what you’ll find with a parfum. If you want a unique fragrance that is wearable for every day, check out the You Eau de Parfum by Glossier.

An Eau de Toilette comes with a lower concentration of its perfume oils than what you’ll find with an Eau de Parfum. This type of fragrance is often known in shorthand as an EDT. These scents are ideal for daytime wear and create a light spritz that is pleasant and not overwhelming. An EDT will be amongst the most affordable versions of a scent and are ideal if you want a fragrance that you can layer with other scents.

‍

‍

When it comes to luxury brands, it’s often the EDT that is the most popular form of perfume due to its price point. One EDT that is worth trying is the Guerlain Aqua Allegoria Ginger Piccante.

Eau de Colognes are a term that is often confused. For generations, the world ‘cologne’ has been used to signal that a fragrance is specifically designed for men. In recent years, the term ‘cologne’ has been used on unisex fragrances, along with fragrances for women. When a fragrance carries the name ‘cologne’, it means that it has a lower concentration of perfume oils than what you would find in an Eau de Parfum.

‍

‍

Jo Malone is one brand that is famous for their colognes, offering a variety of unisex and female scents that are often inspired by the English countryside. The Jo Malone Sage & Sea Salt cologne is one of the most popular options from the brand.

Choosing the right type of fragrance for your lifestyle can be tricky. You can expect to pay a premium for concentrated perfumes, which will last longer on your skin and give you more bang for your buck. Traditional, Parfums and Eau de Parfums are reserved for evening use, while fragrances with a lighter concentration are kept for daytime use. There are no fast and firm rules when it comes to perfume wearing, meaning you can choose any scent that tickles your fancy.

‍

‍

Where should I apply my perfume?

‍
It’s easy to get carried away when applying perfume. If you’ve spent a pretty penny on a bottle of perfume, you want to avoid wasting any of it. The secret to applying perfume is to focus it on the pulse points of your body. You can start by applying it behind your ears, wrists, and in the nape of your neck. If you want your perfume to last longer, you can also apply it to your knees and the creases of your elbow. You can even apply it to your bellybutton if you want to make the scent linger on your skin.

‍
When you’re looking for a lighter application, you can try the traditional ’walk through’ method for applying your fragrance. All you have to do is spray your fragrance into the air and walk through the mist as it falls through the air. This method allows the perfume to fall onto your hair and clothes, making it the perfect final step for your morning routine or before heading out for the evening.

‍

‍

How do I make my perfume last all day long?

‍
The application process is what will make or break the longevity of your perfume. You want to make sure your skin is clean and hydrated to make it the perfect base for absorbing your fragrance. You can also lightly spray the perfume onto your clothing, but the best scent will come from the mixture of the fragrance and your skin. If you’re planning on spraying it onto clothing, you want to avoid delicate fabrics that can become stained, including silk.

How to make your perfume smell more intense

‍
There are some occasions where you’ll want to amplify the intensity of the scent of your perfume. Along with our tips above, you want to keep your fragrance in your bag to reapply throughout the day. Stronger concentrations will last longer, but even the strongest of parfums will need to be reapplied at some stage throughout the day. You want to avoid going too overboard with your reapplication. If you spray too much of a perfume, it may simply evaporate into thin air.

‍

‍

Which notes to look for to create a strong scent

‍
Some perfumes will start to change their scent once the top notes have dissipated after application. Once the top notes disperse, the base and heart notes take over and blend together to create the scent. These are known as the ‘dry down notes’. If you want a stronger scent, look for fragrances that focus on the stronger dry down notes.

‍
Look out for fragrances that include notes of moss, patchouli, and sandalwood. You’ll still smell the lingering scent of these notes days after spraying your fragrance.

‍

The most common perfume application mistake

‍
We all make mistakes when applying our fragrances. You might spritz it on one wrist and then rub it against another wrist or even on your neck. This popular application method is actually the wrong way to apply your perfume.

‍
