Don’t rub your wrists together as the friction inhibits the molecules within the perfume, changing how the scent smells and can even dull it down. It mainly changes the top notes, which you’ll smell first.

‍

How to prolong the life of your favourite fragrance

‍
If you’ve invested in a fragrance, you don’t want it to be used up or lose its allure after only a few months of use. We’re sharing our top tips on how to prolong the life of your favourite fragrances so that you can get the most out of every drop.

‍
You want to make sure you keep your fragrances in a cool and dry place, hidden away from direct light. While most people display their perfumes on a vanity, it’s best to keep them hidden away. Another place that you don’t want to store your perfume is in your bathroom. The humidity, heat, and light of your bathroom will shorten the lifespan of your fragrance. When you’re not using your perfume, make sure to put the lid back on it to prevent oxygenation.

‍
What is your go-to fragrance? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: Perfume is considered to be one of the oldest traditions in the beauty industry. It’s something that is rich in history, culture, and intrigue. Perfume has changed and evolved throughout history, changing its purpose, but it’s always been there. Smell is one of our primary scents and a way that helps us feel the world around us. Smells can unlock memories and stir emotions deep within us that we never expected.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: makeup, fall trend, makeup 2021
meta-description: We’re rounding up the most exciting trends that we are expecting to see everywhere during fall 2021.
meta-title: The 7 Makeup Trends to Try in Fall 2021
name: The 7 Makeup Trends to Try in Fall 2021
post-body:
Things are starting to look extremely autumnal. As summer comes to an end, we’re more than ready to welcome fall back into our lives. As the world starts to reopen after the pandemic, fall promises to bring with it excitement and new opportunities for us to make up for lost time. It’s also an exciting time for the beauty industry. Will the laidback minimalistic aesthetics that we saw during lockdown remain as the world continues to reopen? Will so-called ‘soft glam’ rise up in its place as a more elevated alternative for wearing outside the house.

‍

‍

What can we expect from beauty trends as we finally start to ditch the face masks and experience life to the fullest for the first time in over 18 months? Looking at trends for fall 2021, it’s all about a pop of colour, whether it’s with soft pastels or bright bold hues. What we love about this idea is that you can incorporate a pop of colour into any look, whether you’re going ultra-glam or more minimalistic.

‍
As part of this, we’re also starting to see people experimenting with and wearing colour in new and exciting ways. Did we ever think we would be talking about blush placement on TikTok? Well, we definitely didn’t think so. On the other hand, classic makeup looks like a bold lip and smoky eye may make their way back into makeup trends as we rediscover our makeup bags and the full contents of our vanity.

‍
If you’re not sure what to do with your makeup for fall 2021. Keep it classic. You can never go wrong with lashes and liquid lips – but make sure to give them a 2021 twist.

‍
We’re rounding up the most exciting trends that we are expecting to see everywhere during fall 2021. It’s time to grab your makeup and teach yourself that techniques that you’ll have forgotten over the last 18 months. Come on, it’s time to rejoin society again.

‍

An overview of fall 2021 makeup trends

‍
It’s worth remember that most of us have spent over a year of hardly wearing any makeup, gradually easing back into the contents of our makeup bag during the summer. However, that’s a season when most of us adopt a skinimalistic approach and keep everything simple with multi-functional products.

‍
As part of the fall 2021 trends, we can expect the concept of skinimalism to play a big role in every trend. Look out for lightweight products with a breathable formula that help your skin achieve a healthy, dewy glow without weighing down your skin. It’s all about finding a concealer and foundation that offers you buildable coverage.

‍
Although fall 2021 makeup trends will largely be understated, there will be an element of glamour to them. With face masks being reduced, you can expect a return to the days of glossy lips. Other ‘glamorous’ trends like brow care are here to stay, along with the focus on healthy and radiant skin. You can expect skincare products to remain almost some of the most popular beauty products for fall 2021.
Some of the trends that you’ll find on this list are ones that we’ve come to know and love during fall. Picture soap brows, ultra-bold lips, and eyeshadow with an electric hue. As we start to rediscover the world again and the seasons change, you can expect makeup to become brighter and more joyful.

‍
Whatever trends you decide to experiment with, make sure they’re ones that reflect your personality and help you create a makeup routine that doubles as a self-care ritual.

‍
Read on to find out about the 7 fall 2021 makeup trends that we’re most excited for this season.

Lined Eyes

‍
The focus on eyes that we saw during spring and summer aren’t going anywhere, in fact, it’s going to get even bolder. Kristen Stewart’s go-to makeup artist has said that fall 2021 will be the time for heavy lined eyes. She explains that it’s because of the longer bags and ‘70s inspired hair cuts that mean you need to overdo the liner to help define the shape of your eyes.

‍
It’s not all black eyeliner that you’ll be seeing though. While the debate of black vs navy blue eyeliner continues to go on in the background, other shades that you can experiment with include sable brown and deep burgundy. What we enjoy about these shades is that they give you definition and shape to your eyes, without being as harsh as black eyeliner. They add an unexpected pop of colour to the windows of your soul.

Reverse cat eye

‍
When you find something that you love, do it in reverse. That seems to be the philosophy of the beauty industry right now. After all, we’ve already been talking about reverse makeup and contouring – which revolves around applying your makeup products in reverse order.

‍
The ‘reverse cat eye’ look is a little different in that it flips the silhouette upside down, meaning that your liner focuses on your lower lash line, instead of the outer corner of your eye. You can easily adapt this eyeliner look to make it as subtle or as dramatic as you like.

‍
What makes this eyeshadow look more seductive is when you use a fluffy brush to blend the liner under your lash line for a smoky look. If you want a more defined look, add your favourite liquid liner to the inner corner of your eyes, before applying mascara to your top and bottom lashes for a fluffy look. With the addition of liquid eyeliner and mascara, you can make your reverse eyeliner look more dramatic and striking for a bold appearance.

‍
What we love about the reverse cat eye makeup trend is that it’s beginner friendly and easy to recreate. You can go all out by finishing off your look with false eyelashes or keep it simple with a few coats of mascara on the top and bottom lashes.

‍

Skinimalism

‍
After living through a global pandemic, working from home, and the reality of mask wearing, heavy makeup looks have become a thing of the past. People want a more streamline and easy to use makeup routine that has a simpler approach. ‘Skinamlism’ focuses on embracing your natural beauty, focusing on evening your texture and creating a glowing radiance.

‍
One thing that we know for sure is that skinimalism is here to stay – well after the pandemic and long after fall 2021. With our social calendars starting to fill up again, we’re all looking to keep our skin healthy to maintain a radiant glow. Keep your buildable conceal and contour products nearby and focus on letting your skin breathe to keep it looking radiant and healthy.

‍
You can update your makeup for fall 2021 by adding an oil-free or lightweight foundation to help your skin transition from summer to fall. These formulas are easier to blend and will give your skin the hydration it needs to prevent flakiness and dryness.

Glossy lips

‍
One trend that we’re waiting to welcome back in fall 2021 is glossy lips. During the pandemic and when mask mandates were in place, no one could show off their lipstick or glossy lips. It meant that our lip products were going unloved in our makeup bag. It’s time to make up for lost time with a glossy lip look.

‍
You want to find a lipgloss that has either a glossy or satin shine – whichever you prefer. Choose a hydrating formula that you can wear alone, as a topper over lipstick, or as a base to lock in moisture and hydration. If you’re not sure which lip products to use with a skinimalistic makeup look or if you’re going for a semi-matte look, glossy lips are always a great idea.

Lashes, lashes, and more lashes

‍
We’re already back to talking about eye makeup. It’s one trend that is going to last through the pandemic and beyond. For fall 2021, your lashes are once again taking centre stage. You want to work on getting your lashes as fluffy and voluminous as possible, with definition in the upper and lower lashes. You can invest in a regular lash lift and tint for a low-maintenance look or purchase faux lashes if you’re not able to go to a salon for a lash lift.

‍

Soapy brows

‍
Soapy brows are one trend that we know always associate with fall makeup. When we’re thinking about things like lash lifts and reverse cat eye looks, you’ve got to remember about your brows. While your eyes are the window to your soul, it’s your brows that frame and shape your face.

‍
The beauty of soap brows is that they work with any makeup look and are easy to achieve. If you missed this trend when it was all the rage last summer, now is your chance to give it a go.

Statement electric eyeshadows

‍
As soon as we saw the fuschia pink lids and electric blue shades on the Versace fall/winter 2021 runway, we knew that dramatic electric eyeshadow colours were going to be one of the biggest trends for fall 2021. Instead of reaching for soft browns and burnt oranges this season, swap it out for a neon hue. As life starts to come back to normal, it’s time to celebrate – and there’s no better way than with your eyeshadow!

‍
post-summary: Things are starting to look extremely autumnal. As summer comes to an end, we’re more than ready to welcome fall back into our lives. As the world starts to reopen after the pandemic, fall promises to bring with it excitement and new opportunities for us to make up for lost time. It’s also an exciting time for the beauty industry. Will the laidback minimalistic aesthetics that we saw during lockdown remain as the world continues to reopen? Will so-called ‘soft glam’ rise up in its place as a more elevated alternative for wearing outside the house.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: makeup, beauty trends, celebrity beauty trends, fall 2021 trends
meta-description: must-try celebrity-approved beauty trends that will transform your makeup routine for fall 2021.
meta-title: The Celebrity-Approve Beauty Trends to Recreate i
name: The Celebrity-Approve Beauty Trends to Recreate in Fall 2021
post-body:
A new season brings with it the chance the change up your makeup looks and try something new. Celebrities are amongst some of our favourite style muses – both for makeup and fashion. With the end of the pandemic in sight and the world slowly returning to normal, we’re all ready to have a little fun with our fall 2021 makeup looks.

Celebrities are starting to make a return to the runway and red carpet, with awards season right around the corner, and life is slowly getting back to normal. If you’re a fan of celebrity-approved beauty trends, you’re in the right place.

‍
Ready to embrace your new makeup look? We’re looking at our favourite celebrity-approved looks to give you inspiration for your new look. There’s something for everyone, from colourful eyeliner to glossy lips.

‍
We’ve looked everywhere from the runway to our Instagram feed and candid pictures to find the must-try celebrity-approved beauty trends that will transform your makeup routine for fall 2021. You can expect a few surprise along the way, including statement eyeshadow, ultra-glam looks, ‘90s-inspired lip liners, and a fresh base for a flawless finish.

You’ll want to bookmark this page as a reference for your next shopping trip or when you’re experimenting with your makeup. It’s official – makeup is back! Let’s celebrate with our favourite celebrity-approved beauty trends to give you inspiration for your fall 2021 makeup looks.

Extreme Smoke

‍
Smoky eyes are making a comeback – and the best thing is, they’re one of the easiest looks to recreate at home. You don’t need to a professional MUA to create a smoky eye look. In fact, the more imperfect the better. Your smoky eye look is meant to capture the idea of ‘rock n roll’ and without any sharp or defined lines to the shadow.

One of the easiest ways to create an extremely smoky eyeshadow look is to take a cream shadow and apply it over your eyelid using a small dense eyeshadow brush to give you a solid foundation for your smoky eyeshadow look.

A smoky eyeshadow look is one where you don’t have to worry about going in with a heavy hand. It’s a makeup look that’s meant to look imperfect. You can go as heavy or light with your smoky eyeshadow look as you’d like. Finish off your smoky eyeshadow look with a coat of your favourite mascara.

Over the Top Colour

‍
Speaking of extreme eyeshadow looks, it’s time to bring colour back into our lives. Helene Vasnier, the makeup artist for Giambattista Valli, created a pansy-inspired makeup look for fashion week that was focused on a vivid two-tone look. These abstract and watercolored shades gives the eyeshadow look a beautiful effect.

We also saw bold hues of colour at the Versace show. We fell in love with the electric cat eye liner and shades of crimson, cyan, and fuchsia. You can use saturated or swirled colours to help emphasise the contours of your face. You can carry a bold of pink over with a draped blush of bright fuchsia over your cheeks for a healthy glow. We saw this look at the Vivienne Westwood and Molly Goddard shows.

Don’t forget. Your face is a blank canvas that you can transform with colour and pigment.

Pencil Thin Lips

‍
One unexpected trend that we saw on the runway was the idea of ‘pencil thin’ lips. We’re used to seeing the dramatic and oversee lips that were inspired by Kylie Jenner, but the ‘90s lip liner trend is making a comeback.

It adds a subtle boost to the shape of your lips without getting too carried away. The key is to make your liner and lipstick appear to blend together for a seamless look. Start by applying your lipstick first before taking your lipliner in a slightly darker shade to avoid an obvious contrast between the shades. The general rule of thumb is to always choose shades that are within two hues either side of your lipstick.

Snow White Inspired

‍
With fall just around the corner, you can use Snow White as your styling muse – just like we saw on the runway. It’s a 1990s makeup trend that was largely led by Drew Barrymore. It’s ultra-fashionable and easy to create with just a few products. You want to choose the hues that work best with your undertones. If you’re someone who wears silver accessories, look out for frosted or silver shadows to add to your eyeshadow look. If you prefer gold jewellery, choose eyeshadow shades that have a yellow or golden undertone. You can go full Drew Barrymore by adding a coat of burgundy lipstick to contrast the hues of the eyeshadow.

Red-Hot Lips

‍
Red lipstick is finally back in style. We were all guilty of ditching it when we were wearing face masks. After all, no one wanted to deal with the chaos of a smudging lipstick when wearing a face mask. For fall 2021, you want to invest in a highly-pigmentated red lipstick with a creamy consistency to stand out from the crowd.

We like to think of red lipstick as an instant confidence booster. It’s like stepping into your favourite designer shoes or the little black dress that hugs your curves. When you’re wearing red lipstick, everything changes.

You can finish off your makeup look by focusing on creating a dewy, luminous glow for your skin and adding a thin eyeliner to keep the attention on your lips. If you’ve mastered the art of skinimalism, you can even go makeup-free and focus on your lipstick.

We’ve seen red lipstick being reimagined in several ways this season. On the runway, models appeared with highly pigmented crimson lips, while others choose to go with brick red lipstick with a clear gloss for an ultra-glam finish.

If you’re worried about your red lipstick smudging, it’s a good idea to try and keep it soft with your finish. After all, red lipstick will always smudge. Other runway shows like Vivienne Westwood and Ferragamo went outside the box by using gold and silver liner for their red lipstick. Over at Nina Ricci, they decided to incorporate an oil-finish to their lips with a metallic shine.

Soft Monochrome

‍
If you’re using fall 2021 as an opportunity to get back into the world of makeup, try soft monochrome looks – otherwise known as ‘soft glam’. This makeup trend is universally flattering and works for every skin tone and is beginner friendly.

The focus of the ‘soft glam’ look is to unlock your skin’s inner radiance with natural-looking makeup that has an elevated feel. Cream and liquid products are your best friend when creating the ‘soft glam’ look. Make sure to add a shine to your lips, cheekbones, and eyelids. Lipgloss is perfect for adding a healthy finish to your look. Instead of wearing black eyeliner, swap it out for a more understated hue like chocolate-brown or chestnut.

90s and Y2K Beauty

‍
If you’re a fan of TikTok beauty trends, you’ll be familiar with the ‘90s and Y2K looks that are popping up everywhere right now. Celebrities are no stranger to these two aesthetics. Bella Hadid is the poster girl for ‘90s makeup.

‘90s makeup is all about nude lipstick and a dark lip liner. Keep your brows groomed and on the thinner side, while opening your eyes with a smoky wing. For the Y2K look, go for nostalgia with pastel shades and your favourite lip gloss.

Strong Lines  

‍
If there’s one thing that we love seeing on the runway, it’s avant-garde makeup with a classic twist. We saw this aesthetic appearing on the Erdem and Christian Dior shows on the runway. The secret to creating this look at home is to practice and be patient.

Focus on drawing the graphic shape with a grey or brown pencil before adding over a pigment-heavy eyeliner to give it a smoky finish. One thing you want to do is keep a cotton swab nearby to help clean up any mess.

You can make this celebrity-approved beauty trend more wearable with a simple nude lipstick or a clear gloss. While we love avant-garde makeup trends, you want to make sure you balance it out with a flawless base and don’t go too OTT with each part of your makeup.

Fall 2021 is an opportunity to have some fun with your makeup and fall back in love with your beauty routine.  These celebrity-approved beauty trends are the perfect way to shake up your look for the season.

‍
Which of these celebrity approved makeup looks are your favourite? Will you be recreating any of them at home? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: A new season brings with it the chance the change up your makeup looks and try something new. Celebrities are amongst some of our favourite style muses – both for makeup and fashion. With the end of the pandemic in sight and the world slowly returning to normal, we’re all ready to have a little fun with our fall 2021 makeup looks.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: tiktok, trends, social trends, tiktok trends
meta-description: We’re taking a deep-dive into the world of TikTok beauty hacks to see which ones are worth trying and which ones you should definitely skip
meta-title: The TikTok Beauty Hacks to Try
name: The TikTok Beauty Hacks to Try and Which Ones to Skip
post-body:
TikTok is the corner of the internet that we all go to when we need hacks – whether it’s beauty hacks or for the latest must-try recipe. The video-sharing app is full of advice and hacks that we would never think about. Not every hack on TikTok is easy to do – or even advisable to try. An Australian reality TV star found this out the hard way after trying an at-home acupuncture treatment that she saw on TikTok.
‍

The platform is quickly influencing our beauty trends, creating a cycle of skincare and wellness trends that sometimes seem more like fads than full-blown trends. Most of the hacks you’ll find on TikTok follow the DIY format that often goes viral on the platform. Most of the people posting on TikTok are not trained makeup artists or dermatologists, meaning that not every hack is one you should try.
‍

It’s easy to see an edited video and think that you have to try a trend you’ve seen on TikTok. Jumping into a TikTok hack without researching first, could cause your skin serious consequences. We’re taking a deep-dive into the world of TikTok beauty hacks to see which ones are worth trying and which ones you should definitely skip when they appear on your ‘for you’ page.

‍

Slugging

(Must-Try – Unless you have acne-prone skin)

‍
One of the biggest beauty hacks on TikTok is also one that we think everyone should try. Slugging is a hack that involves using a thick moisturizer (or Vaseline) on your face, applying a thick coat, and leaving it on as an overnight treatment. The purpose of this hack is to hydrate your skin, making it no surprise that this trend started in South Korea. K-beauty is all about achieving a dewy glow for your skin, with this hack being an easy way to jump on the k-beauty bandwagon.

‍
Why should you give slugging a go?

‍

‍
This hack works as it helps to lock-in moisture for your skin, repairing damage to your skin’s natural protective barrier. The easiest way to try the slugging trend is to cleanse and moisturize your skin before you give the hack a try. However, you want to avoid doing this hack after using a retinol or exfoliating acid, as it can irritate your skin.

‍
Slugging is a beauty hack that you want to use occasionally to address seasonal dryness or flaking in your skin. If you start using it too regularly, you’re almost guaranteed to start suffering breakouts. If you suffer from acne breakouts, you want to avoid slugging as it will clog up your pores and lead to more breakouts.

‍

Contouring with sunscreen

(Avoid at all costs)

‍
We all know the importance of using sunscreen, but TikTok has taken it to the next level with this beauty hack. Sunscreen contouring focuses on using sunscreen on specific places of your face, creating a tanning effect on certain areas of your skin.

‍
Unlike slugging, this is one TikTok beauty hack that you want to avoid at all costs. You should be applying sunscreen all over your face, instead of picking and choosing. It can be dangerous to your skin and cause lasting damage that leads to premature aging. If your skin is unprotected, it could even lead to skin cancer.

‍
If you really want to try this TikTok hack, there is a way of doing it that is safer. You could use a lower SPF – like an SPF30 – as your base before using a stronger SPF for the contouring effect. While this isn’t dermatologist approved, it’s less harmful than the original trend.
Whatever you’re doing, make sure you’re wearing at least SPF30 on your skin and reapplying every few hours.

‍

Shaving with sandpaper

(Avoid, avoid, avoid!)

‍
Another TikTok beauty trend that you want to avoid at all costs is sandpaper shaving. This peculiar trend could only go viral on a platform like TikTok. While using sandpaper will remove hair, it will take your skin along with it. If you start trying this trend at home, you can expect to see scarring on your skin and hyperpigmentation.

‍
There’s no reason to use sandpaper for removing body hair. Traditional shaving and using wax are significantly safer for your skin, along with gently exfoliating.

‍
This TikTok trend is one that we definitely advise avoiding – no matter what!

‍

Drinking Chlorophyll

(Skip)

‍
One TikTok beauty trend that everyone is talking about is drinking chlorophyll. You’ll find dozens of videos that talk about its wellness benefits, including improving your skin and diminishing acne. The bold claims behind this hack include that it can boost your energy, improve body odour, and reduce bad breath.

‍
What is Chlorophyll? It’s a pigment that you can find in plants and that plays a role in the photosynthesis process. The hack focuses on the antioxidants, minerals, and vitamins that power Chlorophyll.

‍
While Chlorophyll has antioxidant and anti-inflammatory effects, it’s not as amazing as the TikTok hype would have you believe. There are only a limited number of studies that suggest that chlorophyllin is suitable for treating acne – and all of these have involved applying it topically.

‍
Drinking chlorophyllin has not been proven to have any benefits. While it is considered to be a relatively safe substance, you carry the risk of developing ‘pseudoporphyria’, a phototoxic rash that can form after drinking liquid chlorophyll.

‍
Instead of drinking chlorophyll, there’s an easier life hack that you could try. Add more green vegetables to your diet, such as broccoli and cabbage, that are high in chlorophyll to give you the vitamin boost without the risk of any side effects.

‍

Microneedling

(Skip!)

‍
One treatment that everyone is talking about is microneedling, with TikTok being no exception. This treatment uses a dermaroller to lightly prick the skin using tiny needles. The purpose of this treatment is to rejuvenate your skin by boosting your collagen production to give your skin a smoothing effect, while firming and toning your face.

‍
Most people choose to go to a trained professional for their microneedling treatment, but TikTokers have taken the treatment into their own hands – not always with the best results. While microneedling may seem like a straightforward treatment, it’s not one that you should be doing yourself.

‍
Microneedling produces little holes in your skin, which open up your pores and allow everything from bacteria and allergens to enter your skin. If your microneedling device isn’t clean, it can lead to infections and breakouts that can cause chaos for your skin.
If you want to try microneedling, book in for a professional treatment instead of trying to DIY it.

‍

Reverse Makeup

(Try it ASAP!)

‍
Most of the beauty hacks on this list have been pretty extreme and ones that you to avoid. Some of the best TikTok beauty hacks are the ones that are the simplest and easiest to do. Reverse makeup is an easy to try hack that focuses on changing up the order that you do your makeup routine.

‍
The idea behind this trend is that you put your makeup on by starting with your eyes, instead of your base. By doing your brows and eyes first, you’re able to define your makeup and accentuate your features before moving on to the base. When you do your makeup in reverse, you’ll likely find that you end up using less concealer and foundation that normal.

‍

Bobby pin eyeliner

(Tried and Tested!)

‍
Another easy TikTok beauty trend is to use a bobby pin to achieve the perfect winged eyeliner look. Eyeliner is one step of our makeup routine that most of us struggle with. Unless you’ve got a steady hand, it can be difficult to achieve that illustrious winged liner look.
TikTok is full of dozens of different eyeliner hacks, but the bobby pin one is perhaps the easiest. All you need is to coat the flared end of your bobby pin with eyeliner and apply it against the corner of your eyelid. If you have hooded eyes, this TikTok beauty hack will be right up your street.

‍

Curling your hair with socks

(One of our favourites!)

‍
We all know the damage that hot tools can cause to our hair. Did you know that socks are an easy way of achieving bouncy curls without damaging your hair? All you need is four long socks to twist into different sections of your hair, before securing them with one or two hair ties. You can sleep in them overnight to help the curls form around the socks before removing them in the morning and brushing them out.
Using socks is an easy alternative to a curling wand and means that you don’t have to worry about damaging your hair. The main drawback of this TikTok beauty hack is the time commitment. You won’t be able to achieve a curl instantly like with a curling wand. While this TikTok hack can be useful, it’s not a reason to throw your curling iron away just yet.

‍
Which of these TikTok beauty trends are your favourite? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: TikTok is the corner of the internet that we all go to when we need hacks – whether it’s beauty hacks or for the latest must-try recipe. The video-sharing app is full of advice and hacks that we would never think about. Not every hack on TikTok is easy to do – or even advisable to try. An Australian reality TV star found this out the hard way after trying an at-home acupuncture treatment that she saw on TikTok.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: neon makeup, neon trends, makeup, neon looks
meta-description: One of the biggest trends in beauty right now is neon. It’s neon lights everywhere you look.
meta-title: How to Wear Neon Eye Makeup
name: How to Wear Neon Eye Makeup as Part of Your Everyday Look
post-body:
One of the biggest trends in beauty right now is neon. It’s neon lights everywhere you look. The resurgence of the beauty trends is in no small part due to the Y2K aesthetic, which is making everyone experiment with colour. It’s no surprise that after almost 18 months of living through a pandemic, that people want to see colour back in their lives. Neon eyeshadow is an easy way to experiment with colour without having to buy a whole new makeup bag.

Everyone from influencers to beauty editors and celebrities are starting to show off their love for neon beauty. We’ve seen Selena Gomez stepping out in neon coral makeup with a focus on adding a pop of colour to the corner of her eyes. Jenna Nicole, the Los Angeles-based makeup artist, is the genius behind her neon makeup look. It’s not just the eyeshadow that was neon. The actress-turned-singer finished off her look with a bronze tan and lime-green nails.

Neon makeup on the runway

‍
When we’re looking to predict the latest makeup trends, there’s one place that we always turn to. The runway. Yes, it’s usually where you’ll find next season’s fashion must-haves, but the makeup that the models wear is just as telling. Brands put just as much thought into their chosen makeup looks as the models and sets that they choose. Neon makeup is once again making an appearance on the runway of some of the world’s fashion capitals.

The Autumn/Winter 2021 show for Off-White was one of the first shows to put neon makeup at the front of its look. The fashion house created their neon makeup looks by using crayons in blue and neoprene orange shades, reflecting the colours that Virgil Abloh had used as the centre piece of the Off-White collection. The neon makeup looks were created by makeup artist Morgane Martini, who came up with the graphic neon eye makeup looks that reflected the aesthetic of the collection.

‍
The Off-White collection was named ‘Laboratory of Fun’, which gave Martini the idea of using Virgil’s keen eye to create colourful neon makeup looks. Neon was chosen as the focal point for the makeup looks as it instantly brings your attention to the person’s face, in particular their eyes. Virgil and Martini used neon as a form of self-expression for each individual person – regardless of their age and personality.

‍
While neon makeup is all over the runway, it’s slowly starting to make its way onto our social media feeds and into mainstream beauty trends. We know it can feel overwhelming when trying to experiment with a new trend, especially one as daring as neon colours. We’re sharing five of our top tips on how you can create the perfect neon eye makeup look that is contemporary and cool, while still being wearable.

‍
Life is too short to wait for a special occasion to wear a neon eye makeup look! You want to make sure to bookmark this page to come back to when you decide to give neon makeup a try.

‍
Here are our five tips for how to add neon eye shadow to your everyday makeup look:

Sometimes, less is more.

‍
We know neon colours can be scary. Trust us. There’s a reason why we don’t wear them every day. Our number one piece of advice is to start small and that less is more. You don’t need to go crazy with your neon makeup or think too far out of the box. Start small and work your way up until you become more comfortable with using neon shades. You don’t need to use just neon shades either. You can use these colours to add little details or a pop of colour to your look, such as at your inner corner. You can add a coat of eyeliner or blend in a neon shade.

‍
Sometimes it’s the smallest things that can have the biggest impact. Keep it simple when you get started and find ways to incorporate hints of neon into any makeup look.

‍
You don’t need to go all out to jump on this trend.

‍

Add a graphic twist

‍
One of the biggest trends within the neon beauty niche is graphic elements. It’s an easy way to take a trend that’s synonymous with the ‘80s and to give it a modern and contemporary twist. Adding a graphic twist makes your makeup feel more like living art or an accessory than just a beauty trend.

‍
Just like our first tip, you don’t need to go over the top with graphic makeup. It’s all about letting your creativity flow and trying something new. Graphic eye makeup is one of the must-try trends within the beauty industry. Adding a neon colour palette can give your look an edge.

‍
The beauty of graphic is that anyone can give it a go. You don’t need to be a professional makeup artist to start experimenting with graphic eyeliner. One of the easiest ways to create this look is by using a tape to help you achieve a straight line – whatever shape you’re trying to create.

‍
Make sure that you place the tape down correctly before going over it with an eyeliner pen or pencil to create the shape you need. You don’t need to be an artist to achieve the shape that you want. It’s an easy way to add a flair of creativity to your makeup look. Keep your graphic lines small if you want a subtle look or go all out for something bold.

‍
Graphic eye makeup is a way of enhancing your features and changing your everyday makeup look without doing too much. If you want to keep it understated, use a neutral shade as your base to help the neon hues to pop.

Stay away from your lash line

‍
It’s easy to get carried away when you’re doing neon makeup. You’ll want to keep a micellar water or makeup wipes on hand to clean up any mistakes or if you get a little too carried away. One area that you want to stay away from is the lash line when doing neon makeup. Unless you’re planning on heading out for a night on the town, you want to keep your lash line and lashes as natural as possible.

‍
Curl your lashes and add a coat of your go-to mascara but stay away from adding a neon shade to your lash line. If you drop any of neon colour into your lash line, you can take a cotton bud with micellar water to help clear up any mistakes that might form.

‍
Don’t be afraid to experiment with your lash line on the right occasion though. It can be an easy way to take your makeup routine to the next level, whether it’s with a blue mascara or adding a neon eyeliner to your lash line.

Keep your colours minimalistic

‍
Neon is a bold statement for any occasion – especially when you’re using it with makeup. Unless you’re heading to Coachella, you want to be subtle and minimal with the colours that you choose. While colour contrasting is a growing trend, you want to choose neon shades that complement each other and work well together. It’s usually best to choose one or two neon shades to start with and to choose buildable colours instead of jumping off at the deep end.

‍
One of the best ways to select colours is to keep it monochromatic, especially if you’re incorporating other trends like graphic lines. You want to make sure your colours work well together if you’re going outside of the monochromatic look. Unexpected shades like blue and warm orange can work perfectly well together – especially if you keep it simplistic.

‍
Sometimes, it’s the simplest looks that have the greatest impact. If you use too much neon, it can make your eyeshadow look like you’re heading to an ‘80s-themed disco party. You don’t have to wear every neon shade in your eyeshadow palette to have a big impact.

Keep the rest of your look natural

‍
The secret to pulling off a dramatic makeup look like neon eyeshadow is to balance out the rest of your makeup. This trick is one that we’re always talking about. If you want to make one part of your makeup ‘pop’, you want to keep the rest of it minimalistic.

‍
Let your eyeshadow take centre stage with a clean and simplistic base look. The Off-White runway look didn’t include any blush or contour, but you can add these if you wish. You want to focus on creating a flawless base to help your eye makeup pop. It’s usually best to choose a ‘your lips but better’ lipstick shade and incorporate soft contouring into your makeup look.

‍
Neon makeup shouldn’t be scary. With these five tips, it couldn’t be easier to experiment with this beauty trend.

‍
What do you think of neon eye makeup looks? Are you thinking of trying out this trend? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: One of the biggest trends in beauty right now is neon. It’s neon lights everywhere you look. The resurgence of the beauty trends is in no small part due to the Y2K aesthetic, which is making everyone experiment with colour. It’s no surprise that after almost 18 months of living through a pandemic, that people want to see colour back in their lives. Neon eyeshadow is an easy way to experiment with colour without having to buy a whole new makeup bag.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: makeup, makeup artist, blush , apply blush
meta-description: Whether you’re a makeup pro or are starting to wear makeup for the first time, this guide will have something for you.
meta-title: How to Apply Blush Like a Professional
name: How to Apply Blush Like a Professional Makeup Artist
post-body:
Blush is a staple makeup product that we don’t often talk about.  We usually focus on things like lipstick colours and foundation formulas. We think it’s time to shine a light on blush and how to correctly apply it. If you do it the wrong way, your blush can make your face look like it’s dropped and give it an unflattering finish. Applying your blush correctly means that you can naturally lift your face and give your skin a healthy blush.

It’s easy to think that there is only one way to apply blush. Just like eyeliner and lipstick, you can apply blush in different ways to achieve a particular affect or aesthetic. You can use blush to give you a sun-kissed look, which involves applying it in a different way than just adding it to the apples-of-your-cheeks.

‍
The one thing that every makeup artist will tell you about using blusher is that the application is the most important part. It’s one beauty product that you can have much of. You want to master the art of applying brush to give your skin a healthy glow and to make it appear lit-from-within.

‍
Whether you’re looking to create a natural flush or want to experiment with draping, these are the makeup artist approved tips and tricks that will change your makeup routine. Whether you’re a makeup pro or are starting to wear makeup for the first time, this guide will have something for you. Read on to find out the different ways you can apply blush to create a unique look for your makeup.

‍

A natural flush on the apples of your cheek

‍
The most common ay of applying blusher is to focus it on the apples of your cheek. It’s an easy-to-use method and gives you an ultra-natural look. When applied properly, it gives your skin a healthy flush, as though you’ve just been on a jog. If you’re experimenting with blush for the first time, this is the application method that you want to start with.

‍

‍
You want to start by taking your blush colour and swirling your brush into the powder before applying a small dab of it onto the apples of your cheeks. You can use your brush to buff it out onto your cheeks in circular motions for the most natural look. Applying it to the apples of your cheeks helps to give the illusion of a wider (and thinner) face, while also brightening your complexion.

‍
Are you not sure where exactly to place your blush? One useful tip is to put your blush two fingers away from your nose and two fingers under the bottom of your eye. Using this placement keeps your blush looking balanced and prevents an uneven appearance.

‍
If you’re thinking of which blush colour to start with, a fresh and rosy, pink is always a good idea. You can try a product like Benetint by Benefit – a liquid blush that blends seamlessly into your skin for a natural finish. Liquid formulas are amongst the best choices for anyone with a dry skin type and allow you to layer them over other products to boost the pigment.

Dramatic draped blush

‍
Ever since Rihanna showed up to the 2017 Met Gala with a dramatic ‘70s-style blush, we’ve fallen in love with the look of draped blush. It’s the perfect way to get out of your comfort zone. It’s one beauty trend that we’ve been seeing all over the runway. Draping is often thought of as a ‘side-eye’ blush as it is a softer and fluffier application that uses a small to medium size blush.

‍

‍
The easiest way to achieve the draping look is to add the blush to your temples before draping it downwards across your cheekbones to help frame your face. Shades of rose and coral are the best choices for this draping look. You can also sweep the colour from your cheekbones and up into your hairline, working it across your brow area. This style of application helps to naturally brighten your face.

‍
If you want to experiment with draping, there is nothing more important than remember to blend it properly. You might decide to use two or three different shades to create a softer look, keeping them all within the same colour family. You can focus the bolder shade around your temple and the high points of your cheekbones, while keeping the softer shades to your hairline.

‍
Start with the deeper shade at your eye socket and blend it towards your temple and cheekbones using a denser blush brush and by working in circular motions. You can use a fluffier brush with a second colour to create that seamless draping look and to add warmth to your face.

The sun-kissed and natural glow look

‍
One reason why everyone loves blush is that it’s an easy way to give your skin a sun-kissed look and an all over glow. All you need is to place your blush in the right place to give the illusion of having spent a little time in the sun.

‍
If you’re aiming for a sun-kissed look, you want to use both a bronzer and blusher to achieve this aesthetic. Start with using your bronzer as a base layer, helping to dull the pigment of your blush so that it doesn’t look too harsh or artificial. You want to use the bronzer to create a dewy glow, before adding your blush. You want to sweep your blush over the parts of your face where the sun would naturally hit, including the top of the bridge of your nose.

‍

‍
Don’t forget to add some colour to the rest of your face, including your chin, eyelids and foreheads. When you’re aiming for a sun-kissed look, you want to try and keep it as realistic as possible. You don’t want to make it look as though you’re wearing makeup, but instead as though you’ve spent a day sitting out in the sun.

‍
You can add a twist to the look by starting with a dewy foundation for a natural glow before using a freckle pen to create some faux freckles for a sun-kissed look. You can add extra dimension to your face by using two different shades of blush – one brighter colour and then a softer hue within the same family for added dimension. Take a stippling brush to add the darker shade to the high points of your face, before using the softer hue on your cheeks, chin, and nose.

A natural flush with a low and intense colour

‍
Most of us want to avoid making our face looked flushed. Whether it’s from being outside in the wind or taking a jog, we usually avoid the activities that add a little colour to our cheeks. Using a blush to add a flush of colour to your cheek can be cute and right on trend.
For the most natural look, keep an eye out for blushes with a cream or gel-based formula. Pink and rosy hues will give you a more natural finish and prevent adding too much texture to your skin. You want to focus the placement of your blush on the higher parts of your cheeks to avoid any harsh lines on your face.

‍

‍
If you have any leftover blush on your fingers or brush, you can apply them lightly to the top of your nose. This placement gives you a more realistic look, which is what you want to aim for with this aesthetic.

‍
An easy way to blend this colour is by using a makeup sponge to help apply the colour across the apples of your cheeks. You want to smile when applying the colour, working from the centre of your cheeks. Less is more when it comes to blush and it’s best to start small and build the colour slowly.

‍
If you’re applying blush to nose, focus it on the sides of the bridge of your nose for a naturally flushed looked.

Sculpted blush across your cheekbones

‍
Contouring isn’t the only way to add definition to your face – blush is the perfect alternative if you want a more natural look. If you want to achieve a sculpted look using blush, you need to buff it into your cheekbones using a brush. You’ll place the blush in a similar place to where you would put highlighter, applying it with small circular strokes while blending it upwards and outworks as you move.

‍

‍
You can use this sculpting method to help naturally lift your face by patting in the powder using an upward motion. You can start in the mid-section of your cheekbones and work diagonally upwards towards the corner of your eyes. If you want a seamless look, bring the blush under your eyes but you don’t want to take it as far as your hairline.

‍
An angled blush brush is another option that you can use, gliding it across your cheekbones and working it inward before buffing any leftover product into your temples.

‍
Blush is one of our favourite beauty products and one that is coming back in style thanks to the resurgence of natural makeup. With these tips and tricks, it couldn’t be easier to start adding blush to your makeup routine.

‍
Is blush one of your favourite beauty products? What application method do you use? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Blush is a staple makeup product that we don’t often talk about. We usually focus on things like lipstick colours and foundation formulas. We think it’s time to shine a light on blush and how to correctly apply it. If you do it the wrong way, your blush can make your face look like it’s dropped and give it a unflattering finish. Applying your blush correctly means that you can naturally lift your face and give your skin a healthy blush.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: lipstick, red lipstick , wear lipstick, makeup
meta-description: We’re sharing some of our favourite tips and tricks that you need to make the most out of your lipstick.
meta-title: It’s Time to Bring Lipstick Back into Our Routine
name: It’s Time to Bring Lipstick Back into Our Routine
post-body:
After a year of hiding our lips under a face mask, it’s time to rediscover the joy of wearing lipstick. It’s time to bring back your makeup mojo and to start experimenting with lipstick again. While most of us have started to return to wearing a full face of makeup, lipstick is one product that we’re only now starting to wear again. For years, we saw lipstick as an instant mood booster that could change our day with just one swipe.

We fell out of love with lipstick when the pandemic hit, and lipstick became our worst enemy. We’ve all dealt with the chaos of our mask smudging our lipstick and sending it all over our face. After a few mask-induced messes, we all decided to put our lipstick to the back of the vanity. After all, it’s not like anyone could see it!

‍
As the world starts to return to normal, our favourite makeup product is finally starting to make a comeback. In fact, bold lipstick is one of the biggest beauty trends for summer 2021. The lipstick trends that we’re seeing all over our Instagram feed are bolder and more playful than ever before.

‍
To mark the return of lipstick into our routine, we’ve decided it’s time to write a guide on everything you need to know about lipstick formulas. We’re sharing the best formulas that you want to start adding to your makeup bag and how to wear these lipsticks.

‍
If you’ve stumbled across this article, you’re probably ready to start wearing lipstick again. There’s no better time than the present to experiment with lipstick again. We’re sharing some of our favourite tips and tricks that you need to make the most out of your lipstick.
Spoiler alert: once you start wearing lipstick again, there’s no going back!

Hybrid lipstick formulas

‍
As a result of the pandemic, we’ve all started streamlining our beauty routines. Gone are the days when we would spend an hour in front of a mirror applying our makeup products as part of a 20-step routine. Natural beauty is back in vogue, and we want to keep our makeup routines short and simple. Hybrid formulas are everywhere we look as people reach for multitasking products that allow us to cut down and streamline our daily routine.
After a year of wearing little to no makeup, it’s no surprise that we’re in no rush to go back to the days of layers upon layers of makeup. Along with trends like soft sculpting, hybrid lipstick formulas are becoming one of the ‘it’ trends within the beauty industry.

‍
The beauty of lipstick is that it can take a minimal makeup look and change how it looks instantly. You can take a 5-minute beauty routine and make it look like you’ve spent all morning working on your makeup. Have you ever added a touch of red lipstick and seen your look go from a 6 to a 10? Adding a bold lipstick instantly makes it look like you’ve put more effort into your makeup look than you actually did.

‍

‍
If you’re looking for ways to streamline your skincare routine, you want to look for lipstick products that give you the best of both worlds. You don’t want to compromise on colour, but you want a formula that hydrates your lips as well. Some of the most popular hybrid formulas are also the ones that are most beneficial to your lips.

‍
Tinted lip oils and balms will give you a wash of colour while giving your lips the hydration and nourishment that it needs. The skincare benefits within these products help improve the longevity of your lipstick colour for longer wear. Applying a densely pigmented lipstick, such as a liquid lipstick, can be difficult and lead to mistakes. If you want a quick makeup routine, oils and balms are easy to apply.

‍
If you’re not a fan of applying dark lipstick that you can overapply and make mistakes with, then oils and balms are the perfect alternative.

Don’t forget about using a gloss

‍
Thanks to the Y2K aesthetic, we’ve all fallen back in love with using a lip gloss. For years, we all skipped this lip product as the formulas were sticky and would end up causing your hair to stick to your lips. Gloss is an easy way to switch up the texture of your lips to suit your mood or the occasion. If you’re looking to achieve a dewy look, gloss is one product that you don’t want to overlook. It’s a must-have for your makeup bag that you can use a dozen different ways.

‍
You can apply a lip gloss as a stand-alone product or layer it with other lip products for a more dramatic look. If you want to add extra texture, start by using a long-lasting lip product like a stain before swiping on a gloss. You can choose one that is clear to create a natural shine and iridescence or find a gloss that matches the lipstick shade to amplify the colour.

‍

‍
If you want to keep your base colour in place all day long, you’ll need to use a lip liner as a primer to help maintain the colour. A liner is ideal as it helps to create a base that your lipstick pigment can stick to for added longevity. One type of lip liner that you want to look out for is those with a gel-based formula. These are waterproof and long-lasting, staying in place throughout the day and into the evening. Whether you’re drinking coffee or out in the sun, you want to make sure your gloss has a proper base for the best results.

Go bold with your colour but stay foolproof

‍
After so long without wearing lipstick, it’s easy to feel like you have to keep it safe with a neutral or nude shade. Sometimes, the best way to get back onto the bandwagon is to go off the deep end. Instead of playing it safe, choose a bold lipstick colour instead. You want to find a colour that is both bold and fool-proof, which will depend on your application skills when it comes to using different lip products.

‍

‍
Bright and bold shades will help to naturally warm up your skin and brighten your complexion, especially during the summer and holiday months. The one thing to keep in mind with using a bold lipstick colour is that these more intense pigments are more likely to smudge than their natural counterparts.

‍
If you’re trying to get back into wearing lipstick for the first time since the pandemic, you want to make it as easy as possible. The best way to do this is to find a bold shade that works for you and has a fool proof application. You want to find a long-lasting lipstick that won’t smudge and that you can feel comfortable wearing and reapplying throughout the day.

‍
Keep an eye out for lipstick products that have long-lasting formulas and don’t forget about the importance of layer lip products to improve their longevity. Throughout the day, your lipstick products will naturally start to wear off as you eat, drink, and speak. The best way to prevent this is by applying thin layers of products – starting with your lip balm and going through to your liner, lipstick, and gloss. You want to keep these layers thin to prevent them blotching. As your lipstick starts to naturally wear off, these thin layers will come off seamlessly together in a more flattering way as the colour dies down.

‍

‍
You also want to consider which lipstick colours work best for your skin tone and complexion. While everyone can wear a red lipstick, there are different shades and hues within this colour that better complement one skin tone over the other. Don’t be afraid to experiment with corals, pinks, reds, and oranges as you rediscover the joys of lipstick colours.

‍
Let your lipstick take centre stage with a subtle and glamorous look. You want to balance out your bold lipstick by grooming our brows and adding a slick coat of lengthening mascara, while creating a flawless base with the right skincare and base products.

‍

Your smile is your best accessory

‍
A picture paints a thousand words – with your smile being no exception. As something we don’t see, we often overlook our best accessory. Your face mask will have hidden your smile for more than a year, meaning that it’s time to make up for lost time as masks start to become a thing of the past. Nothing makes your smile look brighter and more dazzling than a coat of lipstick.

‍
If you want to get the most of out your smile, use a blue-based lipstick shade that helps whiten your teeth and reduce any yellow and orange tones in your skin. One thing you want to keep in mind – whatever shade you choose – is to make sure you don’t have lipstick on your teeth. Nothing can ruin your smile quicker than lipstick on your teeth. You want to blot your lip after applying your products, before running a finger between your lips and teeth to remove any excess products.

‍
Are you starting to wear lipstick again? What is your favourite shade? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: After a year of hiding our lips under a face mask, it’s time to rediscover the joy of wearing lipstick. It’s time to bring back your makeup mojo and to start experimenting with lipstick again. While most of us have started to return to wearing a full face of makeup, lipstick is one product that we’re only now starting to wear again. For years, we saw lipstick as an instant mood booster that could change our day with just one swipe.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: wolf haircut, hair style, haircut, tikok hair style
meta-description: Just like most of the beauty trends that we’re seeing right now, the wolf-cut has become a trend in no small part due to TikTok.
meta-title: Why Everyone is Talking About the Wolf Haircut
name: Why Everyone is Talking About the Wolf Haircut on TikTok
post-body:
Summer is the perfect time to experiment with your hairstyle. The infamous ‘wolfcut’ is everywhere that you look on social media and it’s just as fierce as the name suggests. It’s a mash-up of two of the biggest trends in the hair industry right now, the shag and the mullet. Just like most of the beauty trends that we’re seeing right now, the wolf-cut has become a trend in no small part due to TikTok. It’s time to wave goodbye to the classic bob and to try out this latest hairstyle that everyone is talking about.

Unlike the bob, you need a little extra length and more layers to your hair to pull off the ‘wolf’ cut. This trend has made its way out of the confinements of TikTok and is taking over the internet. Searches for ‘wolf cut haircuts’ are up 250% on Google, with more than 415 million views and continuing on the #WolfCut hashtag on TikTok. Meanwhile, Pinterest searches for the hairstyle are already up 75% since the style took off on TikTok. It’s one of the most drastic cuts of the season and one that everyone is thinking of experimenting with.

‍
If you’ve stumbled onto this article, then the chances are that you’re also considering giving the wolf haircut a go. Whether you’ve tried it before or want to experiment with the look, we’re covering everything that you need to know about this haircut and how it became one of the biggest trends for summer 2021.

‍
Spoiler alert: it’s universally flattering, and you’ll want to make an appointment with your hairstylist ASAP.

What is the wolf haircut?

‍
The wolf haircut is exactly as the name suggests. It’s a little on the wild side and has a shaggy appearance with lots of wavy layers to give it extra texture. The trademark feature of this haircut is to add extra volume to the top of your hair, tapering it towards the bottom while adding in a full or side fringe for dramatic effect. If you want to make it as contemporary as possible, you can even experiment with adding curtain bangs.

‍
You don’t want to make this haircut too radical and instead get your hairstylist to tailor it to your personality to give you a cool and relaxed style. What we love about this haircut is that it does most of the work for you and is easy to maintain. All you need to do to look after this haircut is to add a little texture spray and run it through your hair with your hands. If your hair is naturally straight, it may need a little extra work to prevent it from looking flat.

‍

‍
The wolf haircut works by blending the layers and choppy look of the shag hair style, along with the volume and length that is synonymous with the mullet. While these two styles seem different, they come together to create a universally flattering look.

‍
The mullet is a hair trend that seems to make a reappearance every ten years, but rarely makes it into the mainstream. What is unique is that Gen Z have claimed ownership of the hairstyle and made it their own by creating the wolf-cut trend. It’s one that influencers and hairstylists are obsessed with.

‍
What we love about the wolf haircut is that it instantly adds a ‘vibe’ to your look by giving it an interesting shape that is unique and unlike other contemporary trends. This hairstyle works with your natural wave and textures, bringing them to light in a way that you wouldn’t find with a longer or heavier haircut.

Style inspiration for your wolf haircut

‍
With a new hairstyle like the wolf cut, it’s easy to assume that there’s only a few people that you can use as your style muse. The popularity of the wolf haircut means that it’s already forming a loyal celebrity following – including everyone from FKA Twigs to Demi Lovato and Billie Eilish to name just a three.

‍
We’re obsessed with Billie Eilish’s new bleached blonde take on the style, which has taken centre stage for the promotion of her new ‘Happier Than Ever’ world tour and album release. Her bleach blonde colour choice shows how you can take the trend and give it a Y2K twist.
Every time we open our TikTok or Instagram apps, there are countless girls rocking this cool and edgy hairstyle that requires minimal styling and upkeep.

‍
Another celebrity that you can use as your styling muse is Debby Ryan. She’s taken the mullet style and given it a more laidback look by adding a layered fringe that extends down to her ear. This badass haircut has a gender-fluid feel to it and is ideal for those who want to frame their face while still rocking the trend.

‍
One reason why people love this haircut is that it’s easy to maintain. You don’t need to wash your hair more than once a week, as your hair’s natural oils add a gritty appearance to your bangs and the edge of your hair. By skipping a fee washes, you can use your hair’s natural oils as a way of adding texture to your hair.

‍
Only washing your hair once a week doesn’t mean that it needs to have a ‘dirty’ texture. You can achieve the gritty look without being too dirty with just a few products that you probably already have in your cosmetic bag. Dry shampoo is your BFF for this hairstyle, along with a matte pomade to help  add a natural shine to your hair and keep the style in place.

‍
If your hair is naturally dry, you want to use a shiny pomade or choose a lightweight oil to apply to your bangs and the side of your hair to give you the grunge look that everyone loves.

How to pull off the wolf haircut

‍
We believe that the wolf haircut is one that everyone can rock, but you do want to consider your hair type and face shape before you commit to the hairstyle. Like any radical change, it’s a good idea to speak to your hairdresser before you take the plunge. You should consider your hair’s natural texture, as this hairstyle tends to look better on those who can maintain a dirtier look. If you’re someone who is in a routine of washing and drying their hair every day, this haircut might not be for you.

‍
The other thing that you want to consider is how this haircut exposes your face shape. You can describe the wolf haircut as ‘lifting the veil off your face’ as it leaves your nothing to hide behind as your hair is pushed back to your ears. If you want to hide a little of your face, you can add in a curtain bang or a micro fringe to frame your face. If you opt for a fringe, you’ll have to consider the practicalities of growing it out. It’s best to speak to your hairdresser to form a sold game plan, whether it’s regular appointments or slowing trimming the bottom of your hair to encourage growth.
Another thing you want to consider is that your hair type might leave the style looking flat on you if you’re not commit to daily styling. While it is a more low-maintenance style, this will depend on the texture and feel of your hair.

‍
While you’ll see most people rocking the wolf haircut with straight and sleek hair, it doesn’t mean you have to follow the same aesthetic. Curly hair can give the wolf haircut a more feminine twist. If you’re aiming for this look, craft your curls by stacking them towards the top of your head for extra volume before trimming them downwards to achieve the shaggy wolf haircut look.

‍

You can also experiment with the wolf haircut without losing the length of your hair. It’s easy to think that the only way to jump on this trend is by chopping off your locks to a blob length. This twist on the trend is one that you definitely want to see a hairstylist to achieve. It’s on the wilder side but is the most unique style. It’s all about focusing on the shaggy layers at the top of your hair that are synonymous with the trend, tapering them towards the bottom of your hair.

‍
We’re official obsessed with the wolf haircut style and can’t wait to see where the trend goes next. If you’re looking to shakeup your hairstyle but can’t decide between a mullet or a shaggy bob, this is the style for you. It’s a daring look that is sure to make a statement wherever you go. While this look is typically low maintenance, you want to consider your hair type and texture before committing to the style long-term. You’ll want to invest in a dry shampoo and texturized spray to give your wolf haircut a gruddy appearance.

‍
Are you thinking of joining the wolf haircut pack? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is the perfect time to experiment with your hairstyle. The infamous ‘wolfcut’ is everywhere that you look on social media and it’s just as fierce as the name suggests. It’s a mash-up of two of the biggest trends in the hair industry right now, the shag and the mullet. Just like most of the beauty trends that we’re seeing right now, the wolf-cut has become a trend in no small part due to TikTok. It’s time to wave goodbye to the classic bob and to try out this latest hairstyle that everyone is talking about.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: makeup trends, makeup ideas, beauty trends, makeup products
meta-description: We’re deep diving into the summer trends that everyone from Bella Hadid to Rihanna are rocking this season.
meta-title: The Biggest Beauty Trends That You Need to Try
name: The Biggest Beauty Trends That You Need to Try
post-body:
Summer is in full swing and it’s time to shake up your makeup routine. Whether it’s metallic lips, dewy skin, or orange blush, these trends are here to stay. Summer is the perfect time to experiment with your makeup routine and add a pop of colour. It’s officially time for ‘hot girl summer’ and we’re here to round up all the beauty trends that everyone is talking about.

‍
We’re deep diving into the summer trends that everyone from Bella Hadid to Rihanna are rocking this season. As the world starts to slowly reopen after the pandemic, it’s finally time to venture outside and have fun with your beauty routine. We’ve taken a look at the trends that some of the industry’s biggest brands are promoting for summer 2021. Grab your credit card. It’s time to refresh your makeup bag.

‍

Don’t be afraid of colour

‍
If there’s one thing that summer brings with it every year, it’s colour. Draping – a form of contouring that focuses on blush – is becoming one of the biggest trends of the season. Pinks are one hue that you want to fill your makeup bag with during the summer. Pinks and red also work with blue if you want a pop of colour.

‍
For this summer trend, it’s all about creating a grading effect using different hues of blue, pink, and purple. Your eyes are the perfect way of experimenting with these colours. All you need is a handy blending brush and a few matte and iridescent shades. Focus on a strong hue as your base before blending in a metallic layer for an iridescent finish.

‍
If you’re experimenting with this dramatic eye look, keep the rest of your makeup dewy and natural. Eye makeup isn’t for everyone, and you might decide to focus on your lips instead. A strong lip and a glossy lid is one of makeup look that Valentino Beauty is becoming synonymous with.

‍

Keep the eyes on your lips

‍
After a year of hiding our face away with PPE and face masks, it’s time tobring the attention back to our lips. For summer 2021, it’s all about bold colours and a daring metallic finish. If you’re sitting sipping cocktails or lounging at the beach, fall back in love with your liquid lipstick and lip liner.

‍
Don’t be afraid to draw attention to yourself and pull all eyes to your lips. One of Burberry’s staring looks for summer 2021 is a bold metallic gold lip for a sun goddess look.

‍

Reverse makeup application

‍
One trend that we’re all loving is the shift to natural beauty. It’s risen in popularity thanks to the emergence of k-beauty trends within the mainstream and as a result of mask-wearing. The days of heavier and over the top makeup are over. For years, social media has been full of images of makeup artists and influencers creating over the top looks that you wouldn’t wear in real life.

‍
Millennials and Gen Z are the driving force behind the natural beauty trend as they prioritise skincare over beauty products. If you’re looking to jump on the natural beauty bandwagon but aren’t sure where to start, you can take a leaf from the book of Carolina Herrera Beauty.

‍
The brand has been promoting the idea of ‘reverse beauty’. This trend is about starting with your brows and eyes to add definition, before moving onto your base makeup. Starting in reverse order means that you’ll likely end up using less concealer and base products than you usually would, giving you a more natural look.

‍
Reverse beauty routines means that you can have a lighter base that gives you a youthful look, allowing you to play up your eyes and lips. Keep your look natural with curled lashes, a vibrant lipstick, and groomed brows.

Natural skin finish

‍
With the trends shifting towards a more natural look, you want to avoid adding texture to your skin. The finish of your skin is what can make you have a ‘dewy glow’ or a greasy finish. This trend is one that will never go out of style. The secret to creating a natural skin finish is to use only as much foundation as you need.

‍
It’s tempting to think that you need to apply foundation all over your face and to choose a full-coverage foundation. Gucci’s beauty campaign focuses on using foundation where it’s needed, allowing your skin to shine through. You can illuminate your skin with a hint of natural gloss on your lips. If you want to try something different, add the gloss to your eyelids instead of a traditional eyeshadow.

‍
You want to make sure you keep your skin looking naturally shiny than greasy. Your lips are another way to incorporate this trend. Look out for lip products in natural shades of peach, burnt orange, and light rose.

‍

Don’t be afraid to be playful

‍
After a year of wearing little to no makeup, it’s time to start taking risks. Don’t be afraid to play with your makeup and experiment. If it doesn’t work, just wipe it off and you can start again.

‍
Colour clashing is one of the biggest trends for summer beauty. Take your favourite colours and experiment with them. You can take a bright red lipstick and clash it with a lavender eyeshadow. If you’re looking to experiment with colour clashing, keep your base as light and natural as possible. Wearing a heavier base can make your makeup look as though it’s straight from the ‘80s – and not in a good way.

‍
Focus on one aspect of your makeup and keep the rest of your colours soft. You might experiment with a bold blue eyeliner but keep a peachy cheek and lip to balance out your look.

‍

Dewy and glowing skin

‍
We’ve already touched on it before, but dewy skin deserves it own mention on this list. Glowing skin is one of the biggest trends that come back every summer. Keep your heavy powders away for the winter months and choose products that have a cream or liquid formula instead. Avoid contouring too heavily and work with a light hand.

‍
You can try the new trend of soft sculpting and add in a pop of colour to achieve the dewy skin look. Look for lip products that create a stained effect or add a gloss on top of your favourite lipstick. You can also experiment with eyeshadow colours with different finishes, whether it’s a shimmer or metallic. Keep your makeup fun throughout the summer and don’t be afraid to try something new.

‍

Add a touch of green

‍
While pinks and reds are common shades that we reach for during the summer, don’t overlook other trending colours. Green is one shade that we’re seeing everywhere. While you might not want to wear a green lipstick or eyeshadow, you can incorporate the shade using scaffold liner. All you need is a green eyeliner and a neutral shade, working with parallel lines. Wing your eyeliner and keep the second line above the first to create a contrast.

‍
Makeup isn’t a tattoo. If you’re not sure where to start, go bold but keep it minimalistic. You don’t need to use complicated shading or aim for a gradient effect. Sometimes the best looks are the simplest ones.

‍
If you experiment with green and aren’t happy with it, just start again. You have nothing to lose!

‍

Focus on giving your skin the TLC it needs

‍
The beauty industry is slowly switching its focus from makeup to skincare. During the summer, it’s more important than ever to focus on your skin. Don’t forget about the importance of using sunscreen to protect your skin and protect premature aging. Before you pick up your makeup products, start with your skin.

‍
Some of the best products for creating a dewy glow are serums that hydrate your skin to give you a natural glow. If you want to create the look of a sunkissed glow, focus on using hybrid products like a tinted moisturiser that is one shade darker than your natural colour. Your skin will stay hydrated and you’ll look like you’ve just been on holiday.

‍
Once you’ve finished your base, take a light bronzer and apply it to the parts of your face that the sun naturally hits. You won’t be contouring your skin, but instead highlighting with a darker shade. It will give the appearance that you’ve spent a little time in the sun. Another alternative to the traditional contour is to use an orange blush to warm up your face, while keeping your makeup looking natural.
Look out for tinted balms and creams that will hydrate your skin while adding colour. Balms naturally reflect the light and add a shine to your skin, whether you use them on your lips or cheeks. You want to fill your makeup bag with hybrid skincare products that are packed full of hydrating skincare ingredients.

‍
Which beauty trends are you loving for summer 2021? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is in full swing and it’s time to shake up your makeup routine. Whether it’s metallic lips, dewy skin, or orange blush, these trends are here to stay. Summer is the perfect time to experiment with your makeup routine and add a pop of colour. It’s officially time for ‘hot girl summer’ and we’re here to round up all the beauty trends that everyone is talking about.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: livestream shopping, livestream, e-commerce, livestreaming
meta-description: In this article, we discuss the 9 livestreaming mistakes that you want to avoid for maximum results.
meta-title: 9 Livestreaming Mistakes to Avoid
name: 9 Livestreaming Mistakes to Avoid
post-body:
Livestream industry has been seeing exponential growth in the past few years. And, it’s not just the pandemic that’s driving its popularity; the consumer behavior is making it more relevant than ever.

‍
As more and more brands jump on the bandwagon of livestreaming, you need to up your game. Avoiding a few common and underrated mistakes can make your livestreams more effective.

‍
In this article, we discuss the 9 livestreaming mistakes that you want to avoid for maximum results.

‍
Let’s get into them.

Poor Planning

‍
One of the reasons why a livestream doesn’t perform as well as it should is the lack of planning. While livestreams don’t require a lot of input from you, they do need proper planning to deliver the message.

‍
It can be tempting to just go with it without putting in the effort, but livestreams are more complex than they seem.
There are multiple moving parts, so if you want to conduct a livestream smoothly, you need to plan everything beforehand.

‍
For instance:

‍
• Your content should resonate with the audience
• You should use the right livestream software
• Your content and host should be fun enough to captivate the audience
• Troubleshoot any technical issues before getting into the action
• And, more

‍

Wrong Topic Selection

‍
The number one thing that you should have in mind while creating your livestream content is your audience.

While it would be tempting to just talk about how great your new product is, you don’t want to sound too salesy.

Adding value to your livestream viewers’ lives should be your number one priority.

Think about what your target customer would want you to talk about. Make sure your topic and content add value.

One effective way to come up with the right livestream topic is by getting in touch with your prospects. Ask them about their pain points and desires and try to address them in your livestreams.

Just make sure the topic is relevant to your brand as well as your audience. Finding the perfect balance will help you boost your reputation and sell more.

‍

‍

Not Promoting Your Livestreams

‍
Another mistake that streamers make is that they skip on promoting their livestreams. This could lead to a low headcount on your livestream.
To attract the right people to your livestreams, you need to market them properly. Fortunately, promoting your livestreams don’t have to cost an arm and a leg.

‍
You can bring the right people at scale without having to invest a lot of resources.

‍
First, you should be looking into marketing your stream to your current subscribers/email list. Send them an email that you are going live, tell them what will you cover and that they should not miss it.

‍
In addition, if you have the budget, you can promote your livestream using social media advertising. Anything you can afford to get your live event in front of the right people.

‍
After all, you need a sizeable audience if you want your livestreams to bring a good ROI (return on investment).

Inconsistency

‍
Consistency breeds trust and credibility. As a brand, you need to be consistent in any marketing strategy that you are using to further your business.
Being consistent can bring you long-term results for your business. When you don’t have a schedule and go live whenever you want, it won’t turn out to be very beneficial for your business.

‍
Ideally, you should be following a schedule like the good old TV programs. Your audience needs to know at what time you are going live so that they can take time out.

‍
However, how many times you conduct a livestream depends on your resources and business type. If you think going live once a week can be more effective, a daily livestream won’t be a good idea.

Not Testing Your Results

‍
Another mistake that you don’t want to make as a live streamer is not testing your strategies. You can produce the best livestream, but if you are not doing testing, you are missing out on an opportunity to grow.

‍
