Do you wonder why the brick-and-mortar shopping model continues to be more and more redundant by the day?
If the ever-advancing technology has taught us anything it’s that the only constant is “Change”. We’ve seen a drastic change in consumer behavior just because there are more convenient alternatives now. Not necessarily because a brick-and-mortar shop lacked something. In this article, we discuss how the brick-and-mortar shop transformed into an eCommerce store. And, how eCommerce is quickly taking livestream shopping under its umbrella.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: denim closet, denim trend, jeans, style
meta-description: This guide takes a look at the changing rules within the world of denim, helping you find the perfect jeans for you.
meta-title: The New Denim Rules That You Need to Know
name: The New Denim Rules That You Need to Know
post-body:
Denim is an evergreen fashion staple that everyone needs in their closet. It’s a subculture within the fashion industry and is always evolving to meet the needs of contemporary society. Designers reinvent the idea of denim almost every season, changing it up to keep denim current and at the forefront of fashion – no matter what is happening. Just look at the different types of denim that we’ve seen on the runway for 2021. Spring/Summer collection focused on oversized fits that were designed for our post-lockdown lives, where comfort was put first. This season was also when skinny jeans were declared as being cancelled, before form-fitting denim jeans made a resurgence in the Autumn/Winter collections.

One of the new denim rules that we’re seeing everywhere is that you don’t have to stick to classic colours. Gone are the days when jeans came in black, blue, or white. You can find everything from acid-wash jeans with crystal embellishments on the Chanel runway to white denim pieces that include black spied embellishments from Maximilian Davis. Vivienne Westwood brought back denim with a baroque painted print to give it a classic Westwood twist.

‍
When it comes to must-have denim for 2021, The Row’s wide-leg wide jeans made it to the top of our wishlist after they debuted their Autumn/Winter 2021 collection.

‍
Jeans can feel like a paradox. We find ourselves reaching for our favourite old pair of jeans, as though they’re our greatest ally, even as seasons and our bodies change. It’s hard to decide that we want to buy a new pair. Why change a good thing? While you might be devoted to your beloved denim, it’s never a bad idea to refresh your closet. Swapping out your denim for a newer style can help rejuvenate your day-to-day closet and give you a new look.

‍
This guide takes a look at the changing rules within the world of denim, helping you find the perfect jeans for you. While you want to think about trends and the ‘fashion rules’ around denim, you always want to find a style that works for you. Denim is amongst one of the most versatile fashion staples and one that you want to feel comfortable with.

‍
Grab your credit card. It’s time to buy some new denim.

Changing denim rules and the latest trends

‍
Denim is one of the costliest materials to produce when you look at its environmental impact. Brands like Levi are promoting more sustainable alternatives and looking for ways to cut down their carbon and environmental footprint. There’s been a shift towards a ‘buy once, wear it forever’ mentality when it comes to denim – it’s part of the allure of this garment, just like a leather jacket.

‍
The first fashion rule we need to cover for denim is the idea that it should be wardrobe staple that transitions through every season. You want to invest in a high-quality piece that you can wear a dozen times or more. While this might be an investment at first, it’s one that will pay off in the long run. One of the golden rules of buying denim is that it’s a personal experience – not driven by trends but rather suited on your personal style. You want to find a style that flatters your shape and works for your lifestyle.

The denim cuts and trends that you need to know

‍
The denim style that everyone is talking about is high-rise and straight-leg jeans. This trend is elegant but effortlessly chic, working for every occasion. If you want denim that will give you the most for your investment, this is the denim style that you can wear everywhere from the office to a day in the country. Straight-leg jeans are easy to wear and perfect for an off-duty look. If you need to elevate your look, grab a blazer and swap your sneakers for stilettoes.

How to style the latest denim trends

‍
Denim is one material that will last forever in your closet and it’s one of the reasons why designers have always included it in their collections. This utilitarian material is durable and lasts a lifetime, giving you a sleek and chic look that is effortlessly timeless. You can even embrace the idea of double denim by mixing and matching different investment pieces together for a minimalistic and 70s-inspired look that ticks all the styling boxes.

Which denim colours you should be wearing right now

‍
Like we’ve touched on before, denim is starting to appear in more colours than ever before. If you want a look of understated elegance, experiment with deeper shades of grey or a washed-out black for a smart finish. Pale-blue hues are also making a resurgence amongst denim trends, especially amongst high-rise styles for a lighter aesthetic. You want to choose neutral tones that have an understated elegance for the ultimate minimalist look and to get the most out of your denim.

The denim brands to have on your radar

‍
Sustainability is one of the biggest trends within the fashion industry, especially amongst denim designers. There are some brands that are taking sustainability to heart and prioritizing it in their design. The LA-brand Citizens of Humanity handcrafts their denim in their ateliers and work to reduce their water consumption and use more sustainable dyes. E.L.V Denim is another brand with a sustainability mission, focusing on a zero-waste model that uses upcycled fabrics and gives this fabric a new lease on life.
Stella McCartney is a trailblazer within the world of sustainable fashion. The British designer has released a waste-free patchwork jacket that is made using denim remnants from the brand’s previous collections to reduce waste.
Other brands that you want to have on your radar include Valentino, which has recently collaborated with the denim brand Levi to create a collection of sartorial pieces that take the iconic Levi look and give it an Italian twist. Khaite has taken the denim look and given it a classic Manhattan makeover with a contemporary finish.

The true-blue trend

‍
One of the biggest trends within the denim niche is clean lines and a true-blue colour palette. Acid washes and distressed denim are back in vogue as a transitional staple piece that everyone needs in their closet. The barrel leg is one denim silhouette that is making a comeback. It has a high waist with a flared leg, giving you a comfortable and contemporary silhouette.

Looking after indigo denim

‍
Although indigo is one of the biggest trends in the world of denim, it can be tricky to look after. All you need is to give your indigo denim a little TLC to help extend its lifespan. Some people like to give their jeans the least attention possible to give them the effortlessly aged look. If you have rigid denim, you might choose to not wash it every week, although washing will help you break in your denim and make it more comfortable.
When you are cleaning indigo denim, you want to wash it inside out on a cold setting. You might also decide to handwash inside to prevent the colour from fading. You can dry your jeans by leaving them flat to prevent any creasing, while also avoiding the need to use an iron.

‍

Building your denim closet

‍
We all know that denim is a year-round staple that you can wear in the height of summer or the dead of winter. You have dozens of different weights and washes to choose from, along with different cuts and colours. You want to create a denim closet that is versatile and has longevity to it. The investment denim pieces that you buy should fit your body shape and be trans-seasonal, along with being easy to wear for any occasion.
Some of the essential denim pieces that everyone needs includes skinny and straight-leg jeans, along with an elevated whitewash jean, and a more casual style. You will always have an occasion in your social calendar that calls for a classic black jean and it’s considered a heritage piece that every closet needs.

‍
Don’t be afraid to add other denim pieces to your closet outside of jeans, including jackets and jumpsuits. You want to find denim pieces that work with your existing closet and choose quality fabrics that will last a lifetime.

Denim for wearing while working from home

‍
Denim might be the last thing that you think of wearing while working from home, but it’s one of our favourite pieces to reach for. It’s casual while still feeling elevated. Look out for denim that has a ‘comfort stretch’ fabric that makes it perfect for wearing while lounging on the sofa or sitting behind a computer screen. You want to add looser-fitting denim that keeps you cool, while still looking contemporary and chic.
We think that denim is the perfect investment piece into your closet. While there are certainly denim rules and trends, it’s all personal preference. Everyone has a pair of jeans that they reach for as their tried and tested style.

‍
What type of denim do you love to wear? What are your favourite denim trends? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Denim is an evergreen fashion staple that everyone needs in their closet. It’s a subculture within the fashion industry and is always evolving to meet the needs of contemporary society. Designers reinvent the idea of denim almost every season, changing it up to keep denim current and at the forefront of fashion – no matter what is happening. Just look at the different types of denim that we’ve seen on the runway for 2021. Spring/Summer collection focused on oversized fits that were designed for our post-lockdown lives, where comfort was put first. This season was also when skinny jeans were declared as being cancelled, before form-fitting denim jeans made a resurgence in the Autumn/Winter collections.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: Y2K, trend, Y2K hair, beauty trends, makeup trends, Y2K makeup
meta-description: We’re deep diving into the world of Y2K to see what all the hype is about and the trends that everyone is talking about.
meta-title: Y2K Hair and Makeup Trends
name: Everything You Need to Know About the Y2K Hair and Makeup Trends That Everyone is Talking About
post-body:
Y2K is one of the biggest trends right now. Whether it’s fashion or beauty, everyone is talking about the trends that dominated the early 2000s. Whether it’s nostalgia for millennials or discovering trends for the first time, Y2K is one aesthetic that we’re seeing everywhere. Everyone from beauty editors to celebrities and influencers are rocking the Y2K trends. Whether it’s space buns, thin brows, or ombre lips, it’s time to shake up your beauty routine with a touch of Y2K.

‍
We’re deep diving into the world of Y2K to see what all the hype is about and the trends that everyone is talking about. Spoiler alert: it’s more than just an aesthetic, it’s a way of life.

‍

What is the Y2K trend?

‍
Close your eyes and think of Paris Hilton partying with Lindsey Lohan and Britney Spears, the early days of reality TV and Bratz dolls. That’s the Y2K trend. This aesthetic is more like a way of life, blending together everything that made the early-2000s distinctively different than the years before it. Whether it’s bringing back flip phones, pop culture films, or fashion trends – Y2K is making us all nostalgic for the past. If you’ve been holding onto your velour Juicy Couture tracksuit and bright pink lipsticks, now is the time to bring them back into your closet.

‍
The Y2K trend takes its inspiration from the pop culture icons of the late 1990s and early 2000s. Everyone from Mean Girls to Carrie Bradshaw and your favourite Bratz dolls can be your beauty and style muse for the Y2K trend.

‍
This aesthetic and trend is everywhere that you look on social media. Whether it’s Instagram pages with hundreds of thousands of followers or trending hashtags on TikTok, everyone is talking about Y2K.

‍
Are you looking for celebrity inspiration that blends the Y2K look with a contemporary feel? Celebrities like Lizzo, Megan Thee Stallion, Barbie Ferreira, and Bella Hadid are becoming the faces of the aesthetic.

‍

The biggest Y2K beauty and hair trends

‍
When we’re talking about Y2K trends, it’s easy to get caught up in the clothes and accessories that are synonymous with the era. If you want to experiment with the aesthetic without buying a whole new closet, your beauty routine is the perfect place to start. We’re looking at some of the biggest Y2K hair and beauty trends that are easy to incorporate into your beauty routine. Whatever your style is, you can make this aesthetic work for you.

‍
Beauty trends for the Y2K aesthetic as easy to identify. It’s all about keeping your beauty routine light-hearted and having fun with it. Unlike modern makeup, it’s not as much about contouring or trying to have the perfect makeup look. Y2K beauty is all about experimenting with colour, details, and playing with texture. Just think of the over-the-top French manicure with crystal embellishments that every celebrity had in the early 2000s.

‍
When it comes to hair trends for the Y2K aesthetic, it’s all about the accessories. It’s time to dig around your vanity in search of the claw clips and scrunchies that you used to wear. Don’t be afraid to make a statement with accessories or trying hairstyles like mini pigtails. One part of the Y2K hair trend is colour – making as much of a statement as possible. Chunky highlights and streaks of colour are a Y2K alternative to the balayage that has become increasingly popular in recent years.

‍
If you’re thinking of playing with colours, you can experiment with the pigment and placement of your highlights for a custom look that channels your personality.

‍

‍
For Y2K makeup, it’s all about bringing back the look of our favourite early-2000s movie stars. You want to experiment with hues of pale pink and baby blue, glossy lips, and thin brows. These trends might seem a world away from what we were wearing only a year ago, but its resurgence comes in perfect time for a post-pandemic makeover.

‍
The focus of your Y2K makeup should be bright-white eyes, using them as the focal point of your look. It’s not just about brightening your eyes, but your lips and hair as well. Don’t be afraid to experiment with the colour contrasting that was synonymous with the early-2000s. Metallic-blue eyeshadow with a bold red lip is one look that everyone has to try at least once. Nothing screams early-2000s more than colour.

‍

Why is the Y2K trend becoming popular?

‍
If you’re not in the loop, it can be easy to feel like the Y2K aesthetic has appeared out of nowhere. With the trauma and chaos of the last year, it’s no surprise that we’re looking to the happy days of the past for inspiration. The early-2000s were a time of fun and frivolity. We’ve seen other decades make a resurgence in fashion and beaty trends – including every decade from the ’60s to the ‘90s. There’s a long-held belief that trends work on twenty-year cycle, meaning the resurgence of the Y2K aesthetic is right on time.

‍

‍
Gen Z and Millennials are the driving force behind the Y2K trend. The older demographic is falling into the nostalgic of their teenage years, while Gen Z are experiencing these trends for the first time. With the future looking uncertain, it’s no surprise that we’re looking to the past for our hair and beauty inspiration.

‍
Another reason why the Y2K aesthetic is experiencing a resurgence is due to the popularity of second-hand shopping. The younger generations are aware of the danger of fast fashion and are taking active steps to become more sustainable with their fashion choices. The internet is full of advice on how to find hidden gems at thrift stores, with Gen Z sharing their finds on Instagram and TikTok. Pre-loved shopping platforms like Depop and Vestiaire Collective are becoming just as popular as other mainstream platforms selling fast fashion pieces.

‍
As people rediscover the clothing trends of the early-2000s, it’s only natural that they’re looking at the beauty and hair trends of the era as well.

Where is the Y2K trend going next?

‍
Not every trends sticks around forever. It would be easy to look at the Y2K aesthetic and shrug it off as a pandemic trend that might quickly disappear. In reality, we’re seeing the opposite happen as the world starts to reopen again. The obsession with the early-2000s is still going strong, continuing through the summer and into autumn. The future of the Y2K aesthetic is by taking the trends of the era and making them more contemporary.

‍
The most popular Y2K trends are those that take aspects of the original and modernise them. While stripy and chunky highlights are a signature look of the Y2K aesthetic, they’re easily dated and don’t look contemporary. This hair trend can be modernised by switching out the highlighting technique by applying the colour in a softer way, blending it with your natural shade for a contemporary look.

‍
You can take inspiration from Dua Lipa, who is a figurehead of the Y2K movement. She keeps her look contemporary by using bright colours in a modern way. Whether it’s lavender eyeshadow or metallic eyeliner, experimenting with colour is an easy way to take any look and give it a Y2K twist.

‍
It’s not too late to jump on the Y2K bandwagon. Beauty industry insiders are predicting that colour will remain one of the biggest trends for hair and beauty in upcoming seasons. You can try the powder blue and lilac shades that Drew Barrymore was famous for wearing in the late-90s, or the brown lipstick shades that are both chic and Y2K at once.

‍

‍
We love looking to Megan Thee Stallion for inspiration for our Y2K makeup. The singer is famous for using a darker lip colour on her outer lips, before using a lighter shade on the inside of her lips – all while skipping on lipliner.

‍
One thing we know for sure is that the Y2K beauty trends aren’t here forever. It’s the perfect time to experiment with these trends and have fun with them. The Y2K hair and beauty trends that we’re talking about today will naturally evolve into a more contemporary look.

‍

How to start with Y2K hair and beauty trends

‍
Are you not sure where to start with Y2K trends? It’s easy to feel overwhelmed – especially with all the different trends and looks within the aesthetic. The easiest way to start is to bring more colour into your beauty routine; whether it’s with chunky highlights or a pastel eyeshadow look.

‍
Pick up a few hair accessories and update the hair trends of the early-2000s by keeping the colour soft and blended. While blonde was one of the ‘it’ colours of the early-2000s, you can experiment with pigment and placement for a unique look. Y2K makeup is all about having fun and keeping it bright, whether it’s with a glossy lip or a touch of eyeliner.

‍
What do you think of the Y2K aesthetic? Which hair and beauty trends are your favourite? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary:
Y2K is one of the biggest trends right now. Whether it’s fashion or beauty, everyone is talking about the trends that dominated the early 2000s. Whether it’s nostalgia for millennials or discovering trends for the first time, Y2K is one aesthetic that we’re seeing everywhere. Everyone from beauty editors to celebrities and influencers are rocking the Y2K trends. Whether it’s space buns, thin brows, or ombre lips, it’s time to shake up your beauty routine with a touch of Y2K.
We’re deep diving into the world of Y2K to see what all the hype is about and the trends that everyone is talking about. Spoiler alert: it’s more than just an aesthetic, it’s a way of life.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: tiktok, professional, careerTok, TikTok Becoming the New LinkedIn
meta-description: LinkedIn is one social media platform that every college graduate has been told to sign up to. But could TikTok be the new place to focus your job search?
meta-title: Is TikTok Becoming the New LinkedIn?
name: Is TikTok Becoming the New LinkedIn?
post-body:
Is the reign of LinkedIn about to come to an end? It may have found a competitor in the most unlikely of places. When it comes to TikTok, most of us see it as an alternative to Instagram and any other social media platform that focuses on short videos that can go viral overnight. It’s not just Instagram that has to be worried about losing its popularity to TikTok, LinkedIn has to be worried as well.

Most of us think of TikTok as a way of sharing hacks, outfit videos, and witty content. We’ve long seen LinkedIn as the ‘professional’ social media channel where you connect with people within your industry and build your network virtually. For years, LinkedIn is one social media platform that every college graduate has been told to sign up to. But could TikTok be the new place to focus your job search?

It seems TikTok has set its sights on overtaking the niche of LinkedIn by leveraging their multi-billion-dollar app to allow its users to apply for jobs. The hashtag #TikTokResumes allows users to directly approach some of the best-known brands in the world.

What is LinkedIn?

The social media platform LinkedIn launched in May 2003 and has been changing the hiring process and professional networking ever since. It’s essentially a professional networking service that operates online, allowing its users to post their CVs and provide updates on a feed similar to a Twitter or Facebook feed. Employers can also use LinkedIn as a recruiting pool by posting job openings and to update followers on their business development.

It offers something for every professional – whether you’re a recruiter or someone looking to go to the next stage of your career. It’s been owned by Microsoft since 2016. In June 2021, LinkedIn currently has over 750 million registered users from over 200 countries across the world.

LinkedIn allows you to create a profile that documents your career achievements, education, and personal skills in one easy place. It acts as a more in-depth CV, with fellow users being able to provide recommendations and references directly to your profile. You can provide as much information as you want, using different sections of the platform. Businesses can set up a similar profile for their companies, including similar information about their projects, clients, and mission.

Businesses and users can ‘connect’ with each other online, forming a social network that looks just like a real-world professional relationship. You can invite anyone to become a ‘connection’ on LinkedIn, including potential mentors and people within your industry that you would like to connect with.

What is TikTok Resumes?

TikTok describes itself as “an entertainment platform that’s powered by a community that’s fuelling culture”. The addition of #TikTokResumes is designed to enhance the experience of the user on the platform, leveraging it as a way to embark on their recruitment journey.

By using TikTok’s easy-to-use and built-in video creating tools, the platform gives job hunters a unique way to discover career opportunities and for businesses to find the right candidate for them.

TikTok Resumes is a pilot program that has been launched as a way of turning the video-sharing app into a new way of recruiting and discovering employment opportunities. For its launch, TikTok has teamed up with a number of companies who are offering entry-level positions, including Shopify and Target.

How the TikTok Resume system works

The new TikTok resume program is a three-party system. It allows users to search for available job openings, post their video resume as an application, and submit it to the company that is hiring. The feature is already showing promise with brands like Abercrombie & Fitch Co. and Chipotle utilizing the platform during their hiring process. You can even apply to be the next WWE superstar using the TikTok resume program.

The brands that have quickly joined the scheme are those who have been using the platform as part of their digital marketing strategy. Marissa Andrada, the Chief Diversity, Inclusion, and People Officer at Chipotle described the platform as being “ingrained into Chipotle’s DNA” and that they’re “evolving our presence to help bring in top talent to our restaurants”. Chipotle has already used the TikTok resume program to advise over 15,000 jobs across the United States.

How TikTok are using their recruiting program

It’s not just other brands who are using the recruiting program, TikTok themselves are using their platform to scout out potential candidates for job vacancies. Each video application can be up to three-minutes long, allowing candidates to pitch themselves directly on the app towards their potential employer.

Right now, the TikTok resume program is only opened to candidates based in the United States. With TikTok growing every day, we have no doubt that this program will eventually be rolled out globally to users in other countries. All users however can use the #TikTokResumes hashtag to post their video resume, even if they can’t access opened positions.

TikTok has set its eyes firmly on redefining the space currently occupied by LinkedIn as the leading platform for connecting candidates and potential employers. The popular app is encouraging candidates to use the resume program in a way that is “creatively and authentically” showing their potential. There’s no doubt that TikTok’s latest venture is targeted at Gen Z and millennials, who are already fuelling the expansion of the app’s popularity.

You can explore the TikTok resumes program at www.tiktokresumes.com. The website includes several examples to help you see how you should film and caption your resume video. It also shares the platform’s top career creators who share all the tips you need to get started.

Do’s and Don’ts of TikTok Resumes

Are you interested in experimenting with TikTok resumes? Unlike LinkedIn, TikTok Resumes is a new program and not one that you’ll find many advice guides for. We’ve gone in search of the TikTok-approved advice on how to create a winning TikTok resume.

Here’s how you can craft the perfect TikTok resume:

- DO: Highlight why you would be a great asset for a company by highlighting your skills, knowledge, and qualifications.
- DON’T: Be afraid to let your personality shine through. Recruiters want to get to know who you are and that’s why video is such a powerful tool. TikTok is all about authentic self-representation and you want to carry that through into your video resume.
- DO: Avoid saying your last name or email during your video. It shouldn’t include any personal or confidential information as this will be included later in the application process.
- DO: Keep your video up and set to public for one month after posting to allow recruiters enough time to review your TikTok resume.
- DON’T: Use music that is too loud. While music is okay, you want to make sure that you can still be heard speaking clearly.
- DO: Film your video vertically and use the hashtag #TikTokResumes and use TikTok tools and effects to help share your passion and job experience. The green screen filter and voiceover tool are the perfect choice.

Why TikTok has launched their recruitment program

‍
Just like on other apps, there’s an expanding subculture on the TikTok platform called #CareerTok that works exactly like LinkedIn – but in video form. The purpose of the TikTok Resume program is to reimagine what the recruiting and job discovery process is like for the next generation of leaders.

We often think of TikTok as being the home to hashtags about Y2K and cottagecore, but #CareerTok is one of the strongest trends on TikTok. There are over 73.2 million views on the hashtag, with thousands of videos sharing tips and tricks for fellow professionals and job seekers. You’ll find videos where users are sharing their professional advice, employment stories, and tips to help others attain their dream job.

The Marketing Manager at TikTok, Kayla Dixon, has described the program as “a natural extension of our TikTok College Ambassadors program, where we previously employed hundreds of college students as on-campus brand representatives”. Currently, the recruitment program is aimed at college students and job seekers who are hunting for entry-level jobs.

It is this growing subculture on the app that led to the release of Tik Tok resumes, but it’s not the only trend that has led to its release. LinkedIn itself has carried our research that shows that 76% of hiring managers think pre-recorded interviews would help with the candidate selection process. More than 60% of those survived believe that video resumes could one day replace the traditional cover letter.
In an effort to take on the TikTok expansion, LinkedIn has updated its platform to include a new feature that allows users to add a short video introduction on their profile.
It’s hard to think that the platform that brought us viral videos, dance routines, and beauty hacks could become a recruitment platform. In the future, LinkedIn might find itself replaced by TikTok. It’s hard to predict where the video platform’s recruiting program will go next. Time will only tell, but we’re excited to see where the video-sharing app will go next.

‍
What do you think of TikTok’s resume program? Would you apply for a job using a video resume? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

When it comes to TikTok, most of us see it as an alternative to Instagram and any other social media platform that focuses on short videos that can go viral overnight. It’s not just Instagram that has to be worried about losing its popularity to TikTok, LinkedIn has to be worried as well.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: live shopping, livestream shopping, livestream, e-commerce, online shopping
meta-description: In this article, we talk about the importance of livestreaming for marketers and businesses. By the end of it, you’ll know why you need to get started right now
meta-title: Why Do Marketers Need to Focus on Livestreaming?
name: Why Do Marketers Need to Focus on Livestreaming?
post-body:
Marketing is a continuously evolving industry, which can leave marketers on their toes. They need to come up with effective ways to keep reaching the right audience.

‍
Video content is proving to be effective at that. And, brands that are using livestreaming to achieve their business goals are seeing great results.

‍
So, if you are a business that hasn’t jumped on the bandwagon of livestreaming, you might be missing out on a huge potential here.

‍
In this article, we talk about the importance of livestreaming for marketers and businesses. By the end of it, you’ll know why you need to get started right now!

‍
Let’s dive in.

Livestreams are Attractive

‍
It doesn’t matter if your current strategies are working or not. If an opportunity knocks on the door, you better take it.

‍
Livestreams are incredibly attractive for your prospects because of two reasons.

‍
1. They are intimate and “Now”
2. They let the audience effectively interact with the streamer (brand)

‍
Not only that, but search engines and social media platforms love livestreams. Algorithms give a boost to live videos over traditional videos so that more and more people can interact with the content.

Livestreams Inspire Engagement

‍
Livestream content is fresh and interactive. People want the latest news and stories from their favorite sources.

‍
Consumers tend to engage with livestreams better. And, we know that engagement is one of the most powerful driving forces for action.

‍
So, when you engage your audience, you increase your chances of conversions. But, for that, you do have to craft content that hooks your audience to your streams.
Here are a few tips to boost livestream engagement:

‍
1. Conduct Q&A sessions: You can either do a session where you ask them about their pain points. Or, you can do a session where you let your audience ask anything about your brand, industry, and products.

‍
2. Do giveaways: It’s not difficult to get people to take out some time for free stuff, right? Once in a while, conduct a giveaway to keep your audience excited about your brand.

‍
3. Choose the right topics: One way to keep your audience hooked to their screens is by talking about what they want to hear.

‍
What you can do is, get suggestions from them and conduct live sessions on those topics. Of course, you’ll have to keep these sessions related to your brand or industry.

Livestreams are Cost-effective

‍
Another reason why every marketer should consider doing livestreaming for their business is its cost-effectiveness.

‍
Money is most probably the primary motivation for any business. You want to implement strategies that don’t make a dent in your marketing budget.

‍
Here is a list of stuff you’d need for a perfectly effective livestream for your business.

‍
1. A camera and a mic
2. A computer device
3. A livestreaming software
4. A stable internet connection

‍
Probably the only thing you’ll have to invest in is livestream software. And, that shouldn’t have to be expensive either.

‍
In addition to providing a fun live shopping experience, Jumble.tv lets you stream your business livestreams without hassle.

Provides a Better Consumer-Product Connection

‍
A consumer needs to know about the product before they can invest in it. Brands that put some effort into showing their products in an effective way drive more conversions.

‍
The more knowledgeable your prospect is about your product, the more confidently they can make a decision.

‍
While you can show a product on a recorded video, a livestream provides a platform where the audience can ask about it.  

‍
There might be questions that they need to know the answers to. While you can make educated guesses, you can’t assume all the possible questions.

‍
So, let your audience ask about the product through livestreams. Often, people don’t buy something because of insufficient information about the product.

‍
By addressing those prospects, you’ll be able to substantially improve your results.
What you can do is, present your product in a way to address every possible question of a target customer. And, then, conduct a Q&A session to see if they still have more to ask.

‍
An effective way to make your audience feel connected to the product is by using it on your stream. If they can see how your product solves their problems, nothing should prevent them from purchasing it.

It Leverages Content and Influencer Marketing

‍
Marketers would know how effective content marketing can be if implemented right. And, no one can deny the impact of influencers in the marketing world.

‍
Content marketing and influencer marketing can work wonders when you pair them up with the engaging nature of livestreams.

‍
Content marketing is when you use the power of content to market a product or business. Influencer marketing is when an influencer works with you to further your marketing goals.

‍
Put an influencer on a livestream, provide them with high-quality, valuable content, and you’ll see your engagement going through the roof.

How to Get Started with Marketing Livestreams?

‍
One of the great things about livestreams is that you don’t need to go through the whole video editing process.

‍
You can just prepare a script, do some marketing, set up your equipment, and start interacting with the audience face-to-face.

‍
You will, however, need to check a few boxes if you want your livestreams to go seamless.

‍
Prepare a Script

‍
You don’t want to go in front of your target customer without planning your content. A well-crafted script will make sure that everything goes in one direction.

‍
Remember that livestreams should be interactive, so you don’t want to focus too much on the script. The primary purpose of a script should be to prevent your livestream from derailing from the main topic.

‍
Market Your Stream

‍
You don’t want to skip the marketing part of your livestream. You aren’t going to attract an audience if you don’t invest your resources in telling them about it.

‍
If you have an established audience on any social media platform, getting the word across would be easier.

‍
A good way to bring people to your livestream is by registering people for it. This way, you can build your email list too.

‍
And, sending out a reminder email that you are going live is a good way to maximize your livestream’s viewer count.

‍
Plus, you can speed up the registration process by running paid ads on social media platforms like Facebook. But, make sure to invest your advertising budget on the platform where your target audience is present.

‍
Use the Right Tools

‍
Fortunately, anyone with a lean budget can execute an effective business livestream. Most of the equipment that you’d need is readily available.

‍
The only investment you’d have to do is livestream software. Luckily, Jumble has its own livestream software that’s easy to use and effective.

‍
While going with a social media platform may seem like an easier option, those livestream platforms don’t offer the flexibility you need as a business.

‍
You want to control the user data and build your audience on an independent platform.
In addition to that, you’d need a stable internet connection and equipment (computer, mic, tripod, camera).

Final Thoughts

‍
We are seeing a continuous shift in the online marketing landscape. Strategies that used to work in the past are now obsolete.

‍
Think of the classic billboard. When did you last buy something after seeing a billboard from a brand?
Today, internet users love consuming videos and livestreams. Marketers need to follow their audience. So, if you haven’t jumped on the bandwagon of livestreaming as a marketer, now would be the time to take action.

‍
Join jumble’s own livestream software to conduct effective livestreams for your brand easily.

‍

‍

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: lips care, lips beauty, lips care routine, baume
meta-description: Read on to find out all our tips and tricks for achieving perfectly kissable lips.
meta-title: The Ultimate Lip Care Routine to Follow
name: The Ultimate Lip Care Routine That Everyone Needs to Follow
post-body:
When we think about ‘skincare’, our lips are rarely the first thing that comes to mind. We’re often more concerned about preventing premature aging or treating acne. For too long, we’ve overlooked our lips when we think about our skincare routine. In fact, this part of your skin deserves the same TLC as the attention that you pay elsewhere on your skin. Your lips are the one of the first parts of your skin that starts to show the signs of aging and it’s one part that everyone sees. While we’ve spent most of the last year hiding our lips away under a mask, it’s time to start giving our lips the attention that they need.

‍
Your lips are also one of the most delicate areas of your face, constantly exposed to different environmental elements, not to mention the effects of using makeup products. It’s time that we rethink our skincare routine and start to include our lips as part of our treatments.

‍
No one wants to have chapped lips. Just like a dewy glow, soft and kissable lips are something that everyone strives for. If you’ve stumbled onto this article, you’re probably looking for the same effect. We’re deep diving into this overlooked aspect of skincare and sharing our top tips and tricks on how to look after your lips and create the prettiest pout possible.

‍
Keep an eye out for our product recommendations and different tips that you can easily incorporate into your skincare routine. Make sure to bookmark this page for the next time that you’re shopping for skincare products. Read on to find out all our tips and tricks for achieving perfectly kissable lips.

Preventing chapped lips

‍
One thing that we all dread during the winter is chapped lips. As the temperatures start to drop, our lips become dehydrated and start to develop an unpleasant texture. It can make it feel impossible to wear lipstick and can be uncomfortable to talk or eat. The best way to prevent chapped lips is to avoid your lips from becoming dry. You want to start incorporating lip products into your skincare routine and avoid exposing your skin to artificial heat when the temperatures start to drop. One tool that can help keep your lips (and skin!) hydrated is by adding a humidifier to your routine to keep them moisturised.

‍
It’s one tip that pharmacists and dermatologists swear by and it’s an easy way to shake up your skincare routine. You want to let your humidifier run throughout the night as you sleep, especially during the summer to keep your lips soft. It’s also a multi-tasking product that will help protect your skin from flaring up during the winter, especially if it’s sensitive to irritation. A humidifier is also a tonic for preventing your throat from becoming dry as you sleep.

Choosing the right lip balm for you

‍
One lip product that we should all be using is lip balm. It’s one of the first beauty products that we start to use as a young child or teenager and it’s something that you want to use throughout your lip. Using a lip balm is a non-negotiable for having soft lips. You’ll often see lip balms advertised as lip butters or lip moisturisers, although they all do the same thing.

‍
This product will keep your skin moisturised and lock-in hydration to prevent moisture loss. You want to boost your lips’ natural protective barrier to keep them healthy throughout the winter.
Choosing the right lip balm is essential to forming the correct foundation for your skincare routine. We’re sharing our top tips and tricks on how to choose the perfect lip balm for you.

Look out for ingredients that your lips will love

‍
Just like any product, you want to deep-dive into the ingredients list on your lip balm. You want to make sure it’s packed full of ingredients that will protect and moisturise your lips. Some of the best lip-loving ingredients include jojoba oil and shea butter, which will give your lips long-lasting hydration.

‍
When the temperatures start to drop, you want to use ingredients like avocado oil, cocoa butter, coconut oil, and sunflower oil to protect your lips from the elements. A lip balm is usually the first product that you’ll use before applying a lipstick or liner. As a result, beeswax is a natural ingredient that you’ll find in most lip balms as it helps to add a natural shine to your lips. Carnauba and candelilla waxes are other alternatives that you’ll often find in vegan-friendly lip balms.

Keep your lips protected from the sun

‍
You don’t want to overlook your lips when you’re thinking about sun protection. It’s a mistake that’s often made and your lips can become sunburnt – just like anywhere else on your body. It’s not as well reported, but skin cancer can develop on your lips – in particular on your bottom lip as the result of excess exposure to the sun.

‍
When you’re applying your daily sunscreen, you want to make sure you’re using a lip balm with SPF in the morning. It’s best to look out for a lip balm with SPF that is made using titanium oxide or zinc oxide as you’ll naturally start to digest the lip balm due to where it is on your skin.

If a product dries out your lips, get rid of it

‍
We often believe that there’s no way that a lip balm can try out your lips. In fact, some of them can and will. This fact isn’t a beauty myth. Unlike other skincare products, lip balm is one that you should start to see almost immediate results with. Most skincare products take weeks to see results, but you should start seeing a change in your lips within three days.

‍
If you aren’t seeing an improvement in your lips, you want to get rid of your lip balm and swap it out for a different formula.

‍
Sometimes the best way to find the right product for you is with a little trial and error.

The lip care routine that will give you soft and juicy lips

‍
Now that we’ve shared our tips for finding the best lip balm for your skin, it’s only right that we share with you the perfect lip care routine. Just like any routine, it’s important that you get the steps right and stay consistent with your routine. Consistency is key to keeping your lips hydrated, soft, and looking kissable. Even when you start to get results, you want to keep up with your routine and use these products on a daily basis to maintain your results.

Step 1 – Use a scrub

‍
There are two reasons why you want to be using a scrub to exfoliate your lips. This product helps to remove dry and dead skin cells from your lips in order to keep them smooth and soft. You want to start your lip care routine by using a scrub as it helps your lips better absorb the active ingredients in the rest of your routine. It works just like cleansing your skin and is an important first step that you don’t want to overlook.

‍
Although exfoliating is important, you don’t want to do it more than twice a week. While it’s easy to find affordable lip scrubs in-store, you can even make your own DIY scrubs. If you’re in a rush, you can exfoliate your lips by buffing them with a soft toothbrush that has some lip balm on it, working the product in circular motion.

Step 2 – Use a mask

‍
Another product that you want to be using is a lip mask. There are two popular types that you can incorporate into your lip care routine. Removal gel masks are ideal for giving your lips an instant boost of moisture and hydration. You can use it right before a big event if you want to plump your lips. A leave-on lip treatment mask is something you can incorporate into your night-time routine as it works to nourish your lips while you sleep.

Step 3 - Give your lips the hydration it needs

‍
You want to keep your skin hydrated and moisturised by making sure that you reapply your lip balm throughout the day. If you like to have a wash of colour over your lips, you can swap out your regular everyday lipstick for a tinted lip balm. It’ll be easier for you to remember to reapply, and you can skip using lipsticks that can often dehydrate your lips. Tinted lip balms give you a wash of colour while giving it a boost of nourishing hydration.

Our top choices for lip balms

‍
We couldn’t finish off our lip balm guide without sharing our top choices for which lip balms you should buy. We’re sharing three of our favourite types, which are all an instant ‘add to basket’.

Alpha-H Liquid Gold Rose Perfect & Plump Lip Balm

‍
This lip balm is a luxury product that comes with pumping properties. It’s infused with 24K gold and has exfoliating pineapple enzymes that plumps your lips while smoothing its texture.

Go-To Lips! Lip Balm

‍
This budget-friendly lip balm includes medical grade lanolin with sweet almond and jojoba oils. It hydrates your lips while preventing future moisture loss.

By Terry SPF15 Baume De Rose Lip Care

‍
Do you want a lip balm that is infused with SPF? Look no further than this By Terry lip balm that is formulated with rose wax and shea butter. It conditions your lips while protecting it from the sun.

‍
How do you look after your lips? What products are your holy grails? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
