From content to equipment, you need to sort out everything that can have an impact on the effectiveness of your livestream.
It’s pretty simple though. Fortunately, livestreams don’t require a lot of resource investment to be impactful.
But, you do need the right tools and powerful and engaging content to keep your viewers hooked to your stream.
Here are 10 tips from Jumble for a successful business livestream.

Ensure a Smooth Internet Connection

‍
The internet is the only thing that keeps you connected with your audience on a livestream. So, a stable internet connection is probably the number 1 requirement of a business livestream.
Switching to a wired internet connection can be a good idea as it tends to be faster, which will help you carry out your streams without interruptions.

‍
A Wi-Fi connection can be fast, but you can’t be sure about its stability. Your device keeps on scanning for new connections, so you can see a dip in the performance.

‍
While a wired connection doesn’t necessarily guarantee a faster internet connection, it’s more reliable You don’t want an unstable internet connection while interacting with your potential customers.

Market and Promote in Advance

‍
Before you go live, you want to create a buzz around your livestream. The more you promote, the higher the number of viewers you’ll get.
Let’s talk about a few promotion tactics that you should be practicing.
1. Create a detailed yet interesting description of your livestream and spread the word around on different social media channels. It’s important that you tell your prospects what they should expect from your livestream.
2. A creative way to build some excitement around your live event is by making people curious about it. For instance, mentioning that you have an exciting surprise for them can pique their curiosity. Keep in mind that underdelivering can lead to distrust.
3. Another way to attract more of the right people to your stream is by offering an incentive just for the livestream viewers.
4. You can also use the FOMO (fear of missing out) to bring new leads to your livestreams. For instance, you can announce a live contest and a prize at the end of it. Make sure the prize is something that your dream buyers find value in.
5. Lastly, you also want to use the power of advertisement and opt-in forms to get as many people as possible to register for your livestream.

Use the Right Equipment

‍
You shouldn’t have to invest a lot in your livestream equipment. The beauty of livestreaming is its simplicity.
All you’d need to execute a perfect livestream for your business is:
1. A computer or laptop
2. A camera and a mic
3. A livestream software
4. A stable internet connection
Also, make sure the sound and visual quality are up to the mark before going live.

Do a Test Run

‍
After you plan your livestream, it’s a good idea to do a test run to make sure everything goes according to the plan. A test run is important to:
• Make sure your internet is fast and stable
• Check the sound and visuals

Engage Your Viewers

‍
One of the most effective ways to engage a livestream audience is by asking questions. It could be an open-ended question like “What do you think about our brand?”.
However, a closed question like “Do you understand me?” has a better chance of getting a response. Anything that doesn’t require much thinking from your audience will do.
In addition, when you call someone by their name, it gets their attention. You can mention viewers by their names to make them feel that you care about them.
An effective way to attract the right kind of people that are more likely to engage with you is by setting the right expectations.
If they know what you are going to talk about next and they’re still with you, it would be easier for you to engage with them.

Work With an Influencer

‍
By integrating livestreaming with influencer marketing, you can easily multiply your livestream success. See, influencer marketing is a great way to tap into a completely new audience base for your brand.
Influencers know the art of engaging people and you’d be leveraging an audience that they have already established over time.
A great way to find an influencer that’s right for your business is by doing some research on social platforms.
Keep in mind that any influencer you choose to work with might already have a bunch of pending message requests.
To pique their interest, offer them something first. You can offer anything that can help their business grow. By doing that, you can stand out in a list of people that want to collaborate but don’t know how to approach influencers.

Be Consistent

‍
Consistency keeps you connected with your target customers. People tend to trust brands that consistently add value to their lives.
You don’t want to let a bunch of your hard-earned audience go because you couldn’t be more consistent.
You can create a schedule so that your audience knows when you are going live next. Try not to desert them as it can have a negative effect on your business reputation.
If you can’t keep up with a set schedule, let your audience know about it. The idea is to keep them in the loop so that they don’t forget you.

Have a Helping Hand

‍
Although livestreaming isn’t actually a two-person job, a helping hand can make sure everything goes as planned.
See, even if you are tech-savvy, a minor unanticipated fault in any piece of equipment will distract you from your goal.
Plus, you might also need someone to read your audience’s comments and help you interact with them more effectively.

Don’t be a Perfectionist

‍
It’s important to realize that your livestream doesn’t have to go “perfectly” to be successful. The beauty of livestreaming is that it shows the human aspect of your brand.  
A more human-to-human interaction helps you build a stronger bond with your prospects. Aiming for perfection can easily lead to inaction.  
So, the right approach is to make sure you check all the boxes and execute your livestream. Take your mistakes as stepping stones to improvement.

Use the Right Software

‍
Going with the right livestream software is a must to get the most out of your livestreams. The right software is the one that lets you have good control over your audience data.
Plus, it should be easy to use as well. While you can use a social media platform like Facebook to carry out your livestreams, it would not be a good long-term strategy.
A dedicated livestream software is what you need to keep things professional and more effective.
Fortunately, Jumble has its own livestream software that’s not only easy to use but also allows good control to the user.
So, if you are thinking of starting a livestream for your brand or want to shift to a more effective tool, start your journey from here.

Final Thoughts

‍
Whether you are struggling to get new customers or want to scale your business, livestreaming is an effective way to achieve your goals.  
Arguably the most important aspect of livestreaming for business is planning. It would be virtually impossible to move in the right direction without a clear and sound plan.
You also don’t want to lose your hard-earned audience due to weak content. Your livestream content should be engaging and powerful.
And, working with an influencer can help you deliver the right content in the right way. See, they know what they are doing.
Let’s list the key takeaways from this post.

‍
post-summary: Livestream shopping has been a major technological shift in the retail industry. The popularity of brick-and-mortar shops was already on the decline before livestream shopping was a thing. The introduction of livestream shopping is evolving the eCommerce industry. Now, consumers and brands can interact one-on-one over the internet. This leads to more trust and more business, especially for the brands that are trying to get into a new or competitive market. See, with livestreaming, it’s not that difficult to gain the credibility and trust of a target audience. Plus, it’s cost-effective as well. But, you do need to be on the right track to achieve your business goals with livestreaming.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: tiktok, tiktok trends, influences, summer 2021 tiktok trends
meta-description: Our guide gives you an overview of the hottest TikTok trends that you need to know for summer 2021.
meta-title: The Hottest TikTok Trends for Summer 2021
name: The Hottest TikTok Trends for Summer 2021
post-body:
Last summer is when TikTok had its first major moment. Given that most of the world was still in lockdown, we didn’t get to take full advance of the new TikTok trends during the summer. Now, the world is finally starting to open up and it’s never been a better time to take a look at what’s trending on TikTok.

‍
The app has exploded in popularity since the start of the pandemic, even rivalling Instagram with its ability to turn normal users into overnight superstars and make or break the success of product launches. Whatever you think of TikTok, it’s clear that the social media platform is dominating trends everywhere we look.

‍
During quarantine, we all embraced the idea of DIY beauty – and TikTok played no small role in that. Whether it was teaching you how to do curtain bangs or tie-dye your old loungewear, TikTok is responsible for the rise in trends and our sudden obsession with DIY beauty.
Our guide gives you an overview of the hottest TikTok trends that you need to know for summer 2021. We’ve tried to include something for everyone with hair, beauty, and fashion videos to give you a taste of the biggest trends that are right around the corner.

‍

Hair Feathers

‍
Thanks to TikTok, Y2K beauty is back with a bang. It’s not unusual for trends to come back around on a twenty-year cycle. TikTok is fuelling this trend as most of the users on the app fall into the millennial or Gen Z demographics, meaning they are either reminiscing about their childhood or experiencing trends that they were too young to remember.

‍
The Y2K hair feather trend is a throwback to the days of Nicole Richie and Paris Hilton. The beauty of hair feathers is how easy they are to use. They’re a total gamechanger and will transform your look in a low maintenance way. You can keep your feather in for weeks and let it blend in with your natural hair. You want to keep the feather near the front of your head or wear it underneath for a cool peek out effect.

‍

Cottagecore Dresses

‍
TikTok is all about the cottagecore aesthetic. Depending on what side of TikTok you’re on, you may have no idea what we’re talking about. Cottagecore is a fashion aesthetic that started on Tumblr and Pinterest before making its way onto TikTok. It’s set to become one of the biggest trends of summer 2021.

‍
You can think of cottagecore as being Jane Austen meets Bridgerton. It’s all about feminine silhouettes, floral prints, and comfortable clothing that you could wear while napping or curling up with a good book.

‍
These dresses are perfect for summer as they tend to be flowy and oversized, making them ideal for when the temperatures start to rise.
If you don’t have a pretty ruffle dress in your summer wardrobe, what are you waiting for?

‍

Contour Mapping

‍
Did you think that you had finally mastered the art of contouring? Well, it’s all changed again. We’re all used to contouring with a bronzer or cream powder, but contour mapping is an entirely different beast.

‍
Contour mapping involves drawing dozens of small squares in different colours across your face, as though you’re applying your other makeup products. You want to blend out neutral shades, your normal concealer colour, bronzer shades, and a blusher hue.

‍
We’re not sure where we stand on the contour mapping trend. It’s one of the newest trends but it’s time consuming and not something you want to do right as you’re running out the door.

‍

Cruella DeVil Hair

‍
TikTok is no stranger to the world of wigs and extravagant hair. After the new Cruella film dropped, our ‘For Your Page’ was full of videos of girls rocking the two-toned white and black Cruella hair that Emma Stone wore in the film. Part of the reason for this trend is that it fits right in with the E-girl beauty standards. TikTok is still obsessing over the two-tone Narcissa Malfoy hairstyle, so it’s no surprise that Cruella is also having her moment.

‍
What we love about this trend is that it’s easy to recreate at home. You don’t need to splash out on a trip to the salon to recreate this two-tone look, in fact, it’s usually easier to do it at home. If you have blonde or brunette hair, you’ll usually only need to choose one colour to dye half your hair.

‍
Don’t feel like you have to stick to the black and white Cruella colours either. Think outside the box and choose colours that speak to your personality and make you want to show off your new look.

‍
We’ve all heard the saying – change the hair, change the woman. If you’re looking for a dramatic change, give the two-tone look a try.

‍

Bubble Braids

‍
We have another 2YK hair trend on this list to share with you. The bubble braids are easy to create. The look is essentially ponytails or pigtails that are sectioned, plumped, and covered in tiny rubber bands. You can even be inventive and use clips instead.

‍
The look is back in vogue that a number of celebrities, including Gigi Hadid, were spotted rocking the hairstyle.

‍
If you want a more understated look, keep all your hair ties one solid colour like black and don’t emphasise the shape of the bubbles too much. The secret to achieving the bubble braid look is to keep it simple and chic by avoiding the temptation to go overboard.

‍

Colour Lashes

‍
It’s no secret that beauty trends are all focusing on your eyes right now. With mask wearing looking like it will be the norm for the foreseeable future, all our attention is on our eye makeup right now. Even with taking masks on and off, it’s only your eye makeup that will remain unaffected.

‍
We’ve seen everything from graphic eyeliner shapes to metallic eyeshadows and coloured eyeliner come back in style thanks to TikTok. Now, it’s the turn of the colour lashes. You can take your monochromatic makeup look to the next level by matching your eyelashes to your outfit or lipstick colour.

‍
This trend is all about taking a little loose pigment and concealer to physically tint your false eyelashes to make them match the aesthetic you want. Just think, you can wear your favourite go-to falsies and make them look entirely different with a pigment and concealer.
You can follow Mikayla’s tutorial above to see how she turned her false eyelashes into a daring vibrant purple shade.

‍

Corsets

‍
Corsets have been a trend on TikTok for a few months now, and they show no sign of slowing down. Love them or hate them, it seems like corsets are here to stay.

‍
Part of their popularity is that they fit into both the Y2K aesthetic and the cottagecore aesthetic. The one thing to remember if you’re buying a corset is that it shouldn’t be uncomfortable to wear. It’s a common misconception that a corset only fits once you’ve lost the ability to breath.

‍
It may take some trial and error to find the perfect corset for you, but it’s worth going on the hunt. You want to choose one that you can see yourself styling on a daily basis, whether it’s with jeans or under a button-up blouse. Corsets are an easy way to achieve that envious hourglass shape and to accentuate your natural curves.

‍

Bangs a la Farrah Fawcett

‍
There’s a growing niche on TikTok that is obsessed with all things 70s inspired. So, it should come as no surprise that their newest muse is Farrah Fawcett – more specifically Farrah’s signature voluminous hairstyle, from the big curls to the curtain bang fringe.

‍
Part of the reason why the Farrah Fawcett look is so popular is that it encapsulates the idea of a ‘hot girl summer’ aesthetic. The hair flip and bouncy curls show that you’re sexy, carefree, and ready to party.

‍
If you’re looking to recreate this look at home, you can use hot rollers for the most authentic look, placing them from the top of your hair down. The secret is to always lift and bounce the hot roller. When you don’t have time to wait around on hot tools, you can use a curling wand or straighteners to achieve a similar look.

‍

Perfect Complexion

‍
If there’s one makeup trend that we’re seeing on TikTok, it’s finding the perfect match for complexion products. We all know how hard it is to find your signature foundation shade or to cancel out redness or discoloration in your face.

‍
Beauty trends are all pointing towards the idea of a natural look with ‘barely-there’ makeup that accentuates your natural glow. The secret to achieving this trend is to look for products that offer full or buildable coverage. We’ve seen products like the KVD Vegan Beauty Good Apple Perfecting Foundation Balm, and the Charlotte Tilbury Hollywood Flawless Filter Concealer all go viral in recent weeks.

‍
Which of these TikTok trends will you be rocking this summer? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Last summer is when TikTok had its first major moment. Given that most of the world was still in lockdown, we didn’t get to take full advance of the new TikTok trends during the summer. Now, the world is finally starting to open up and it’s never been a better time to take a look at what’s trending on TikTok.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: lipstick, red lipstick, red shadows, make up, lips
meta-description: This article is the ultimate guide for everything you need to know about red lipstick. We’re covering the most iconic shades of all time.
meta-title: The Most Iconic Red Lipstick Shades
name: The Most Iconic Red Lipstick Shades
post-body:
Red lipstick is one makeup item that will never go out of style. While pink is feminine and flirty, nude is a subtle elegance, and coral orange is a quirky twist. Red lipstick is the only colour that works for every occasion. Whether you’re going to a coffee shop, attending a wedding, or going on a date, red lipstick is a must-have for every woman’s makeup bag.

‍
While red lipstick will always be an iconic moment, there are some shades that are so famous within the beauty industry that they have become legend. If I said ‘Ruby Woo’, any beauty lover would know that it’s the name of MAC’s signature red shade. The same goes for Dior’s 999 or Uncensored by Fenty Beauty.
Not all red lipsticks are made equal, even more so when you consider their different undertones. If you’re a fan of red lipstick, you’ll know that there is a difference between scarlet red, burgundy, and rainbow red.

‍
This article is the ultimate guide for everything you need to know about red lipstick. We’re covering the most iconic shades of all time – the ones that every woman needs to own – and how to perfect the art of applying red lipstick. Warning: these lipstick shades are all an instant ‘add to cart’. Whether red lipstick is your signature, or you want to give it a try, you’re guaranteed to learn something new from this guide.

‍

How to wear red lipstick

‍
Unlike pink lipstick or a berry tinted gloss, red lipstick can be daunting to wear. While it adds an instant ‘wow factor’ to your outfit, it’s easier to see mistakes in your application. We’ve all smudged red lipstick onto our teeth at least once. Before we jump into our top red lipstick recommendations, we wanted to share our secrets on how to achieve an effortless red lipstick application.

‍
Before you add your red lipstick, you want to stop and consider the rest of your makeup. You want to avoid wearing blush that is too dark against your skin if you’re also wearing a red lipstick colour. It’s best to balance our red lipstick with a lighter pink blush.

‍
Before you go anywhere near your lips with a lipstick, you want to stop and add a lip balm. The last thing you want is to be applying red lipstick onto cracked lips. If you apply a lip balm first, your lips will be hydrated and plumper, making it easier for you to apply your lipstick and giving you a smoother finish to your look.

‍
If you want to achieve the most even and perfect red lipstick application, you need to be using a lip liner. You might think of them as an unnecessary add-on, but they’re a gamechanger for helping you get a smooth finish and will boost the longevity of your red lipstick. You can also use a blot of foundation or concealer over your lips to help cancel out your natural lip shade to make the red pop.

‍
It’s a good idea to keep some micellar water and cotton buds on hand to help clean up any mistakes you make during the application process. You can also touch-up your lips by applying concealer underneath your lip line to give you a bolder line.

‍
Every red lipstick is a different colour, the undertones and brightness impact how the shade looks on your lips. You want to consider your complexion and skin tone when you’re choosing which red lipstick you want to make your signature.

‍

The 15 most popular red lipstick shades of all time

‍
When it comes to buying your red lipsticks, there are fifteen shades that every woman should try. Grab your credit card, all of these need to be added to your makeup bag.

Mac Cosmetics’ Ruby Woo Matte Lipstick

‍
Ruby Woo is perhaps the most iconic red lipstick shade of all time. It has a semi-matte formula that is so popular that Rihanna even had a custom shade made for a collaboration with the brand called Riri Woo.

‍

Fenty Beauty Uncensored Stunna Lip Paint Longwear Fluid Lip Color

‍
The first red lipstick from Rihanna’s beauty brand, Fenty Beauty, is universally flattering and is opaque with just one swipe. The matte formula will last all day long, taking you from day to night. This red lipstick shade will stay on until you remove it at the end of the night.

‍

NARS Dragon Girl Velvet Matte Lip Pencil

‍
You can get an iconic red lip colour without using a traditional lipstick. The velvet matte lip pencil from NARS gives you the same colour as a lipstick but with the versatility of a pencil.

‍
Dragon Girl is an unapologetically bright shade of red that has a pink undertone, making it perfect for those trying to transition from wearing pink colours to red. Did you know that Dragon Girl is the go-to shade of Taylor Swift?

‍

The Lip Bar Hot Mama Matte Liquid Lipstick

‍
What we love about Hot Mama is that it’s a fiery matte red shade that works with every skin tone, giving you a pop of colour. As this lipstick dries down, you can be guaranteed that the colour won’t move until the end of the night.

‍

Gucci Goldie Red Rouge a Levres Matte Lipstick

‍
While Gucci’s makeup brand is relatively new, it’s no surprise that their signature red shade has already made it onto this list. The formula is ultra-soft with a matte finish. You get the ultimate flexibility of choosing between a just-there red tint to your lips or layering it for an opaquer look.

‍

Revlon Fire & Ice Super Lustrous Lipstick

‍
The name ‘Fire & Ice’ was synonymous with red lipstick long before Game of Thrones hit our TV screens. This classic red shade dates back to 1952 and is still available today. If you want to wear the same shade as some of Hollywood’s most iconic legends, this is the red lipstick for you.

‍

Guerlain Rouge Kiss KissKiss Creamy Finish Lipstick

‍
For a hydrating and moisturising formula, look no further than Guerlain’s Rouge Kiss shade. What we love about this colour is that it has a blue-red tone, meaning that it helps to brighten the appearance of your teeth and give them a whiter look.

‍

Shiseido Ginza Red VisionAiry Gel Lipstick

‍
If you want a weightless red lipstick, look no further than the Ginza Red shade by Shiseido. You get a classic red shade that will stay on all day, whether you swipe it over your lips or dab it on for a more natural look.

‍

Dior 999 Rogue Dior Lipstick

‍
The iconic 999 shade from Dior is a fan-favourite amongst celebrities and influencers alike. It flatters every skin tone and is a must-have for all fans of luxury makeup.

‍

Beauty Bakerie Bowl of Cherries Matte Lip Whip

‍
Beauty Bakerie is fast becoming one of our favourite makeup brands. With its waterproof and smudge-proof formula, the Matte Lip Whip is one of the most talked about lipstick formulas. No matter what you put it through, this lipstick colour won’t move.

‍

Chanel Pirate Luminous Intense Lip Colour

‍
Another luxury red lipstick that you should consider is Pirate by Chanel. While the brand has over a dozen red shades for you to choose from, Pirate is one of the most famous shades of all-time from Chanel.

‍

Pat McGrath Labs Obsessed! MatteTrance Lipstick

‍
Pat McGrath is a leading brand within the industry, making it no surprise that her brand makes an appearance on this list. If you’re a fan of an orange-red lipstick shade, this colour will be your go-to. It has one of the best matte formulas on market and gives you a creamy and smooth application process that won’t dry your lips. The colour is long-lasting and scentless, making it ideal for all-day wear.

‍

Maybelline Red Revival Color Sensational The Creams

‍
Maybelline’s pigmented formula is a go-to drugstore dupe for those who don’t want to spend the price of a MAC or Chanel lipstick. You might find that the color is an exact dupe for other shades on this list.

‍

Christian Louboutin Rouge Louboutin Velvet Matte

‍
Red is a colour synonymous with Christian Louboutin and his red bottom shoes. In fact, you’ll usually hear Louboutins being referred to simply as ‘red bottoms’. When the shoe designer launched his beauty brand, it was no surprise that red was one of the focal colours of his products. The shade ‘Rouge Louboutin’ is an exact match to the red of his shoes, making this colour a must-have for any shoe fan.

‍

Yves Saint Laurent Le Rouge Rogue Pur Couture Lipstick

‍
Nothing looks better than a red lipstick bullet in one of YSL’s statement gold cases. It’s a classic old Hollywood inspired colour that is universally flattering and works for every skin tone and complexion.

‍

‍
Do you wear red lipstick or are you considering taking the plunge? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Red lipstick is one makeup item that will never go out of style. While pink is feminine and flirty, nude is a subtle elegance, and coral orange is a quirky twist. Red lipstick is the only colour that works for every occasion. Whether you’re going to a coffee shop, attending a wedding, or going on a date, red lipstick is a must-have for every woman’s makeup bag.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: summer purchases, fashion, summer style, summer must have, fashion trends
meta-description: This guide shows you everything that you need in your summer closet to be heatwave ready.
meta-title: The Fashion Purchases You Need to Make This Summer
name: The Fashion Purchases You Need to Make This Summer
post-body:
Summer is right around the corner. If there’s one thing that we’ve learnt, it’s that heatwaves come at the least expected moment. It’ll be raining one moment, and the next you’ve got record breaking temperatures. This summer, we’re committed to being prepared for whatever heatwave comes our way. While we love a chance to sit outside with a cocktail and sunbath (with SPF on!), it can make getting dressed a little tricky. No one wants to wear layers upon layers of clothes during a heatwave but finding weather-appropriate clothing can be difficult.
This guide shows you everything that you need in your summer closet to be heatwave ready. Don’t forget to buy a few extra bottles of SPF (and reapply!), along with keeping a sun hat or bucket hat nearby to protect your face from the sun. We’re rounding up twenty of our must-have summer buys to see you through the season and help you survive the heat.

We’re covering everything from the oversized sunglasses that you can’t afford to sleep on, along with swimsuits and the dresses that everyone will be wearing this season. With sunshine on our doorstep, it’s time to treat yourself and click ‘add to basket’. Trust us. You’re worth it!

A colourful bucket hat!

‍
If there’s one thing you should be thinking about during the summer, it’s how to protect yourself from the sun. The heat and humidity can dehydrate your hair and leave frizz behind. Wearing a bucket hat not only protects your scalp, but it serves as an extra layer of protection for your skin against the UV rays.

A one-shoulder swimsuit

‍
Is it even summer if you don’t buy a new swimsuit? Splurge on a one-shoulder swimsuit that you can post all over your Instagram feed. If you’re only planning to make one splurge purchase this summer, let it be a new swimsuit. We’re obsessed with this Maygel Coronel ruffled one-shoulder swimsuit – it’s a classic that you can wear for years on end.

Birkenstocks

‍
If you haven’t already bought yourself a pair of Birkenstocks, then now is the time. These shoes are everywhere you look on social media, with celebrities and influencers alike rocking the style. These shoes can go with you everywhere this summer, whether you’re having brunch with your girlfriends or sipping cocktails at the pool bar.

Cut out dress

‍
One of the biggest trends of 2021 is cut-out or cutaway dresses. Whatever your style preference is, you’re guaranteed to find a silhouette that works for you. While back cut-outs are a conventional choice, you can find this style with more innovative cutaways elsewhere on the garment. This cut-out dress by H&M is top of our wishlist. This dress is one of the most versatile style that you can choose and will see you through any event this summer.

Basket bag

‍
The basket bag is a trend that comes back in style every summer. If you don’t already own a basket bag, now is the time. This silhouette and style are perfect for day trips to the beach or to carry your essentials to a friend’s garden party or engagement shower. You can hold everything you’ll need for a summer BBQ or cocktail party. We’re fans of this budget-friendly version from H&M.

Midi dresses

‍
Summer is a time of special occasions like birthdays, graduations, and weddings. Whatever events you have on your social calendar, you want to have a midi dress in your closet that you can rely on to see you through it all. A midi-dress works for any occasion and has a universally flattering silhouette. You can wear it to brunch one day, and a friend’s birthday bash the next. You can splurge on a midi-dress from The Vampire’s Wife or keep it simple with this voluminous tube top midi dress from & Other Stories.

Oversized coloured sunglasses

‍
Along with a swimsuit, a summer essential will always be oversized sunglasses. One trend that we’re loving this season is coloured framed. You can pick up a budget-friendly style from ASOS or splurge on classic Gucci frames. You can even think outside the box and choose a style with a coloured lenses for a dramatic look.

Terry Cotton Shorts

‍
Most of us spend summer sitting outside sunbathing and trying to get a natural tan. Terry cotton shorts are one of our staples for the season. They’ll keep you looking cool and stylish all summer long, whether or not you’re heading to the gym. You can pick up an affordable style from NA-KD or go all out with STAUD shorts.

Linen Top

‍
Speaking of clothes that will keep you cool; every woman needs a linen top in their closet. Once the temperatures start to rise, you’ll be glad to have it to keep you cool. You can keep it classic with a front tie linen blouse or choose a more structured peplum style silhouette.

Leather sandals

‍
If you’re looking to make a splurge purchase this summer, look no further than the classic Hermes leather sandals. These summer shoes will never go out of style. We’ve added the Camelia sandals to this list as a less common version of the Oran sandals that are amongst the brand’s best-selling items.

Two-piece swimsuit

‍
When you’re planning to sit at the poolside instead of getting into the water, you want a two-piece bikini to help you get an even tan. Nothing looks chicer than a matching bikini set during the summer. If you want a feminine look, we recommend the Loveshackfancy floral rigley bikini.

Midi Skirt

‍
Along with your midi-dress, you want to have a midi-skirt in your close that you can wear on days when you don’t want a dress. You’re spoilt for choice with hundreds of styles to choose from. We love this frilled midi skirt from & Other Stories, along with the midi pleated skirt from NA-KD.

Tortoiseshell sunglasses

‍
For a classic and Jackie Kennedy inspired look, you want to invest in a pair of tortoiseshell sunglasses. You can choose a round lens style (like these classic Mint Velvet lenses) or go for an affordable cat eye silhouette. Whatever your budget is, you’re guaranteed to be able to find tortoiseshell sunglasses that will work for you.

Beaded shoulder bag

‍
Bring back the roaring twenties into a new age with a beaded shoulder bag. It’s the perfect way to bring a vintage feel to your outfit while still keeping it contemporary. You can make a statement with this Tulipa Multi Beaded Bag by Not Impressed.

Printed Shorts

‍
Don’t think that you have to stick to monochrome shorts. Sometimes, you can let your shorts do the talking. We love these cotton printed shorts by Story MFG, which you can style with a linen blouse or a t-shirt to finish off your look.

‍

Straw hat

‍
One accessory that every woman should wear at least once in their life is an oversized straw hat. This accessory is a staple within the preppy fashion scene and adds a hint of romanticism to any outfit. You can channel your inner Bridgeton character with this Eliurpi straw hat.

‍

Leather flip-flops

‍
Summer is the perfect time to indulge in a pedicure. It’s time to bring back the classic leather flip flops. While rubber flip flops might be a more affordable choice and easy to throw into your bag, they’re more harmful for the environment. Don’t forget to add an extra coat of polish to your nails before stepping out in these shoes.

Cotton dress

‍
One thing we love about cotton is how breathable it is. It’s the perfect fabric to turn to when you’re not sure how high the temperatures will get. If you’re heading off on vacation or indulging in a staycation, you want to pack a cotton dress with you for when the temperatures start to rise.

Silk-twill bandana

‍
When it comes to staying cool during the summer, you want to have a silk-twill bandana on hand to wrap up your hair. When your hair comes into contact with UV rays, it can become dehydrated and brittle. Tying your hair back with a bandana can offer an extra layer of protection. It’s perfect for a music festival look or a tropical vacation.

Halter-neck Top

‍
During the summer, you want to be able to show off your fresh tan and glowing skin. A halter neck is the perfect blend of a timeless silhouette with a sultry look. Whether you’re heading out on the town with friends or going on a date, a halter neck is one style of top you want to have in your closet. A silk-satin halter neck top is a classic choice that works for any occasion, while cotton gives you added wearability.

‍
What purchases are you planning to add to your summer closet? Are you going to click ‘add to cart’ on any of the items on this list? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

‍
post-summary: Summer is right around the corner. If there’s one thing that we’ve learnt, it’s that heatwaves come at the least expected moment. It’ll be raining one moment, and the next you’ve got record breaking temperatures. This summer, we’re committed to being prepared for whatever heatwave comes our way. While we love a chance to sit outside with a cocktail and sunbath (with SPF on!), it can make getting dressed a little tricky. No one wants to wear layers upon layers of clothes during a heatwave but finding weather-appropriate clothing can be difficult.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: sun care, spf, sunscreen, summer beauty care
meta-description: We’re taking an in-depth look at what you should be including in your everyday sun care routine.
meta-title: What You Need to Know About Your Sun Care Routine
name: What You Need to Know About Your Everyday Sun Care Routine
post-body:
When you think of your skincare routine, how often do you consider the impact of the sun? While the sun is an instant boost of serotonin, it can wreak havoc on your skin. We all know the importance of applying SPF. The sun and its UV rays can accelerate premature aging and damage your skin’s natural protective barrier. When it comes to your skincare routine, the sun is something you can’t afford to overlook. We’re taking an in-depth look at what you should be including in your everyday sun care routine.

The importance of SPF

‍
The first thing to remember is that SPF isn’t optional and it’s not a seasonal staple. Unlike your fake tan, SPF is something you want to be using year-round. If you want to protect your skin from UV rays, you need to be applying SPF on a daily basis. Using SPF every once in a while isn’t enough to look after your skin. Consistency is always key for your skincare routine.
While the sun’s vitamin D can benefit your skin and brighten your mood, you want to ensure you’re also protecting your skin from sun damage. Continued exposure to the sun can lead to premature aging, including age spots and sagging as your skin loses its firmness and collagen production.
Prevention is always better than the cure. Without wearing sunscreen, your skin will be prone to everything from sunburn to hyperpigmentation and fine lines. It’s important to mention the role that SPF plays in protecting you from skin cancer.
The Skin Cancer Foundation recommend using a daily sunscreen with at least SPF 15 to reduce your risk of squamous cell carcinoma by 40% and lower your melanoma risk by 50%. It only takes a 30 seconds to apply your SPF, but it can be a gamechanger in protecting your health.

Using SPF in your daily routine

‍
You might think that moisturiser is the final step of your skincare routine. While this is true for your night-time regime, your daytime routine should always end with your sunscreen. You want to be applying an SPF to anywhere on your body that is going to be exposed to the sun. Regardless of what you’re wearing, this will usually be your face and hands.
You want to have a separate SPF for your face and one for your body. Apply both SPFs around 20 minutes before you head outside. Even if it’s raining and cloudy outdoors, you want to be wearing your SPF. Even if you don’t see the sun, it’s always there, lingering in the background. You also don’t need to be sitting outside to be exposed to UV rays. Sitting by a window is enough for your body to come into contact with the sun.
It’s not enough to just put your SPF on once a day. You want to be carrying your sunscreen with you every day to reapply throughout the day. The usual rule of thumb is to reapply your SPF every two to three hours on a sunny day. On cloudy days, you can usually reapply your SPF around the same time you’re adding a fresh coat of lipg gloss.

What is the right amount of SPF to use?

‍
One of the most common questions about incorporating sunscreen into your routine is how much should you be using? It’s not an exact science and everyone’s skin is different. You want to be using enough sunscreen to cover your exposed skin, including areas of your face like your ears and neck.
Usually, a teaspoon of sunscreen is enough to cover your face, although this will depend on the consistency of your product. You want to be using enough that it gives you a coat of SPF to protect your skin without missing out on any parts of your face.
Your sunscreen should cover everything from your chest and decolletage to your ears and hairline. Don’t forget about your lips! Chapped lips can be caused by dehydration in the summer as well as the winter.
You want to make sure you’re using the right level of SPF for the climate. As a general rule, you should always be wearing at least SPF15. When you’re spending the day outdoor, you want to make sure you’re using an SPF30 or higher. Your local supermarket will usually stock at least SPF30 or SPF50 for you to use.
If you’re heading on vacation, you can find a higher SPF sunscreen if needed. It’s always best to go up with your SPF than to be using one that doesn’t provide enough protection.

Do I need to be wearing SPF?

‍
Everyone should be wearing sunscreen, regardless of their age or gender. The only category of people who can’t wear sunscreen are babies under 6 months as their skin is too sensitive. Instead, you should be keeping them out of the sun and adding sun-protective clothing. These tips are also great for both adults and kids alike.
If you’re not already wearing a daily SPF, this is a sign to start today. Every skin tone should be using SPF. The sun doesn’t discrimination, regardless of what your skin undertones or color is. Whether you tan or don’t tan, you should be using an SPF every day.
While it’s true that darker skin tones can be a little more resilient to sun damage, they are also susceptible to the same skin induced issues and sun burns. On the flip side, those with darker skin tones are often more likely to experience skin cancer, because they believe they’re less likely to be at risk of sun damage.
Thankfully, as the beauty industry involves and becomes more inclusive, it is easier to find sunscreens that do not leave a white or ashy cast on your skin.

What is the best type of SPF to use?

‍
You’re spoilt for choice of sunscreens as the industry wakes up to the importance of using SPF every day. There are dozens of sunscreens to choose from that offer protection from UVA and UVB rays. Just like your beauty products, sunscreens include active ingredients that help to protect your skin from sun damage and prevent UV rays attacking your skin.
The most popular types are either chemical or mineral SPFs. It’s usually a matter of preference when deciding which one you should be using.
Mineral SPFs are usually less irritating and a good choice for those with sensitive skin as it sits on your skin’s surface, while still blocking out the harmful UV rays. This type of sunscreen is also known as ‘physical’ SPF and contains minerals like titanium dioxide and zinc oxide. They block out the UV rays from penetrating into your skin.
Chemical SPFs have a thinner consistency, making them ideal for wearing under your makeup and easily absorbs into your skin. This type of sunscreen is made with chemical ingredients like avobenzone and octisalate. They work by absorbing the UV rays before they can damage your skin.
You can choose to mix and match these types of sunscreens, depending on whether you’re wearing makeup, or settle on whichever one works best for you. Most of the sunscreens you find on the market are actually a blend of mineral and chemical ingredients. Both physical and chemical SPFs are equally as effective, making it a personal preference as to which one will work best for you.
It’s worth remembering that you need to be using a dedicated SPF and not relying on the sun protection in other beauty products. These products offer an add-on protection that helps to top-up the SPF in your sunscreen, but you should not be relying on them as an independent sunscreen.
The Skin Cancer Foundation recommend that the best SPF you can use is the one you’re most likely to use. As long as the sunscreen gives you the protection you need and has at least an SPF of 15, you’re good to go! It may take some trial and error, but you’re guaranteed to eventually find a sunscreen that works for you and your skin.

How to remove SPF

‍
Just like your makeup, you want to make sure you’re removing your SPF at the end of the day. Cleansing should be the focal point of your skincare routine to remove impurities and dirt from your skin.
Using an SPF is like having hairspray in your hair. It sticks to your skin and won’t move until you remove it. You should be double cleansing when wearing a sunscreen as it helps to break down your SPF before removing dead skin cells. You can use an oil or balm cleanser as your first step before following it up with a gentle face wash.
Just like sleeping with your makeup on, forgetting to remove your sunscreen can clog your pores, lead to breakouts, and cause skin irritation.
Even if you’re not planning to wear makeup or spend time outdoors, you should be wearing an SPF every day. Sitting by your window is enough for the UV rays to reach your skin. Protect yourself from the risk of skin cancer and prevent premature aging by taking 30 seconds out of your day to apply sunscreen. Trust us. You’ll thank yourself later.

‍
post-summary: When you think of your skincare routine, how often do you consider the impact of the sun? While the sun is an instant boost of serotonin, it can wreak havoc on your skin. We all know the importance of applying SPF. The sun and its UV rays can accelerate premature aging and damage your skin’s natural protective barrier. When it comes to your skincare routine, the sun is something you can’t afford to overlook. We’re taking an in-depth look at what you should be including in your everyday sun care routine.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: live shopping, live stream shopping, live shopping for business, live stream shows
meta-description: Executing a perfect livestream is neither expensive nor difficult. You just need to follow some best practices. This article takes you through best practices
meta-title: Livestream for Business: Best Practices
name: Livestream for Business: Best Practices
post-body:
Whether you are thinking of starting a livestream for your business or are already using it to grow your brand, this article is for you.
Look at this stat: Research suggests that 80% of consumers prefer watching a livestream of a brand over reading their blog.
This is why Chinese companies have utilized this content format to generate great results. And, the effectiveness of livestreaming is clear from the fact that other countries and platforms are also jumping on the bandwagon.  
Luckily, executing a perfect livestream is neither expensive nor difficult. You just need to follow some best practices.
This article will take you through those best practices. So, stay with us till the end.
Let’s get into the details.

‍
Plan Your Livestreams

‍
Streamers often neglect this part of a livestream even though it’s one of the most important ones. To make sure your livestream goes well, you should plan its content in advance.
Going live without a planned outline can lead to a lot of pauses and mistakes. This can easily lead to a sub-par audience experience.
You don’t want your audience to get bored or lose their interest even for a few seconds. A well-thought-out outline is imperative to not only grab their attention but to also keep them hooked to your livestream.
You don’t have to write the whole script for a livestream though. Just an outline that tells you what you have to talk about.
An important thing to keep in mind while creating an outline is this: Keep your goal in mind so that you get the most out of your content.

Promote Your Streams

‍
Livestream best practices actually begin well before you go live. One crucial step that you need to take before your livestream is promoting it on every channel your target customer hangs out.
While producing the best content and hosting a perfect livestream is important, you need enough viewers to make it profitable.
When you get the word out about your livestream beforehand, people that are interested in your business will take the time out.
Otherwise, many of your prospects might not be available at your time; you’d be losing them.
What you can do is, create a schedule on your social media accounts and let your audience know when you want to connect with them.
Alternatively, you can ask them to register for the livestream through an email opt-in form. This way, you won’t only attract the right people to your business but can also use their contact details afterward.
A great way to get people to give their email addresses is by offering something to them first. For instance, you can give them a free eBook on a question they might looking for an answer to.
Anything that they find value in can be a good lead magnet.

Interact with the Audience

‍
Audience engagement is a must when you are doing livestreams. And, you can easily achieve that by starting the interaction yourself.
Without interacting with your audience, it would be quite difficult to achieve your livestream goals. A majority of People prefer watching livestream because they are participative.
When you take the interactive element away from your viewers, there is a chance you’ll lose a bunch of them.  
Live interaction can prove to be a game-changer for your brand. Not only you can build trust with your audience, but it can also help you understand your dream customer better.
An effective way to get people to talk to you on your livestreams is by encouraging them to ask anything they want.
Alternatively, you can ask questions from them and offer something of value to them. For instance, announce a 20% off on your product for the one that correctly answers the question.

Have a Goal

‍
Besides preparing a well-thought-out outline before going live, it’s also important to clarify your goal in advance.
Your content should be aimed at one purpose. It could be educating your audience about the new product that you are launching.
Or, it could be a session where you answer your prospects’ questions to let them make more informed decisions.

Allow Your Audience to Ask Questions

‍
A great way to boost audience engagement is by including a question-and-answer part in your livestreams.
Doesn’t matter what’s your goal with a livestream, make time for a Q&A part so that your audience can clear their minds.
Not only will it let you form a more personal and stronger bond with them, but it will also let you get new content ideas.
For instance, if a question arises multiple times, you can take that topic and create a separate livestream on that.
Plus, your audience’s questions can tell a lot about them.

Have a Helping Hand While Streaming

‍
While executing a perfect livestream where you engage your audience can be a one-person job, a helping hand can make things easier.
While livestreaming, it’s common to need something that you haven’t anticipated before, which is normal.
However, you don’t want to desert your livestream audience even just for a few seconds; you’ll be giving a good reason to them to leave your stream.
A livestream can pose any type of technical challenge; and, a host’s job is to engage the audience.
To avoid any circumstance that makes you move away from the screen, keep a team member with you throughout the livestream.

Keep Your Livestreams Entertaining

‍
This best practice is a no-brainer. It’s obvious that you have to keep your livestreams appealing to your audience.
Craft content that’s entertaining; you’ll be able to hook your audience till the end of your livestreams. The more they watch your live video, the better your chances of getting conversions.
The ever-dwindling attention span of human beings calls for it. You don’t want to invest so much into attracting the right audience and then have them leave just because your content lacked entertainment.
Your host has the biggest impact on your livestreams. If the host is lively and puts their personality into the livestream, you’d have nothing to worry about.
Of course, your content plays a vital role too.
If you don’t have such a person in your team or simply want to outsource this task, there is a perfectly feasible solution.
You can work with an influencer in your field and let them handle the steering. They know what they are doing. But, make sure you find the right influencer for your livestreams.
The most important thing to consider while selecting an influencer is their relevance to your industry. See if their content is related to your industry.
And, while the size of their audience isn’t the most important factor, it largely impacts the price you’ll be investing in them.

Keep Your Livestreams Accessible

‍
Probably the biggest impact a livestream makes is before you push the stop button. However, a lot of your prospects might not be able to mark their attendance.
To cater to that audience, what you can do is, keep your livestreams as recordings. This way, you can attract more people to your business.
In addition to that, you can use your livestream recordings to attract new prospects to your next livestream. For this, you’d have to announce when you are going live next.
Don’t take your livestream recordings for granted. You can bring a lot of new potential customers to your business if you keep engaging with the viewers.

Be Consistent

‍
You’ve probably heard of this one in other marketing strategies. Consistency is important if you want people to see you as a credible source.
While you don’t have to over-produce content, keeping a consistent schedule keeps you in the game.
Consistency in livestreaming can help you build trust with your audience and helps you boost your viewership.
So, make sure to have a realistic livestreaming schedule and deliver great content consistently.

Final Thoughts

‍
Whether you are an entrant or an established business, livestreaming can help you expand your reach and bring in new customers.
The strategies and best practices discussed in this article can help you get the most out of your business livestreams.
While it may be a little overwhelming to jump into an entirely new marketing strategy, livestreaming is easier when you follow the right path.

‍
post-summary: Whether you are thinking of starting a livestream for your business or are already using it to grow your brand, this article is for you. Look at this stat: Research suggests that 80% of consumers prefer watching a livestream of a brand over reading their blog. This is why Chinese companies have utilized this content format to generate great results. And, the effectiveness of livestreaming is clear from the fact that other countries and platforms are also jumping on the bandwagon. Luckily, executing a perfect livestream is neither expensive nor difficult. You just need to follow some best practices.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: nails, summer nails, manicure, nail polish, manicure ideas
meta-description: We’re sharing some of the best nail ideas for summer 2021 so you know what to show your nail tech or practice recreating at home.
meta-title: The Best Nail Ideas for Summer 2021
name: The Best Nail Ideas for Summer 2021
post-body:
Summer is the perfect time of year to splurge on a manicure. Whether you’re someone who religiously gets their nails done, or if you keep it as an occasional treat, we all love to be pampered and have our nails professionally done. If you’re on a budget or talented with a polish brush, don’t overlook the option of a DIY at-home manicure. It’s never been easier to recreate your favourite nail looks, regardless of whether you’re a fan of gel or acrylic nails.

‍
The summer months bring with them a busy social calendar. Whether it’s weddings, bridal showers, brunch with friends, or a vacation, we always have something happening. No look is ever complete without having your nails done. We’re sharing some of the best nail ideas for summer 2021 so you know what to show your nail tech or practice recreating at home.

‍
The overarching trend for summer 2021 nails is a subtle look with minimalistic nail art. Everything from swirls to chrome manicures and a rainbow French tip is in style. Make sure to bookmark this page so you can reference it as your go-to source for nail inspiration throughout the summer.

‍

Minimalistic Swirls

‍
Abstract shapes are one of the biggest trends of summer 2021 across the board for beauty. Just like graphic eyeliner, sharp lines and swirls are making an appearance in the world of nail art. The beauty of the swirls look is that you can put your own twist on the style and choose your favourite colour palette to recreate the look.

‍
You can keep it minimalistic with one or two swirls on each nail or go all out with a metallic finish. If you want your swirls to pop, it’s a good idea to choose a nude or baby pink shade for your base coat and then a brighter hue for the swirls. You can even change-up the swirls and do different colours on each nail.

‍

Metallic Finish

‍
Are you someone who likes to stick to their classic one-shade manicure? If you like to leave as much time as possible between appointments, it’s usually a good idea to stick to one shade. Chrome manicures are everywhere we look on Instagram. It’s the perfect way to shake up your look without going to far out of your comfort zone.

‍
We think the chrome manicure, with its metallic finish, is the go-to choice for this wedding season. Don’t be afraid to match the metallic of your nails to your shoes or accessories for a big event.

‍

3D Textured Nails

‍
While minimalism is the overarching trend, textured nails are still having a moment. If you want to embrace your inner Cardi B and experiment with acrylic nails, it’s worth giving 3D nails a try. You can still give it a minimalistic twist by keeping your nails all in the same nail polish colour, choosing either a nude or beige as your go-to shade to create the look.

‍

Blink and you miss it…

‍
Minimalism is everywhere we look in the nail industry. If you’re starting to experiment with nail art, why not stick to tiny accents? This look is ideal for anyone who worries about nail regrowth, as the accents are less noticeable than a full set of nail art.

‍
If you’re looking for a low-maintenance nail art style, it’s a good idea to keep your accents to the side of your nails, the tips, and cuticles. You can take almost any larger nail art look and downsize it to a smaller accent style.

‍

Rainbow nails

‍
One of our favourite nail trends for summer 2021 is rainbow nails. This style is low-maintenance and easy to recreate at home. The rainbow nail trend is all about recreating your classic manicure with a myriad of colours. You can choose your favourite ones, keep them all in the same colour palette, or go with every shade in the rainbow.

‍
This style is perfect for when you don’t know what colour you want to settle on and you want the best of all worlds. The mis-match nail trend looks like it’s here to stay. If you haven’t already jumped on the bandwagon, this summer is the perfect time to.

‍

Bring back the butterflies

‍
If there’s one nail trend that we’re glad to see back, it’s the butterfly nails. You can thank Dua Lip for bringing this style back after wearing it to the Grammy’s. Butterflies are the perfect choice to wear as we leave quarantine and the pandemic behind to embrace the outside world once more – just like a butterfly emerging from their slumber.

‍

Checkerboard Chic

‍
Embrace your inner Queen’s Gambit and bring the checkerboard back to your nails. If you want to give this nail trend a summer twist, you can add a quirky floral addition for a feminine feel or give it a pastel colour palette. This look may be a little tricky to recreate at home, so it’s best to visit your nail technician or practice at home.

‍

Marble nails

‍
The water marbling nail art trend is back with a bang. The secret to perfecting this look is to learn how to blend the colours together to get that marble effect that looks as natural as possible. If you’re trying this nail art out this summer, experiment with shades of pastel, green, and blue hues.

‍

Classic pink

‍
If you want to channel a look of understated elegance, keep it simple with a pink or nude manicure. These minimalistic colours are right on trend and easy to recreate at home. You can make this nail trend your own by switching up your nail shape to an almond, square, or coffin nail shape.

‍
We think this nail look would be perfect for an engagement photo shoot or for an elegant and minimalistic look.

‍

Color Blocking

‍
We’ve all mastered the art of colour blocking with our clothes, and the trend has finally made its way over to the world of nail art. It’s an easy style to recreate at home. You want to take your first colour and paint it on your first four nails, choosing the second colour for your pink. GO back in with the second colour and paint it on the top of your pointer, ring, and thumb.

‍

Coloured Tips

‍
A classic French manicure is a style that will never let you down. You can update the look for summer 2021 by changing the colours of your tips. You can keep them all one shade or incorporate the rainbow colour aesthetic into the nail art style. Pastel colours are amongst the most popular for this trend, along with jewel tones and classic rainbow shades.

‍

Cuticle Accents

‍
Most of us tend to focus our nail art on the top of our nails. For summer 2021, we’re turning this look on its head and adding the accents at the cuticles. This half-moon shape is easy to recreate at home or for your nail technician to create for you. It’s best to keep your nails to one classic shade and then choose a metallic colour for your accents.

‍

Lady in Red

‍
Nothing will ever beat a classic red manicure. Summer is the perfect time to go back to basis and incorporate an understated elegance to your outfit. A red manicure will see you through any event in your social calendar, whether it’s brunch with friends or a date with your significant other. Red makes a bright and bold statement that you can easily recreate at home with a gel polish.

‍

Abstract nail art

‍
Just like eyeliner trends, nail art is all about incorporating abstract shapes into your manicure. The beauty of an abstract nail art is that it gives you a chance to show off your personality with a unique look. You want to focus on adding sharp lines and colours to your nails. It’s a good idea to choose two or three shades to create your abstract nail art look.

‍

Dual-Finish Nails

‍
Can’t choose between a matte or glossy finish? A dual-finish manicure gives you the best of both worlds. You’re guaranteed to have the coolest manicure on your girl’s vacation trip. All you have to do is change two of the top coats to different finishes. You can do them on the same nails on each finger – like your pointer or pinky – or apply them to two fingers beside each other.

Rose Quartz Inspired

‍
Thanks to TikTok, we’re all obsessed with rose quartz and crystals. You can show your new love for rose quartz by incorporating it into your nail art with a marble inspired look. The rose quartz nail trend has been around for a few years but is experiencing a resurgence in popularity. These are the perfect ‘your nails but better’ style and will work with any outfit.

‍
Which of these manicures will you be rocking for summer 2021? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is the perfect time of year to splurge on a manicure. Whether you’re someone who religiously gets their nails done, or if you keep it as an occasional treat, we all love to be pampered and have our nails professionally done. If you’re on a budget or talented with a polish brush, don’t overlook the option of a DIY at-home manicure. It’s never been easier to recreate your favourite nail looks, regardless of whether you’re a fan of gel or acrylic nails.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: breezy shirt, oversize shirt, style, fashion, how to wear
meta-description: We’re sharing some of our top choices for breezy shirts that you can add to your closet, along with easy styling choices that you can recreate.
meta-title: Why a Breezy Shirt is the Number One Summer Purcha
name: Why a Breezy Shirt is the Number One Summer Purchase
post-body:
After a hot pink shirt stepped onto the runway at the Valentino spring/summer 2021 show, everyone has been talking about breezy shirts. What makes this garment so special is how it encapsulates the concept of effortless chic. It’s the only item you need in your close this summer. In fact, you’ll want to buy a back-up in case of emergencies. What we love about the breezy shirt is its oversized fit, especially when you style it partly unbuttoned. If you’re looking to refresh your closet for summer 2021, all you need is a breezy shirt.
We’re sharing some of our top choices for breezy shirts that you can add to your closet, along with easy styling choices that you can recreate. Breezy shirts let you style cool and stylish all summer long, without worrying about dreaded sweat patches under your arm.

You can thank Pierpaolo Piccioli for bringing back this classic staple in a new and inventive way with the neon colour palette. The bright colour gives you a contemporary feel, while getting the versatility of the classic silhouette of a breezy shirt. Everyone from Dua Lip to Kylie Jenner have shared snaps of themselves wearing the Valentino shirt. If Kylie’s wearing it, then you know it’s an instant hit.
Elevated shirts have been a staple for supermodels and celebrities alike, with Kendall Jenner and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley being two of the style’s biggest advocates. Rosie is famous for virtually living in The Row’s Sisilia silk-satin blouse throughout every season.
Our favourite celebrities love to style these breezy shirts with a sculpted pant and a tank-top underneath for extra modesty. The Bottega Veneta square-toe sandals seem to be the number one accessory for wearing with these shirts. Don’t be afraid to add bicycle shorts underneath for a Princess Diana-inspired look.
Button-down shirts have gone from a menswear essential to a staple that every woman is adding to her closet. Everyone from Irina Shayk to Hailey Bieber are being spotted rocking the style. It’s universally flattering and works for every body type.

The next time you log onto Instagram, you’ll be guaranteed to find your own feed full of friends and influencers wearing this must-have summer shirt. Everyone can wear a breezy shirt this summer. It’s one of the most versatile silhouette that works for any occasion. Anne Laure Mais showed off her maternity style with a breezy shirt and midi skirt in a 90s inspired look.

You never want to under-estimate the brilliance of having an elevated staple in your closet. We’re obsessed with how Aurora James, founder of Brother Vellies, styled her preppy-inspired blue and white breezy shirt with a playful cap and dainty jewellery. It’s the perfect example of balancing masculine pieces with feminine flairs.

You don’t have to wear a summer shirt as a buttoned-up style. You can take a leaf from Jeanette Madsen’s styling book and wear your shirt open, with a white vest and ripped jeans underneath.

Summer Shirts

‍
You might think of shirts as a staple in workwear, but we think they’re perfect for almost any occasion. Choosing shirts with a sunshine colour palette or energising print can change up your summer wardrobe. Shirts are a versatile garment that you can wear with anything from bicycle shorts to linen trousers or even leather pants when the temperatures drop. If you’re heading on vacation, an oversized breezy shirt should be at the top of your packing list.
Breezy shirts are a perfect choice if you’re heading out to a beer garden or planning on enjoying some al fresco dining with your friends.
The point of a breezy shirt is to give you the option to cover-up on top, without overheating. We all know the dangers of sun damage, and no one wants to end up with a sunburn on their shoulders. What we love about breezy shirts is that you can wear them as an everyday piece or throw them on over your swimsuit as you head out for drinks after a day at the pool.
When you’re choosing your breezy summer shirt, you want to take the time to consider the fabric of your shirt. It’s best to choose one that is lightweight and eas to wear. You want to choose one like linen or cotton that won’t absorb sweat and will keep you cool throughout the summer months.
Whether you want a vibrant colour like the OG Valentino style or a more classic option like nautical stripes, you’re guaranteed to find a summer shirt that works for your closet. You want to look for a style that works for your aesthetic and will sip seamlessly into your closet. What makes a shirt summer-appropriate is its colour and fabric.
No one wants to spend the summer with sweat-stain on their shirt. Choosing a breezy summer style means that you can wear a shirt all-year long without worrying about having a major fashion faux pas.

Our Top Picks for Breezy Shirts

‍
Whatever your budget is – whether you want to splurge or save your pennies – there is a breezy shirt out there for you.
You can go with the original Valentino oversized neon silk shirt – which will set you back a pretty penny at almost £1800. If you have the money to spend and you want to replicate Kylie Jenner’s look, then this is the breezy shirt for you. Don’t worry, you don’t need to break the bank to jump on this summer trend.
If you want a similar dupe to the Valentino but with a feminine twist, check out the soal loose-fitting blouse by ba&sh. It has the same vibrant shade of pink and gives you just as much ‘wow’ factor. It’s loose fitting and comfortable enough to see you through the whole summer season.
You can get a mid-level option from Hommegirls with their cotton-twill shirt, it’s the perfect length to worth with everything from your favourite jeans to shorts or a midi skirt. Another option is the Frame oversized gathered cotton poplin shirt, with its crisp cotton poplin and barrel cuffs.

Styling summer shirts

‍
One of the reasons why everyone is going crazy for summer breezy shirts is how versatile they are. You can wear them as a transitional piece through the summer months and right into winter. When the temperatures drop again, you can layer it under your favourite sweater or cardigan. If you have a capsule closet or want to invest in a seasonless piece, these breezy shirts are a must-have.
We’re sharing a few of our favourite ways to style breezy summer shirts to show you how easy they are to incorporate into your closet.

You can take a leaf from Leias Fez’s style guide and embrace your inner off-the-clock supermodel. We love how she’s styled her white oversized shirt with on-trend black shorts and croc-inspired mules. What sets the look off is her mini Kelly bag. It’s the perfect example of how you can plenty luxury accessories with everyday pieces to create an effortlessly Parisian chic look.
This outfit shows that you can take pieces you already have in your closet and incorporate them into a casual outfit with your breezy summer shirt.

Although we’ve featured several monochrome breezy shirts, it’s worth remember that stripes are always a good idea. If you want a shirt that you can wear year-round, choose stripes or a classic print instead of a neon shade. The beauty of a striped shirt is that it gives you a minimalistic base to contrast against statement heels to help make them ‘pop’. Don’t forget to add your favourite Gucci bag and oversized sunglasses to finish off your look.
If you want to recreate this look, make sure to keep your shorts and shirt in a similar colour palette, along with the rest of your accessories, to allow your statement shows to take centre stage.

Our favourite supermodel look is breezy shirts with masculine trousers. It’s a contemporary and modest look that works for any body type as its universally flattering. We love how Rosie Huntington-Whiteley styled this outfit. Her open-toe shoes add a summery twist to the outfit, while the high-waist and leather belt on her trousers give the outfit a more refined and elevated silhouette. You can swap out Rosie’s Birkin bag for your favourite oversized tote. Pull your hair back in a sleek bun and add your go-to sunglasses.
Kendall Jenner stepped out in a virtually identical outfit, but the supermodel wore a matching white t-shirt under her breezy shirt, sticking to the same mannish trousers and leather belt as Rosie. She also opted for the leather sandal kitten heels to elevate her look. If Kendall and Rosie are wearing it, then you know the look is on our radar.

‍
Which of these breezy summer shirt looks will you be rocking this season? Do you think that they’re a closet staple? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: After a hot pink shirt stepped onto the runway at the Valentino spring/summer 2021 show, everyone has been talking about breezy shirts. What makes this garment so special is how it encapsulates the concept of effortless chic. It’s the only item you need in your close this summer. In fact, you’ll want to buy a back-up in case of emergencies. What we love about the breezy shirt is its oversized fit, especially when you style it partly unbuttoned. If you’re looking to refresh your closet for summer 2021, all you need is a breezy shirt.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: summer looks, plus size looks, plus size summer fashion, plus size summer outfits
meta-description: We’re taking some style inspiration from our favourite influencers to show you the pieces that you’ll want to add to your closet.
meta-title: Plus Size Summer 2021 Looks
name: Plus Size Summer Looks
post-body:
If you’re plus sized, then summer might be a time of year that you dread. Between the fear of thigh chub and anxiety about wearing a swimsuit, it’s easy to see why body confidence can become an issue during the summer months. We’re here to tell you that your dress size is only a number. This summer, we want you to look and feel amazing in your body.
Summer is a time of garden parties, trips to the beach, road trips, afternoon tea, and al fresco dining. It’s probably the one time of year where you will end up doing multiple outfit changes during the day – and that’s before you even think of the heat! Getting your closet ready for the summer months can be tricky, but trust us, your Instagram feed will thank you!
You should be enjoying summer and the all the fun that comes with it just as much as everyone else. Our guide gives you tips and tricks on some of the best plus size summer looks for 2021. We’re taking some style inspiration from our favourite influencers to show you the pieces that you’ll want to add to your closet.
Remember: if you love something and it makes you smile, then wear it!

Mini Dress + Leather

‍
Depending on where you live, your summer season might not be all sunshine and rainbows. We love this look by Mikayla that incorporates a mini dress with an oversized leather jacket. You can show off your summer tan while staying warm against the summer breeze. Accessorising your shoes to match the leather jacket helps tie the look together.
Even if you live in a tropical climate, it’s worth keeping a leather jacket at the front of your summer closet to throw over your shoulder on night’s out or if you’re not sure how the day will pan out. You can wear this outfit from day to night, just by adding the leather jacket on top.

Figure-Hugging Dress

‍
You can guarantee that you’ll end up on at least one dance floor this summer. A  figure-hugging dress is something that every woman should own. Choose one in your favourite colour and pick a silhouette that works with your body shape and silhouette. Midi dresses and slip dresses are a go-to choice for summer, but don’t be afraid to go with a shorter figure-hugging dress.
You can choose your dress in one of the trending colours of the season – magenta pink, acid green, mellow yellow, or bubblegum pink.

Matching Knitwear

‍
You might think that knitwear is a winter-only staple, but you can rock this closet staple all year long. Nothing is cuter than a matching knitwear set, which can keep an outfit casual if you’re heading out for drinks with friends or splurging on some al fresco dining.
You can make your matching knitwear set summer appropriate by choosing a crop top style like the one Julia is wearing in our inspiration picture. It’s also worth keeping an eye out for cotton and other breathable fabrics that will keep you cool throughout the summer.

Ladylike neutrals

‍
Summer is a time of garden parties, trips to hotels, and more than a few meals out with friends. You can never go wrong with a tonal look during the summer. We love this neutral look that Thamarr is wearing, with different hues of beige and white playing off each other for an elevated look. The straw hat gives her look a summery twist, along with the open-toe strappy sandals.
One of our favourite pro-tips for wearing dresses during the summer is to wear bicycle shorts underneath to stop your thighs rubbing against each other. This tip works best if you have a longer skirt and a shorter pair of bicycle shorts to hide them under the skirt. If not, you can add a coat of baby powder to your legs to help stop the friction between your skin.

Laidback Sporty Chic

‍
If you’re looking for plus size fashion inspiration, Ashley Graham will be your new style muse. She’s our go-to choice for outfit inspo, and her body positivity is infectious. We love this sporty chic look that is perfect for a BBQ, day out with friends, or a trip to the beach.
Ashley’s outfit features pieces from the Hugo Boss x Russell Athletic collection, but you are almost guaranteed to have similar pieces already in your closet. It’s worth taking a tip from Ashley Graham and shopping in the men’s section for pieces like these as you’ll often get a nicer fit and may even be able to grab them on sale.
Who said we couldn’t make preppy chic?

Activewear meets Business

‍
Speaking of activewear, we’re not ready to give up our comfortable sports bras and bicycle shorts just yet. If you’ve got a business casual event or if you’re heading to a restaurant that requires a jacket, this is the perfect solution. We love how Carla Ortiz has kept the classic activewear look of a sports bra with knitted cycling shorts, while elevating her look by throwing a blazer on top.
You can finish off your look with your favourite white sneakers and add a small mini bag to elevate your look. Make the outfit even more summer appropriate by throwing your hair back into a high ponytail or a bun to keep it out of your face. Don’t forget to layer up your jewellery to add a feminine feel.
Even though we’re going back into the real world, it’s not time to say goodbye to our activewear just yet. During the summer, you want to be comfortable in your clothes – meaning that activewear is your BFF. Does anyone want to wear a wired bra when the temperatures start to rise? We’ll stick with a sports bra.

Bridgerton Inspired

‍
If there’s one thing that we all love, it’s a romantic dress. The summer season naturally has a romantic feeling in the air, between weddings, engagements, and the bloom of new flowers.  Embrace the season by treating yourself to a regency inspired full-length smock dress. We love this white and blue floral dress that Ana Rivera is wearing. It gives us serious Belle vibes and would be perfect for any event in your social calendar.
The beauty of these midi-dresses is that you can do anything in them; whether it’s having a quick nap or going for a walk on the beach. You can take your dress from day to night by swapping your sandals for open-toe mules or your favourite stilettoes. If you want to keep it casual, you can wear flip flops or sneakers.
When you’re choosing a fuller dress, it’s a good idea to choose one that covers your shoulder. The last thing you want to worry about is your shoulders getting sunburnt while you’re relaxing outside.

Bold Shades

‍
Summer is the time of year when we tend to have a fully-packed social calendar. Between weddings, engagement parties, birthdays, and ‘just because’ events.
