You can guarantee that you’ll need at least one special occasion outfit to see you through the summer. We love that Nicole Campbell went outside the box with a monochromatic look in one of the trending colours of the season.
Don’t be afraid to take centre stage with a bold colour to make a statement. Nicole’s two piece outfit also incorporates an illusion of the on-trend cut-out silhouette.
Other colours that you want to consider for summer 2021 include sage green, acid green, pastel pink, mellow yellow, and magenta purple.

Jeans and a crop top

‍
Whether you’ve got a date night or are going out for drinks with friends, one of our favourite summer looks is a casual jean and crop top combo. This outfit is casual and chic, making it perfect to wear throughout the summer. If you’re looking to recreate this style, it’s best to choose a shirt in a silk fabric to keep your cool and give your outfit an elevated feel.
For the summer, you want to avoid wearing darker colours of denim as it will attract the sun and make it difficult to keep yourself cool. White denim is your BFF if you want to wear your favourite jeans during the summer months. They’re also perfect for wearing with a crop top that has a pop of colour to shake up your look.
When it comes to jeans, it’s a good idea to stay away from skinny jeans as that can make you feel warmer and make it harder to keep your temperature cool. Straight legged and boyfriend-fit jeans are the perfect choice for summer. You can finish this outfit off with any shoes of your choice – whether you prefer mules or leather flats.
With summer just around the corner, it’s time to remember that you can wear whatever you want. Regardless of what your dress size is, you can wear a crop top or a bikini. Trust us. You’ll look amazing!
Which of these plus size looks is your favourite? What will you be wearing this summer? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: If you’re plus sized, then summer might be a time of year that you dread. Between the fear of thigh chub and anxiety about wearing a swimsuit, it’s easy to see why body confidence can become an issue during the summer months. We’re here to tell you that your dress size is only a number. This summer, we want you to look and feel amazing in your body.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: hairstyle, celebrity hair, celebrity hairstyle, hair guide
meta-description: Our guide goes through some of the most popular hairstyles with bangs to give you inspiration for your next haircut.
meta-title: The Best Hairstyles with Bangs – Celebrity Inspire
name: The Best Hairstyles with Bangs – Celebrity Inspired Guide
post-body:
It’s official. Fringes are back in style.


Tell you mom, tell your sister, tell your BFF.

‍
The beauty of a fringe is that there is a style out there that suits every face shape. Whether you have a square, heart, or a round face, there is a style out there that will work for you. It may take some trial and error, but you’re guaranteed to find your perfect match
Pretty much the entire population suits a fringe – but it’s all about how it frames your face and where it ends. It’s important to stop and think about how a fringe changes the illusion of your face. If you have a longer fringe, it can accentuate your cheekbones or skim your eyebrows and make them look virtually invisible.

‍
When you’re choosing your bangs, the most important thing to do is to stop and consider your face shape and the jaw line that you have.
The go-to fringe style for 2021 is the classic style of a cropped and chopped fringe. It’s true that fringes generally work best with longer hair, but they’re also the perfect match for a long bob or even a pixie cut. When choosing your fringe, you want to stop and consider where it sits on your face.

‍
What will make or break your fringe is where it sits on your forehead. You either want to place it halfway across your forehead at your brow bone or keep it shorter in the centre and keep the sides longer by a few centimetres.

‍
When in doubt, the best thing to do is to look for some celebrity inspiration. Find someone who has the same face shape and a similar bone structure to your face. You can then use their different hair styles and fringes as a point of reference to help you find a style that will flatter your own face. If you’re still struggling to decide, your hair stylist is usually the best person to turn to for advice.

‍
Our guide goes through some of the most popular hairstyles with bangs to give you inspiration for your next haircut. This guide is packed full of ten celebrity inspiration photos, so it’s worth bookmarking this page and coming back when you’re getting ready for your next haircut.

‍

Feathered cheekbone fringe and shag haircut

‍
If there’s one person who can rock any hairstyle, it’s Elizabeth Olsen. The actress has changed up her hairstyle various times for different film roles and in real life. Her new brunette bangs made an appearance during a virtual event for Marvel’s ‘The Falcon and the Winter Solider’ series.

‍
Elizabeth’s complemented her tousled shag haircut with 70s inspired curtain bangs that are feathered down to her cheekbones.

Bun and French girl fringe

‍
One classic low-maintenance option hat you don’t want to sleep on is a bun and a French girl fringe. Gigi Hadid recently shared a photo on Instagram captioned ‘fresh snow, fresh cut’ as the mum of one unveiled her new hair. The French-girl fringe is a thick and full fringe that skims your eyebrows. If you’re someone who is always wearing their hair in a high ponytail or bun, then this style is a classic choice for you to try.

‍

Feathery fringe and long longs

‍
While Kendall didn’t seem a fan of her feathered fringe, we think it’s a great example of how drastically your fringe can change your look. Just by adding a feathered fringe, Kendall suddenly looked a lot more like her mum Kris and older half-sister Kim Kardashian-West. Although this style didn’t work for Kendall, it’s a style that suits her face shape and is a classic choice.

‍

Blunt block bangs and straight bob

‍
Nothing screams supermodel more than a straight bob with a blunt block fringe. If you’re blessed to have the same bone structure as Bella Hadid, then this is the hairstyle that you need to try.
The one thing you want to consider with a block fringe is how quickly your hair grows. You might find yourself heading back to the salon more often or cutting your fringe at home.

‍

The 70s shaggy fringe and boho curls

‍
When it comes to bohemian romanticism, the 70s shaggy fringe is king. If you want to inject a little boho chic to your look, take a leaf out of JLo’s book and experiment with some extra long curls and a messy fringe.
Depending on your face shape, you can feather your fringe down to your cheekbones or leave them shorter to work with your bone structure.

‍

Full bangs with straight hair

‍
Are you ready to channel your inner superhero? Kim Kardashian switched up her look for a Valentine’s Day shoot for KKW Beauty. Her full fringe and straight bangs gave the reality TV star a 60s inspired look and turned her into an epic superhero (or villain!). The super straight hair creates a seamless look between Kim’s mid-lengths and fringe. If you’re someone who is prepared to deal with the upkeep of a full fringe, this still might be right up your street.

‍

French girl fringe and curly waves

‍
Is there anything more Parisian than Priyanka Chopra’s hair style? We love that she opted for the easy-to-maintain French girl fringe that frames her face without being too overwhelming. The tousled curls and wavy hair add a feminine feel to the look that deliberately appears natural instead of picture perfect. If you’re trying this look at home, it’s worth brushing through your curls to help loosen them or to use a straightener instead of a curling wand for more wavy curls.

‍

Curly Bangs and a long bob

‍
Selena Gomez can do no wrong when it comes to hairstyles. The singer and actress is currently rocking a curly look inspired by the 1970s flower power look. If you have curly hair, you’ll love this retro-inspired look. The secret to recreating Selena’s style is to keep shorter locks of hair around your face to help enhance and define the shape of your natural curls. The same advice applies if you’re curling your hair with a wand or other hot tools.

‍
One of the biggest hair trends right now is texture and embracing your natural hair, with Selena’s look being a classic example of that. You can also see flashes of blonde through her curls, showing the natural glow that comes from a balayage treatment. If you’re thinking of going with a full curly look, it’s worth considering adding a balayage or highlight treatment to your hair to give your curls a lift.

‍

Tapered curtain bangs and long curls

‍
We couldn’t help but share another hair style from Priyanka Chopra – especially as it seems to be the hairstyle of 2021. Her long and tapered fringe is an example of how you can add volume and length into your curtain bangs. If you’re not a fan of styling your bangs every day, the long and tapered style requires no maintenance.

‍
The benefit of this style is that you can let it grow or put it to the sides of your face once it gets too long. As they’re your natural bags, you don’t need to worry about straightening them. If you want to keep your curtain bangs looking fresh with this style, it’s a good idea to have them re-cut every two to three weeks depending on your hair growth.

‍

Micro fringe and baby ponytail

‍
Bella Hadid is infamous for bringing old styles back into fashion. Baby and micro bangs are making a serious comeback this year, which isn’t surprising when you see Bella Hadid rocking the style. If you’re thinking of going with a shorter fringe, it’s good to know that this style generally is better suited to those with a slimmer and oval face shape.

‍
While other fringes can hide your features, a micro fringe is so shot that it hides nothing at all. It’s also worth remembering that a micro fringe needs a little extra TLC as it will generally be greasier than a normal fringe.

‍
What we love about bangs being back in stye is that we don’t have to wait until a breakup or nervous breakdown to change up our look. If you want to change your style without doing anything drastic to the length or colour, a fringe is always your best option. You can give your look an upgrade without feeling the need to chop off half your hair.

‍
When you’re choosing your fringe style, it’s a good idea to stop and think of which style fits your lifestyle. Do you have the time to style your fringe every day? Are you prepared to wash your hair more for a micro-fringe? Just like anything, these bangs come with pros and cons. The most important thing to remember is that you need a fringe that works with your face shape.

‍
Which of these hairstyles will you be trying out? Are you a fan of hairstyles with bangs? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary:
It’s official. Fringes are back in style. Tell you mom, tell your sister, tell your BFF.
The beauty of a fringe is that there is a style out there that suits every face shape. Whether you have a square, heart, or a round face, there is a style out there that will work for you. It may take some trial and error, but you’re guaranteed to find your perfect match

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: live streaming, live stream shopping, China, live, influencers
meta-description: In this article, we talk about the successful use of livestream shopping by Chinese influencers and its effects on the rest of the eCommerce world.
meta-title: The success of Chinese Livestream Influencers
name: The success of Chinese Livestream Influencers
post-body:
Livestream is finding its place in the mainstream eCommerce industry partly because of Chinese eCommerce giants and influencers.  
The heavyweights like Alibaba and other smaller-scale companies have proven that livestream shopping brings results and is the future of shopping.  
The success of livestreaming can be attributed to its intimate and interactive nature. Consumers can have complete peace of mind before going through with the purchase on a livestream.
Plus, coupled with influencer marketing, livestream shopping can work like a miracle for brands.  
In this article, we talk about the successful use of livestream shopping by Chinese influencers and its effects on the rest of the eCommerce world.
Let’s dig in.

Chinese Livestream Shopping Giants

‍
It might not be news now that the Chinese eCommerce industry has been on the rise and the pandemic has given it a push forward.
A study suggests that China has the highest level of retail sales in the world. And, most of it can be justifiably tied to live commerce.
The eCommerce giant Alibaba’s Taobao enjoys the largest share of 80% in live commerce. And, other Chinese eCommerce companies like Baidu and JD.com aren’t far behind either.
Livestream shopping platforms like Taobao have been successful at connecting shoppers and brands. It has not only been selling at a massive scale to consumers but also is a source of entertainment for the masses. Something that other eCommerce platforms might want to replicate.

Chinese Livestream Influencers Getting Celebrity Status

‍
Influencer marketing has already been growing at a pace comparable to any other marketing strategy. What that means is that influencers are gaining popularity in their respective industries.
But, influencer marketing isn’t limited to social media platforms. Chinese Ecommerce heavyweights like Taobao have proven that by using influencers to sell a historic number of products on livestreams.
Ecommerce livestreaming has elevated influencers to celebrity status, especially in China. They are thought of as key opinion leaders and are being paid generously as well.
KOLs in China receive a hefty sum of commissions on the products sold through their livestreams in addition to an appearance fee.
That said, as more and more people jump on the bandwagon of influencer marketing, there are a lot of relatively inexpensive options in virtually every industry.
As a brand, you just need to look at the right place with the right strategy. Plus, you can strike up a deal where most of your expenditure goes from the products sold. This would be a win-win for both parties.

The Growth of Livestream Influencers in the Smaller Sector

‍
While influencers that gained celebrity-like status in China have been quite impactful for brands, the trend seems to shift to smaller markets as well.
This can be encouraging for brands that can’t afford to invest a hefty sum of their marketing budget on a heavyweight influencer.
Niche influencers with a specialty in their own industry are gaining popularity not in China but also in the western eCommerce landscape.

The Impact of Chinese Live Commerce Success

‍
As digital media continue to be more relevant in the lives of a consumer, convenience will continue to find its way into their lives.
We’ve seen that how eCommerce has been taking the place of a brick-and-mortar retail store in the last few years.
The changing retail landscape experienced a boost when the crisis hit in the form of a pandemic. It affected everyone and limited human-to-human interaction on a massive scale.
And, some might say that eCommerce has been a saving grace for many consumers that didn’t have the option to leave their homes.
Meanwhile, China has been pretty active at using livestream commerce even before the pandemic hit. And, again, the crisis has only given it a push forward.
Even before the crisis, by March 2020, Chinese live commerce users were 265 million. This was more than 29% of the country’s overall internet users.
And, lockdown situations in China boosted the live commerce industry. You’d see Chinese brands doing livestreams weekly or even daily.
Seeing the success Chinese eCommerce platforms like Taobao had, many other digital giants like Amazon and Facebook jumped on the bandwagon.  
In 2019, the US eCommerce heavyweight also announced its own livestream platform “Amazon Live”. It allows brands and influencers to work together and present their products directly to prospects.
Not to mention the social media giant Facebook, which now also owns Instagram, jumping on the bandwagon of livestream shopping.
But, is there still room for improvement for the western eCommerce industry? Let’s see.

What the West Can Learn?

‍
Clearly, the west needs to catch up as far as eCommerce livestreaming is concerned. It still trails China in the “livestreaming for selling” industry.
A prominent factor that renders Chinese companies more effective at utilizing live commerce is the less fragmentation in eCommerce.
While Amazon and eBay are major players in the worldwide eCommerce phenomenon, the US still lacks in this sector.
Amazon accounted for 37% of the eCommerce in the US in 2019 while eBay had a share of 6.1% of the market. Beyond that, the picture is not that bright.
Almost everything else in the online retail industry relies on individual websites. It’s a fragmented market and consumers need to explore a variety of websites from different sellers to find what they want.
In contrast, you’d find a lot of integration in China. The country’s 2 eCommerce companies, Alibaba and JD.com account for about 72% of the overall market share.

Creating Livestream-specific Talent

China has also been producing skillful hosts that know how to maneuver livestreams. They know the art of engaging the audience while also selling products effectively. Something that’s probably lacking in the western livestream influencer industry.

Building Cross-functional Platforms

‍
Did you know that Google tried to move into the social media arena and Facebook took its shot at eCommerce?
Well, both initiatives didn’t go quite as planned. While both are extremely successful in their own category, they haven’t been able to capture other markets as effectively up until now.
The audiences in the west see these platforms belonging to completely different categories and aren’t really ready to accept the cross-functionality.
In contrast, Chinese eCommerce industry leaders like Alibaba have been able to move into categories other than eCommerce as well.
For instance, Taobao, a livestream shopping platform where hosts don’t only sell products but also deliver great content to consumers.
Alibaba has also integrated its own payment solution “Alipay” into the mainstream. Moreover, WeChat is another example of how the masses can use a single platform for multiple purposes.

What Should You Do as a Brand?

‍
So, as a brand, what can you learn from the success of Chinese influencer Livestreaming? For one, you should consider starting livestream shopping if you haven’t yet.
Second, as a brand, you need to look into the ways you can use livestream influencers to grow your brand.
See, influencers don’t only know the craft of creating engaging content, but they are also great at communication.
Plus, if your business is new, you could use an already established audience by working with a seasoned influencer in your industry.

Finding the Right Influencers for Your Livestreams

‍
The next step after you realize that influencer livestreaming can help you get more customers is creating your strategy and finding influencers.
But, any influencer won’t do. You would need to find out the one that can not only engage your audience but make them act on your offers as well.
First, find the platforms where you think your target audience might be hanging out. See if you can find some influencers that have a decent engagement rate on their content.
The most important factors while considering an influencer for your livestreams are:
• The industry
• The audience size
• The engagement rate
Once you have a small list of influencers, you can then pitch your offer to them. Making sure that you offer them something first can substantially increase your chances of getting a reply.
Most influencers are great at engaging and selling to the online audience. You may even not have to provide a content outline for your livestream.
If all goes well, you can form a long-term partnership with them so that you don’t have to look for new influencers for your future streams.
The massive success that the Chinese livestream influencers had tells us a lot about influencer marketing’s potential.
Besides the right influencer, probably the second most important thing you need to carry out impactful livestreams is dedicated livestream software.
We are excited to tell you that now you can do livestreams with full control and ease with Jumble’s own livestream software.

Start your live commerce journey as are tail brand from here.

‍
post-summary: Livestream is finding its place in the mainstream eCommerce industry partly because of Chinese eCommerce giants and influencers. The heavyweights like Alibaba and other smaller-scale companies have proven that livestream shopping brings results and is the future of shopping. The success of livestreaming can be attributed to its intimate and interactive nature. Consumers can have complete peace of mind before going through with the purchase on a livestream. Plus, coupled with influencer marketing, livestream shopping can work like a miracle for brands.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: legs, summer, prepare, beach
meta-description: During the summer, you want to look and feel amazing. We’re sharing our top tips on how to get your legs ready for summer 2021.
meta-title: How to Get Your Legs Summer Ready
name: How to Get Your Legs Summer Ready
post-body:
Summer is right around the corner. It’s the time of year when we’re all thinking of how our body look. We’ve all heard the saying ‘summer body’ and ‘suns out, guns out’.  While that might make you think of your arms, it’s usually our legs that we’re most conscious about. Most of the year, our legs are covered by jeans or tights. Once the temperatures start to rise, it’s shorts and skirt season.
During the summer, you want to look and feel amazing. You can get your legs summer-ready by helping to lift and tone what you already have. It’s all about smoothing and defining your legs. We’re sharing our top tips on how to get your legs ready for summer 2021.

Toning your legs

‍
If you asked a personal trainer what the most common question that they get is, most of them will tell you that it’s about how you can get your legs ready for shorts season. The secret to toning your legs – or anywhere on your body – is to reduce your body fat, while maintaining the lean tissue.
What you need to do to lose weight is to be in a calorie deficit. You only need a small (and sustainable!) calorie deficit to start to see a difference. Alongside your diet, you want to be incorporating training to preserve the leaner tissue. Diet and exercise go hand-in-hand to give you that toned look that everyone is trying to achieve,
You want to start by incorporating lower body workouts that focus on movements in every direction to engage all of your major muscle groups. You need to be activating everything from your adductors in your thighs to your quadriceps in the front of your leg, and the hamstrings.
Before you think of heading to the gym and doing nothing but lunges and squats, take a step back. You don’t want to be focusing solely on what you can see in the mirror. Focusing too much on squats can end up causing lower back and knee issues. You need to be working out the back of your legs as much as the front, otherwise you’ll have an imbalanced look. Most fitness trainers spend twice as long training the back of your leg as the front.
If you’re someone who wears high heels, you want to be focusing on boosting the balance between your hamstrings and quadriceps. When you’re standing in heels for long periods, it pushes your centre of gravity forwards, which means that your quadriceps are doing most of the work to keep your body straight and upright.

Your starter leg workout

‍
When you’re coming up with your fitness routine or workout plans, you want to be training your legs three times a week with two low-intensity cardio sessions added in.
Here’s an example of a sample workout that you can do:
• 3x 6-8 reps of goblet squats
• 4x 10-12 reps of sliders/hamstring curls
• 3x 8 reps of step ups
• 3x 12 reps of hamstring bridges
It’s never too early or too late to start your fitness journey. If you’re looking to get your dream summer body, it’s usually a god idea to start right away. You won’t lose weight or tone-up overnight, so it’s always better to start now than wait until the time is ‘right’. Summer starts earlier and lasts longer than ever, meaning you want to start and keep up your summer workout routine for longer.

How to define your legs without doing exercise

‍
It’s not just exercise that you want to be focusing on. Toning your leg is as much about adding definition as it is about exercising. While you want to be incorporating toning exercises, there’s plenty of other steps that you can take to boost the tone and definition of your legs.

Add a healthy glow with a body oil

‍
Body oils are a staple of the summer to give your skin a dewy glow. The Sunday Fridays Pool Time Glowing Body Oil is being raved about as the must-have for summer. It leaves a healthy sheen on your skin, making you look and feel more confident. What we love about using a body oil is that it adds an extra layer of fragrance to your skin. The Sunday Fridays body oil has a sweet vanilla, coconut, and warm almond scent that lingers on your skin. It’s sweet enough to eat!

Hydrate your skin

‍
Don’t forget about hydrating your skin! During the summer, you want to make sure you’re boosting your water intake – both for your body and skin. We all know the importance of using a body moisturizer, but it takes on a whole new importance during the summer. No one wants flaky or dry skin during the summer.
Add a lightweight and silky body moisturizer to your routine to deeply hydrate your skin and help it maintain its elasticity. Our top choice is the Black Rose Beautifying Emulsion moisturizer by Sisley, powered by black rose, camelina oil, and white ginger.

Tan from a bottle

‍
We all know that it isn’t safe to get your tan from the sun or a sunbed. It’s always safer for your skin to indulge in a fake tan than a genuine one. When you find a fake tan that you love and that gives you a golden glow, then you’re set for life.
One of the most popular fake tans is the Isle of Paradise’s new Self-Tanning Butter which hydrates your skin and is beginner friendly. The Glow 20 Tan Mousse by James Read is our go-to choice when we need a last minute fake tan as it starts to show a subtle glow within 20 minutes, giving you deeper results within 90 minutes.

Tone with a body cream

‍
Hear us out. While a body cream alone isn’t enough to tone your legs and get them summer ready, it can be a gamechanger to how your legs look. You want to choose a body cream that nourishes your skin and gives you a natural shine.
If you’re looking to make a splurge purchase, the Restoring Toning Body Cream by Susanne Kaufmann is a must-have. It contains an innovative formula with boldo, caffeine, and tiger grass that boosts the metabolism of your skin and supports your collagen production. Using this product consistently will help to plump your skin to give you a toned and healthy look. It also contains jiagoulan plant that helps fortify your skin’s protective barrier to smooth your skin.

Streamline and give a lengthening illusion

‍
If there’s anyone who is our inspiration for a summer body, it’s Rihanna. She’s the queen of a glowing tan and has mastered the art of body tints to help streamline your body and give the illusion of slimmer legs. The Body Sauce Body Luminizing Tint
by Fenty Beauty is our go-to this summer. All you need to do is roll the transfer-resistant formula over your legs to give you a natural-looking tan and a subtle shimmer that leaves an airbrush effect on your skin.

Depuff your legs

‍
Just like your under eyes, you want to depuff your legs. As the temperatures start to rise, it’s not unusual for your limbs to start to swell up. You want to use a serum for your legs to help depuff your limbs.
Our top choice is the Legs Eleven Cooling Leg Serum by Bloom and Blossom. It’s packed full of peppermint leaf oil for a refreshing effect, while the aloe vera works to soothe and hydrate your skin. You can massage it into your legs to help promote your lymphatic drainage, de-puff your skin, and boost your circulation.

Don’t forget about exfoliating!

‍
If there’s one secret to summer-ready legs, it’s exfoliating. Before you can even think of adding fake tan and using a moisturizer, you need to remove the dead skin cells from your skin. You won’t be able to get a natural-looking and even coverage with your fake tan unless you’ve exfoliated first.
Choose a body scrub with sea salt and use it on damp skin before showering as a way of prepping your body before applying your fake tan. If you want to save time, find an exfoliator that also includes oil so that you can buff away the dead skin cells, while also hydrating your skin. You can exfoliate during your morning routine and then apply your fake tan later in the day.
Speaking of fake tan, you need to moisturize your body before applying your fake tan. At a minimum, you want to add moisturizer to anywhere on your body with dry patches, especially your ankles, elbows, palms, and knees. During the summer, it’s a good idea to moisturize your legs twice a day. With hundreds of body lotions and creams on the market, you’re guaranteed to find one that works for you and your body.

Indulge in a pedicure

‍
No look is every complete without a fresh coat of nail polish. The summer brings with it open-toe shoes and flip-flops. Take the time to indulge in a pedicure or give yourself an at-home nail treatment. Don’t forget to add a moisturizer to your feet to give them a natural shine and to keep them hydrated.

‍
How are you getting your legs summer-ready? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is right around the corner. It’s the time of year when we’re all thinking of how our body look. We’ve all heard the saying ‘summer body’ and ‘suns out, guns out’. While that might make you think of your arms, it’s usually our legs that we’re most conscious about. Most of the year, our legs are covered by jeans or tights. Once the temperatures start to rise, it’s shorts and skirt season.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: eco- friendly, sustainable gifts, ideas gifts
meta-description: Our guide goes through 11 of our favourite eco-friendly and sustainable gifts that work for all the women in your life.
meta-title: Eco-Friendly and Sustainable Gifts
name: It’s Time to Start Giving Eco-Friendly and Sustainable Gifts
post-body:
We’ve all bought a last-minute gift that we know the person isn’t going to use for long. Whether it’s grabbing a novelty gift or something that will go out of style within a season, we’ve all been guilty of choosing a less than sustainable gift. When you think of how often you’re buying gifts – between Christmas, birthdays, graduations, engagements, baby showers. These are just a few examples of the events where you’re buying someone else a gift. Often, we leave our gift buying to the last-minute and end up regretting it.
We’re all becoming more sustainable in our life choices. Whether it’s saying goodbye to single use plastic or making more ethical fashion choices, we’re all taking steps to become more sustainable and environmentally friendly. Thankfully, there are hundreds of brands out there that offer sustainable gift ideas for you to give to your family and friend.
Our guide goes through 11 of our favourite eco-friendly and sustainable gifts that work for all the women in your life. Whether it’s your BFF’s birthday, your sister’s baby shower, or a Mother’s Day gift, this list has something for everyone. These items include everything from recycled gold to eco-friendly packaging and zero-waste products.

You’ll want to bookmark this page and come back to it every time you want to buy a sustainable gift. With our help, your panic last-minute shopping will become a thing of the past!

Janessa Leone Felix Hat

‍
Who doesn’t love a hat? They’re having a major fashion moment, and they always come back in style. We love this rich chocolate hat by Janessa Leone. It’s a mid-priced item that is perfect as a splurge gift for your BFF or sister that won’t break the bank. It’s an ideal choice for birthdays or the holiday season
This hat takes on the contemporary silhouette of a bucket hat and gives it a more timeless and sophisticated look with raffia palm fibers that are dried and crocheted to create the hat’s distinctive silhouette.
It’s available in four colours and various sizes for a custom fit.

Camille Beinhorn Green Tourmaline and Pearl Lagoon Necklace

‍
Do you have a friend celebrating a big birthday? Do you want to spoil your wife or girlfriend? Check out this necklace by Camille Beinhorn. They’re made in New York using recycled metals to create a contemporary and sustainable piece of jewellery. This necklace incorporates Tahitian pearl with tourmaline, while the beads are hand-knotted using silk thread.
We love this necklace so much, that we think you should pick-up one for you and your BFF.

Porto Pouch

‍
When in doubt, buy a bag. While not everyone has the bank balance to buy their BFF a Birkin or a Chanel flap bag, there are some more attainable choices on the market.
Minimalism is one of the leading trends in the fashion industry right now, with handbags being no exception. This pouch takes its inspiration from several of the best-selling Bottega Veneta bags – while being a fraction of the price.
Our top choice for a pouch bag is by Porto, who uses smooth leather from Italy and expertly craft their bags to last a lifetime. The cloud-like silhouette is a dram gift, with the bag being handmade in a family-owned factory in Italy. Could you find anything more luxurious?

Deveruex Gena Huggies

‍
Is there anything chicer than huggie earrings? They’re having a major comeback right now, but they’re a timeless silhouette that make the perfect keepsake. Devereux’s jewellery is made to order, preventing waste, and making the experience feel even more luxurious. While these huggie hoops are small, they’re made using recycled gold and pack a bunch.
It’s worth noting that these earrings are made in New York by artisan goldsmiths and can take up to 4 weeks for delivery, so they’re not a last-minute gift.

Maggie Marilyn – The Marilyn Dress

‍
Every woman loves getting a new dress. If you have a girlfriend that’s about to get married, or if you want to treat her to a new dress, check out the Marilyn Dress.
The Maggie Marilyn brand puts ethics and environmental sustainability at the heart of what they do. We think this is the perfect dress to wear for a spring or summer bachelorette party or bridal shower. It would work amazing for any social events your friend has during the warmer months.
We love how the gathered bust and knot detailing gives the fitted basque around the waist a contemporary feel. This dress is for the Marilyn Monroe in your life.

Feroce Eyewear – Vicky Sunglassess

‍
Sunglasses are an investment that most of us won’t splurge on. If you’re not sure what to buy your BFF or sister, sunglasses always go down a treat. We love the Vicky style by the New York-based Feroce brand. They scream luxury without breaking the bank.
Feroce is committed to protecting the environment and offers a ‘revival’ programme, where you can bring in your old Feroce frames and exchanged them for credit towards your next pair. We think it’s a win-win and the perfect way to recycle your old sunglasses in order to get a new style.
At $125, this style is available in six colours. We think it’s worth picking up a pair for both you and the recipient. You can even have your prescriptions placed into the lenses!

Nomasei x Lucy Folk – Hotel de la Plage Mule

‍
Everyone is living in mules and sandals. The Hotel de la Plage style gives you the best of both worlds at an attainable price tag. These shoes are made from start to finish in Tuscany. The brand Nomasei works with local manufacturers in the area, helping to reduce it’s carbon footprint.
Nomasei has just teamed up with the Australian lifestyle brand, Lucy Folk, to create the must-have summer mule of the season. These shoes are the perfect gift for the girl who is always son the go and never far from the beach or a tropical vacation.

Chelsea Paris Finn Sandal

‍
Speaking of shoes, it’s worth having a pair of heels on your radar. Every girl wants a pair of dancing shoes, and we couldn’t pick a better pair than the Finn Sandal by Chelsea Paris.
The brand was founded by Theresa Ebagua, an LA-based and Nigerian-born black designer who is on a mission to leave her mark on the industry. Hitting zero waste and protecting the environment are two of the brand’s key mission.
Chelsea Paris uses exclusively metal-free and vegetable-tanned leather, meaning that the production process doesn’t result in harmful by-products. The textiles used to create their shoes are ecologically processed, while the factory uses only cruelty-free and organic dyes and glues.
The Finn Sandals run true to size and are available in four colours. Do you have a Carrie Bradshaw in your life? If so, these are the perfect gift for her!

Fable Home Dinnerware Set

‍
We couldn’t write a sustainable gift guide for women without incorporating a wedding-appropriate gift. This suggestion is also ideal for housewarming gifts or if you know someone who is looking to re-do their kitchen.
The Fable Home dinnerware set is made using recycled clay and incorporates eco-friendly packaging. This 16-piece set includes everything your friend will need, from dinner plates to salad bowls and pasta plates. Everything is hand-finished in Portugal and the set is available in five shades, including white, pink, blue, green, and grey.

Ceremonia Aceite de Moska Hair Oil

‍
Are you looking for a budget-friendly gift that won’t break the bank? If you need a gift for a more casual friend, someone who doesn’t like gifts, or a secret-Santa, then this hair oil is your perfect solution.
The Aceite de Moska Hair oil by Ceremonia has a nourishing formula that is free of parabens, silicones, and sulfates. This hair oil has an award-winning formula and was named the Best Scalp Oil in Women’s Health 2021 Beauty Awards.
There’s no greater gift than helping your friend smash their hair goals. It’s also a perfect gift for the person who has everything. This hair oil promotes hair growth, strengthens the hair, nourishes the scalp, and enhances the natural shine of your hair.

Mociun Sophie Lou Jacobsen Wave Pitcher

‍
Do you have a friend with a quirky personality? Are you looking for a gift that will stand out from the ground and be memorable? This water pitcher may be a splurge gift but it’s a functional item that doubles as a unique piece of home décor.
The Wave Glass Pitcher is designed by Sophie Lou Jacobsen, whose work is inspired by the concept of finding joy in everyday items. The pitcher is made using borosilicate glass and is available in five colours, with various handle colours to choose from.
We think this gift is ideal for a wedding, engagement, birthday, housewarming, or anniversary gift.

‍
Which of these sustainable and eco-friendly gifts will you be giving away this year? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: We’ve all bought a last-minute gift that we know the person isn’t going to use for long. Whether it’s grabbing a novelty gift or something that will go out of style within a season, we’ve all been guilty of choosing a less than sustainable gift. When you think of how often you’re buying gifts – between Christmas, birthdays, graduations, engagements, baby showers. These are just a few examples of the events where you’re buying someone else a gift. Often, we leave our gift buying to the last-minute and end up regretting it.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: nft, fashion, cripto, non-fungible , fashion brands
meta-description: What makes the NFT non-fungible is that it is irreplaceable. It’s a one-off, original, and exclusive item.
meta-title: Things you want to know about NFTs and Fashion
name: NFTs and Fashion
post-body:
NFTs are a booming business. If you’ve been on Twitter or Instagram lately, you’ll have come across the infamous non-fungible tokens, known as NFTs. While it’ll take most of us a while to wrap our head around the idea, we’re here to help you understand it. NFTs are a form of cryptocurrency blockchain and is a digital asset. What makes the NFT non-fungible is that it is irreplaceable. It’s a one-off, original, and exclusive item.

Throughout the course of the pandemic, NFTs have taken on a whole new life. They’re appearing in every sector, whether it’s literature, music, or photography, with art being the most common type of NFT. Everyone from influencers to high-profile celebrities are tipping their toes into the world of cryptocurrency, including the infamous NFTs. They’re not just buying NFTs, they’re selling them.
Emily Ratajkowski has been auctioning a virtual essay that she’s written for The Cut and fellow supermodel Kate Moss is selling several videos of herself doing everyday things like sleeping and driving. They’re not the first celebrities to try and make a pretty penny from NFTs. Actress and entrepreneur Lindsay Lohan sold a portrait of herself as an NFT for more than $50,000.
If you want a more extreme example of how much an NFT can make, look no further than Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey. He sold his first-ever tweet for almost $3 million. It was bought by Sina Estavi, a CEO of a Malaysian-based blockchain service. He compared the tweet to a modern-day version of the Mona Lisa.
When you think of all these celebrities getting on board, it’s no surprise that NFT sales have bounced by 2000% between 2020-2021. If you’re able to get your foot into the NFT business, you can make a pretty penny.

Recent NFT Sales

‍
Some of the recent NFT sales give you an insight into the interesting world of NFTs and what is making the top-ticket price.
Do you remember the iconic ‘Charlie Bit My Finger’ video? It was one of the first YouTube videos to go viral, featuring Charlie biting the finger of his older brother, Harry. It was auctioned off by their family and earned almost £540,000. Now that the video has been sold, it will be removed from YouTube. The Charlie video is an interesting example, as the video is widely available elsewhere online.
On the fashion side, the Parisian luxury accessory store, Labodet, has unveiled its first NFT in the form of a mobile phone wallpaper. The original item behind the wallpaper was handcrafted by a specialist artisan using exotic crocodile leather and features 18k gold that is satin-brushed onto the fabric.
At another end of the spectrum, we have a more poignant example of NFTs. Khaled Jarrar is selling solid from the Palestinian city of Ramallah, located in the central West Bank. His work is entitled, ‘If I don’t steal your home, someone else will steal it’. The title is a reclaiming of the phrase used by an Israeli settle when they were evicting Palestinian families the Sheikh Jarrah neighbourhood in East Jerusalem. Khaled Jarrar chose to offer his work as an NFT due to the public attention on the industry and to bring awareness to the issues citizens face in Palestine.
The art industry remains the most popular niche within the NFT sector. The famous Uffizi Gallery in Florence has just sold a Michelangelo NFT for almost £120,000. The painting, the Tondo Doni, is one of the prized pieces from the gallery’s Michelangelo collection, and focuses on the holy family. The painting dates back to 1506 and is an example of heritage art being brought into a contemporary setting. The Uffizi Gallery is planning to sell other works from their collection as NFT, including the famous Birth of Venus painting by Botticelli.
It’s not just art that has found its way into the NFT market. FC Dynamo Kyiv, the top team in the Ukranian Premier League, has started selling NFT tickets for their 2021 season. This new style of ticket will be launching at the end of the month and is part of the brand’s strategy to become the ‘greatest technological leader of football within the next two years’.

Luxury Brands and NFTs

‍
Luxury fashion brands are currently debating whether they want to take the plunge into the world of NFTs. While they are all the rage right now, fashion brands don’t want to attach themselves to a momentary phase. Are the millennials who are obsessed with crypto-currency interested in purchasing the NFTs from luxury fashion brands? Would it dilute the value of the brand? How complicated would it be to set up NFTs alongside brand’s existing products?
Everywhere we look, there are stories of record-breaking NFT sales, some of which we’ve featured in this article. While the art world is awake to the sound of NFTs, the luxury fashion industry is still making its mind up about NFTs.
Gucci have told Vogue Business that it is “only a matter of time” before brands within their niche release their first NFT. The publication claims to have been told my multiple sources that there are numerous luxury fashion brands who are planning to release NFTs in the near future. The question around NFTs and the luxury fashion industry is who will be the first person to bring one to the market.
It’s a well-known fact that luxury brands are on the back-foot with the e-commerce industry, but it’s clear that they are becoming more willing to embrace the world of NFTs and blockchain technology.
The fashion industry is full of conversations around the possible incorporation of NFTs with the luxury fashion niche. Some commentators see NFTs as the natural evolution within the digital fashion industry, especially as digital fashion skins have already been embraced by luxury brands. What makes NFTs appealing to luxury fashion industries is that their scarcity and rarity brings their value closer to that of a physical luxury item.

Creating a NFT hub for fashion

‍
For now, the fashion that is being sold through NFT is art instead of actual fashion. More utility will eventually come into the niche, but for now, it’s clear that the industry is more focused on art NFTs than fashion items. Part of what puts the fashion industry off NFT is that they are not functional. What can an owner do other than look at it? An NFT is not like a Birkin bag that you can carry around with you.
The problem is that the NFT industry doesn’t meet the expectations of luxury shoppers and fails to match the in-store experience or even that of ordering online. The virtual game Decentraland and its fashion NFTs shows that for now, NFTs are a world away from that of luxury fashion. The NFTs that you’ll find focus primarily on sneakers, hoodies, and costumes. Everything is pixelated and has a cartoon-style finish.
The Decentraland game also showcases another problem that the industry faces. Setting up your browser-based Ethereum wallet is not something that is likely to appeal to people who buy from brands like Chanel, Dior, or Hermes.
The solution to these problems is to create a system and experience that gives the audience a luxury experience. The industry doesn’t need another Amazon style set-up, but something closer to MyTheresa or Net-a-Porter.
We’re already seeing start-ups arriving on the market to try and capitalise on this need. Neuno, a Syndey-based start-up, is rumoured to be working with five different luxury fashion brands to help them launch their NFTs. The company’s CEO, Natalie Johnson, has told Vogue Business that they want to create a “universal 3D wardrobe that plugs into everything”. Part of their work includes utilizing social media filters to allow the owners of fashion NFTs to post images of themselves wearing the item they have bought. This technology would also include being able to use the NFT as clothes for gaming avatars.
The current set-up of NFTs allow anyone to upload and sell an NFT on the market. What Neuno hopes to achieve is to work directly with brands to create a premium and luxury experience for audiences, giving consumers the assurance that the items are authentic and backed by the brand. This start-up also aims to streamline the process by allowing consumers to purchase NFTs using their credit card, so that there is no need to have cryptocurrency.

Existing NFT marketplaces

‍
It’s worth knowing that there are already some fashion NFTs companies out there that work as marketplaces. Currency websites include KnownOrigin, OpenSea, and Nifty Gateway. Clothia is an online retailer that offers fashion NFTs as a digital ‘twin’ of an existing and physical garment. Clothia operates by giving winning bids both the physical garment and NFTs of a one-of-a-kind item.
Clothia’s CEO, Elena Silenok, told Vogue that luxury fashion houses should think of NFTs as an additional revenue stream and a way of digitalising their existing product range. NFTs are a way of making brand’s more accessible, just like a Dior lipstick is more accessible for the average person than a Lady Dior bag.

‍
What do you think of fashion NFTs? Let us know in the comments below!

‍

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: make up, Mikayla Nogueira , makeup artist, tiktok
meta-description: If you’re on TikTok, you’ll have seen Mikayla Nogueira. She’s become one of the unofficial ‘big sisters’ of TikTok.
meta-title: How Mikayla Nogueira Became TikTok Makeup Artist
name: How Mikayla Nogueira Became Our Go-To TikTok Makeup Artist
post-body:
If you’re on TikTok, you’ll have seen Mikayla Nogueira. She’s become one of the unofficial ‘big sisters’ of TikTok and is teaching a generation of women how to love themselves and embrace treat makeup like the work of art that it is. This 23-year-old makeup artist is everywhere you look on TikTok and has become an overnight sensation thanks to her creative makeup looks. Her candid reviews, on-point makeup, and bubbly personality have gained her over 5.7 million followers on the app.

‍

‍

Almost every video that she puts out goes viral and Mikayla is responsible for several products selling out worldwide after being featured on her videos. What is impressive about Mikayla is how quickly she’s found fame on TikTok as a beauty influencer. Her 5.7 million followers’ rivals that of long-term and more established influencers who have been on the scene since the early days of YouTube or Instagram.

‍
It all started in March 2020, just as the pandemic entered our lives. Like millions of us, Mikayla turned to TikTok to fill her time at the start of quarantine. She had just been laid off from her job at Ulta and decided to download TikTok as a way to fulfil her passion for makeup.

‍
Mikayla’s first video was of the ‘Catfish Challenge’. Her success on the app is in large part due to her ability to spot trends early and capitalise on them. The video was the first time Mikayla had showed anyone what she looked like without makeup.

‍

‍
Since then, Mikayla has used TikTok as a platform to show off her creativity and experiment with every aspect of the beauty industry. Whether it’s product reviews on showing her daily makeup, Mikayla’s relatability makes her content easy to watch.

She recently told Vogue Online that she found creating TikToks to be “very easy for me…my mind is constantly overflowing with ideas.”. It’s not just makeup that Mikayla shares on the app. Her videos have shown a unique behind the scenes take of the life of a ‘average’ girl turned social media megastar. Mikayla has shared everything from disappointing dates to meeting her current boyfriend and buying her first Chanel bag.

‍
Mikayla feels more like a BFF or big sister than a beauty influencer trying to sell you a product. Her authenticity and creativity are her greatest assets. She’s the sort of content creator that you can sit down, and binge watch her videos with an iced coffee. Mikayla isn’t afraid to show herself makeup free and with her hair in a bun – just like your friend sending you a WhatsApp video.

‍
Her first collaboration with Glamlite recently launched online, hitting the market on her 23rd birthday. The Mikayla x Glamlite collection has already sold out, showing the power and community that this TikToker has behind her.

‍

‍

How Mikayla Makes her Tiktok Videos

‍
Speaking during her Vogue interview, Mikayla said that she wakes up around 7am to start filming her TikTok videos. Her daily goal is to make at least three videos, but no more than six. On average, it takes between one to two hours to film each video. Eyeshadow tutorials can take up to three hours to film. Afternoons are spent posting videos and engaging with her community of followers, before heading to meetings and hosting calls with her managers.

‍
By 7pm, Mikyala’s working day is over and she’s ready to fall asleep by 9pm. Her daily schedule shows that becoming a successful TikTok star takes more than filming 30-second videos.

‍

Mikayla’s Makeup Journey

‍
Part of Mikayla’s appeal is her raw honesty. We’re used to seeing makeup artists and beauty influencers who look like they’ve been blessed with flawless skin and a perfect life. Mikayla isn’t afraid to talk about the hard topics. She’s spoken openly about being pulled growing up because of her voice, weight, and appearance. Her childhood bullies used to say she looked like a man, making her question her femininity.

‍
She turned to makeup at 10 years old as a way to make herself feel more feminine and positive about herself. Mikayla has described makeup as being her “safe zone”. Like most of us, Mikayla found herself watching makeup tutorials and beauty videos every day, giving her an appreciation for makeup as an art form.

‍
You can tell by watching Mikayla’s videos that her passion for makeup is genuine. She’s described being able to share her passion with the world as an “incredible honor and blessing”.

‍

‍

Why Mikayla Thinks She’s Been Successful

‍
It’s one of the first things we ask when we see someone being successful. How have they done it? Why are they so successful? While most people will shrug their shoulders, Mikayla has two strong answers to this question. She describes her positive attitude towards life and her authenticity as being key to her success.

‍
It is her life experiences and what she has gone through that has allowed this TikToker to truly be herself. Unlike other content creators, her videos are unscripted and off-the-cuff. Her goal is to always lift others up and she isn’t afraid of what people thinks of her. She aims to bring humour to all of her videos and to remind people that makeup is meant to be fun.

‍
If you’re a follower of the beauty community, you’ll know of the drama that usually follows some of its most successful creators. Mikayla’s TikTok is a drama-free zone, with this content creator aiming to bring a “refreshing perspective”. Mikayla shard that her “main goal is to make someone smile or teach someone something new”. We know that Mikayla’s videos always put an instant smile back on our faces.

‍

How Does Mikayla Review Products?

‍
We all know of influencers who only review products that they’re paid for. Mikayla is famous for finding wonder products – both drugstore and high-end. With her millions of followers, Mikayla has the potential to make or break the success of a product. While most beauty influencers won’t speak negatively about a product for fear of a PR backlash, Mikayla posted a ‘full face of makeup I hate’ video.

‍
Mikayla is more transparent than other influencers, describing how she has “absolutely wrecked products I have received in PR”.

‍
Speaking of product reviews, you’re probably wondering what this social media superstar counts as her holy grails. Mikayla’s must-have products include the Soft Matte Complete Concealer by Nars, Nyx’s Brow Glue, the Maybelline SuperStay Foundation, Anastasia Beverly Hills’ Liquid Eyeliner, and the entire range of Glow Recipe’s skincare.

‍

‍

Mikayla’s Makeup Advice

‍
Mikayla’s number one makeup hack is to take the time to understand your skin type and texture. This factor is what will make or break your skincare routine. You should always be keeping your skin texture and type in mind when buying and applying makeup products. Your skin type will determine which products you should use to prep and primer your skin, as well as which product formulas to avoid.

‍
If you know your skin texture and type, you can avoid buying the wrong products or causing a breakout.
Part of this process is also understanding your skin tones, which can be a gamechanger when choosing your foundation shade. You want to understand what your master and undertone is to be able to buy a foundation. You might be able to finally find your perfect match.

‍

Mikayla’s TikTok Career

‍
At the time of writing this article, Mikayla’s most viral video on TikTok is her contouring hack, which has over 28 million views. The content creator has pointed to ‘hack’ videos as being a key part of her success. Viewers are more likely to watch under the end to see the dramatic results. The longer someone watches a video, the more successful it will be and the more the creator’s content will end up on their ‘for you’ page. She’s singled out the contouring video as being successful because it’s easy for her audience to recreate and do themselves.

‍
For the future of TikTok, Mikayla has reflected on how the app is changing day by day. She’s said she’s committed to staying on the app for the foreseeable future as it’s fun and she’s enjoying creating content. Mikayla told Vogue that she likes the TikTok format as it doesn’t require her to have a ‘big idea’. She can be herself and make unique videos without feeling like she’s putting on a performance, as most creators feel when making YouTube videos or long-form content.
Mikayla’s future looks bright as one of the most successful beauty influencers to originate from TikTok. Outside of TikTok, Mikayla has her recently released Glamlite collaboration and over 1.1 million followers on Instagram.

‍
She got in the app right as it was about to experience accelerated growth thanks to the pandemic. Her success is a blueprint for other creators who want to break out and make a name for themselves on social media. Tell a story, be your authentic self, and build a relationship with your audience.

‍

She’s become one of the unofficial ‘big sisters’ of TikTok and is teaching a generation of women how to love themselves and embrace treat makeup like the work of art that it is. This 23-year-old makeup artist is everywhere you look on TikTok and has become an overnight sensation thanks to her creative makeup looks. Her candid reviews, on-point makeup, and bubbly personality have gained her over 5.7 million followers on the app.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: livestream benefits, livestreaming , brands,
meta-description: In this article, Jumble will take you through a few amazing benefits that livestreaming offers to new and established brands alike.
meta-title: 11 Live Streaming Benefits for Your Brand
name: 11 Live Streaming Benefits for Your Brand
post-body:
Although livestream shopping is a relatively new way of selling products, it’s gaining popularity rather quickly in the online shopping industry.
Livestream, in general, isn’t a new concept. Brands have been using this interacting form of medium to connect with their audience for a while now.
More and more people are shopping online post-pandemic. This is why the livestream shopping industry has seen a rise and seems to have a bright future.
If you want to know how livestreaming can help you achieve your business goals, you have landed on the right page.
In this article, Jumble will take you through a few amazing benefits that livestreaming offers to new and established brands alike.
Before jumping into the benefits, let’s see why you need to start livestream shopping for your brand.

Why Should You Start Livestreaming?

‍
The recent boom in eCommerce shows that the shopping industry has taken a big leap into the online world.
More and more brands are going online as it’s cost-effective and convenient for both, sellers and consumers.
And, the trend doesn’t seem to stop there. Livestream shopping is an aspect of online retail that continues to prove its effectiveness.
So, if you are thinking of using new ways that can effectively boost your sales and brand awareness, consider starting livestream shopping.

11 Live Streaming Benefits for Your Brand

Let’s explore some amazing benefits of livestream shopping together. If you are wondering “Why is livestream shopping so effective?”, By the end of this article, you’d know why.

More Exposure for Your Brand

‍
You want to get in front of as many prospects as possible, right? Every brand does! Livestream can easily expand your reach and bring more potential customers to your business.
And, the best thing is, you don’t need to invest a lot to achieve that.
The more people that see your livestream, the better. And, if you are able to reach your target customers at scale, what’s better than that for a brand?
As digital media expand, brands can reach more and more people cost-effectively through livestreaming.
Plus, lots of people prefer livestream videos over conventional ones. The immediate nature of livestreams lets you grab the attention of most internet surfers and deliver your brand message to them.

‍
Leverage Impulse Buying

‍
Another benefit of using livestream shopping is that you can use consumer behavior of impulse buying in your favor.
You see, livestreams are immediate and persuade the audience to take quick action. Even if they know your livestream will remain there even if you push the stop button, they tend to engage with it as it’s “Now”.
Getting your livestream in front of spontaneous buyers can substantially improve your conversions.
Just make sure your livestreams aren’t boring and try to engage your prospects as much as possible with top-notch content.

Better Interaction with Prospects

‍
There can be several benefits of effective customer interaction. But, what if you could also talk with your prospect and find their pain points?
Livestream shopping can let you do that with ease.
Audience interaction helps you understand what your prospects are thinking, what are their pain points, and what are their desires.
Understanding what your target customer wants is valuable information. It lets you mold your marketing message for maximum results.
One thing to keep in mind is that you need to promote your livestreams before going live. Fortunately, any brand can leverage social media advertisement for that as it’s quite inexpensive these days.  
You can use Facebook advertisement to create ads that can bring your dream buyer to your livestream without having to spend too much.

‍
Reduced Marketing Expenditure

‍
Another great thing about livestreams is that you don’t need to set aside a lot of your marketing budget for them.
You can afford to use inexpensive equipment to execute perfect livestreams. The basic equipment you’d need includes livestream software, a computer with a mic, and a stable internet connection.
Livestreaming saves you a lot of trouble as well. For instance, you don’t need to do video editing or hire a video editor.
You don’t need a perfect script: A Livestream allows you to present a more humanized version of your brand.
Your host can just talk to your audience one-on-one without worrying about small mistakes. The more transparent you get on your streams, the more trust you can build with your audience.

Effective Communication

‍
If we were to tell you the single most important aspect of a successful brand, it’s effective communication.
Without communicating your message, how can you make your prospects act on your offers?
Livestreams enable you to deliver your message more effectively as you can directly talk to your audience.
In addition, livestreaming allows brands to address any misinformation about their business or products immediately.
You can also use livestreams to convey your brand news and messages. It’s the best tool to get in touch with your customers instantly.

‍
Lets Consumers Make Informed and Confident Decisions

‍
Educating prospects about your products is probably the greatest driving force for conversions. If you want to increase your sales as a brand, livestreaming can help you do that.
The better your prospects understand how your products or services can add value to their lives, the higher the chances of conversions.
A good strategy to educate your livestream audience is to create an explainer video about your product and conduct a Q&A afterward.
While every brand can increase their conversions with this strategy, businesses with complicated product features can benefit more.
As you can show your products live to your audience, you are better able to help them understand what they are all about.
Seeing a product in action can certainly help your audience put their trust in that product. If you can use the product in front of them, you’d be helping them make a confident purchase. This can help your product return rate as well.

Reduced Product Returns

‍
Product returns can be quite damaging to a brand. And, it can be quite painful too, especially when you are not at fault.
Fortunately, there are strategies that can help you reduce your returns, helping your profitability. Livestream shopping is one of the most effective strategies.
How can livestream shopping help reduce returns, you ask?
Livestreams help you provide the right information about whatever you are selling. For instance, you can get your audience to ask any questions about your product. This way, you’ll be able to address any misconceptions or confusion about your products.
Livestreaming allows you to showcase your products live. This helps the prospects understand every feature and functionality before making the decision, which makes their purchase a well-informed one.

Builds Brand Awareness

‍
You need to reach as many people as possible to build brand awareness and attract more prospects.
The urgent and interactive nature of livestreams helps you engage more people with your content. Even if someone doesn’t become your customer, livestreaming can boost your brand’s awareness.
And, the more you can get in front of your target customers, the more likely they’ll do business with you.

Helps Increase Happy customers

‍
Your number one goal with any marketing strategy is increasing customer satisfaction. Your happy customers are your most valuable asset.
With them being on your side, you don’t even have to invest in marketing efforts and try to get in front of more prospects.
If the list of your existing customers is long enough, you might not want to invest too much into the advertisement.
Your happy customers can bring new prospects to your business through word of mouth and positive testimonials.
Livestreams help you increase customer satisfaction and brand loyalty. These happy customers act as your brand advocates, keeping the flywheel of your business moving.

Better Profitability

‍
As discussed earlier, conducting livestreams is not an expensive task. You can carry out a high-converting livestream even on a lean budget.
While you are attracting prospects with low investment, your profit margins are the same. This eventually leads to more profit for your brand.

‍
Amazing Tools

‍
Another great thing about doing livestreams is that you have a lot of options as far as the software is concerned.
Jumble has its own livestreaming software that’s easy to use and provides great control over your livestreams.

‍
post-summary: Although livestream shopping is a relatively new way of selling products, it’s gaining popularity rather quickly in the online shopping industry. Livestream, in general, isn’t a new concept. Brands have been using this interacting form of medium to connect with their audience for a while now. More and more people are shopping online post-pandemic. This is why the livestream shopping industry has seen a rise and seems to have a bright future. If you want to know how livestreaming can help you achieve your business goals, you have landed on the right page. In this article, Jumble will take you through a few amazing benefits that livestreaming offers to new and established brands alike. Before jumping into the benefits, let’s see why you need to start livestream shopping for your brand.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: dress, summer , fashion , style summer dresses
meta-description: We’re rounding up a few of our favourite summer dresses, so that you can get a head start on building your summer closet.
meta-title: The Best Summer Dresses That You Need for 2021
name: The Best Summer Dresses That You Need for 2021
post-body:
Summer is right around the corner. Once the temperatures start to rise, we put our jeans firmly to the back of our closet and rediscover our love for dresses. During summer, there’s nothing else that we can wear other than dresses. Whether you’re working on your summer tan or want to stay cool, then a dress is your BFF for the summer season.

There are hundreds – if not thousands – of dresses for you to choose from. We’re rounding up a few of our favourite summer dresses, so that you can get a head start on building your summer closet. Don’t forget, summer dresses notoriously sell out, especially if they go viral on social media. You’ll want to snag these dresses ASAP before they sell out. Trust me. Your closet will thank you!

Mango Contrast-Bodice Jersey Dress

‍
If you’re a fan of the knitted jumper dress, we’ve found the summer alternative for you. You get the classic silhouette with the benefit of a breathable jersey fabric. What we love about this dress is that it’s a lookalike for the vintage Celine dress that Sienna Miller recently wore. You can get the same look for summer 2021 at a fraction of the price.

Faithfull the Brand – Nikoleta Tie-Detailed Shirred Floral Print Mini Dress

‍
Milkmaid dresses are one of the classic silhouettes that make a reappearance every summer. It’s the perfect choice for making a splurge purchase. This mini dress will work for any occasion, whether you’re heading out for brunch or going on vacation. This breezy dress is the perfect choice for a feminine dress to see you through the summer months.

H&M Rib-Knit Dress

‍
If you like the first dress on this list, you’ll love the classic rib-knit dress. There’s nothing chicer than a tank dress with a rib-knit fabric that you can wear anywhere. You can style this dress with mule sandals or keep it casual with white sneakers.

Ghost Floral-Print Tea Dress

‍
Embrace your inner Duchess and take a leaf out of the Duchess of Cambridge’s fashion book by picking up this floral-print tea dress by Ghost. This feminine dress is one we expect to see everywhere this season. We love this dress in the shorter version as it gives you the most versatility and is perfect for any summer event on your calendar.

& Other Stories Voluminous Open Back Midi Dress

‍
Your summer closet needs an oversized midi dress. This classic silhouette is one that you can wear for a picnic in the park or when relaxing on the beach. They’re so comfortable that you could even sleep in these dresses. This & Other Stories dress incorporates several of the biggest summer trends, including tiered silhouettes and seersucker fabric.

& Other Stories Tiered Mini Lace Dress

‍
Another dress from & Other Stories that you want on your radar is this Victorian-inspired smock dress. You can wear it with anything from combat boots to ballet flats or your favourite stilettoes. What we love about this dress is that you can wear it as a transitional piece through to fall and winter by adding woollen tights or knee-high boots.

Mango Vent Cotton Dress

‍
Cut-out dresses are one of the biggest trends for summer 2021 and this style by Mango is one of our favourite budget-friendly choices. The mellow yellow shade is a must-have for summer. You’ll want to wear this dress if you’re heading on a tropical vacation or attending a beach wedding. Don’t forget to finish your outfit off with leather sandals and cocktail in hand.

Olivia Rubin – PF21 Ombre Mini Dress

‍
Whether you’re planning to dance the night away or grab a few drinks with friends, this ombre Olivia Rubin dress will see you through it all. The silhouette is easy to wear, and you can add a cardigan or shawl on top to layer up when the temperatures drop in the evening. The ombre colour palette is right on trend and universally flattering.

OMNES Puff Sleeve Tie Back Midi Tea Dress in Lips Print

‍
If you want a feminine dress that you can wear to a garden party or afternoon tea, look no further than this style by OMNES. The sustainable brand has taken the classic midi silhouette and added a corset-inspired lace-up back with a lip print across the dress. Everyone needs at least one ethical fashion choice in their coset for summer 2021.
This ‘Astrid’ tea dress has a feminine puff sleeve and is lightweight, making it ideal for summer wedding or any occasion that you have in your diary. It’ll take you seamlessly from day to night.

Urban Bliss Plus Smock Mini Denim Dress in ECUR

‍
If there’s one trend that you need to jump on for summer 2021, it’s smock dresses. We love the classic and minimalistic silhouette of this style by Urban Bliss Plus. It’s plus-size friendly and has a universally flattering square-cut silhouette.

Free People Regina Midi Dress

‍
Embrace your inner bohemian chic with the Regina midi dress. This dress is perfect for a music festival or if you’re jetting off on vacation and want a look that no one else will be wearing. Free People is our go-to brand for bohemian chic, and they’ve nailed it with this midi dress. Layer a few of your favourite necklaces, add your leather sandals, and you’ll be ready to go.

Jacquemus Saudade Open-Back Ruched Twill Maxi Dress

‍
Do you have a special occasion on your social calendar? Is there a wedding, graduation, or milestone birthday coming up? We think this dress would be perfect for a trip to anywhere from Vegas to Bali.
This Jacquemus TDF Saudade dress is timeless yet sultry with a high-leg slit and open back. It’s the perfect way to show off your fresh summer tan. You can also purchase this dress in white if you’re looking for a bridal shower dress or something to wear to elope this summer.

The Hippie Shake Lady of the Canyon Brown Floral Maxi Dress

‍
Stevie Nicks called, and she wants her look back. With the 70s trends back in style, it’s never been a better time to embrace your inner bohemian chic. This dress is universally flattering, and you can add a leather belt to help accentuate your natural silhouette.

Olivia Rubin Rae Pink Collared Mini Dress

‍
Make a statement in this pastel dress by Olivia Rubin. The timeless silhouette and Peter Pan collar has been given a contemporary update with a layered plaster lace colour scheme. The skater style skirt and three-quarter length sleeves are perfectly on trend and universally flattering. This is the feminine dress that you’ll reach for every day during summer.

Stradivarius Gingham Maxi Dress

‍
Summer isn’t complete without at least one gingham dress. We love this budget-friendly style by Stradivarius. With this dress, you get the class gingham print with a tiered silhouette and tie-up straps. You’ll spend the summer living in this dress! You can style it with classic dad sandals and your favourite oversized sandals.

& Other Stories Printed Statement Collar Mini Dress

‍
We couldn’t write this list of summer 2021 dress without featuring a cottagecore inspired style. This dress by & Other Stories gives us serious Alexa Chung vibes from the late 2000s. What we love most about this dress is that it looks like you’ve found it in a vintage store, instead of picking it up from a high-street store.
The polka-dot print and Peter Pan collar gives this dress a classic silhouette that is timeless and feminine. You can add a leather satchel and dainty jewellery to complete your classic look.

Olivia Rubin Aubrey Pastel Ombre Silk Satin Slip Dress

‍
Another must-have silhouette for this summer 2021 dress guide is a satin slip dress. This style is one of the most versatile that you can add to your closet. It’ll take you anywhere from a dinner party with friends to drinks at a bar. You can style this dress with anything from sneakers to flip-flops or combat boots. The thin straps make it perfect for wearing when the temperatures skyrocket and you can always add a cardigan when the temperatures start to drop in the evening.

Whistles Shirred Midi Dress

‍
While we usually hide away from black during the summer months, it’s still a classic shade that we think you need in your closet. If you’re wearing black, it’s best to choose a midi silhouette with thin straps to keep you cool. We love this Whistles dress that incorporates ruching on the back to give you a tailored fit without being too clingy to your figure.

Majorelle Sweet Pea Dress

‍
Another special occasion dress that you want to have on your shopping list this is wrap dress by Majorelle. The long length and plunging neckline are juxtaposed with the thigh-high split for a sultry twist. The lemon print is one of our favourites and a classic summer style.

‍
Which of these summer dresses will you be adding to your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is right around the corner. Once the temperatures start to rise, we put our jeans firmly to the back of our closet and rediscover our love for dresses. During summer, there’s nothing else that we can wear other than dresses. Whether you’re working on your summer tan or want to stay cool, then a dress is your BFF for the summer season.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: sunscreens, summer, chemical, mineral, skin, protection
meta-description: We’re taking a deep dive into chemical and mineral sunscreens to help you decide which one is your perfect match.
meta-title: Chemical vs Mineral Sunscreens
name: Chemical vs Mineral Sunscreens and Why You Need to Know the Difference
post-body:
Wearing sunscreen is a non-negotiable. You might think that you can’t leave the house without a coat of mascara or a layer of lip gloss. In reality, it’s your SPF that needs to be your daily go-to. The number one tip that every dermatologist will give you is that you should be wearing a daily SPF to protect your skin. Regardless of its formula, a sunscreen will protect your skin from sun damage and the threat of premature aging.
Sunscreens can be divided into two types of formulas – chemical and minerals. What are the differences and why does that matter? We’re taking a deep dive into chemical and mineral sunscreens to help you decide which one is your perfect match.

Using a daily SPF

‍
Whether you decide to use a chemical, mineral, or hybrid sunscreen formula, the most important thing is to be consistent. It’s not enough to just be using a sunscreen when the sun is out. You want to be using it every day. The golden rule has always been that the ‘best’ sunscreen is the one that you’re wearing every day.
The secret to protecting your skin and keeping it youthful is to find a sunscreen that you enjoy using and can be consistent with. As long as your sunscreen has an SPF of at least 30, you’re good to go!

Why you need a daily SPF

‍
