By the time you get to your vanity, you’re ready for your morning coffee and an extra dose of caffeine. Instead of starting your beauty routine when you get to your vanity, you want to start it when you jump in the shower. Not only does it save you precious minutes in the morning, but it can be a gamechanger for your skin.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: ideas, content , livestream, show,
meta-description: Come up with fun and creative ways to engage with your audience and form a more personal connection with them. Let’s discuss fun livestream ideas for brands
meta-title: Interesting content ideas for the livestream show
name: Interesting content ideas for the livestream show
post-body:
Livestream is a great way to keep prospects in touch with your brand. Plus, showcasing a product on livestream is always more effective than conventional eCommerce shopping.
But, if you want to strengthen your relationship with your audience and stand out from the crowd, you need to offer something more than that.  
Come up with fun and creative ways to engage with your audience and form a more personal connection with them.
This will eventually lead to more trust and, in turn, conversions,
Let’s discuss some fun livestream ideas for brands.

Show Products in Action

‍
If your products need a detailed demonstration, you can do that on livestreams. For instance, if you are selling clothes, you can hire models and have them try the clothes on.  
The audience will be able to see the fitting, stitching, and other features in action. This can not only make your livestreams livelier, but it can also improve your sales.

Take Your viewers on a Virtual Tour

‍
To form a personal bond with your audience, you can create a vlog where you show them the surrounding areas of your company.
If you have a warehouse of products that you are trying to sell to them, offering them a sneak peek into it can also help.
You can also show them around your studio where you create your livestreams.

Host an Informational Session

‍
One of the most effective ways to provide value to your audience is by teaching them something they want to learn.
Free and live informative sessions can help you stand out from your competition and establish yourself as an expert in the industry.
You can also give your audience an in-depth understanding of your services or products. This will eventually lead to more sales for your brand.
And, by livestreaming, you are adding more authenticity and value. For instance, you can ask your audience to ask questions related to your products or anything they want to know and answer them there and then.
This way, your audience will be more engaged as compared to a recorded session.

Show Behind-the-scenes Action

‍
Give your audience a behind-the-scenes look. This will help you form a deeper connection with your audience.
Think about what your audience would find interesting. For instance, you can show them how your products are packed or made.
A livestream isn’t polished content. When you present your products in this raw format, your brand appears authentic.
If your products go through a manufacturing line, show your audience each step with demonstrations. This would keep them hooked to your livestreams.

Host a Question & Answer Session

‍
Another way to add value is by hosting a live question & answers session with your audience. They might have questions about your brand.
You can tell them your brand story and the challenges you went through initially. This will create an emotional bond with your audience, which is great for brand loyalty.

Host a Product Launch

‍
If you are launching a new product, what you can do is, host a livestream and tell your audience about the new launch.
This will create hype about your new product as more and more people will join in due to engagement.
Alternatively, you can host a livestream where you tell everything about your new product in detail. This could be a live question and answer session for that product.

Host a Contest

‍
You can also engage your audience by hosting a contest occasionally. This way, you can market your products by giving away some of them for free.
Who isn’t attracted to free stuff, right? Some good examples of contests are “pick a number”, “spin the wheel”, and a lottery.
No one would be at the losing end. It would be a win-win for both.

Play a Game

‍
Humanizing your brand is one of the most effective ways to build a loyal following. Sharing a livestream with your audience where your team members play a game will do the trick.  
Play a game with one of your colleagues and interact with your viewers as well.

Do a Suggestion Livestream

‍
Another fun and productive livestream idea would be to put your brand out in the open and ask for suggestions from customers.  
You won’t have to do much in this case. Your audience will come up with suggestions and improvements; you’d just have to take their advice.
This way, you’ll not only get better as a brand, but you’ll also tell your customers that you care about them.

Arrange Interviews

‍
Interviewing someone that your audience likes are a great way to pique their interests. You can get questions from your audience that they would like to ask the interviewee.
If you interview a celebrity, you’ll be attracting his/her fans to your brand in a fun way. You can expand your brand’s reach substantially using this method.

Broadcast Live Events

‍
Another fun and impactful livestream idea is broadcasting live events. This can not only portray your brand as a recognized one but also expand your reach.

‍

Final Thoughts

‍
Livestreaming for the sake of shopping is great, but your audience needs a little bit more from you. You can offer them by coming up with fun livestream ideas.
The fun livestream ideas for brands discussed in this article shouldn’t be difficult to implement. You won’t probably need anything other than the usual livestream resources.
Plus, with these fun livestream ideas for brands, you’ll provide more value to your audience, strengthening your relationship with them.
Brands that focus on adding value more than selling end up selling more than their competitors.
If you think you are ready to offer fun livestreams to your audience, get started with Jumble.tv’s excellent livestream software now.

‍
post-summary: Livestream is a great way to keep prospects in touch with your brand. Plus, showcasing a product on livestream is always more effective than conventional eCommerce shopping. But, if you want to strengthen your relationship with your audience and stand out from the crowd, you need to offer something more than that. Come up with fun and creative ways to engage with your audience and form a more personal connection with them. This will eventually lead to more trust and, in turn, conversions, Let’s discuss some fun livestream ideas for brands.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: instagram accounts, style, follow, social media
meta-description: We’re rounding up a collection of our favourite fashion Instagram accounts – from size-inclusive fashionists to shoe designers and inspiration accounts.
meta-title: The 25 Most Stylish Instagram Accounts
name: The 25 Most Stylish Instagram Accounts You Need To Be Following
post-body:
Instagram is a form of art, inspiration, and escapism. We all love to take a scroll through our Instagram feed to see what’s trending in the world of fashion. On those little squares, we can see what our favourite influencers are wearing and get an insight into their lives. Its our favourite social media platform for following fashion influencers.

‍
We’re rounding up a collection of our favourite fashion Instagram accounts – from size-inclusive fashionists to shoe designers and inspiration accounts. These are the 25 Instagram profiles you should be following for your fashion and lifestyle inspiration.

‍

@lydiamillen

‍
Lydia is a digital content creator, based in the UK. She lives with her fellow influencer husband, Ali, and their pets. You can find her on YouTube and Instagram, with her content focusing on luxury pieces and classic European style. Her blog started as a hobby when she was doing her university dissertation before it became her fulltime job. You’ll find Lydia sharing her daily outfit ideas through creative reels. This British blogger frequently works with some of the biggest names in the fashion industry, including Dolce & Gabbana, Karen Millen, and Tiffany & Co.

‍

@kellyaugustine

‍
Kelly is who we want to be when we grow up. She’s a celebrity stylist and self-defined “vibe curator”. You’ll get everything from dating advice to food and travel inspiration, along with unbeatable celebrity styling. Kelly’s also a woman who isn’t afraid to tell you her opinion – and to wear a bold colour while doing it.

‍

@annarvitiello

‍
If you want Helmut Newton worthy photos with London styling and iconic vintage pieces, look no further than Anna. While she’s what we would consider a micro-influencer with less than 60k followers, her photos are Vogue worthy and show a unique editorial style. You can also catch Anna’s writing in Harper’s Bazaar UK.

‍

@itsmekellieb

‍
Kellie Brown is a size-inclusive fashion blog that you’ll find on everywhere from TikTok to YouTube and Instagram. She’s got the hashtag #fatatfashionweek and shows off her home décor at @aigdhome. Kellie’s also got a podcast coming soon, so keep your eyes peeled!

‍

@stephaniebroek

‍
If you want some serious hair inspiration, meet your new hair muse. Stephanie Broek is a fashion writer and consultant with 124k followers on Instagram. Her minimalistic style and modernist interiors will have you wanting to change your entire lifestyle. Follow her for perfect tailoring, monochrome looks, and elevated basics.

‍

@maryorton

‍
Mary is the big sister we always wanted. Her style is elegant and elevated, with a healthy mix of luxury and attainable fashion pieces. If you love to wear dresses, Mary’s Instagram will give you inspiration for any season. Her two daughters are already fashionistas. Mary takes her style inspiration from the royals, and vintage fashion, with a timeless elegance that is uniquely her own. If you’re a fan of classic interiors and home décor, you’ll be in for a treat!

‍

@greceghanem

‍
Learn about ageless style and how fashion knows no bounds from Grece Ghaem. You’ll have serious handbag envy from Grece, who works with everyone from Kate Spade to Loro Piana. She’ll give you next-level style inspiration and you’ll want to emulate her unique style of natural photograph.

‍

@aminamuaddi

‍
Are you even on the fashion side of Insta if you don’t follow the Queen of shoes? After several collaborations with Rihanna’s Fenty brand, Amina’s popularity shows no signs of slowing down. You can follow her personal Instagram account to see behind the scenes content of what it’s like to run a shoe brand. Amina’s fashion style is 80s Dynasty worthy, while being timeless and equally on-trend.

‍

@stephanieyeboah

‍
Another size inclusive blogger that we love to follow is Stephanie Yeboah. She’s the author of ‘Fattily Ever After’ and is a content creator and blogger. She’s a self-described body image and self-love activist, as well as being a freelance journalist. Stephanie will change the way you look at your fashion choices – and give you some major fashion inspo in the process.

‍

@carriebradshawsc

‍
This Instagram account is curated by @brunanardellib and has over 200k followers. If you’re a fan of the iconic Sex and the City, you’re probably already following this account. It’s a time capsule back in time to the early 2000s and has us all wanting to find our Mr. Big. Along with iconic TV show quotes and outfit inspo, you’ll find hundreds of photos of Manolo Blahnik shoes – the brand made famous by Carrie Bradshaw.

‍

@mariaxxd

‍
If you’re a fan of luxury fashion and want to stay up to date with the latest releases by Chanel and Louis Vuitton, Maria Draganova is a must-follow. This London based fashion blogger has a YouTube channel, where she uploads luxury fashion hauls and vlogs. Be prepared for some serious handbag envy.

‍

@carly

‍
When Carly started her blog, she was still in college. Now, she’s married and about to have her first baby. Her style is classic and preppy chic. Along with posting fashion content, Carly is a fan of needlepoint and reading, with two separate dedicated Instagram accounts for her hobbies. If your favourite colours are white and navy, you’ll be perfectly at home on Carly’s Instagram.

‍

@emshelx

‍
Another Instagram account worth following is Em Sheldon, a London based fashion blogger who also posts about travel, fitness, and beauty. She blends luxury and high street fashion, along with showing you the best food spots in London. We also love all the pictures of her four-legged furry friend. You can also find her on YouTube, where she uploads hauls and product reviews. Like other fashion bloggers, Em also offers her photo presets for sales (@emspresets) and has a dedicated Instagram account for her home (@emshelhome).

‍

@slipintostyle

‍
If you want to always stay up to date with the latest happenings at fashion week, Ellie is the person you need to be following. She regularly highlights black owned businesses and currently lives in Paris, France. Ellie’s also shared a ‘how to...like a parisian’ series on Instagram – teaching you how to avoid making the same mistakes as Emily in Paris.

‍

@sophiaroe

‍
Sophia is a Copenhagen based fashion blogger, who focuses on minimalistic clothing and a neutral-colour palette. You can expect to see plenty of vintage-inspired grayscale photos that reflect Sophia’s sharp editorial style. With over 417k followers, Sophia is one of the must-follow Instagrammers for anyone with a love for minimalism.

‍

@lonestarsouthern

‍
Kate is a preppy fashion blogger who frequently collaborates with small, independent designers to create capsule collections. Her style is simple and chic, with lots of pastels thrown in. If you want fashion inspiration that will work for any season, Kate is your new muse! You’ll see lots of Lily Pulitzer and Kate Spade on her profile, along with her adorable puppy.

‍

@claire_most

‍
If your style is more sporty than ladylike, Claire is your new fashion BFF. The Parisian now lives in Portland and uses her 73k strong following to promote social issues. As her bio reads, “use your voice and take action”. Her streetwear style is minimalistic with an athleisure feel. You’ll have plenty of food and travel posts to enjoy, with a sleek editorial style and minimalistic colour scheme.

‍

@missyanacherie

‍
For anyone who was one Tumblr back in the early days, you’ll recognise this Instagram account. Her Bergdorf Princess tumblr page saw her named the “Carrie Bradshaw of Tumblr” and “most reblogged user” by Daily Dot. The New York fashionista has brought most of her Tumblr following across to her Instagram, which has over 100k followers. If Blair Waldorf was on Instagram, this would be her account. Follow for designer handbag inspiration and the most impressive fashion focused coffee art you’ll see on the platform.

‍

@allieprovost

‍
Allie is a photographer and fashion blogger based in New York who personifies the idea of Kate Spade. She frequently collaborates with the brand and similar fashion houses. You’ll almost always see a flower in the back of her photos, which has a feminine pastel feel. If you love shoes – especially heels – you’re going to love Allie’s content.

‍

@sarahkjp

‍
Sarah’s Instagram bio says it all, “the photographic tale of New Englanders Sarah Patrick, her dashing husband @kjp, baby Harry and dog @bennieandmaple – documenting the American dream”. Sarah started out with a fashion blog ‘classy girls wear pearls’ and has over 570k followers. Her husband’s account doubles as the page for their preppy fashion brand – also named KJP – which has over 1m followers. Sarah’s photos are always perfectly on season, with a mixture of fashion and lifestyle posts. Trust us. You’ll be ready to up and move to New England after a trip to her Instagram page.

Who is your favourite fashion blogger to follow on Instagram? What do you look for when picking accounts to follow? Let us know in the comments below”

‍
post-summary:
Instagram is a form of art, inspiration, and escapism. We all love to take a scroll through our Instagram feed to see what’s trending in the world of fashion. On those little squares, we can see what our favourite influencers are wearing and get an insight into their lives. It's our favourite social media platform for following fashion influencers.
We’re rounding up a collection of our favourite fashion Instagram accounts – from size-inclusive fashionists to shoe designers and inspiration accounts. These are the 25 Instagram profiles you should be following for your fashion and lifestyle inspiration.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: sock, sandal, combo, pairing, style, fashion
meta-description: Sock and sandal combo is a popular choice for wearing with athleisure or while travelling. Socks and sandals can keep you comfortable and chic.
meta-title: Your Go-To Sock and Sandal Pairings
name: Your Go-To Sock and Sandal Pairings
post-body:
Wearing socks and sandals together has long divided the fashion community. When slides made their comeback in 2016, the internet was divided between two camps. Those that were pro ‘socks and slides’, against those who thought it was a fashion sin. Fast forward a few years – and the combo has become one of the biggest trends for spring/summer 2021. Why is this? You just have to look at the rise of ‘dad’ fashion, fuelled by Birkenstocks and Chanel sandals. While we once thought of this look as something your dad would wear on a foreign holiday, everyone from Kylie Jenner to Rihanna and Justin Bieber are rocking the trend.
You can think of the trend as ‘off-the-clock supermodel chic’ with an athleisure twist. This combo is a popular choice for wearing with athleisure or while travelling. If you’re heading to the airport, socks and sandals can keep you comfortable, whether you’re booked into business class or economy.

The secret to nailing the sock and sandal trend is to know how to mix and match them together. Pairing the wrong socks with your sandals can make you stick out like a sore thumb. This trend is one we plan on rocking all summer long. Our guide shares 8 simple sock and sandal pairings that you can easily recreate throughout the summer. Grab a pen and write down the sock styles that you’ll need to grab on your next shopping trip.
Do you need to grab a pair of sandals first? We have a dedicate guide to the sandals you need in your closet, including all the latest styles for spring/summer 2021. Whether you’re working from home or hitting the shops, these socks and sandal pairings can take you anywhere.

The Rise of Sock and Sandals

‍
What makes the sock and sandal trend so appealing is that you can personalise it to your aesthetic. There are no hard or fast rules that you have to stick to. In fact, you can usually mix and match pieces that are already in your closet. This trend is a way to update your look without breaking the bank. You can make the look preppy or give it a sporty twist depending on your combo of choice. This trend is one that anyone can jump on, whether you’re a busy stay-at-home mum or a college student cramping for their finals.
One thing you want to consider what this trend is that your socks are going to be on view just as much as your shoes. Make sure you have a fresh pair that doesn’t have any holes (it happens!) or look too dog-eared. If you think this trend is going to become a staple look for you, it’s a good idea to keep a few pairs strictly for wearing with your sandals for a sleek look.
You can wear this trend all year long. If you’re someone who loves sandals but hates the idea of cold feet or getting caught in a rainstorm, socks can help you wear your sandals 365 days a year. Even when the sun comes up, you can stick to your socks. After all, you might forget to give yourself a pedicure but still want to rock your new sandals.

Combo 1 – Comfortable Cotton Socks

‍
Wearing sandals can be uncomfortable for your feet. The strap can dig into your skin and might struggle to get a proper grip on the sole of your sandals. If this sounds like you, a pair of socks can make your sandals more comfortable. It’s worth investing in a pair of cotton socks that will make it feel like you’re walking on a cloud. If comfort is your aim, you can keep your sock-sandal combo simplistic with a pair of classic leather sandals with minimalistic hardware.
If you’re planning to walk for a long distance – especially in the sunlight – adding comfortable socks can make the experience easier on your feet and reduce any bad smells by absorbing the moisture and sweat from your feet.
This look is the perfect opportunity to add a little monogram to your look. The rise of this trend has led everyone from Gucci to Versace coming out with monogram socks. They’re a splurge purchase that you’ll want to save for days when you can show them after. Why would you break the bank with Gucci socks if you can’t put them in the spotlight?

Combo 2 – Add a Pop of Colour

‍
Not everyone wants to wear a bold pair of shoes. Black, white, and tan are the most popular colours for sandals of every style. If you’re looking to experiment with colours and give your look a quirky twist, you can take your minimalistic sandals and add a colourful sock. If you have white or black sandals, they’ll work with any colour.
To make a statement with your socks, you want to try and keep the rest of your look monochrome and within the same colour scheme as your sandals. You can let your socks take centre stage. If you want to give your closet a summer refresh, you can choose a trending colour like magenta purple or pastel pink for your socks.

Combo 3 – Platforms and Pink Socks

‍
Platform sandals are the perfect way to bring the sandal trend to your nightclub look. If you’re someone who has to have a few extra inches of height, platform sandals are your BFF. This silhouette gives the sandals a more feminine look, which is where the inspiration for our third pairing comes from. Don’t be afraid to embrace your inner girly-girl and pink socks to your look.
If you’re a fan of the cottagecore aesthetic – or have binge watched Netflix’s Bridgerton – you can swap these out for a pair of classic socks with a frill detailing. The frills will add a classic touch to balance out the platform in your sandals. If you choose socks with grills around the top, you can tuck your socks over the ankle strap of your platforms for a sleeker look.

Combo 4 – Sporty Spice

‍
The sandal and sock trend got its start thanks to the slides, which makes this combination one of the most recognisable on this list. You want to make it look like you’re heading to your yoga class or have just finished weightlifting. If you want to nail this look, choose sandals that feature velcro or a rubber sole. You can even choose a pair with a monogram twist if you want to give your look an athleisure feel.
The best socks to choose for a sporty look are the same style you would wear to the gym or with your everyday sneakers. Keep it simple with grey socks or your favourite pair of Nike socks. Don’t overthink the sporty combo. The more minimalistic, the better.

Combo 5 – Tie-Dye

‍
If there’s one trend we love to incorporate into every look, it’s the tie-dye trend. Most of us spent the start of the pandemic tie-dying everything we could get our hands on. If you’re looking for a budget friendly sock and sandal pairing, this is the one for you. Take an old pair of socks and follow a DIY tie-dye tutorial to give your socks a new look. You can keep it simple with a black and white monochrome or think outside the box with your favourite colours.
For tie-dye socks, you want to try and keep your sandals as simple as possible, so you don’t have a colour clash. Keep it classic with black or white sandals. If you want to show off your tie-dye socks, opt for a pair of open-back sandals to get the full effect of your tie-dye look.

Combo 6 – Sweet and Simple

‍
The beauty of this pairing is that it naturally elongates your legs and gives the illusions that your socks and sandals are an all-in-one shoe. You want to choose socks that are as close to the colour of your sandals as possible for this look. You can keep it simple with black socks and sandals or give it a summer-time twist with a pastel pairing.

Combo 7 – Subtle Shading

‍
If you’re not a fan of being too matchy-matchy, this pairing is the perfect alternative. Instead of choosing socks and sandals that are the exact same shade, you can add definition to your look by adding socks that are a few hues lighter or darker than your sandals. If your sandals are a more unique colour, it can save you searching high and low for an exact match.

Combo 8 – Experiment with Yellow

‍
White socks and sandals may look nice on your Instagram page, but it can be a nightmare when you’re out and about. If you’re worried about getting dirt on your sandals, swap out the pairing for a yellow duo. Sunshine yellow is one of the trending colours for spring/summer 2021, and it can add a softer aesthetic to your outfit. Your socks and sandals don’t have to be an exact match, and you can keep it simple with cotton socks.

‍
Which of these sock and sandal pairings are your favourite? Are you a fan of the trend? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Wearing socks and sandals together has long divided the fashion community. When slides made their comeback in 2016, the internet was divided between two camps. Those that were pro ‘socks and slides’, against those who thought it was a fashion sin. Fast forward a few years – and the combo has become one of the biggest trends for spring/summer 2021. Why is this? You just have to look at the rise of ‘dad’ fashion, fuelled by Birkenstocks and Chanel sandals. While we once thought of this look as something your dad would wear on a foreign holiday, everyone from Kylie Jenner to Rihanna and Justin Bieber are rocking the trend.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: livestream, equipment, camera, team, mic
meta-description: In this article, you’ll know about all the things you need for an engaging and impactful livestream. We’ll be discussing the equipment, software and strategy.
meta-title: All you need for a livesteam
name: Equipment you need for your livesteam show
post-body:
While going live has become so easy anyone with a phone can do it, doing livestreams for business is a different ball game altogether.
The steps involved in producing an engaging and effective livestream can be overwhelming.
Worry not though. In this article, you’ll know about all the things you need for an engaging and impactful livestream.
We’ll be discussing the equipment, software, platform, and strategy in this article. So, this article is all you need to read if you are thinking of using livestream to grow your business.  
Let’s get started.

A High-quality Camera

Although you can use a mobile camera to livestream on any platform, a high-quality dedicated camera is a better choice for businesses.
A camera is the most important part of your livestream. The visual quality of your stream gives the first impression to your viewers.  
You don’t want your audience to have a bad impression of your business, right?
For livestreams, the most common type of camera is a USB webcam that connects with your laptop/desktop.
If you can’t find a stable surface for the camera, a tripod stand will do the trick. Just make sure you get a webcam with at least 1080p resolution.

A Laptop

‍
You’d need a laptop that can deliver your livestream smoothly. Any modern laptop would suffice as livestreaming isn’t a highly intensive task.
However, it does require good RAM and a processor. So, make sure you get a laptop with at least 8 GB of RAM and an i7 processor. You’d also want to have maximum USB ports to connect other devices to your laptop.
If portability isn’t important to you, a desktop computer would be a great choice too. In fact, desktops are even better as they offer more USB ports; you can also improve their specifications later.

A Mic with Noise Reduction Capability

‍
The audio quality is another key element of a livestream. Without clear and crisp audio, most of your users will lose interest in what you have to say.
Find a mic with noise-reduction capability. You don’t want background noise causing distraction.  
You can get a good wireless mic as well if you want to move around in your livestream.

Audio Mixer

‍
An audio mixer will allow you to use multiple sound sources in your livestream. Plus, it lets you adjust the audio volume of multiple mics.
The key aspect to look for in an audio mixer is the number of audio inputs. Will you be livestreaming as a team? Or would you want to have guests join your livestreams?
Generally, look for an audio mixer that has multiple outputs and good audio adjustment features.
Also, look for the one that connects with a laptop via a USB port.

A Livestream Software

‍
The software is where all the magic happens. It puts you in front of your audience. Plus, it allows you to use transitions and overlays over your livestreams.
For instance, you can put your logo and other graphics over your livestreams.
The level of sophistication and professionalism you’d need as a business requires the use of professional livestream software.

A High-speed, Stable Internet Connection

‍
Internet is the medium that connects you with your prospects. And, interruption in livestreams is mostly because of unstable internet connections.
So, it’s important to have a high-bandwidth, stable internet connection to let things go according to plan.
Even better would be a wired internet connection. Wi-Fi connections are more prone to disruptions.
Make sure your internet is working smoothly before going live. Lastly, we recommend doing livestreams with a bandwidth between 3 and 5 Mbps speeds.
That was all about the equipment and software. Now comes the trickier part. Let’s see what you’d need for your livestream to be highly effective.

Engaging Content

‍
The content of your livestream is without a doubt the key to its success. As a business, you can’t just go live. You need a topic to talk about.
You’d need engaging content to keep the audience with you. Your content shouldn’t be boring. You don’t want to let your audience leave the livestream.  
So, deliver your message in an engaging and interesting way. Interact with your audience, encourage them to ask questions, and address them with patience.

A Helping Hand

‍
You don’t want to go live without a team member having your back. While you can make sure everything goes according to plan, livestreams tend to be unexpected.
You might need water during the livestream. You may run into a problem that you don’t know the solution to.
So, make sure to have a helping hand beside you so that you don’t get distracted from the livestream.

Video Management

‍
Many of your prospects may not end up watching a livestream. And, many may also want to watch it later.
Ask your viewers to drop their suggestions and questions in the comments section. Respond to their queries even after the livestream has ended.
With your livestream saved as an on-demand video, you’ll attract more viewers to your future livestreams.
So, keeping your livestreams as a video is also important. Consider keeping the recording on the platform and use a video editing tool to cut out any unnecessary parts.

Final Thoughts

‍
Delivering a livestream requires a few tools and strategies. You need the right equipment and software to make your livestreams impactful.  
Moreover, your content should be engaging and valuable for your target audience. Interact with them, encourage them to ask questions, and address them effectively.
Lastly, keeping your livestream as a video can multiply your viewers. Most of your target audience may miss your livestream. Keep it for the audience that may want to watch your livestream later.

‍

‍
post-summary: While going live has become so easy anyone with a phone can do it, doing livestreams for business is a different ball game altogether. The steps involved in producing an engaging and effective livestream can be overwhelming. Worry not though. In this article, you’ll know about all the things you need for an engaging and impactful livestream. We’ll be discussing the equipment, software, platform, and strategy in this article. So, this article is all you need to read if you are thinking of using livestream to grow your business.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: makeup, summer, trends, lips, lashes
meta-description: We’ve pulled together all the top trends for summer 2021, so you know which essentials to grab before the temperatures skyrocket.
meta-title: These Are the Summer 2021 Makeup Trends
name: These Are the Summer 2021 Makeup Trends Everyone Is Loving
post-body:
Summer is right around the corner. It’s time to give your makeup bag a refresh. Summer makeup is in a league of its own. Everything changes. Everyone is chasing the ideal of a ‘hot girl summer’, meaning that we all have to step up our makeup game. It’s time to dig around for your favourite bold lipstick, book in for a lash lift, and splurge on a new eyeshadow palette. With the end of lockdown coming just in time for summer, you can expect this summer to be unlike any other.
While this list focuses on makeup trends, you don’t want to forget about your skincare. During the summer, it’s more important than ever to be on top of your skincare routine. You need to protect your skin from sun damage, which means touching up your sunscreen throughout the day.
You can interpret these summer trends to meet your personal preference. Summer makeup tends to fall into two categories – natural and full glam. Some people prefer to go as minimalistic as possible to let their summer tan shine through and to avoid their makeup sweating. If you fall into this category, you want to focus on levelling up your skincare routine and focusing on lip stains and two-in-one products.
While glam is something you can wear all year round, this summer is different. After a year of barely wearing makeup, most of us are counting down the days until we can have an excuse to wear a full face of makeup. One thing you’ll want to consider if you’re going for full glam, is the reality of wearing a face mask.
Whether you’re a fan of natural makeup to avoid your makeup sweating in the sun, or if you’re going full glam, this guide is for you. We’ve pulled together all the top trends for summer 2021, so you know which essentials to grab before the temperatures skyrocket. You’ll want at least one of each of these staples in your summer makeup bag.

Signature Red Lipstick

‍
Is there anything more classic than a red lipstick? It’s a summer staple for nights on the town or first dates. You can give your red lipstick a tropical twist by choosing a shade with orange undertones. If you’re planning to wear your red lipstick under your face mask, make sure to set the lipstick with a translucent powder to avoid it smudging all over your mask.
If you’re a fan of long-wearing formulas, choose a liquid lipstick that can take you from day to night. You can jump on the natural beauty bandwagon and choose a lip stain for a ‘just kissed’ look.

Berry Blush

‍
We usually think of ballerina pink or a magenta shade as the go-to shade for summer. For summer 2021, it’s all about berry shades. With masks hiding the lower half of your face, you want to show off your cheeks and cheekbones with a deep blush. Look out for shades like rose, raspberry, or pinks with red undertones. Don’t be afraid about making it look too blended, as the berry blush trend comes from the 80s resurgence.
If you’re a fan of mixing and matching your makeup products, you can usually find 2-in-1 blush and lip stains. You can coordinate your lips and cheeks, while enjoyable a sheer and buildable colour for a custom finish.

Go Full Glam

‍
For most of 2020, our makeup bags sat gathering dust. With the world opening up again, it’s time to refine your makeup skills and experiment with full glam. While this will mean something different to each person, you want to make sure you’re paying attention to each of your features. Blended eyeshadow. Winged eyeliner. Glossy lips. Sculpted cheekbones. The list goes on.
During summer 2021, you can wear full glam makeup anywhere. One thing you’ll want to consider is whether you’ll have to wear a mask while you’re out-and-about. If you’re going to be wearing one, it’s a good idea to invest in a setting spray and translucent powder to prevent your makeup smudge. You’ll also want to keep a concealer or powder on hand for touch-ups.

Fluffy Soap Brows

‍
Again, you can thank the pandemic for this summer 2021 trend. While eyebrows naturally frame your face, they’re even more important when you’re going out and about with a face mask on.
You can prep your eyebrows for the season by booking in for a brow lamination or micro-pigmentation appointment to give you flawless brows all summer long. If you prefer to do your brows at home, keep a clear gel or a brow wax in your makeup bag for regular touch-ups. The soap brow trend shows no signs of slowing down, with brands now releasing their own custom brow soap to help tame and groom your stubborn eyebrow hairs.

Juicy Lips

‍
Do you remember the juicy lips of the early 2000s? Like all things from the era, they’re back with a bang. You can go back to Lancome for their OG Juicy Tube lip gloss. These glosses are a perfect alternative to liquid lipstick or bolder shades. You can use a clear or light pink gloss to help brighten your complexion and give your lips a dewy glow. Make sure to blot your gloss before putting on your mask!

Pastel Eyeshadows

‍
With all this mask wearing, the one area of your makeup where you can get inventive is your eyes. As your mask covers the lower half of your face, all eyes are on your top half. Don’t be afraid to experiment with eyeshadow shades and take a risk. Go outside your comfort zone this summer and pick up a pastel palette. Dior has focused their summer 2021 makeup collection on purple shades, with a flash of mellow yellow and champagne gold.

Hydration, Hydration, Hydration

‍
If there’s one thing that we’re committed to doing in summer 2021, it’s maintaining our skincare routine. You want to fill your makeup bag with hydrating products that will keep your skin protected from the sun and give you a dewy glow. When your skin is healthy and hydrated, you can opt for skin tints instead of foundation. Don’t forget your sunscreen and body lotion. If you’re planning on going ‘all natural’ this summer, you’ll want to shift your focus to hydrating products that will leave your skin looking plump and healthy.

Dramatic Eyeliner

‍
This summer, we’ve got a lot to catch up on. What is usually considered to be ‘winter’ eyeliner – smoky shadows and dramatic eyeliner – has found its way into the summer trends. It’s time to practice your cat-eye liner and perfect your waterline. If you want to give your eyeliner a fun summer twist, you can opt for a bold or pastel shade instead of a traditional black liner.
If you want to experiment with eyeliner without going too OTT, you can create a similar silhouette but with a thinner line. Eyeliner will add a sultry feel to your look and help widen your eyes. For days when you’re wearing eyeliner without shadow, add a touch of foundation or concealer to act as a base to prevent your liner from smudging.

Pretty in Pink

‍
The colour of the summer 2021 is pastel pink. In fact, it’s pastel pink everything. When it comes to makeup, you have fifty shades of pink to choose from. The best way of incorporating them into your makeup look is to choose different hues and finish. You might do a wash of a rose gold pink over your eyes, before adding ballerina pink to your cheeks. The lips will be the most noticeable pink shade – with a stain or liquid lipstick being your best friend.

Full Lashes

‍
Another eye-focused makeup trend for summer 2021 is your eyelashes. The longer the lashes, the better. Just like your eyebrows, you can choose to treat yourself to a treatment or opt for a budget-friendly at-home alternative. If you want to streamline your beauty routine, you can invest in eyelash extensions so that you always wake up with curled and voluminous lashes. When you’re in for your appointment, you can add-on a lash lift for extra definition. If you’d rather wear mascara, you can opt for just the lash lift by itself.
For anyone who isn’t comfortable with going into a salon just yet, you can purchase a lash serum to help your eyelashes lengthen and before thicker. If you’re not a serum fan, you can go back to the tried and tested eyelash curler to lift and lengthen your lashes.
If you like to stick to the basics, buy yourself a new voluminous mascara for the same effects. Everyone from Revlon to Charlotte Tilbury has recently released new mascaras, so you’re guaranteed to be able to find a well-performing one within your beauty budget.

‍
Which of the summer 2021 makeup trends is your favourite? Do you prefer natural or full glam makeup for summer? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is right around the corner. It’s time to give your makeup bag a refresh. Summer makeup is in a league of its own. Everything changes. Everyone is chasing the ideal of a ‘hot girl summer’, meaning that we all have to step up our makeup game. It’s time to dig around for your favourite bold lipstick, book in for a lash lift, and splurge on a new eyeshadow palette. With the end of lockdown coming just in time for summer, you can expect this summer to be unlike any other. While this list focuses on makeup trends, you don’t want to forget about your skincare. During the summer, it’s more important than ever to be on top of your skincare routine. You need to protect your skin from sun damage, which means touching up your sunscreen throughout the day.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: vintage leather, jacket, style, fashion, how to buy
meta-description: Before you head out and search for your perfect vintage leather jacket, we have a few styling tips that can help inspire your search.
meta-title: How To Wear a Vintage Leather Jacket
name: How To Wear a Vintage Leather Jacket
post-body:
Leather is like fine wine – it gets better with age. If you’re thinking of buying a leather jacket, you might be better of picking up one pre-loved. Not only will you save a few pennies, you’ll often get a nicer looking jacket out of it. If you’re planning on giving your closet an overhaul post-pandemic, a vintage leather jacket should be top of your list. Whatever your aesthetic is, you can incorporate this fashion staple into your closet. Before you head out and search for your perfect vintage leather jacket, we have a few styling tips that can help inspire your search. We’re also giving you some practical advice on how to find the perfect vintage jacket for you.

The Pros of Vintage Leather

‍
The fashion world is changing. More of us than ever are taking an interest in finding more sustainable alternatives for everyday materials. While leather is a durable fabric, it’s not the best choice for the environment. If you’re a vegan, it’s probably something you try to avoid altogether. Buying vintage leather can help solve a common problem most vegans face.
The majority of faux-leather jackets aren’t made to last, especially if they have a PVC coating. If you want the look of a leather jacket without harming the environment, you can purchase a vintage piece instead. By buying vintage, you save another animal from having to be killed for the leather, while also reducing the amount of clothing going to landfill. While vintage leather isn’t entirely cruelty-free it’s a more sustainable alternative than buying a brand-new leather jacket.
While cruelty-free ‘vegan’ leather jackets can be a little harder to come by, they’re still out there. You may need to dig a little more, but with patience and alerts on your favourite re-sale apps, you should be able to track one down that works for you and your style.

Where To Buy Vintage Leather Jackets

‍
You’re in luck! It’s never been easier to get your hands on a vintage jacket. Only a few years ago, you’d have to search through dozens of stores to find a vintage jacket that works for you. Thanks to the rise of re-sale platforms like Depop, you can find your dream vintage jacket from the comfort of your own home. You can also shop around and find the best deal to save you a little more in the process.
If you’re buying pre-loved, you want to do your research on popular leather jacket brands and understand what to look for in the leather. Not very leather jacket is perfect, and you might notice imperfections that suggest the jacket isn’t entirely leather. You want to make sure you’re not paying the price of a full leather jacket for a blended material.

Finding the Perfect Fit

‍
If you’re shopping online for a vintage leather jacket, it’s a good idea to take your measurements to find the perfect fit. Remember, the perfect fit for a leather jacket is oversized. Put on a chunky sweatshirt and then take your measurements, without holding the tape too close to your body.
A major selling point of the longer calf-length leather jacket is that it makes the perfect addition to your evening wardrobe. You can slip it on over a silk dress for a masculine twist. It’s the jacket you want to pack for your next vacation, when you don’t know if you’re going to end up at a trendy restaurant or sipping cocktails at a casino.

Don’t Forget About the Lining

One thing that is often overlooked when buying (and styling!) vintage leather jackets is the lining. Most older leather jackets have a cotton lining, instead of polyester. It’s this kind of lining that you want to keep an eye out for as it makes your leather jacket more breathable. If you intend to layer your vintage jacket over jumpers and thicker dresses, you want a thinner lining that won’t make you overheat.
If things like the lining are important to you, it’s worth grilling the store owner or online seller to see what they know about your jacket. The majority of independent sellers and stores will do their research before putting a leather jacket up for sale, and they’ll happily pass it on to you if it’ll make you more likely to purchase the item.

Here’s a few styles for you to keep an eye out for that are right on-trend.

The Condition of Your Vintage Leather Jacket

‍
While leather gets more beautiful with age, not everyone is easy on the material. A leather jacket might have some exciting stories to tell, but it could also be beyond repair. There’s a thin line between ‘aged’ and ‘damaged’. You want to avoid buying a jacket that has a crack in the leather, along some imperfections can be repaired. Most rips or flaws in the lining are easy to solve, or you can have the lining replaced entirely, depending on the fabric originally used.
Before you commit to buying your vintage jacket, you want to make sure it’s in a wearable condition. If you’re shopping in store, take the time to have an in-depth look at the jacket, including the pockets and zippers.
Before you set off in search of your leather jacket, you want to consider the type of leather used. If you’re in the market for the real deal, you’ll usually have to choose between full grain or lambskin. While full grain is durable and long-lasting, lambskin is soft to the touch, but more delicate.

Calf-Length Vintage Leather Jacket

‍
Don’t be afraid to experiment with a long calf-length vintage leather jacket. These are often some of the most versatile silhouettes. You can wear it with anything from dresses to jeans and a t-shirt. If you’re shopping around for one, try and buy one that is a size or more bigger than what you need to give you an oversized look. Your leather jacket should be big enough to comfortably fit a few layers underneath, including a sweater.
You can style a calf-length leather jacket as a wrap coat, cinching it in at the waist for a more feminine look. All you need is a pair of sneakers or loafers to finish off your look. This silhouette is a favourite amongst streetwear fans and can give you a more elevated look than a casual waist-length leather jacket.

Car Coat

‍
If you prefer a more masculine look, opt for the ‘car coat’ style. This silhouette is similar to a shorter trench coat, but with a leather finish. It’ll hit the same length as your miniskirts, making it a great choice for anyone who lives in shorts or miniskirts. You can wear this style of vintage jacket with everything from your favourite Dr Martens to dad sandals or loungewear.
When you’re shopping for this silhouette, don’t forget to check in the men’s section. This style is genderless and works for any look. The longer length gives you extra versatility and is an alternative to the calf-length if you tend to wear shorter clothes.

The ‘Shirt’ Jacket

‍
Not every vintage leather jacket looks like a jacket. One of the most popular styles from the 90s is the classic shirt jacket. It’s a button-up that looks just like your go-to shirts. You can wear it like a jacket over anything from a hoodie to a turtleneck. It’s a piece you can each for when you’re not sure what the day may bring. A shirt jacket is a must0have transitional piece that will see you from the first days of spring, right through to the dead of winter.
This vintage leather jacket is another genderless option, so you’ll want to make sure to check the menswear section while shopping for this style. For the added versatile, stick to a classic black colour. It’ll go with everything in your closet.

How to Style Any Vintage Leather Jacket

‍
A vintage leather jacket can be easier to style than you think.
You don’t have to have a closet full of pre-loved pieces to be able to wear every day. With the right accessories, you can take your leather jacket from day to night, as a casual or elevated piece.
One way to add definition to your look is by playing with textures. Add softer pieces, like a cotton shirt or a silk dress, underneath your jacket to make it pop. Denim and leather go hand-in-hand for a casual weekend look. While adding in another texture can help soften your look, you can still wear leather pieces. Dr Martens are the partner in crime for any vintage leather jacket.
Leather is one of the most versatile materials – you can add it to everything from a chiffon dress to a cashmere jumper. It may take some trial and error to find your perfect way of styling your new vintage jacket, but that’s half the fun!

‍
Do you own a vintage leather jacket? Is it on your shopping list? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Leather is like fine wine – it gets better with age. If you’re thinking of buying a leather jacket, you might be better of picking up one pre-loved. Not only will you save a few pennies, you’ll often get a nicer looking jacket out of it. If you’re planning on giving your closet an overhaul post-pandemic, a vintage leather jacket should be top of your list. Whatever your aesthetic is, you can incorporate this fashion staple into your closet. Before you head out and search for your perfect vintage leather jacket, we have a few styling tips that can help inspire your search. We’re also giving you some practical advice on how to find the perfect vintage jacket for you.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: slow fashion, trends, fashion, wardrobe
meta-description: In 2021, let’s make the commitment to wave goodbye to fast fashion. Slow fashion is a new trend and here we will explain how to adapt it.
meta-title: Six Slow Fashion Trends to Try In 2021
name: Six Slow Fashion Trends to Try In 2021
post-body:
In 2021, let’s make the commitment to wave goodbye to fast fashion. Over the last few years, we’ve all been making changes to our daily lives to help protect the planet and the world around us. One industry that is finally waking up to the role it’s playing with regards to climate change is the fashion industry. It’s an industry built on momentary trends and the need to consume more products at an ever-growing rate.

It’s not just the rate of our consumerism that is the issue, it’s how we make our clothing. Whether it’s the droughts caused by cotton harvesting or the chemicals dumped into water systems in developing countries, the danger of fast fashion is everywhere you look.

Evolution of Slow Fashion

Slow fashion is all about saying ‘no’ to ever evolving rends, and instead focusing on expanding the lifespan of our clothing You can think of it as prioritising quality over quantity. Instead of buying a $20 shirt from H&M that you’ll wear once, you can invest in a sustainably made $100 blouse from an eco-friendly brand that you can wear for years to come. Slow fashion is a smart investment, both for your bank balance and the planet.

With the evolution of ‘slow fashion’, your clothes can still look current and up to date without you having to jump on every momentary trend. Instead of focusing on pieces that are here one minute and gone the next, slow fashion focuses on staple pieces that define the era, rather than the moment. It takes the approach that clothing is an investment, rather than a folly that you can wear one day and throw away the next.

It’s taken longer than it should have, but the industry is finally turning its attention to the reality of climate change and the need for slow fashion. Embracing slow fashion doesn’t mean you have to turn your back on the industry. It doesn’t mean you have to give up your love of fashion. You can think of it as a reset.

If the pandemic taught us anything, it’s that we don’t need to live in a world dominated by trends that disappear in the blink of an eye. It served as an opportunity to refocus our minds and take stock of the situation within the industry. Without the constant runway shows and limited-edition releases, social media turned its attention to raising awareness of the environmental impact of fast fashion.

The Impact of the Pandemic

‍
As the world starts to return to normal, it is slowly resetting itself with a renewed focus on becoming more sustainable. The financial realities of the pandemic meant that designers went from creating four collections (or more) a year, to two. Smaller, independent designers had to turn to batch productions as a way to save their finances and continue to pay their staff as department stores placed smaller orders for stock.
This batch production radically reduced the waste produced by designers. If a department store ordered 60 dresses, exactly 60 were made. While this may have led to a small delay in you receiving your item, it is minimal compared to the benefits of this slower method of production.
One thing to note is that slow fashion still brings with it trends. Unlike fast fashion, these trends last for more than one season. These trends are designed to help you get the most out of the garment. Instead of wearing it a handful of times, you’re meant to wear it for at least a few years.
Slow fashion is about looking at the bigger picture, looking beyond just one or two seasons ahead of yourself. It’s defined by elevated basics that are still contemporary, but that you can wear for years without becoming dated.
If you want to create a slow fashion capsule closet, all you need is six pieces to see you through every season. These elevated basics are versatile pieces that you can mix and match with existing pieces in your closet or wear together.

An Elevated Blouse

‍
You want a blouse that is more elevated than a simple button-up. Instead of a blouse you would wear to work, you want one that you might wear for brunch with your girlfriends at the weekend. It’ll look different for everyone depending on your aesthetic. If you prefer a simpler feminine look, you might want a prairie collar with a puff-sleeve and three-quart length cut. If you’re someone who prefers a vintage-inspired look, you can choose a blouse with a silk finish and a jewel colour scheme. Emerald or ruby red are always glamorous choices.
An elevated blouse can be worn with anything from leather trousers at the weekend to jeans for a casual look or a pencil skirt to wear to the office. It’s worth having the blouse tailored to give you a more fitted silhouette.

Elegant Flat Shoes

‍
Unless you’re Carrie Bradshaw, you probably don’t need a closet full of shoes. While everyone loves a stiletto, it’s the flat show that is the most practical choice. For years, flat shoes have been outcast as being less fashionable, with trends focusing mainly on higher heels and platforms. If the pandemic has shown us anything, it’s that flat shoes are the most practical thing you can add to your closet.
Over the last year, we’ve all abandoned our high heels for sneakers, Birkenstocks, loafers, and ballet flats. Whatever your aesthetic is, there will be a flat shoe that works for your look. Choose a pair that you know you could dress either up or down, depending on the occasion.
When it comes to narrowing down your search, you want to choose a durable material like leather and a neutral colour palette, like earth-tones or a classic black shade. These shoes don’t have to come with a designer price tag, but you want to make sure they’re ones that can be easily repaired over time to give you a longer lifespan.

A Versatile Cardigan

‍
Cardigans are one fashion staple that is experiencing a resurgence. While you might think of them as something your grandmother might wear, celebrities like Harry Styles and Taylor Swift have brought them back into vogue once more. Thanks to aesthetics like cottagecore and the rise of vintage fashion, cardigans are once again a wardrobe staple – now with a younger demographic.
These cardigans look more like something you’d have expected Coco Chanel to wear, and less like the cardigans that make up a school uniform. If you’re adding one to your slow fashion closet, you want to focus on details that elevate your garment. Keep an eye out for elegant detailing on the button (like the interlocking CC on a Chanel button), embellishments, and functional pockets.
Don’t be afraid to pick up a smart cardigan in a pastel or a bold colour, as this can help add something different to your closet and soften your outfits.

The All-Day Dress

‍
Do you know what all the recent dress trends have had in common? They’ve been designed to see you through day to night with ease. Do you remember the midi dress trend that was everywhere before the pandemic hit? Or the shirt dress that everyon4e loved? These are classic examples of the 18-hour dress. It’s a silhouette that can take you from a day at the office to drinks with your friends, all with a quick change of your accessories.
Again, this is another slow fashion staple that will look different for each person. You want to consider your lifestyle and what works for you. Is it a dress you could see yourself wearing to grab coffee in? Could you wear it to a dinner out with your significant other? While this isn’t a dress that you’ll wear every day, you want to be able to identify situations where you know you could wear it. You also want to choose a length and material that you’ll be comfortable wearing for up to 18-hours in one go.

The Tan Handbag

‍
If there’s one handbag colour that will never go out of style, it’s the toffee-tan colour. This colour works for any occasion and is a softer alternative to a classic black handbag. It’s minimalistic and contemporary, while still giving you a glamorous look that has a vintage feel.
When you’re shopping around for your slow-fashion handbag, take the time to look for brands that use sustainable materials. Everything from plastic bottles to waste leather is being used to make handbags. If you’re a fan of vegan fashion, you can even choose cork as the material for your bag.

Sweatpants

‍
These are another post-pandemic addition. If there’s one piece of clothing that we’re all living in, it’s our sweatpants and loungewear. These pieces were already making a name for themselves thanks to the athleisure trend, but they’ve become an essential during the pandemic. A pair of minimalistic sweatpants can be styled with anything from an oversized sweater to a blazer and aviator sunglasses.
For your slow fashion closet, you want a style that is tailored but still comfortable, with a streamlined look and a fabric that can withstand a few years of wear.

‍
What do you think of slow fashion? Are there any pieces on this list that you’ll be adding to your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: In 2021, let’s make the commitment to wave goodbye to fast fashion. Over the last few years, we’ve all been making changes to our daily lives to help protect the planet and the world around us. One industry that is finally waking up to the role it’s playing with regards to climate change is the fashion industry. It’s an industry built on momentary trends and the need to consume more products at an ever-growing rate. It’s not just the rate of our consumerism that is the issue, it’s how we make our clothing. Whether it’s the droughts caused by cotton harvesting or the chemicals dumped into water systems in developing countries, the danger of fast fashion is everywhere you look.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: sandals, summer, trends, fashion, mule sandals
meta-description: We’re rounding up six of our favourite sandals for summer 2021. We’re also sharing some of our favourite styling tips. Everything you want to know about sandals
meta-title: Sandals You Need in Your Closet This Season
name: Sandals You Need in Your Closet This Season
post-body:
Summer is right around the corner. It’s time to dig into the back of your closet and find the sandals that have been gathering dust since last September. You can wave goodbye to your ankle boots and pre-pandemic heels. This summer is all about sandals. With the popularity of athleisure and activewear, its no surprise that sandals have become the ‘it’ shoe of the season for 2021. They’re the perfect alternative to sneakers if you want to shake up your summer closet. These shoes are the easiest to style during the summer and deserve a spot at the front of your closet.
With sandals, you can go from a day at the beach to cocktails with your friends at a downtown bar. As we say hello to the new ‘normal’ and life starts to resume after the pandemic, your sandals are the perfect choice of footwear to see you through your coffee catchups and socially distanced walks. As the ‘it’ shoe for summer 2021, you’re spoilt for choice with every designer and brand bringing out their version of these classic shoes.
We’re rounding up six of our favourite sandals for summer 2021. If you see these styles in stock, it’s an instant ‘add to cart’. We’re also sharing some of our favourite styling tips, so you can get an idea of how to incorporate these shoes into your summer closet.

Chanel Dad Sandals

‍
When Chanel came out with their now infamous ‘Dad’ sandals, the fashion world raised an eyebrow. Like anything with the Chanel logo, it’s quickly become a classic. These sandals are almost impossible to come across in store. If you’re thinking of making a splurge purchase for the comfiest – and quirkiest – designer sandals, these Chanel shoes will be right up your street.
If you pick up a pair with the ‘Chanel’ name across the front strap, they’ll add a little streetwear twist to any summer outfit. Chanel recently came out with a nautical themed rope-inspired espadrille version, which gives the shoes an extra dose of summer charm. We’ll be wearing them with our favourite smock dresses and dressing them up with a short and blazer combo for drinks.

Fisherman’s Sandals

‍
If you want comfort without compromising on style, fisherman’s sandals are your summer BFF. These shoes are a staple for brands like Church’s. If you’re looking to invest (and want extra comfort!) try to pick this style up in leather. The leather will naturally mould to your feet and help you stay walking for hours during the summer. If you want to save your pennies, you can find this style from popular high street brands like Zara and H&M. They’re the grown-up version of the jelly sandals that every 90s kid had.

Solid Flip Flops

‍
Okay, here us out. While these shoes are often thought of as what you wear after a manicure to keep your polish smudge-free, they’re full of 2000s nostalgia. Whether you’re jumping on the Y2K trend or not, these shoes are a style you want to have in your closet. They’re easy to throw into your backpack to take with you on the go. If you’re hitting the beach this summer, you’ll want at least one pair in your beach bag.
What makes fit flops a better choice is that they have a higher sole and are less likely to break on you. You can give your outfit a touch of 2000s nostalgia without worrying about breaking the tongue of the shoe.
While the chunky flip flop trend was resurrected by The Row, you can find this style almost anywhere. For a classic look, try to stick to black as your colour of choice. Don’t forget to book yourself in for a pedicure before slipping your feet into a pair of these flip flops. Once the temperatures skyrocket, you’ll be glad that you have these shoes in your closet.

Birkenstock

‍
Almost all the summer 2021 sandal trends are casual ‘dad’ shoes. The OG style – the classic Birkenstock – is still going strong for this summer. If you didn’t pick up a pair at the start of the pandemic, now is your time! These shoes will never be off your feet during the summer. You can wear them with anything from loungewear while grabbing your morning coffee to an elevated party outfit with a high-slit skirt and blouse.
These shoes are a must-have for anyone who is creating a capsule summer closet. They’re top of our packing list for any summer vacation. Black is a sandal colour that can do no wrong, but don’t be afraid to think outside the box. The popularity of the Birkenstock style means you can pick one up in almost every colour. The OG Birkenstock is a similar style to the Chanel ‘dad’ sandals, with the key difference being their open back.
If you don’t want to splurge on a pair of Chanel sandals, the Birkenstock is just as iconic and timeless. This shoe has earnt its place on the ‘must have sandals’ list for the rest of eternity. Birkenstocks come in a few different materials, whether you like a leather sole or an eco-friendlier alternative. You can even pick up a pair with suede lining if you want extra comfort. If you don’t want to invest in Birkenstocks, you can find dupes for these shoes in almost every clothing store.
Trust us. Birkenstocks are one of the most versatile shoes you can add to your closet.

Sparkly Sandals

‍
The sandals on our must-have list for summer 2021 have all been fairly casual so far. With the world reopening again, it’s time to add a little sparkle into your life. If you plan on hitting the night clubs or have a special occasion coming up, sparkly sandals are the perfect summer choice. If there’s one brand that dominates the luxury sandal scene, it’s Amina Muaddi. The designer’s popularity has skyrocketed thanks to collaborations with Rihanna’s Fenty brand.
If you happen to strike gold and find a pair of Amina Muaddi summer sandals, pull out your credit card and run them to the check out. These shoes have been an instant sell-out, with influencers and celebrities alike being photographed in the sparkly gladiator-inspired summer sandals.
The sparkly straps will show off your fresh summer tan – as well as your manicure – while elongating your legs. You can wear to a summer wedding with a midi dress or revisit your favourite restaurant in a little black dress. Let these stunning shoes take centre stage with your outfit.

Mule Slides

‍
After jumping on the fashion scene in 2016, the slides have gone from a gym staple to a fashion classic. Gucci was one of the first designer brands to bring the simple slide into the mainstream. The Italian fashion house has given their slides an upgrade for summer 2021 by creating a mule slide. The mules are another staple in the Gucci catalogue, so it’s no surprise that the brand has brought two of their bestselling styles together.
What we love about these shoes is their minimalism. You can pick them up in every colour of the rainbow, from simple white to periwinkle blue or barbie pink. Another bonus? These are some of the most affordable (or attainable!) shoes from the Gucci brand. As they’re made using rubber, these shoes are around half the price of a pair of Gucci sneakers or flats. If you want to buy your first pair of designer summer shoes, these are the perfect choice.
The subtle Gucci logo makes them easy to style. We’ll be wearing them along the seafront with an oversized shirt dress and our favourite aviator sunglasses. These are another pair of shoes that you’ll want to invest in a pedicure for.
We’re expecting to see these shoes everywhere this summer – on both celebrities and influencers alike. They’re already all over Instagram, so we expect them to become the must-have shoe for summer 2021. Run, don’t walk, to grab these shoes before they sell out.
What to Consider When Buying Summer Sandals
Summer sandals take a little more thought than your average everyday shoes. Our feet go through a lot during the summer. If you’re planning on wearing your sandals all day, you want a style that will absorb sweat and moisture to prevent odour gathering in your shoes. No one likes the smell of feet.
If you can, it’s usually best to buy sandals in person as the size can vary. You might find that you have to go down half a size for a comfortable fit. If you’re buying sandals online, take a few extra seconds to double-check the recommended sizing before you checkout.
The material can make or break the wearability of your summer sandals. While the rubber Gucci slides are iconic, you won’t want to be caught in an unexpected rainstorm in them. If you’re not sure what the weather is going to bring, leather sandals are a tried-and-tested style that will see you through anything.
Which sandals are you buying this summer? Do you have a favourite style or are you re-wearing a classic from your closet? Let us know in the comments below!

‍
post-summary: Summer is right around the corner. It’s time to dig into the back of your closet and find the sandals that have been gathering dust since last September. You can wave goodbye to your ankle boots and pre-pandemic heels. This summer is all about sandals. With the popularity of athleisure and activewear, its no surprise that sandals have become the ‘it’ shoe of the season for 2021. They’re the perfect alternative to sneakers if you want to shake up your summer closet. These shoes are the easiest to style during the summer and deserve a spot at the front of your closet.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: livestream, brand, selling, host, promo, livestream show
meta-description: In this article, we’ll be discussing how you can start livestream selling as a brand. Let’s get into the details.
meta-title: How to Start Livestream Selling ?
name: How to Start Livestream Selling ?
post-body:
If you are a brand, realize the importance of livestream selling, and want to get started, this article is for you.
The fact that eCommerce giants have started their livestream selling platforms tells us that the trend is heading upwards.
Brands can use the power of live video to get more customers and increase the lifetime value of the existing ones.
So, if you haven’t jumped on the bandwagon of livestream selling yet, now would be the time.
In this article, we’ll be discussing how you can start livestream selling as a brand.
Let’s get into the details.

Why is Livestream Important for Your Brand?‍

‍Video marketing is probably the most effective form of marketing as you can better deliver your brand message to your audience with it.
Plus, it’s engaging and easy to consume. Livestreams are even more engaging and let you communicate with the target customer effectively.
And, because livestreaming enables the host to bond with the audience, it improves the brand loyalty and customer base.
Moreover, it’s easier to go live than craft an advertisement video for your products. And, with eCommerce giants doing livestream selling effectively, it’s about time you get in on the action as well.
Let’s see how you can leverage livestreaming to sell as a brand.

How to Start Livestream Selling as a Brand?

‍
There isn’t much that you’d need to start a livestream for your brand. You’ll need the equipment that you can rely on, a suitable host, and strategies that can bring you conversions.

Promote Your Livestream

‍
One of the first things you need to focus on is promoting your livestream on different platforms so that more prospects can join in.
If you have a social media audience, tell them when you’re going live and schedule your livestream.  
You can also open registrations and collect emails from people that are genuinely interested in watching your livestreams.
Send a reminder to them just before going live.
An effective way to get the right people to register is through social media ads. Facebook ads platform allows brands to focus their ads on a specific group of people with specific traits and demographics.

You can create a Facebook opt-in form and put it in front of a specific demographic. This way, you not only get them to sign up for your livestream, but you also get more leads for your business.

Create a Content Plan

‍
While livestreams don’t require you to be stiff with content, you still need to plan your content to make it impactful.
Assign a topic to your livestream and stick to it. Your livestreams should be engaging, lively, and not boring. Otherwise, you might lose the hard-earned viewers in no time.
Moreover, have a question-and-answer session at the end of the livestreams to let prospects interact with the host.
Live interaction will help your audience understand your products better, improving the chance of their conversion.

Use the Right Equipment and Software

‍
Your livestream tools play a vital role in making it effective. The video and audio quality should be up-to-the-mark to keep the audience hooked.
After all, it’s your brand’s reputation that’s at stake. You don’t want your first impression to be a bad one.
Use a high-quality mic, camera, laptop, and other equipment to make sure everything goes professionally.
There are software that can help you do livestreams without hassle.
Using reliable and effective livestream software like Jumble.tv, you can overlay branding graphics and have full control over your brand representation.

Find the Right Host

‍
If you don’t intend to get in front of the camera, you’d have to hunt for the right host or influencer for your livestreams.
Finding a host is easy but landing on the right one can be a little tricky.
You want the host to interact with the audience and present your products in a lively and engaging way.
Ask the audience if they have any questions about the products and address them effectively. Showing the products in action can also make the buying decision of the audience easier.
If you are using an already-established influencer in your industry, you’ll be able to leverage their audience.
Social media users tend to trust the people they follow. So, micro-influencers are a great way of attracting the right audience to your livestreams and generate sales as a brand.

Leverage FOMO (Fear of missing out)

‍
As a brand that wants to attract sales, you can use the power of FOMO. Offer something only until the end of the livestream.  
If your offer is attractive enough, prospects will want to claim it right there and then.

Analyze Your Performance and Keep Improving

‍
You can devise a perfect strategy, but there will always be room for improvement. So, it’s important to have a critical eye on your progress as a brand.
Analyze your strategies, identify the loopholes, and don’t hesitate to make necessary tweaks.
Your livestream engagement rate, conversions, viewer count growth, and rate of return (ROI) are important metrics to look out for.
Even better, ask your audience if they want anything extra from your livestreams. Answer their questions even after the livestream has ended.
Some of them may not be able to join the livestream or prefer watching it as a video. Keep your livestreams as videos and try to interact with the comments as much as you can.

Final Thoughts

‍
As eCommerce expands, businesses are coming up with new and effective ways to sell their products online.
Livestream shopping is one of those impactful ways brands can connect with their audiences and build awareness.
It’s more intimate and allows you to better present your products. Prospects can interact with the host and get their queries addressed.
This enables you to provide the necessary peace of mind that your potential customers might need before going through with a purchase.
If you are thinking about starting a livestream to increase brand awareness and sales, Jumble.tv is the platform for you.
With Jumble’s livestream software, you’ll just have to focus on creating effective content. The rest will be taken care of by the platform.

‍
