author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: hair, hair color, trend, red hair
meta-description: After the popularity of the Queen’s Gambit the redhead trend has reached new heights. So what is the most popular hair colour of 2021? Discover here
meta-title: The Most Popular Hair Colour of 2021
name: The Most Popular Hair Colour of 2021
post-body:
The redhead trend has been slowly gaining popularity in recent years. It started with Sophie Turner’s character, Sansa Stark, on Game of Thrones. Her luscious red wig had us all wanting to channel our inner Queen of the North by going copper red. After the popularity of the Queen’s Gambit, Netflix’s latest hit tv series, the trend has reached new heights. Although Anya Taylor Joy is a natural bleach blonde, the actress had a short red bob for her critically acclaimed role. We’re calling it now – copper red is the hair colour of 2021.

‍

‍

Copper red comes in several hues, especially as the colour loses its vibrancy whether you get from a bottle or if you’re naturally blessed with the shade. Everyone from Lizzo to Zendaya and Emma Roberts have experimented with the warm red shade. Some celebrities have used it as their signature throughout their career, like Isla Fisher who is a proud redhead and whose auburn locks has been a source of inspiration for us all.

The beauty of this hair colour is that it works for any shape or length of hair. You can take a lead from Rihanna’s book and go with long curls inspired by Sansa Stark or stick of Anya Taylor Joy’s sharp bun. If you want a natural redhead to look to for inspiration, give Angela Scanlon a follow on Instagram.

‍

How To Care for Copper Red Hair

If you decide to try out this colour, there’s a few things you’ll want to keep in mind. As the colour starts to fade over time, you want to make sure to keep your hair moisturised with a hydrating mask as part of your regular haircare routine. Depending on the fragility of your hair, you want to be using a hair mask once or twice a week after washing your hair.

When you dye your hair any colour, whether you do it yourself or visit a salon, you want to change up your shampooing routine. It’s worth investing a colour-protecting shampoo to help maintain the brightness of your colour and to improve the longevity of your dye. Along with a new shampoo, you’ll want to make sure you’re conditioning your hair every time you wash it. Once you start dying your hair, you need to take extra care to maintain the condition of your hair and to prevent damage to the hair follicles that you result in breakages.


Not Sure if You Want to Commit?

In recent months, we’re seeing more haircare brands releasing wash-out hair colours. These products allow you to experiment with a new colour without committing to the shade permanently. Affordable brands like Revolution London have a full spectrum of colours for you to choose from. The final weeks of working from home are the perfect time to experiment with your hair colour. If you fall in love with this copper red, you can visit your hairstylist and make it a permanent change. Trust us, it’s going to be the ‘it’ colour of 2021.

What do you think of the copper red hair colour? Is it something you would try? Are you planning to dye your hair in 2021?
post-summary: The redhead trend has been slowly gaining popularity in recent years. It started with Sophie Turner’s character, Sansa Stark, on Game of Thrones. Her luscious red wig had us all wanting to channel our inner Queen of the North by going copper red. After the popularity of the Queen’s Gambit, Netflix’s latest hit tv series, the trend has reached new heights.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: micro-blogger, marketing, livestream shopping, targeted marketing
meta-description: Micro-bloggers have an audience that has more trust in them than the more famous stars of social media. But It's not the only reason why brands chose mini-stars
meta-title: Why brands are switching to micro-bloggers
name: Why brands are switching to micro-bloggers for marketing
post-body:
In the age of internet fame, sharing your life as a profession, marketing has been blooming more than ever. Brands have been competing for the attention of the audience of stars like the Kardashians, soon only to realize the expansion of opportunities with the presence of mini-stars, micro-bloggers, who’s much smaller audience does not lack in support or devotion. Their support in a product has shown to bring much higher conversion rates than the celebrities, while having higher engagement rates. How does this relate to brands marketing strategy innovation and its use for Live Stream selling?


Mini-stars with 50-100 thousand followers have an audience that has more trust in them than the more famous stars of social media. Instagram has been a powerful tool to create an audience for those posting their life and identity in a stylish way. It is observable that the ones who have become giants of Instagram have a less unique approach to their online presence, maybe due to their name becoming a brand in itself and using it mostly for personal gains.  The ones with a smaller audience have more transparency with their likes and experiences, thus are more authentic. This creates a deeper sense of familiarity for their followers, whose trust grows with each post. Being more relatable and viewed as more ‘common’ by their followers, those in return are more interested in what they recommend to buy. 


It is not just about making your advertisement or product be seen, it is about conveying your brand identity directly to the hearts of your audience. Less about the visual effect, the internet and TV is already full of advertisements screaming you are missing out on the best thing there is. Having the unprejudiced attention of the audience is priceless. Having someone who is viewed as a peer or a friend talk about their experience of your product is different to having someone who does it on a daily basis and the fans are already used to the concept of them making a business out of it. 


This goes perfectly with Livestream Shopping selling and your brand choosing the perfect host for your presentation. Targeted marketing through micro-bloggers acting as hosts will bring you a much more lively audience and you are more likely to have their attention for the whole stream. You can target the audiences more efficiently, adding to the intimacy and trust created by going live already. It will be a more unique event, bringing the audience and your brand closer through this third party that brings realness and life to the table. At better costs, you will have more engagement and conversion rates. You can switch up the hosts you choose, opening up to a whole new level of opportunities by maybe making them shorter, but more often. The viewers will want to act on those discounts and excitement spread by someone they see as a peer. Seeing a down to earth human that they relate to so much, they will almost automatically believe in your products presented. The critique will be honest, not just paid for. Thus, less resistance to skip onto the next opportunity out there.
post-summary: n the age of internet fame, sharing your life as a profession, marketing has been blooming more than ever. Brands have been competing for the attention of the audience of stars like the Kardashians, soon only to realize the expansion of opportunities with the presence of mini-stars, micro-bloggers, who’s much smaller audience does not lack in support or devotion. Their support in a product has shown to bring much higher conversion rates than the celebrities, while having higher engagement rates. How does this relate to brands marketing strategy innovation and its use for Live Stream selling?

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: sunglasses, fashion, style, aviators
meta-description: Spring and summer are right around the corner, making it the perfect time to invest in some new sunglasses. Discover the newest sunglass trends.
meta-title: Our Ultimate Guide For Sunglasses
name: Our Ultimate Guide For Sunglasses
post-body:
Spring and summer are right around the corner, making it the perfect time to invest in some new sunglasses. They’re a wardrobe essential that you can wear all year round and they can become part of your signature look. Sunglasses have a way of adding an air of mystery to your look. People will stop and look at you twice. Are you a celebrity? Are you an off-duty model? When it comes to buying sunglasses, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the different options on the market. We’re rounding up the most popular styles that you need to have in your sunglasses collection.

Aviators Sunglasses

These classic sunglasses started their life as protective glasses for test pilots in the U.S. Military. Now the style is synonymous with celebrities like Gigi Hadid. These sunglasses can add a masculine twist to any outfit. These sunglasses will never go out of style, making them the perfect investment. Current aviator trends focus on tinted and chrome lenses that make a statement, which can help make these frames a little more feminine, if that’s your preference. You can pretend you’re a test pilot or an off-duty military officer with these sunglasses.

Cat-Eye Sunglasses

One of the most sophisticated styles of sunglasses are the cat eye. If you look at a photo of celebrities from the 60s and 70s, you’re guaranteed to see them wearing a pair of cat eye sunglasses. This style can elevate any look with their wing-shaped frames. Your cat-eye sunglasses will add an air of refinement to any outfit. Look at brands like Celine and Saint-Laurent for classic cat-eye sunglasses that will never go.

‍

Oversized Sunglasses

Chanel your inner Victoria Beckham or Jackie Kennedy with a pair of oversized sunglasses. These sunglasses are designed to cover as much of your face as possible, at least your eyes and brows. These frames add glamour to any look and can elevate even a pair of jeans and a t-shirt.‍

90s Inspired Sunglasses

Take a leaf out of the 90s fashion era with a pair of narrow sunglasses. These streamlined frames make a bold statement and are the perfect alternative to cat-eye or oversized sunglasses if you have a smaller face shape. Most of the sunglasses in this style have a minimalistic frame, usually with tonal accents and laser cuts that give these glasses a tailored feel. Le Specs is the perfect sunglasses brand to check out for a 90s inspired silhouette.

Retro Sunglasses

The 90s aren’t the only era making a comeback with sunglasses. Embrace your inner 70s socialite with a pair of round frames, ideally with some gold-tinted lenses. You could look even further back in the history books and choose a pair of tortoiseshell frames to give your outfit a vintage feel. These retro sunglasses will work with any outfit and can help you stand out from the ground with elegant frames.

Which sunglasses are your favourite? Are you planning to invest in sunglasses are your new accessory for the season?‍
post-summary:
Spring and summer are right around the corner, making it the perfect time to invest in some new sunglasses. They’re a wardrobe essential that you can wear all year round and they can become part of your signature look.
When it comes to buying sunglasses, it’s easy to feel overwhelmed by the different options on the market. We’re rounding up the most popular styles that you need to have in your sunglasses collection.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: selfies, trends ,social
meta-description: Taking the perfect selfie has become an art form. We spend our lives online and our selfies have become our virtual selves. Learn how our selfies have changed.
meta-title: How Our Selfies Have Changed
name: How Our Selfies Have Changed
post-body:
In the words of Ru Paul, “if you can’t love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?”. It’s safe to say that you could get away with calling our society self-obsessed. With the rise in technological advances and the age of social media, more of us have taken to sharing our lives online with total strangers. It started simple enough with selfies of ourselves our with our friends. Over the last few years, sharing your life online has become a profitable way of ranking in millions of dollars. We’ re each creating a digital footprint, like a time capsule of our lives, becoming more open with each change in social media.

‍

‍

Taking the perfect selfie has become an art form. We all know the way to turn our head to hide a double chin or to give us Angelina Jolie worthy cheekbones. We each have a favourite filter that we automatically apply to our photos. We’re editing our selfies to within an inch of their lives. Gone are the days when you took a selfie before a big event – now we take them everywhere. Museums have even had to put a ban on selfie-taking due to the disruption they’ve caused and almost every public institution and theme park has banned the infamous selfie stick.

Ever since the magazines started to photoshop their cover models, our days of self-declared perfectionisms were ahead of us. Fast forward thirty years and you can download photoshop directly to your iPhone and do the same amount of editing as any magazine photographer to your selfie. We all know someone who looks drastically different on their Instagram feed compared to how they look in real life.

Before we were calling them selfies, we have the MySpace pictures. These came around in the mid to late 2000s, when MySpace was at its height and we were all taking photos on the crappy cameras of our flip phones to post as our profile picture. When smartphones made their way into the mainstream in the early 2000s, we started to up our selfie game.

After all, the camera that is now in our smartphones is of a similar quality to professional DSLR cameras. Fast forward a few years, and the age of influencers came around in the early 2010s, when selfies became monetised. The right influencer could (and certainly does) charge thousands of dollars to post a selfie of them wearing or mentioning a product by a brand. Who would have thought the wholesome selfie to capture a moment in time would become the new form of advertising?

Within a few years, the age of filters was upon us. These filters could allow you to change your look at the swipe of your phone screen. Whether you wanted to see what you might look like at 60 years older if you wanted to add bunny ears, these filters continue to get more advance.  

We spend our lives online and our selfies have become our virtual selves. Gone are the days when a selfie was for your close friend and family, now it’s a reflection of how you want yourself seen by the world.

What do you think about the evolution of the selfie? Do you think we’re going to become even more obsessed with filter and editing our photos?
post-summary: With the rise in technological advances and the age of social media, more of us have taken to sharing our lives online with total strangers. It started simple enough with selfies of ourselves our with our friends. Over the last few years, sharing your life online has become a profitable way of ranking in millions of dollars. We’re each creating a digital footprint, like a time capsule of our lives, becoming more open with each change in social media.

author: 60740f23ed8dc65637d65f83
keywords: trends, fashion, dress, spring, shopping
meta-description: Dress trends change every year, with spring being everyone’s favourite time to add a few to their closet. We’re rounding up some of our favourite dress trends.
meta-title: The dress trends you need to know this spring
name: The dress trends you need to know this spring
post-body:
Once the temperatures start to rise and we get the first taste of spring, we all head straight to the back of our closets to grab our favourite dresses. After the last year of living through a global pandemic and wearing nothing but loungewear, we’re all ready to get back into some spring dresses. We think it’s time we all treated ourselves to a few new dresses to celebrate the spring and the light at the end of the pandemic tunnel. 

Dress trends change every year, with spring being everyone’s favourite time to add a few to their closet. We’re rounding up some of our favourite dress trends for spring 2021 that you’ll want to start wearing ASAP.

Feminine Puff Sleeve

Thanks to Netflix’s Bridgerton, we all want to channel our inner English socialite and run around in a dress with puff sleeves. These dresses come in every shape and form, whether you want something wearable for everyday or with a seductive twist. Puff sleeves are the perfect way to welcome spring and give you just enough drama while still being a minimalistic and timeless silhouette. If you want to embrace your inner Duchess, look for a puff sleeve midi-length dress to add to your spring closet.

Little Black Dress

Is there anything more classic than a little black dress? We’re all dying for the day that we can throw our loungewear out and slip back into a little black dress. This trend is one of the most versatile that you can add to your closet. The right styling can take your little black dress seamlessly from day to night. Add a pair of white sneakers for a brunch date with your girlfriends or step into a pair of stilettoes when you want to make an impression.

All Over Print

Dresses are the perfect way to make a bold statement with your outfit. If you’re confident about mixing and matching prints, you can jump on the trend with a simple one print dress. Choose a print that sparks joy into your day and that shows your personality. With an all over print dress, you can really wear your heart on your sleeves. If a printed dress catches your eye and makes your heart flutter, buy it!

Pink Dress

You don’t need to be Elle Woods to appreciate the beauty of a pink dress. Pink is one of the defining colours of 2021 and you can expect to see everyone and their mother wearing it during 2021. If you’ve never had the colour pink in your wardrobe before, a dress is the perfect way to start experimenting with the shade. There are dozens of pink hues and shades for you to choose from, whether you’re a fan of ballerina pink or a magnetic colour. For any everyday look, keep an eye out for oversized t-shirt dresses and mini dresses with puff sleeves. Pink dresses are the perfect way to kill two birds with one stone by blending two trends together.

‍

Which of these four spring dress trends is your favourite? Will you be wearing any of them this spring?

‍

‍
post-summary: Once the temperatures start to rise and we get the first taste of spring, we all head straight to the back of our closets to grab our favourite dresses. After the last year of living through a global pandemic and wearing nothing but loungewear, we’re all ready to get back into some spring dresses. We think it’s time we all treated ourselves to a few new dresses to celebrate the spring and the light at the end of the pandemic tunnel.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: camera, microphone, lighting, people, equipment, livestream
meta-description: Live streaming takes less preparation than filming a professional advertisement. Using a phone with a good camera quality will allow you to stream directly.
meta-title: What you will need for a livestream show
name: What you will need for a livestream
post-body:
-cameras, microphone, lighting, people 

-where to look, how to act

Although live streaming takes less much preparation than filming a professional advertisement which means coming up with a catchy concept idea, professional equipment and a lot of spendings, it is still a good idea to take in consideration that the quality of experience you create for the viewers, will affect the length of them staying to watch it, hence having the opportunity to sell out your products. There host will have to improvise most of the communication and just be himself like you would on a typical social media live, you can ensure it will run smoothly by taking in mind and controlling the following factors:

Equipment and setting-up

Using a phone with a good camera quality will allow you to stream directly from the streaming platform like Jumble. You will need to make sure it’s positioning grabs a good angle that will allow you to move around within it, or put it into a stabilizing tripod/selfie-stick. There are many you can find with a microphone and a torch light. This will give you the ability to take the audience with you around the studio, boutique or wherever you will be going, creating even more excitement for them. It is important to consider that if you go to noisier places, you will need a good microphone that filters out the noise for audio experience optimization. Streaming really requires much less hustle with equipment preparation in comparison to a typical advertisement. 

Be sure to check you are streaming from a place with good internet connection or service right before the live. Although the live might not stop, technical errors are annoying for the viewers. If you are going to be moving around, you need to consider this beforehand.

You want to consider when your target audience is most active and what sort of experience would they enjoy. If it is late at night, consider that they will be at home, and a sense of familiarity and casualness will bring a lot of comfort. You don’t want to put them asleep though, so make sure the host is ready to entertain without being overbearing. 

Assistants

The host will need someone to be on stand-by, who can pass them the products if needed, bring them water or snacks and give a hand with heftier products like furniture. You don’t want to go “out of character” by struggling with clearing the space for the presentation of the next product or your cat sitting in front of the camera. All sorts of things will happen and the host will have to adapt to them casually and make a laugh out of it, yet you don’t want these situations to steal the time slot reserved for a discount. 

Process

The host has to know which products will go after which, it might be a good idea to variate them by making the more exciting ones come later during a stream or in between other ones less desirable. Although it is hard to make a definite time slot because the host will have to prioritize communicating with the audience as much as possible, it is still a good idea not to spend too much time on each one and to put a little pressure on the viewers to make up their mind to buy. You will help this decision by knowing when to speed them up by offering discounts for the first ones to buy it and in an auction-like style remind them that time is running out. You will have to strategize beforehand which combinations of products will have a discount, or 2-1 offers and other variations of perks you can offer, and strategically integrate them into the sale by the order of products. You don’t want to offer all of the juiciest offers at the beginning, yet you want to excite the public from the moment they join. 

The host will have to always remember that behind the screen there is a crowd of people and it is not just a recording. By always communicating in a lively manner, asking them what they want to know or making them have fun when they are responding less is a great way to keep the audience on their toes. Even if there are two hosts, whatever they are doing together be it talking or sharing advice or live reactions, they always have to make the audience feel included and noticed. Read out their reactions with their username, ask personal questions to get to a better idea of who is behind the screen. There are many ways for all parties to have fun, important is to go with the flow with the consideration of the factors we listed here.
post-summary: Live streaming takes less preparation than filming a professional advertisement. Using a phone with a good camera quality will allow you to stream directly from the streaming platform like Jumble. You will need to make sure it’s positioning grabs a good angle that will allow you to move around within it, or put it into a stabilizing tripod/selfie-stick.

author: 60740f22ed8dc64b4bd65f7f
keywords: menswear, fashion, fashion week 2021, men
meta-description: Fashion Week comes to define the trends for the upcoming season and they’re your first look at what everyone else is going to be wearing within a few months.
meta-title: The Top Trends from Men’s Fashion Week
name: The Top Trends from Men’s Fashion Week
post-body:
Fashion week is always our go-to source of inspiration for menswear trends. Fashion Week comes to define the trends for the upcoming season and they’re your first look at what everyone else is going to be wearing within a few months. Whether it’s the street style of celebrities and influencers or what you see walking down the runway, fashion week gives us an idea of what trends are on the horizon. Give your closet an update with five trends from men’s fashion week that you’ll want to invest in for 2021.

Puffer Vests

Brands like Moncler have been dominated recent menswear trends, so it’s no surprise that puffer vests were one of the biggest trends at men’s Fashion Week. This utiliary style is easy to wear and gives you a laidback athleisure look. If you want a versatile piece, add a puffer vest in a neutral tone to your closet. You can keep it sleek with a fitted puffer or go oversized for a streetwear look.

‍

Beanies

One easy trend you can add to your closet from Men’s Fashion Week is the beanie. It’s a classic accessory that you likely already know and love. It gives you the casual off-duty look while giving you a little extra comfort and warmth during your commute or socially distanced walk. While you’re shopping around for a beanie, keep an eye out for ones that have a snug fit, as this will create a more streamline look.

‍

Oversized Striped Sweaters

After a year in lockdown, no one is ready to give up the oversized silhouettes. The same is true at Men’s Fashion Week. We saw this universally flattering sweater style everywhere from the digital runways to our favourite influencers’ Instagram feeds. You can thank Harry Styles for making striped sweaters a trend. Now that they’ve reached men’s Fashion Week, it’s the time to add one to your closet. Shop around for a striped sweater with contrasting shades to make an effortless statement with a piece you can wear with any outfit.

‍

Bold Blue

Blue is the standout hue in both menswear and womenswear for 2021. This colour will take you through every season with ease. It was Pantone’s colour of the year for 2020 and shows no sign of disappearing into the background. The bright blue trend is easy to jump on. You don’t have to wear the colour from head to toe. Instead you can build into your closet with separates like t-shirts or accessories like scarves and sneakers. If you want a more gender-fluid hue, keep an eye out for icy blue shades.

‍

‍

Black Bags

Menswear is becoming more open to the idea of carrying a bag. Gone are the days when ‘man bag’ was in our vocabulary. Some of the latest bag releases in menswear collections are giving fierce competition to their womenswear counterparts. The crossbody bag has been a staple in men’s streetwear fashion for several seasons now, and Fashion Week shows it’s not about to slow down. A black crossbody bag goes with everything, whether you like your bags nano size or oversize. Pick up a black crossbody to carry your daily essentials, including your hand sanitizer and back-up face masks.

‍
post-summary: Fashion week is always our go-to source of inspiration for menswear trends. Fashion Week comes to define the trends for the upcoming season and they’re your first look at what everyone else is going to be wearing within a few months. Whether it’s the street style of celebrities and influencers or what you see walking down the runway, fashion week gives us an idea of what trends are on the horizon. Give your closet an update with five trends from men’s fashion week that you’ll want to invest in for 2021.

author: 60740f2280ced74507dffbb0
keywords: Shacket, trend, fashion, spring
meta-description: The Shacket is a hybrid between a shirt and a jacket. We’re giving you a quick round-up of everything you need to know about this trend.
meta-title: Meet The Must-Have Spring Essential – The Shacket
name: Meet The Must-Have Spring Essential – The Shacket
post-body:
If you’ve taken a scroll through Instagram recently, you’ll have likely spotted a trend on the horizon. It’s called the shacket and it’s your new BFF for spring. This piece is a hybrid between a shirt and a jacket, hence the name ‘shacket’. If you’re someone who loves to layer pieces or wants to achieve the effortlessly chic look of an off-duty supermodel, the shacket is for you. We’re giving you a quick round-up of everything you need to know about this trend.

‍

What is the Shacket?

The shacket is perhaps the most versatile piece that you can add to your closet. It’s something you can wear while working from home or heading into the city for brunch with your friends. You can wear it everything from a little black dress to your favourite jeans and a t-shirt. The laid-back silhouette means the shacket is universally flattering and a staple in everyone’s closet. Whatever your style aesthetic is, you can benefit from adding the shacket to your wardrobe rotation.

The shacket looks like a button-up shirt but has the functionality of an everyday jacket. It’s embodies the idea of casual chic, whether you want to wear it with tailored black pants or flared jeans. We’re already seeing the shacket all over the street-wear community and on the Instagram feed of our favourite Instagram influencers.

You can think of the shacket as a updated version of the cardigan, just as comfortable but even more stylish. It’s a great piece for tonal dressing and you can add it to your closet in a neutral-tone shade for ultimate versatility or a pop of colour to make a statement.


‍

What’s the Inspiration Benefit the Shacket?

Like most utilitarian pieces, the shacket takes its inspiration from the world of military clothing. Don’t let this fool you into thinking you have to wear it as part of a uniform. We’re seeing a myriad of material options for the shacket, from buttery leather options by MM6 Maison Margiela to suede shackets for a winter appropriate look. 

The beauty of the shacket is that you can wear it over and under just about anything. It’s the perfect piece to wear under your heavier winter jackets when you want to layer up and it’s an ideal summer jacket for the evening when it’s a little too chill to be baring your arms. You can wear it over your favourite silk dress and a pair of stilettoes for a night-time appropriate look.


The It Piece for Spring

If you’re looking to make an investment into your closet, there’s nothing better that you can add for spring than a shacket. This piece is trans-seasonal, allowing you to wear it all year round. Wear it by itself for spring or layer up with scarves and a thicker jacket for the colder seasons. The soft silhouette of the shacket gives it a feminine feel, a unique feature in any military inspired piece.

What do you think of the shacket? Is it a spring must-have? What colour will you be adding to your closet?‍
